title: Impressed my friends
review: I brought my friends from out of town here, and they loved it! I’d been here before but it was great to hear them praise the food so much, and it did not disappoint. We ordered several rounds of tapas and did not regret any of the choices. This is an amazing place if you like to eat “family style”.

title: Hard to enjoy the meal...
review: While the food we ended up getting was very flavorful and cooked well, it was hard to focus on enjoying the meal and experiencing the restaurant since it was absolutely freezing! My friend and I both ended up putting our winter hats and coats back on during the entire meal. For as popular and highly sought after that this place is, it was unacceptable to have this type of experience. I would suggest getting only take-out at this location, unless you enjoy eating meals feeling like you are in a cold, dungeon. Maybe we were just put in the wrong part of the restaurant, but it is hard to tell if other spots were better heated. Not a great first experience.

title: Great Tapas for Breakfast
review: Hadn’t really tried tapas for breakfast before but Ba-Ba-Reeba set the bar pretty high. Everything we had was real good: the omelette, spicy potato, beef empanadas, croquetas and the French toast to top it off. Service was prompt and attentive. I’d go back without hesitation.

title: Great experience
review: Amazing food and fun ambience. The red wi e sangria was amazing. We had the grilled calamari, the hangar steak, peri peri chicken, parathas bravos, just too name a few. Amazing service as well.

title: A Chicago Staple
review: Amazing tapas! We had 10 different dishes, any one of which was absolutely delicious. Favorites were the bacon wrapped dates, patatas gravas, goat cheese bathed in tomato sauce, burrata with avocado toast and fried peppers. Simply wonderful!

title: Fun place to eat
review: We booked a table for 2 just in case. Turns out that this "cafe" has plenty of outdoor dining area and even bigger inside seating. Our friend familiar with this Windy City told us it was a fun place to go. We agree, the inside ambiance was just so mellow with versions of Picasso covering the walls to complement Spanish ham dangling by the entrance.Here's how we'd rate the tapas we ordered:Item #31 - stuffed mushroom, came piping hot and delicious - 5 starsitem #52 - beef empanada, also piping hot and tasty - 5 starsitem #43 - octopus with potatoes, stayed hot, perfectly tender and great flavor, the best of our order - 5 starsitem #64 - fried chicken thighs, tender and tasty - 5 starsItem #61 - iberico charcuterie, despite being among chef's recommendations, it was quite unexceptional and deserve a rating not higher than 3 starsCatalan "crystal bread," because of tomato puree topping, the bread was soggy and worthy of barely 2 starsI thought the price was reasonable for the quality of food and does not deserve $$$$ as some have rated.

title: Spanish in Lincoln Park find
review: While Cafe Baba Reeba has been in Chicago for decades, it was a new find for me. We had a wonderful family dinner here in August with Emma as our friendly and knowledgeable server! We shared multiple tapas plates, chicken/vegetable paella and classic red sangria. We loved it all and had no room for their dessert selections. Highly recommended & we will be back,

title: Great Spanish restaurant
review: We loved everything about it. The tapas, the paella and the sangria.   I hadn't eaten paella de mariscos in several years, and this one is a s good as I remembered them.  The ambiance was also great.

title: Ok Tapas
review: We came here for dinner with the family, and we were seated right away. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and very eager to please. We ordered a combination of tapas and Pinxtos which were good, but the best part of the meal was the cold “gazpacho” soup. The pear sorbet was good as well. Overall a good experience.

title: Arrogant Receptionist
review: Have dined here in the past and enjoyed experience. We have patronized other restaurants in this chain for years and always found them welcoming with friendly service. Not this time. My wife and I stopped to have lunch and before we could reach the isolated reception desk the receptionist barked that I had to put on a mask. I was already in fact pulling it over my chin to cover my nose. We elected to dine at a table in adjacent bar, but she lectured us 1st that we had to cover don our masks whenever staff came to the table, We said we would not and elected to leave when she said, "I'm sorry you don't care about our safety" This obvious millennial was snotty in a condescending manner which was offensive. If this restaurant wants to return to pre-pandemic business they wiil need to do a better job of training employees in appropriate customer service.

title: Wonderful Experience!
review: Even with COVID, we were able to experience an amazing time here. Reservations a must! Tables set a good distance apart. Really fun small plates. The garlic potato salad . . . . yum. Who would have guessed?! Shrimp , excellent. Everything we had was outstanding. Service was great. Reservation was upheld appropriately. Would definitely go back!

title: Sangria, Sangria!
review: Wonderful lunch here. The Sangria flights are great! The paella is wonderful too. Try a few Tapas, the food is great here.

title: Fun food!
review: Enjoyed an indulgent, snacky, potato-heavy meal delivered from Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba during my last visit to Chicago. My daughter and I split Garlic Potato Salad; Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Aioli; Brussels Sprouts Salad with Marcona Almond, Manchego Cheese (for balance, lol); Spinach & Manchego Stuffed Mushrooms and Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce. I had the Iberia Ham Croquetas all to myself. While it wasn’t the healthiest dinner I’ve ever had, everything was very tasty and well made. Brussels sprouts salad is new find for me - I really hate the taste of cooked Brussels sprouts, but raw and cut up thin for a salad - delicious! This is fun food. Side note, we had one small issue which management was very gracious about and fixed right away.

title: My favorite tapas bistro in Chicago
review: Last week I decided to visit here and at 6pm all the tables in the outside front courtyard were sadly taken so I was seated inside the darkened but romantic inside portion of this adorable tapas restaurant. Because of the pandemic my temperature was taken first and I advise everyone reading this review to make advanced reservations if you prefer outside seating while summer lasts.Regardless service here was excellent. I ordered a tiny deviled egg, a wrapped date and bacon, tomato bread, grilled spicy potatoes with aioli sauce and grilled calamari. It was actually way too much food for me but I loved the textures, presentation and taste of every tapas I ordered. A warning though-- the grilled potatoes are decadent but made for sharing because it's extremely rich so if you order the spicy potatoes just don't overdo it or share with a good friend or your date. If you want the best value come here between 4pm till 6pm where happy hour is extremely well priced but seating is first come first served and you will be seated strictly at the bar for the happy hour price.My soda was refilled and my server was very good with bringing everything to me quickly and attending to my needs.Sorry for the dark photos of my food but honestly the restaurant was extremely dark.I highly recommend the tasty tomato bread and calamari. This tapas restaurant is definitely my first choice in all of Chicago!

title: Great with a group of friends
review: Delicious tapas that can be shared and sangria. Fun atmosphere, ok service. As spanish as it gets in Chicago.

title: Abundance of choice
review: My girlfriend and I were trying to sneak an open table reservation for two hours on a busy Saturday night, and fortunately a 7:45pm spot opened at 7:36. We scooped it up and were on our way. It is VERY apparent why it’s so hard to get in. The tapas menu offers a great variety of vegetarian, seafood, and meats. We felt like we ordered half the menu, and still had a dozen items we wanted to try. The spicy potatoes are great, but be careful not to fill up on them. ALWAYS order grilled octopus when you see it on a menu. The peach sangria was refreshing and turned out to be a good value at $28 per pitcher. We were able to get six glasses poured. Service was attentive, and the patio had great vibes.

title: Interesting tapas
review: We have eaten here several times and have been fortunate to have hard working Joe S. as our server. The sangria is always a favorite and we are choosy about our sangria. The blue cheese beef is one of our favorites as well as the patatas bravas. This time we tried the seafood paella and it was not the flavor that we liked, so disappointed. We took it home thinking it might improve with age or we might like it better, nope...ended up throwing it out. Normally, we really enjoy paella just not here.

title: Great food and classic sangeria
review: Great food and classic sangeria. This place has all small plates that is intended to be shared with the table. They suggest 2-3 small plates per person. We got the short ribs, garlic shrimp, goat cheese, potatoes, and chicken empendana . All were delicious. My favorite was the goat cheese and would highly recommend it. You need to make a reservation. It was a little loud and difficult to hear everyone in the party. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Great place to celebrate an event
review: Went to celebrate my birthday with friends.  Great atmosphere, awesome sangria, service is superb and food is excellent. Highly recommended.

title: Best Tapas!
review: I have nothing bad to say! My daughter and I went for brunch. Food-amazing! Service-amazing! Atmosphere-amazing!! Definitely one of my new favorite places in Chicago!!

title: Crowded, circus act with mediocre service
review: So excited to try this legendary tapas bar and it fell as flat as a Spanish pancake. The place is quite large and is crowded even in the late afternoon. The menu is hit or miss: the Brussels sprout salad was crisp and refreshing; the Spanish omelette was flavorful and not dry; but the paella came out wrong and the sweet potato soup tasted off. Our server was almost oblivious - she knew nothing about the wine list and didn’t bother to pour our wine. I’ve definitely had better service at a fast food restaurant. Don’t waste your time or $$ if you’re looking for a special experience.

title: Casual Visit with Family and meeting new friends
review: Had the trie delight of being introduced to Ba -Ba - Reeba whist on our Christmas Holiday in Chicago , started with a first trip on the EL for 10 minute ride to the wonderful Lincoln Park , 5 minute walk to Ba Ba Reeba was enjoyable .On entrance to the restaurant we were greeted with great charm , delivered to our table , and presented with a enormous selection on the menu , Sangria was surly ordered whilst our meal choices were being considered , on delivery it was a delight to have the dishes delivered in waves of consistency that allowed each dish to be appreciated before the arrival of the next , all of our dishes were of excellent quality , with a quite excellent selection of waiters all of which were professional in there presentation and delivery .In my opinion the value for money was quite excellent .I would nor hesitate in recommending this short trip to Armitage on the EL Brown Line to enjoy the entire experience for yourselves.

title: The only European aspect of this cafe is the portions
review: I went there because of the good reviews from Trip Advisor—-presumably the authors may have never been to Piscolabis in Barcelona. The papas Bravas were horrible.The pulpo was a scam, they put more potato’s than pulpo. The paella was akin to a fried rice from a cheap Chinese restaurant, albeit in minuscule or European portions. The bread was cold and stale. The only good thing was the sangria and the ambiance, which was very cozy. I loved the faux Picasso murals. In sum, it is a nice place to have drinks, but avoid it if you are into real Tapas.

title: GREAT TAPAS
review: Our son found this place for our visit to Chicago.We had a reservations and were seated right away. Service was very good , food even better. Every option was very tasty. Lamb chop tapa THE BEST! Sangria was very good , but could have used a little more fruit, We will be back. Well done.

title: Glad we went there
review: We were seated at a table for two in the patio room-very nice. Some of the other rooms in the back were not quite as attractive and more noisy. The food was very good as was the service. The idea of small plates to be shared is great. We would go back. Reservations recommended.

title: Always excellent! Great dinner!
review: Love this place! Food is excellent and many great choices. I love the garlic shrimp tapas and my husband loves the scallops! We ordered a variety and sangria- yum!  This is our fourth visit and we never tire of this place!

title: We love tapas!!
review: Our family has gone to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba a few times. We love the variety of tapas that we have to choose from; we've had tortilla espanola, ham croquetas, baked goat cheese with tomato sauce, plato de la casa - just to name a few dishes that we've tried. Everything we've tried has been very good. For people who have never been to a tapas restaurant, it's always good to go with a larger group, that way you can pick a larger variety of tapas to see what you like. Our servers have also been very good; they know when to come by to see if we want to order another round of tapas, or another drink. Also, a personal observation - I see other restaurant guests who order Miller Lite, Coors Light, etc. - I wish that they would step out of their comfort zone and order a Spanish beer (Estrella Damm), or a glass of Spanish wine - they don't know what they're missing!! We'll definitely be back!

title: Amazing food ... average service
review: I had a great time here with my friends, the food was delicious! I really enjoyed that a lot, the customer service was not the best but I'll say that it was because they were really busy!This place can be a little crazy at times, especially at rush hours.Other than that ... I had a great time

title: After a Steppenwolf matinee play
review: It was a number of years since we dined at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba, before this visit. We remembered it very good and were curious to find it was not very good, but excellent.Sangria's tasty, refreshing and generous. The Tapas excellent, whatever we selected, and of course desert a real treat. Service was first class and very attentive. Word of advise, we arrived at 4:30, spent 2 hours and when leaving, seating was scarce.

title: Pop in for sangria
review: We stopped here while waiting for a table at another restaurant and honestly, I wish we stayed for a meal here. We shared a half pitcher of the red sangria and it was outstanding. The bar server was fun and shared good info about the place. Good company. Will be back to try some of the great menu items.

title: Excellent
review: Love love this place . Bacon wrapped dates are to die for , sangria is killer ! Love all the tapas , goat cheese and tomato is yummy , Totally recommend.

title: We go here EVERY time we visit Chicago!
review: This is one of our "go to" tapas places! The food is amazing! Our server Joe was very helpful and offered recommendations, which we all loved! We have been here at least 5 times, so I would say next time we are in Chicago, we will probably try and branch out to try something new. However, If you haven't been here before, I definitely recommend. Reservations are definitely recommended.

title: Oh My!
review: We had a fabulous time with friends and family. Excellent selection of tapas and also so good! We tried many and enjoyed the all. Excellent Sangria too. Just a bit loud

title: Dinner with family
review: A good place for a family get-together! Lovely atmosphere, really good food and good service! Although it was very busy and noisy, we still enjoyed it! The food was delicious - one of the best Spanish Tapas restaurants!

title: Loved the Bartender Amy as much as the food
review: My daughter and I showed up on a Saturday night at 7:30. 2 hour wait... but within 10 min 2 bar spots opened! Amy the Bartender was an awesome server! We basically let her pick out our orders.... everything we tried was delish... our favorites were the chorizo wrapped figs, the beef tenderloin with blue cheese and the chicken. The sangria was wonderful too! You can’t go wrong!

title: Dates in Bacon
review: We ordered pretty much one of everything on the menu as we were a big party and we wanted to try it all! The dates in bacon were to die for and had to be ordered twice - just to make sure you understand and nothing to do with being greedy! Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Great atmosphere and lovely decor.

title: A bit overrated ....
review: 4 and 5 star reviews typically require great food, great drinks, great ambiance and great service. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reba only met the mark on 2 of 4. The food was solid and it’s definitely a cool space but the drinks and service weren’t impressive. We enjoyed the burrata and stuffed mushrooms. The paella was good but a bit too oily for my tastes. I didn’t enjoy the red sangria and cocktail options were very limited. Service was slow as my girlfriend and i waited 15 minutes before a server came to our table. Overall, this restaurant is average at best and in a city of excellent choices, we’ll choose a different spot during our next trip.

title: Excellent
review: We received great service and excellent food. We started with the Pintxo Platter, followed with short ribs, seared sea scallops w cauliflower purée, grilled lamb chops, chorizo wrapped dates, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce and a mixed green salad. Every dish was great! We were in a bit of a rush so we did not order paella - we saw many orders delivered and it looked so good.

title: Consistently very good!
review: Second visit here and it was very, very good. The wait staff (Linsey M) was very attentive and made the visit exceptional pushing it from a 4 to a 5. The food is very good and worth a visit.

title: Tasty Tapas!
review: My son and I went for a quick dinner and enjoyed the small plates. Almost everything we had was delicious! Dates stuffed with cheese and wrapped in chorizo, scallops, octopus... Yum! The place is a little bit noisy, though - so not a good place to go for a cozy dinner with conversation.

title: Great tapas
review: My wife and I ate here for the first time recently. Make reservations as it is popular.We had the appetizer sampler plate and each ordered 2 tapas which was plenty of food. The octopus was fabulous as were the potatoes.

title: Tourist trap in non tourist area
review: This restaurant would be a perfect tourist trap if it was placed in the boardwalk of any pier or any major tourist area. Food - 2Would not say that the Spanish food here is authentic or of high quality. Several of the dishes skimp out to give a quick meal in the masses. Biggest example is the bacon wrapped dates, thin crispy bacon wrapped in olive size dates. Where you would expect thick cut bacon wrapped in plum sized dates. Most dishes are overly sauced or drenched in oil. Service - 2Since they are cramming as many tables in this place as possible, the wait staff is overwhelmed by the number of tables they service and being tapas style their table visit count should be higher and quicker. Overall they are just slow. Atmosphere - 3Don’t come here with any anticipation of a fancy quiet meal. This is completely the opposite. Very noisy and crowded. If you want a rambunctious crowd with a vibrant feel, this is the spot. You will be crammed into this place but it will be a spot if your company is a little dull and a little distraction is needed. Would not return to this location. If you are looking for smaller intimate tapas fare Avec would be recommended.

title: Great, fun vibe!
review: Love Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! Everything is always so good! We had the garlic shrimp, stuffed mushrooms, brussel sprout salad, chicken thighs, goat cheese, ham and cheese croquettes, and beef empanadas. Everything was so tastey! A pitcher of red sangria is great to share. This place is always busy, which tells you something. Really fun place to hang out with family and friends!

title: Fantastic!!
review: Great food, tapas style to share with friends, everything we had was absolutely amazing! (Including the pitcher of Sangria!) Best sangria I’ve had, lots of fruit included. Wait staff was also great. Amazing, amazing meal!

title: Brunch!!
review: Can't say enough about this place. Amazing food, great service, super friendly, reservations recommended for larger groups. Will return for lunch/dinner. Delia provided excellent service.

title: Very crowded but great place
review: Amazing service with all the people. Great food with many choices.. Kids seem to find favorites to eat.

title: Excellent
review: Excellent food, service, sangria! Would highly recommend for large groups.  Would definitely come back!

title: Wonderful
review: Really such a wonderful place! Such great food and atmosphere especially for tapas! Waiter was so helpful and the the olives I could eat everyday!!

title: Great brunch concept!
review: I've had several tapas dinners before, but never for brunch! What a great concept. You can get both sweet and savory. I LOVED the eggs benedict, chicken waffle stick and deviled egg. Also - what a cool vibe! This was my favorite meal during our weekend in Chicago.

title: reservation required
review: We are well versed in the art of pinxtos, small plates, and very much enjoyed the small plates from the excellent octopus, mushrooms stuffed with spinach and cheese, calamari, brussel sprouts salad and lastly the beef carpaccio! I'm not sure if they advertise as a Spanish restaurant although, they do the small plates in the Spanish style and they do a good job of it but, I wouldn't confuse them with being a Spanish restaurant. I've been to Spain and I know what it is about. We really liked this place and I would definitely come back. The service was very good with everyone pitching in with delivering the food or taking plates away.

title: A disgrace to Spanish food
review: I have lived in Spain for 30 years my wife is Spanish and my daughters have been born there. And I can tell you apart from the wine there is nothing Spanish about this restaurant or it’s food. The cheese platter has non Spanish cheese the heirloom tomatoes salad is a joke and more of a side dish and the grilled squid is swimming in oil. More like a pil-pil. The staff have really no clue as they will serve you a muga rosado at room temperature. I guess it all makes sense when you read the paella recipes. Seafood paella with mussels out of a can and fennel ???? They also have a paella with confit pork shoulder. Try to find these items in any restaurant in valencia or any other place in Spain for that matter. I guess as the chef is from Sweden (Jorgenson) that’s what to expect.

title: Spanish Heaven!!!
review: This place is great!! The spanish food is unreal!! I love the paella, chicken and ham croquetas, hanger steak, brussel sprout salad, meatballs, the flan, truffle cake, and custard are all out of this world!! The sangria is delicious!!! My cousin had his wedding here!! It was awesome!!! I have been here so many times for bday party dinners too!! Never disappoints!! The service is great here!!!

title: Fun, friendly, and delicious!
review: The tapas at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba were excellent, both in presentation and taste. The waitstaff and manager were very friendly and attentive, and the sun-lit enclosed patio area was the perfect area for a summer afternoon lunch. And definitely order the sangria! While we were there, the power went out - a problem for the entire block - and the manager apologized profusedly, even giving each of us a $10 gift card to make up for our inconvenience. Excellent restaurant!

title: Soo Many Delicious Items to Taste!!
review: I went to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and had the best time! Highlights included their chicken curry, bacon wrapped dates, short rib, and caramelized banana dessert. I loved the food and ambiance so much that I went again a week later. On my second visit, I tried their meatballs, charcuterie board, and goat cheese, chicken and beef empanadas, and their seasonal sorbet. The only thing that didn't win me over completely was their empanadas. However, service was phenomenal both times and they had a great drink menu to accompany their delicious plates. I will definitely be back soon!

title: Fantastic food
review: Went for Sunday brunch, and what a brunch it was. Everything was so tasty and perfect. The service was excellent and loved the whole vibe of the place.

title: Friend Reunion
review: It had been 27 years since we got together with friends. We lived near Cafe Ba Ba Reeba and it was our special place. We returned to commemorate our reunion. It lived up to our expectations. Food was excellent. Service superior and ambiance was vibrant.

title: Best of Tapas
review: This was a return visit to this Chicao institution. The restaurant has been here for many years and remains a favorite for tapas. It is crowded so a reservation is handy. The menu is large and takes a while to study. All the items we tried were excellent. The grilled squid was great. So were the meatballs. Service was very good. Prices are not bad but the accumulated total can be shocking. Glad it has survived and prospered.

title: Sangria and Tapas
review: This was our first visit and pleased we came  Have a great selection of tapas and sangria  We tried the white and Cava and had several jug fulls  We of course sampled around 10 different tapas dishes   Awesome Place

title: Fantastic food, service, and drinks
review: We were taken there by local friends and were wowed. The food was excellent (even compared to the food we’ve had in Spain) and the service was great and - well, it was all good. VERY worth a visit if you’re in Chicago. Seek it out and you won’t be disappointed.

title: Very good array of tapas, excellent service, noise level high
review: A family group of four had tapas and sangria for dinner. The range of offerings is impressive. Good sangria. Excellent service. My favorite tapas were chorizo-wrapped date, Brussel sprout salad, stuffed mushrooms, and the house plate of ham, salami, and olives. We also had short ribs, anchovy toast, a Spanish omelette, and tomato spread and cheese toasts. The noise level is high which made conversation around the table difficult at times.

title: Kinda Fun, Over-Priced, Average Food
review: This place has been a Chicago establishment for many years, so it's a safe "go to" if you have tourists in for the weekend. Nothing very good about the menu, and service is average at best. Many other venues with far better value.

title: True taste of Spain
review: We went there for our anniversary. I have been in Spain countless times and I can say with confidence if you want to get a taste of Spain, this is the place to go! We chose the Paella de Mariscos, Rioja braised short rib with Manchego mashed potatoes, stuffed mushrooms, gazpacho and pintxos Everything was delicious. The staff is friendly and they know the menu. The only thing I didn’t enjoy that much was the music, I would prefer to listen to Spanish music but this is just my personal preference :-)

title: Best Tapas in Chicago
review: You will enjoy every pincho and tapa you try at this place. Make sure you get reservation or you will wait a couple hours to be seated, specially on the weekend. Have some jamón de bellota.

title: Very good Tapas and save room for dessert
review: Make a reservation. It is a busy place and that will make your experience better than waiting. Excellent wine list with some great Spanish options. The tapas and pintxos are very good. We enjoyed the stuffed olive with white anchovy's very much as well as the goat cheese in tomato sauce. The octopus was very tender. I had the white wine flight and would recommend that to anyone that wanted to try several options with varying taste profiles and styles. The service was prompt and attentive. Our server was very knowledgable of all of the menu items. The environment is very lively. As with most places that are busy it can be loud but that is to be expected. I could have done without the tv's in the dining area I was in. That is for a bar as far as I am concerned but I get it..Chicago...sports...whatever. It did not seem that the sound was on so that was good. Save room for dessert. The butterscotch flan was delicious. Overall I would say everything was very good and I would happily dine at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba again.

title: Birthday Celebration
review: We had a party of five and even at 4:00pm this place was rockin'. Our server Velibor was very informative and shared the featured menu items. This is a Tapas (small plates for sharing) restaurant so we ordered ten items including the Spicy Potato's, Citrus Salmon, Chicken Empanada, Garlic Shrimp, Skewered Chicken, Meatballs, Grilled Octopus, Stuffed Mushrooms, Goat Cheese baked in Tomato Sauce, Seared Scallops. All delicious!!! We also enjoyed Estrella Damm beer from Spain, Black Raspberry Sangria and Wiseacre IPA from the beverage menu. For dessert we ordered Passion Fruit Sorbet, Marcona Almond-Caramel Bar and Chocolate Truffle Cake. These too were enjoyed by all. Great time, great vibe, great food. They offer valet parking for $13.

title: Loved their sangria
review: Would advise to have reservations because it's a busy restaurant. We have enjoyed tapas and excellent sangria in Spain so it's hard to find great tapas elsewhere. The burrata needed a bit more flavor. The small garlic shrimp in olive oil and red pepper flakes was good. The beef tenderloin with bleu cheese could have had less bleu cheese which overpowered the beef.The pitcher of sangria was excellent with the perfect amount of flavors and sweetness.Our server, Joe S., worked hard during the busy night.Will return and of course order the pitcher of sangria but will probably try other tapas.

title: Wonderful (with one suggestion)
review: If I were to write all of the amazing qualities this would be the *longest* review ever. Service is top-notch. The best tapas I have ever had. The only minor thing is the noise level. There needs to be some kind of upholstery to cut down in the sound... especially with music blaring, too. People have to shout to hear each other. We will go again, and again, and again. Superb.

title: Sangria!
review: Best sangria I have ever had and all the tapas were truly delicious!  The croquettes and bacon wrapped dates were my favorite and the brussel sprout salad was light and delicious.

title: Excellent!!
review: Great place with great atmosphere with terrific service and good that is over the top!  The Tapas menu is excellent and it is easy to recommend.

title: FUN & DELISH!
review: This place really was FUN and DELICIOUS! I loved the sangria to start and the tapas were one delish dish after another! I am SO glad I finally got to try this place and had a fun time with our great server too! The dishes were full of flavor and served at a good pace to enjoy! This is a strong recommend!

title: Casual
review: Food is always delicious, sangria yummy! They had a special of white asparagus- very small in size and not worth the money , I really should have had it taken off the bill !

title: Come Here for a Lively, Fun Night in a Boistrous Environment, Surrounded by Great Food.
review: This is the toughest review I have written yet because the night was a blur. Ba Ba Reeba is a tapas joint and we just kept ordering small plate after small plate, pitcher of sangria after pitcher of sangria. I tried to keep up with pictures, but during a meal—a really good meal with fun people—you just have to let go and just be in the moment. I missed a couple dishes and I can’t remember them, but know that they were delicious. You can create a meal with a variety of tapas, or choose a selection as an appetizer and enjoy one of their paellas as your main course.We ordered the Burrata Cheese with Catalan Tomato Bread ($11); the bread was toasted crisp and paired with the cheese and sauce well. The Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Aioli ($7.50) is a definite crowd pleaser with its tangy aioli and crispy-on-the-outside potato cubes and fluffy innards. The six of us had to arm wrestle for the three Bacalao Croquettes with Sherry Aioli ($2.50), but halved them and ordered more; this plate had a lot of flavor and good spice. Ba Ba Reeba’s infamous “Paella de Mariscos” with Shrimp, Squid, Preserved Mussels & Fennel ($17) was spectacular—true paella, cooked perfectly; you have to order it first, because it takes a while to make and then magically appears. Their Rioja-Braised Short Rib with Manchego Mashed Potatoes, Roasted Seasonal Vegetables & Rioja Wine Glaze ($14) was a show stopper; so tender and delicious, we tore into it before I could snap a picture. The Shrimp with Garlic, Olive Oil, Red Pepper Flakes ($9.50) was a solid plate with fresh, firm shrimp. My favorite plate was the Seared Scallops with Red Kuri Squash Purée, Maple Vinaigrette and Candied Pumpkin Seeds ($14); I would have ordered ten of these plates and been a happy man.My advice would be to make sure you leave room for dessert, which is hard to do because they have such a large, delicious offering of entree plates, you don’t want to stop. But stop, trust me. We ordered the Caramelized Banana ($3.50), with vanilla ice cream, quince syrup, and toasted pistachios; a great option to end a meal with a sweet, yet not-too-rich dessert. The Chocolate Truffle Cake ($3.50), with kahlua, whipped cream was rich and decadent—make sure your belly is ready for this delicous cake. Saving the best for last again was the Marcona Almond-Caramel Bar ($3.50) with whpped cream and a butter crust—YUM. This too was rich, so beware.This is a great place for couples, large groups, families, everything. You can order lots of small plates for every palette and picky eater. My only recommendation to Ba Ba Reeba is to get bigger tables—we had so many small plates, it was a glorious mess.

title: Good Tapas
review: It was a very nice dinner among friends. The tapas are great. Very flavorful and served hot and quick from the kitchen. The service was a little slow from the order taker and had to chase her down to get the check. This is a lively place and loud conversations. We were there for fun so it wasn’t an issue.

title: Birthday dinner
review: Went here on a busy weekend because it was restaurant week also We have reservations and was seated right away. They have a menu for restaurant week for $36 but for me it is not a deal since you only get 1 small apps, 1 tapas and dessert and a sangria. So we just ordered off the menu. The food was great but very small servings compared to the other tapas places We’ve been too except for the Paella. Everything was very tasty though. My fave is the grilled squid, spicy potato, fried chicken , seafood paella the dates wrapped in bacon.

title: Popular spot for tapas
review: A wonderfully varied selection of Spanish dishes for sharing.  The weekend bloody mary "fixings bar" was amazing (perhaps some bacon with your bloody?).  Attentive service.

title: Pleasantly surprised
review: We had been here maybe 10-12 years ago with a big group and my memory was that it was meh, but this time we were just two and it was really good. It is harder to have a good tapas experience with only two people, but everything was good. Okay I wasn't thrilled about the sardines in a can (they serve it in the can) but everything else was really quite good. We went before a performance at the Steppenwolf and it was very convenient and the service was quite good. I'd go back, particularly with a group of 4 or so.

title: Great Tapas
review: Lively, hectic and authentic restaurant near Lincoln Park where you can enjoy delicious Spanish tapas, Sangria, Bloody Mary Bar and company of good friends. One thing I always appreciate about tapas settings is that you get to try and taste a variety of different dishes. Food quality was very good and service was great. It was our first visit and they have our thumbs up.

title: Tasty tapas
review: Girls night out after wedding dress shopping. We had a small table in the back with an attentive and helpful waiter. The sangria pitcher was a great way to start! The variety is crazy and each of our chosen tapas dishes were delicious and freshly made. It was a very fun way to share a meal and experience a wide variety of items off the menu. Well done!

title: Great place
review: tapas rocks , This place is awesome. Really partial to dates wrapped with bacon and potato bravos. great place for family outings or dates.

title: Fun, artistic food
review: Cafe Babareeba is a fun, hip place to enjoy Brunch with family or friends. The food is creative and delicious. The wait staff is friendly, attentive and menu-knowledgeable! The restaurant, itself, is cozy and welcoming. It is a place to relax and enjoy great food and drink!

title: Could Do Better
review: Been around forever on Halsted and have visited multiple times because it was in neighborhood.. Seems to be always packed so must be appreciated. I thought this time it was mediocre food and selections. Perhaps because I am not-30 something anymore. What no sherry options on the wine list!? Maybe because we were there this time in afternoon but I asked for full menu which was limited and uninspired. OK, nice to have shrimp in the build your own Bloody Mary etc. but there is no challenge or excitement for me in this place. Probably the only restaurant I have had arguments in. Maybe the wait, traffic, wait, slow service, and loudness.

title: I’m in love with the tapas...
review: I wanted to try something different and came across this place. The tapas were sssoooo good! We had the appetizer sampler and about 5 other dishes. Their sangrias are fantastic! I had a passion fruit sangria that I’m going to have to figure out how to make at home. Can’t wait to go back!

title: Tapas to die for
review: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I would have to say this restuarant is by far my favorite in the whole city. We have a lot to offer here, but I always find myself coming here for happy hour. They have $16 pitchers of red sangria and some of their house favorites are $2-$3. Happy is from 4-6pm daily! Make sure you check in on Yelp for a free dessert!!!

title: Fantastic
review: Here for a work holiday party and had an amazing experience!  The food is unbelievable and one thing is better than the next!  I highly recommend waiting for the paella!

title: Great Date Night
review: This is a great date night place to goto, and maybe even family. I love the location as this is where I live, and the establishment is great. I've been going for close to 20 years, and they always do it right. You might have your fav, but the bacon wrapped dates and the saganaki is great. The Skewers, both chicken and steak are great. I have a programmed menu in my mind and am going to challenge them with certification they can delivery upon for a new dish.

title: Date night away from the Kids
review: We came for a date night away, Jess waited on us and she was simply amazing. She was very sweet, funny, welcoming & made us feel right at home as well as well taken care of. We felt like we knew her for years. The food of course was amazing as always. Bacon wrapped dates, goat cheese, beef skewers... all of it. Left full and very happy.Thanks again Jess for taking such good care of us. We will be back and make sure we see you, and cash I’m on your awesome bear hugs.

title: Absolutely delightful wedding shower
review: We had a large room set aside for us that easily accommodated the 45 people in attendance. A small dance floor that served us well for the Spanish guitarist and Flaminko dancers that we were able to book through the restaurant. Both were outstanding and entertaining as the dancers gave us dance lessons so we could all get involved. After carefully choosing the Tapas for the event the restaurant provided outstanding food, service and beverage. We were amazed how flawlessly the restaurant and staff performed. A big thank you to all the staff involved. A must try and guaranteed you will return.

title: Not your typical brunch
review: It’s been decades since my last visit to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and I’m very glad to see the originality and quality are still there! We went for Sunday brunch and had make your own Bloody Marys and Pintxos, a creative spin on Spanish influenced breakfast tapas. Everything was delicious an exceeded our expectations from the menu description. Service was excellent. Won’t be as long before I’m back!

title: Excellent!
review: I was visiting a friend in Chicago from Australia and this one of the restaurants she took me too. The food was insane - so tasty, big serves and ridiculously good value. We ordered 4 different tapas plates, plus the beef empanada each and were so full. The Sangria was amazing too and I loved the different flavours. It was so cheap for the quality and portion size, and the service was great.

title: Great food, great taste and good service
review: There were 4 of us and we decided to order different dishes, the chef specialities (in red on the menu). The dishes started pouring in right away, each dish better than the last one. We all shared the dishes so we got to try a lot more than usual and we were not disappointed with any of them. It was a fun experience and I highly recommend it. The bacon wrapped dates, the chicken, potatoes and one of the steaks stood out.

title: BRUNCH-ELLA...ELLA..PAELLA
review: Creat Tapas and Paella Brunch Dish!!! Wonderful assortment of deviled egg, mini waffles, French toast, a killer Cubano sandwich and all reasonably priced... great plus great service!!

title: Small plates but big flavor!
review: Great casual vibe with tapas to share. My favorite were bacon wrapped dates and goat cheese in tomato sauce. I am not a wine drinker but everyone else at our table LOVED the sangria. Save room for dessert because the butterscotch pudding is a game changer! Service was fantastic.

title: Great food!
review: We stopped here on our way to a show at Second City and they were packed so we grabbed a seat at the bar and received full (and fantastic) service.  The food was amazing!  Highly recommend if you are in the area!

title: My favorite date night location
review: This place is just the best; food, environment, staff, vibe, etc. The food is absolutely incredible. JUST GO and experience it for yourself!!! Any time my boyfriend and I have something to celebrate, this is where we go. It will never get old. I believe they rotate out some items, too, so it is easy to always try new things. One piece of advice is to space out your ordering so you can enjoy each dish as its own and not be juggling a bunch of different ones!

title: Like the vibe; like the food
review: The restaurant is rather spacious; plenty of room. I like the atmosphere. We showed up with no reservations on a Saturday afternoon and there was no problem finding a table for us (although there were only 2 of us). Some of the food items were SUPER delicious and some of them were OK. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

title: HAPPY hour turned nappy hours
review: I went with a group of friends after my 1st Cub game. It was bustling with people. Everything was so good. The deviled eggs eggs were divine, like whipped butter. The meatballs are well seasoned. The heirloom tomatoe salad was one of the best I've had. The paella is also the best I've had. Its cooked and baked in a cast iron pot and comes directly out. All the seafood was so flavorful and tender. Theres even crispy rice at the edges! I think the Sangria put me over the top to a food coma, but no regrets here.

title: Do you know what is “fake news”?
review: So... the name is Spanish? Yes!!!and the names of the food? Yes!!!But what happen when a Spanish go there and ask for “Jamón Ibérico 5 jotas”? Good question... this is not “5 Jotas” neither a good “Jamon iberico” it’s a correct ham but no more...The same with the “Iberican pork”... it isn’t iberican, it’s a normal pink pig.Do not expect very much here... correct but not a Spanish high quality food!!!

title: Chicago Favorite - A Must Have!!! 🔥
review: The absolute best Spanish Tapas in the US! Take a look at the pictures, they speak louder than words. We couldn’t even wait to eat, before taking each picture. You will love this place, as I have for many years. The sangria is amazing too!The Braised Short Ribs are out of this world. The Spicy Potato’s are a must have as well.

title: Can't Wait to go Back!
review: When I visited some friends in July, they kept talking about wanting to go to Ba-Ba-Reeba. I tapas, but kept thinking, can it really be as good as they say? It was actually better. We were a party of 7, so we just ordered a bunch of food and some Sangria and everything was delicious. The deviled eggs were my favorite thing on the table and could have eaten 10 of them. Even the bread was really delicious and I kept finding myself going back to it. Simple things like the brussell sprout salad were really fresh and tasty. If I lived in Chicago, I'd be here constantly. Can't wait to go back on my next trip.

title: One of our favorites
review: We have visited Chicago many times and Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba continues to be one of our favorite restaurants to eat. Since the plates are small and meant to be shared we get to try a variety of dishes. Cafe-Ba-Ba-Reeba has excellent food, attentive wait staff and great Sangria. Would highly recommend

title: Very cool dining experience
review: Was part of a large group for cocktails and dinner. At least 8 dishes were served family-style and each one was delicious. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Would definitely go again!

title: Late Last Minute 3rd of July Dinner
review: Booked a table last minute through Open Table on the 3rd of July for myself and my adult son who lives in the city and adult daughter (who suggested this place). I have eaten here a couple of times since the days I lived just up the street back in the late 1980s and this visit did not disappoint. The paella takes about 20 minutes to make but well worth the wait. We ordered the two-person portion for us three and it was plenty, especially with an awesome shrimp dish, a little beef empanada and the potato and onion omelette. Were sat in the small bar room area to the right as we walked in and it had a lot different feel than the patio but was really nice. Waitress was very good. Would go back to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba in a Chicago-second!

title: Great Tapas
review: This is a laid back place - casual and probably the best tapas we had  in This country . Great food and great service. Just a winner all over . Do try their shrimps with garlics - one of the best I ever had :)

title: Continued excellence
review: Came a few years ago, and they still bring the goods.  Tapas are original and very good.  Bacon-wrapped dates - yep!  Even my finicky 11 yr. old loved that.  Sangrias are to die for.

title: Tap your feet to the tapas!!!
review: Excellent variety of tapas, cosy ambience, flavours well combined with the candle lighting -all combined brought in an exceptional experience

title: Always excellent!
review: Have been here several times and it’s great every time. Paella, sangria, short ribs, potato omelet... just a few of our favorites. Everything has been consistently delicious. Great options for gluten free as well!

title: Great Spanish Cuisine
review: Stopped in last Friday for an early dinner. Johnny was our waiter and took good care of us. We decided to have a number of different tapas for our meal. We began with the bacon wrapped dates with the apple vinaigrette. The bacon is nicely browned and crunchy over the date and the saltiness and sweetness go wonderfully together. Our second tapas was the garlic potato salad - - sounds so plain right? Wrong! It is absolutely fantastic! It’s hard to describe how creamy and rich it is and like no other potato salad you’ve ever had. Our 3rd tapas was garlic shrimp. You get maybe 6 medium size shrimp laying in olive oil with lots of roasted garlic slices. The garlic is roasted so nicely that it is almost nutty in flavor. Our 4th tapas was the chicken and ham croquetas served with a aioli sauce - - crispy on the outside and the sauce is a great accompaniment to them. We also tried the Brussel sprout salad with candied marcona almonds and manchego cheese which was very good.Topped it all off with a pitcher of peach Sangria and we went away happy campers! Can’t wait to return.We had a party with 36 people here in January and the service and food were just wonderful! We had many of the tapas I mention above as well as chicken paella and the vegetarian paella which were delicious. I can’t remember our desserts but they were all a hit as well. Our guests loved the Bloody Mary Bar and people loved the Sangria and other mixed drinks they ordered. The room we reserved was very nice and we were able to bring in flower arrangements and decorations of our choice. They took really good care of us in every way. Allison was instrumental in all the planning and great to deal with.

title: love this place
review: All I can say is that this was my second visit to Cafe BaBa Reeba and I loved it. The service was great - my food was outstanding and just a great vibe. We were there a bit later at night which was nice as it wasn't super crazy there... but I look forward to going back there again next time in Chicago

title: Good apps, skip the paella
review: Got 6 apps and ordered a portion of the seafood paella. Server said it was a 2 portion minimum and that it took 30 mins to make. We debated simply increasing the number of apps, but based in 30 mins to make should = it's good, agreed to the paella. Apps were good to very good. Octopus was a standout as was the spicy fried chicken thighs. We were really looking forward to the paella and it was a complete letdown. Overcooked to begin, but also lacked flavor. Complete miss after the hits the apps were. Mentioned this time the server who seemed to acknowledge that was the case.So definately visit, but stick to the apps.Friday evening had a 30 min wait.

title: Best meal in Chicago!
review: Came to Chicago for 6 nights, on the 4th night in after some very poor and average meals we were sceptical. This meal was Chicago’s saving grace. We had a great server who was super friendly and thoughtful with great recommendations named Erin. Couldn’t recommend this place more - the Paella is a must and all the dishes we had were delicious

title: Best meal ever!
review: Start to finish, everything was exploding with flavor! Loved the margarita. Each tapas was better than the last.

title: Wow!
review: I’ve been here twice but it’s a whole different vibe with 5 people I also had two culinary trained chefs sitting at the table. The sausage tapas was plentiful and tasty. Even the blood sausage. The garlic potato salad could have used more garlic. The short rib was spectacular. Between their Bloody Mary make your own and the blood orange margarita everything was great. Just make sure you ask for the beer back for the dollar extra with the margarita. Our server got a bit testy with us and scolded us for not ordering the “bare back” at the same time. Go with a large group and enjoy the variety of incredibly tasty bites.

title: Happily busy eating.
review: Had a mommies/grown daughters meal here.  Kept busy with one tapas after the other.  Then very pleased that they serve vegetarian paella.  It was better paella than I had in Barcelona!

title: Best tapas anywhere.
review: Been too many tapas in New York, Chicago, and Vegas and this is my favorite place. All the dishes are excellent, but the standout is their Paella. Like mine crispy, theirs comes on on plate sizzling... Squid, scallops, salmon all excellent. Always come here when in Chicago. 5****+

title: Fun and different
review: This is a Spanish tapas restaurant (meaning "small plates"). Don't let that word fool you. Order two at a time. They DO fill you up. This is one of best tapas restaurants been to. Not our first time here. Very large, does get crowded, try reservations. All kind of alcoholic beverages. You can order individual items or tapas to share. Lots of tiny plates stacked up for sharing. There's dessert tapas too. Ask for warm bread if they don't' bring it. There's bacon wrapped dates and potatoes bravas - wow, the best. Sangria is amazing! They've several types and even flavor of day/week. Ask! They've seafood tapas, vegetarian, etc. You can also order paella rice dish to share (never had). I'd def try this place. Experiment and share

title: Tasty nibbles Ba-Ba-Reeba!
review: We ate here prior to going to a IO performance and were glad we did! Fabulous tasty tapas in a fun environment: chickpea Moroccan dish, Pinxto sampler plate, caramelized banana dessert, fried calamari, beef empanada, etc., etc. And the price for 4 hungry visitors to Chicago was $100. Fabulous!

title: Interesting
review: Loved...bacon wrapped dates, scallops Rockefeller, meatballs, breadGood...goat cheese in a tomato sauce with toasted bread, chicken empanadasNot a fan...grilled octopus, small chewy portion didn’t hit mark, deviled egg salty, grilled green peppers...super hotService was fine. Nice wine list...average pours, cosmo good. Pricey...little dishes add up!

title: Interesting fare, vibrant atmosphere
review: The place was buzzing at 9:00 on a Saturday night when we showed up! Small plate menu allows for ordering many items and passing them around the table. I really liked the octopus dish!!! Everything was very good, and I'm sure we'll try it again someday when we are back in town.

title: Tasty tapas, not a great wine list
review: My husband and I came here for dinner on a Friday night in April. We didn't have a reservation but were told by the hostess to come before 7pm for first-come-first-serve seating at the bar. It worked like a charm. We arrived at 6:45pm and were seated within 20 min. About 20 people arrived around 7pm so we were lucky to beat the rush. If you want to have guaranteed seating, I recommend reserving. We lived in Europe for several years and vacationed in Spain annually for the last 6 years as its my husband's favorite destination. So we have had very good tapas/pintxos, especially in Bilbao and San Sebastian. We thought the food at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was comparable, but the portions were small by Spanish standards, and the wine selection was not the best. We chose the brut cava instead. My husband also tried the red sangria, which he enjoyed. I'm not fond of sangria and found it too sour. You can get good beef in the numerous steakhouses in Chicago, but there are not too many places that serve Iberico pork (Iberian black pig with a strict acorn diet) so we decided to order more pork dishes. We sampled the chorizo-wrapped dates, seared cana de cabra (cheese), grilled Iberico pork, jamon Iberico plate, and grilled pulpo (octopus). My husband loved the dates, which I found too sweet. The seared cheese was nothing special. We wouldn't order it again nor recommend. The pulpo was excellent - not too heavy on the sauce or seasoning. While I really enjoyed the jamon Iberico, which was authentic and shipped from Spain, I couldn't justify paying $20 for 4 slices. The real winner was the grilled Iberico pork. Even a dull butter knife cut into the pork as if it were butter. It was so good (and the portion was so small with only 5 bite-size pieces) that we ordered another serving.Although we sat at the bar, it didn't feel crowded or noisy, and service was very good. Prices were reasonable by Chicago standards. Our meal for two costs $100 excluding alcohol. We would definitely return, as long as they serve Iberico pork.

title: Chicago “Must Do”
review: Crazy, crazy good tapas. This is so typical of the Lettuce Entertain You group - high quality food, ambience, service. We absolutely love this place, and will be on our list of “must do”.A word of caution, get reservations. This is a very busy place, but sooo worth it.

title: So much fun!
review: We visited on a Thursday night and were happy we had a reservation.  The atmosphere is fun and vibrant. The food is fantastic.  Our waiter was knowledgeable and enthusiastic.  My daughter felt like it on par with tapas in Spain! Great place.

title: Wished I had room to try more dishes
review: I brought my 19 year old daughter here for dinner. The tapas dishes feature unexpected ingredient combinations seasoned to perfection. So many flavors in each bite! Definitely try the sangria too. We ordered 4 tapas plates to share and were quite full afterward. I would have loved to sample more of them.

I was just about to give this place 5 stars, but before leaving the restaurant I went to the restroom. Oh my!!! I always think the cleanliness of the restrooms tells a lot about the place (especially if we are talking about a place where you come to eat!). Women’s restroom was nasty! Toilette paper all over, even by the door outside the restroom. Nope... just unacceptable! Other than that, service was outstanding, food amazing, .. everything else great! If I’d come back?! ... let me think ...

title: VERY salty paela!
review: The seafood paella was extremely salty! They say it's a part of the cooking process? Everything else was solid. Dates, olives with anchovies, and garlic potato salad. Avoid the lamb skewers. Adequate service.

title: Ideal for Group Dinners
review: Returned with European Clients to Ba-Ba-Reeba for the first time in 15 years, food was better than ever! Their servers are fantastic, just follow their recommendations. Bacon-wrapped Dates and Spicy Potatoes were memorable.A particularly nice touch was that our Server upon greeting us asked about after dinner plans. When I told him we had Second City Tickets, he staged our dishes to arrive in ideal progression, in addition to providing outstanding recommendations.

title: Late Night Feast - Tapa Style
review: On a late Friday night, my family and I were in Lincoln Park pretty late and still wanted to have a quality dinner in spite of the fact that many restaurants were either already closed or closing soon. My daughter recommended Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. One word - feast! There are so many tapas on the menu, and most are served in shareable portions, so we had a number of questions before we placed our order. The waitress was friendly and helpful in assisting us with determining how many of each tapa we needed to order for our group. In the end, we ordered a variety of tapas that included deviled eggs with crispy jamón serrano, spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, beef empanadas, chicken empanadas, Moroccan-spiced lamb kebabs with cucumber yogurt, grilled squid with olive oil and garlic, calamari with tomato crudo and jalapeno alioli, and grilled Ibérico pork with red chimichurri. A menu was left at our table in case we wanted to add to our order. As explained by our waitress, the tapas arrived at the table at different times based on when they were ready. The cadence in which the food was served gave us time to pass around the tapas without being overwhelmed by receiving too many plates at once. Overall, it was an excellent experience. The food was very good, and the most fun part was passing the tapas around person to person so everyone could taste some of each dish. It was much more than we expected from a late night meal. We left with not only with our appetites satisfied, but with great memories over our tapas experience - a new experience for most in our group.

title: Another year in Chicago
review: After been around 8 years since we came here it was a great experience, a group of 20 we where nice and comfortably accommodated in a small private section of the restaurant, the tapas where great and very nice portions with 2 great paella at the end and delicious desserts, endless sangria and wine. Freindly staff, good service.Great dinner with the group, looking foward tonight for another of my favorite restaurant in Chicago.

title: Very well attended but ......
review: Restaurant was very clean, very well attended, and the service and staff in general were outstanding.If for nothing else The Bloody Mary Bar was worth the trip. Menu is tapas and as I like to EAT this does not meet my quantity needs. Some Entrees were cooked well but some were over cooked (dry). Best was the salmon though it took a LONG time to come out.Id go back but I would order off the brunch menu.

title: Great family meal
review: What a great place for a great family meal. Our niece and nephew hosted us, did all the ordering and we enjoyed! Excellent food! Calamari and aioli were outstanding. Patatas bravas!

title: Birthday meal
review: I came here for my birthday with my bff on November 29. The food is great. The waiter thoroughly explained everything. There is ample metered street parking. The shrimp are wonderful, the mushrooms are excellent, just to name a couple.

title: Good place for family and friends
review: I've been going there for the last 15 years or so. We take our friends, children visiting family. The place is very lively and busy most of the time. The food is good and they maintain good quality, however over the years we've noticed that the prices went up and portions went down. Your sangria pitcher has more ice than it should etc.

title: great spanish tapas!
review: We ordered a variety of tapas, a sangria pitcher and a pallea. We had just recently been to Spain and we felt like we were back in Valencia! great food, great drinks and great staff. highly recommended.

title: Delicious tapas for dinner
review: We had a great time at this restaurant in Chicago yesterday. Food was delicious and interesting and the wine was great. Service was friendly and helpful (thanks, Didi). It has been over 20 years since our last visit, but it is still a fantastic restaurant to visit.

title: Excellent
review: From the waiters to the busboy to the food everything was excellent! We'll definitely go here again. We has the garlic shrimp, stuffed mushrooms, bacon wrapped dates (out of our food comfort zone :-) - but the waiter highly recommended) with chocolate cake for dessert. Loved it all.Very busy at 3:30 in the afternoon - we had reservations and would definitely recommend getting reservations. Great for meetings, small groups and large groups.

title: Awesome Saturday evening dinner
review: Sangria , Tapas , Paella , dessert and coffee equals awesome dinner ! The restaurant has lot of seating and yet fully packed on Saturday night . Service was awesome and food was great  amazing. Celebrated special occasion and glad we did !

title: Amazing food and service
review: My wife and I picked this restaurant for our wedding anniversary and boy we were glad that we did. We have lived in Chicago area over 10 years ago but never end up going to this restaurant. Service was amazing and very attentive, while the restaurant was extremely busy we never felt being rushed and we took our time ordering various tapas, drinks, and dessert. Our server was amazing, giving us the background of the restaurant and providing us helpful recommendations on the menu. One reason we love tapas because you are not committed to a single dish, my kids and wife didn't like all the dishes but I loved each and every one of them. This is one of our favorite restaurants for this point on and we will be dropping by there for our future visits.

title: Wonderful!
review: Good menu variety. Portions are good even for tapas. Vegan options are plentiful and even more vegetarian

title: Good choice for families, groups & couples!
review: This is a surprisingly large venue, that can easily accommodate a lot of different diners. There's a cozy bar area at the entrance, & I understand, multiple dining rooms.Our dining combination was 5 adults & an infant. We sat at table for 6, & had a chair replaced by a sling designed for supporting the infant carrier. Perfect! Food & service were wonderful. Although this is a tapas place, the food which is flavorful, rich & filling... was in rather generous portions. We took home left-overs & are making plans to return to try other dishes. The dates (ordered by piece) were excellent. Potatoes were a hit, as was the goat cheese dip. Steak with bleu cheese was was very good. The chicken dish with a green sauce was good. Calamari was enjoyed by fans of that seafood. 2 in our group were in Barcelona, Spain last summer & being fans of tapas dined at several places while there. They preferred a couple of dishes at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba to ones tasted in Spain! We will definitely return. There are several dished we want to try, including the paella, which we were told takes about 45 minutes to make.

title: Excellent food and service!
review: The entire experience was wonderful from start to finish. We did not have a reservation, but my sister and I were able to squeeze in at the bar for dinner. We ordered a variety of small plates, had sangria, and overall had a great time here!!

title: this is the place for tapas and paella
review: We had many tapas including the seafood paella which was flavorful and crispy - served at your table in an authentic paella pan. We also like the meatballs, potatoes brava. The pitcher of sangria was just right - not too sweet.

title: Great Find
review: While visiting my daughter we had the intention of having dinner in a popular restaurant downtown, but we didn't feel like waiting 2 hours for a place to sit.Then my daughter called Be Ba Reeba, asked if we could come in without a reservation, and 20 minutes later we were seated. What a wonderful experience, friendly staff, good food, hefty portions and incredible prices. Not too many tourist around as it's in a residential area, but I am spreading the word, this will be a stop every time I'm in Chicago.

title: Good
review: Getting a table for 6 is a little tough at this popular place but lucky for us we had a reservation, still waited 15 minutes but no biggie. First time here but next time I’m in town I will be making a return visit. If you love tapas this is your place, goat cheese plate to die for, awesome short ribs and I’m usually not a fan of them, deviled eggs are a must, garlic shrimp so yummy I obviously could go on & on. Fabulous atmosphere, great prices and fantastic service, we had Jesse S and if your lucky enough to get him sit back and enjoy. Tapas lovers paradise!

title: Truly Awesome
review: Service staff was super efficient and polite. Restaurant is clean. Lemon drop martinis- ok, Very good wine selection. We ordered: Squid, octopus, chorizo with dates, Mediterranean lamb skewers, grilled or Keith chimmichuri. Chicken curry, Brussels sprouts slaw, chicken skewer, and seafood paella Amazing!!!!! I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

title: Always good
review: This place should be on your list. The tapas are awesome. The selection is really nice. The service was top notch.  Go if you like small plates of shareable delicious food.

title: Tops in the city
review: Year after year it’s still one of our favorite restaurants. Wonderful sangria and plenty of choices of it. Make reservations as they are always busy. Love the octopus and the goat cheese but the potato salad is the best.

title: Gluten Free Ease in Lincoln Park
review: We come hear on business once a year and sign up to go to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba every time. The service continues to be excellent. The food is even easier for my gluten-free-ness. They even have gluten free bread!The short-rib was amazing!Our only problem was getting too full. :)

title: Noisy young crowd, uneven food
review: We were lucky to get a table in a far corner on Friday night. The main room is filled with painful noise of student-age crowd. Their tapas are more like half a portion of a regular item. Octopus was very good; kebab was made of the worst pieces of meat, mostly tendons; calamari salad tasteless and rubbery; hangar steak tough and chewy. They do serve house wines in karafe, it is reasonably priced and quite good. Deserts are small but very good. Although the food is not terribly pricey, it still isn't worth what you pay for it., and conversation is impossible.

title: Big taste on small plates
review: Visiting Café baba re ba was like visiting an old friend. It’s been a number of years since I’ve been here, but the food and I’m Beyonce is still great. We had a family outing so everyone got to choose a number of small plates. It’s a great way to taste a number of their dishes and find out which ones will become your favorites. I would highly recommend the Brichetto with goat cheese and tomato sauce and seafood paella was terrific

title: A "MUST VISIT" RESTAURANT IN LINCOLN PARK!
review: Went here with 8 women who haven't seen each other in 31 years. The lively atmosphere and food were fabulous! The noise level on a Friday night was a quite high for us, as we wanted to talk and be able to hear each other. However, the food was soon good and the service was very attentive so I would DEFINITELY go back here. And the bill was a nice surprise in the end....thought it was quite reasonable for the amount and quality of the food.

title: This is why I love tapas
review: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba epitomizes why tapas are so much. And CBBR has multiple types of delicious sangria, creative tapas and pintxos (bar snacks). Very fun vibe and helpful wait staff, too!

title: Excellent food and service
review: Not usually a fan of Tapas restaurants but Cafe Babareba was a nice mix. Had several appetizers; grilled squid cooked to perfection, stuffed spinach mushroom, mixed greens salad with a dried ricotta that was the best cheese I have ever eaten, pumpkin/sweet potato soup and finished with dinner sized portions of a paella made with carnitas, fried pork bellies and chorizo. Waiter was a big help with the menu and bus staff was always there before you needed them to refill water and wrap leftovers. Definitely will return

title: Tapas and wine
review: Came with family. They had gluten free bread, and a gluten free menu that made it easy for me to order. The noise level was way too loud! Not a place for conversation. The food was pretty good though.

title: Need to try again!
review: Very good! We sat at the bar and service was decent until we were ready to leave (bartender disappeared). The food was good, we only tried three tapas so I definitely need to go back and re-review again later on. I will say though, there is another Tapas place that I can go to, share several tapas with the table, order wine and leave only spending $30. This was a little pricey - for three tapas and two glasses of wine I left with a $45 tab. So, not a "cheap eats" tapas by any means.

title: Awesome Restaurant with Cool Vibe in the heart of Lincoln Park
review: My Daughter moved to Chicago and Lincoln Park in the last year. I finally found my new favorite restaurant! If you like Tapas places, this one is the best. Menu was filled with an awesome and unique selection of tastes, vibe was very cool, waiters and service were top notch professional.. and the Sangria the best I've had in a long time. Prices are reasonable too! When you walk by the place, you have no idea what awaits you inside... so you must check it out. Make a reservation or plan to wait for a bit... but the great bar makes the wait worth while.

title: Amazing Tapas - Gluten Free Friendly
review: Very cute restaurant and neighborhood.  The tapas were delicious especially the octopus!  They offer a gluten free menu as well.  Highly recommend.

title: Redeemed After Last Visit
review: Cafe Ba-ba-reeba has been one of my favorites for almost 30 years. My visit in July was disappointing that I wasn't sure I'd come back but they've redeemed themselves!Our evening began with the "must have " sangria. Our group ordered Papas Bravas, Garlic Potato Salad, Bacon Wrapped Dates, Goat Cheese simmering in tomato sauce, and so much more. The only complaint was the Pincho de Salomillo arrived very late to the table, which is a personal favorite of mine. The atmosphere is energetic and food is diverse and flavorful. Looking forward to my next visit when I'm in Chicago.

title: Terrific Tapas!!
review: We went with a large party and love the typical tapas place. However this wasn’t typical. It was wonderful! The goat cheese in tomato sauce was superb! The ham and cheese croquettes were hands down the best. The food came to the table with a few of the tapas at a time allowing for us to enjoy just a steady stream of food in a nice atmosphere. Made for a memorable evening.

title: Fun bustling restaurant
review: This is a fun tapas restaurant. Great for small and large groups. Great sangria and lots of great little plates for sharing. The paella is a must get.

title: Always fin
review: Return visit last night. This place is always fun. Lively crowd , good service.  Fun to go with others to share dishes. We will be back

title: Great food and fun atmosphere
review: Spanish Tapas style restaurant.  Fun to share a bunch of small plates.  Interesting to try different things.  All done very well.  Great flavors and fun presentation.  Good waiter.

title: Loved the atmosphere and food for table of 8
review: Went here with a family reunion group of 8. Everyone enjoyed their food. Started off with great sangria and cosmos, went on to incredible bread and then to the tapas. The fried chicken, spicy potatoes, hangar steak, meatballs and filet were some of our favorites. Would definitely go there again and recommend it to anyone.

title: Genuinely the worst tapas I’ve ever eaten
review: Wow. Cold food, tasteless and over cooked. A friend found a fly on their meat platter, bought it to a waitress’s attention (after attempting to get the attention of our waiter repeatedly). There was no apology! Just a new plate and fork. One word. Avoid.

title: Incredible Tapas!
review: We first went here two years ago. It was so good and so memorable that we went again on Saturday night. Their selection and variety of tapas is incredible and the food is amazing. Nice selection of wine too. TIP: Great restaurant if you're going to the Steppenwolf. It's only a short 10 minutes walk to the theater.

title: So So!!
review: My friend loves this place because of its Tapas styled food. The ambience is ok, although I felt the food wss overrated and the space is a little crammed. But this place is in high demand and many people frequent it. So like my friend, many people love to visit this place. So if you are into Tapas food, you will love it, if not, then you like me will not be a huge fan.

title: Fun and Tasty Tapas Joint
review: So many food selections, it's hard to know where to start. But we'd start with the Sangria. Super tasty, not too sweet, comes in glass, 1/2 carafe or full carafe. For 2 of us, 1/2 carafe was perfect. Try the ham wrapped dates, and chicken thighs, among others. Cute funky ambiance makes this place a winner.

title: Excellent Tapas in a great location
review: I was visiting my daughter in Chicago (from CA) and had no idea where to have a good meal. We needed to be somewhere in the Linkin Park area. My daughter found this place on YELP. It had good reviews and my daughter's friends also said it was good. Expensive but good. I was very surprised at how good it was and even more suprised at how relatively inexpensive. The last couple of times I hate Tapas it was either very expensive (The Bazaar) or left still hungry. The portions were sufficient prices were reasonable. I recommend the bacon wrapped dates and the Grilled Octopus...good sized portions and VERY TASTY. I would recommend to the restaurant to change the music. They were playing 80's music. its a spanish tapas bar...play some flamenco or other spanish music. Other than this, highly recommend this spot.

title: Nice setting - food just OK
review: Very crowded, bustling and fun place. Great drinks, good service. Food was so-so. Having lived in Spain, most of the dishes didnt feel that genuine. The tortilla was ok. The papas bravas were probably the best we had from the menu. A little spicy, nicely done. The fried calamari, overfried and heavy. Not light and crips. The croqetas too dry, need to work on the bechamel sauce. The grilled pork, not as tender, a little dried out. Overall OK but dont expect to be blown away by the food.

title: Great Tapas with Fun Atmosphere
review: This is a great tapas place with great food, fantastic Sangria and efficient service.  Advance booking is highly recommended.

title: Economically priced
review: The price of their food are reasonably priced. Because of a big group, there was minimum spending. It was challenging to hit the minimum spent amount without over ordering. We ended up wasting a lot of food. Nevertheless, the food was quite tasty.

title: girls day out
review: This is by far one of the best tapas places in the city! Sangria on tap, all food great quality. Our server was excellent, for 6 of us suggested 2-3 plates per person. Patatas bravas were the same as Madrid! Grilled squid, queso, croquettes, bread, every items was superb. Wish you had a location in the southwest suburbs!!

title: Excellent Find!
review: We were in Chicago for our anniversary and stayed at the Swissotel. We ordered a $100 worth of various tapas for delivery to our suite. It was truly terrific. The Garlic Mayo Potatoes were so good I had to find the recipe so I could make them at home. (By the way-really easy!) That $100 worth fed us three times! Highly recommend.

title: Great birthday dinner
review: My husband and I enjoyed everything we had at Cafe B...  The sangria, deviled egg, stuffed olive, lamb, salmon, Brussels sprouts, and tomato salad were very tasty. For dessert we had flan and the banana dessert. Fun place with a good atmosphere.

title: Still the Best!
review: We are on a Chicago food trip. After visiting some favorites, we returned to Caf Ba-ba-reeba. My husband and I agreed this was the best meal so far.Some of the dishes have changed. We ordered the heirloom tomato salad with green goddess dressing. It was a de-constructed salad: beautiful and tasty. We ordered octopus...different than before and tasty. My husband likes fruity drinks.. They had a special of mango sangria. He loved it. They have a new fried chicken dish with piri-piri sauce. Yum!

title: Good tapas and sangria
review: We eat at CBBR once a year for the past 15 years. A pitcher of Sangria and a bowl of Gazpacho are mandatory. We were disappointed in the Gazpacho this year. I don;t know if the soup was different or we like our version better. It was good but not the great soup we remember. We had a special tapa of stuffed peppers, the lamb, accompanied by an order of Brussels sprouts with manchego cheese salad, All were excellent as is the service.

title: Great Dinner
review: Group of 8 for dinner.  Service and food were great. Get the seafood paella. They have a great assortment of tapas. The curry chicken salad was terrific.  Get an outside table.  Reasonably priced.

title: Best Margarita
review: Both of our daughters had eaten here on trips to Chicago. After a stroll through Lincoln Park, we stopped in for drinks and tapas. The food was amazing.
