The margaritas were the best we've EVER had in a restaurant or bar. My husband makes a great margarita and these rivaled his. This restaurant was full of atmosphere and delicious food.

title: Excellent. Thank you TripAdvisor!
review: Last night in Chicago...after two nights of Deep Dish pizza we were after something a bit more adventurous and wholesome. Searched TA and found this place. Could only get an 8:30pm dinner reservation (at 3pm that day). On arrival , good service and promptly shown to our table. Very busy, bustling atmosphere with a mix of tourists and locals. Good sign. Our server was great - we ordered the half pitcher of White Peach Sangria. Great! We ordered the Pork Paella for two and 3 X Tapas (on the portion guidance of the server - which was spot on). Paella was great - rich, flavorsome, good mix of textures and well seasoned.The other tapas were:Spicy Potatoes - excellent!! Great flavor but not over seasoned either Shrimp - excellent. Well cooked and just a hint of spice from chilliCalamari - also excellent. Very tender, nice coating. Excellent meal and great way to finish the visit to Chicago.

title: Yum tapas!!!
review: The goat cheese app is the absolute best! And the classic red sangria, great service and great food, love this place highly recommend

title: Great for large groups, amazing food and service
review: My friends and I came to Cafe Ba Ba Reeba for my birthday and since we were a large group (25 people), I had to plan ahead with their coordinator. Michelle was a pleasure to work with and was extremely responsive and made planning my birthday very easy. We got a private room and a selection of cold/hot tapas as well as unlimited beer, wine, and sangria for three hours for a reasonable $70 per person.Given our group size, we had a private room in the back that was a bit small for standing given the table was in the way but once we sat down it was spacious. There was a server making sangrias and ensuring our cups were always topped off the whole time. The food was amazing and the portions were very generous. We definitely had more than enough to eat and there were a wide variety of choices to pick from. The highlights were the Caesar salad, short ribs, and meatballs in sherry sauce. The sangria was good (nothing exceptional) and I heard those who had wine were happy with the house selections. I would definitely come back for a group event or just to have a regular dinner. The restaurant was packed on the Friday night that we went and seemed to have a great ambiance. Highly recommended!

title: Tapas Heaven!
review: First ate here in the 90s when I was an university student, and went back recently and it was still delicious. Stick with the tapas rather than the heavy paellas dish. The octopus, squid, shrimp, and the vegetable tapas are amazing!

title: Always a favorite
review: We love love love the Spanish tapas at this place always a great ambiance and very delicious food, simply amazing We always go back for more and their sangria its to die for

title: Sweet little restaurant
review: Cute restaurant in Lincoln Park. The tapas were tasty, and fairly standard for Spanish tapas. Service was excellent. We enjoyed being in this neighborhood very much.

title: Family friendly, but feels like a factory
review: Great service. Went with kids (7.5 & 4) per the recommendation of a website that said it was family friendly. It is and the kids were entertained with wikiSticks and the kids cups. Felt that the server was knowledgeable and friendly. Food came QUICKLY and it was just okay. Interesting tapas plates, but nothing stood out. Recently traveled to Europe and enjoyed tapas, so this was a little disappointing. Nothing was bad, we liked the red wine flight and the atmosphere. Pet peeve is when waiters bring out new plates and there is. I room on the table, b/c it hasn't been cleared. This restaurant is HUGE and it felt that speed and quantity have replaced quality.

title: Mediocre
review: This feels like a scene for twentysomethings with blowouts. The food was mediocre. Mushy gushy octopus was the low point. Garlic shrimp was the high point. But who can screw up garlic shrimp? Completely overrated on TripAdvisor as far as I can tell.

title: Good Food, Noisy Atmosphere
review: We reserved here for a birthday dinner. There were 5 of us and we tried to schedule online but we could only reserve for 4 so we called and they were able to accommodate all five of us.Upon entering (around 7 pm) it was very very noisy. Our table was in a room outside the bar area so we were glad for that.We ordered two tapas (small plates) per person and then shared them. The items we ordered were: tomato salad, spicy potato (it was spicy), brussel salad (very good), beef empanada (the empanada was good but the dressing was bland), chicken piri (very very good) and a special hummous plate which didn't have much flavor. We also ordered a vegetarian paella which was very good and was a good portion size.Overall the food was very good. Service was excellent.

title: Delicious Tapas!
review: We met my local friend here for dinner during our trip and it was so delicious! The white peach sangria is so refreshing in the summer. The tapas style menu allowed us to try lots of different things and we loved everything we tried. The spicy potatoes and beef empanada were my favorites. Don't forget to ask for a dessert menu - the selections also come in the perfect small bites so you can get a taste of something sweet without a heavy dessert.

title: Amazing Tapas
review: Fantastic meal with friends. The wait staff were amazing, the food was delicious and the restaurant was of high standard. Go here!

title: Very Good Sangrias and tapas
review: We had the seasonal blueberry sangria, that came with lots of fresh fruit including crisp green apples. Half a picture of that was about 4 to 5 glasses, and was $21. The tapas we had were the Brussel sprout salad, The bacon wrapped dates, the hanger steak, and the grilled octopus. My husbands favorite was the octopus, and I really enjoyed the brussels sprout salad. The restaurant was extremely busy and we made reservations about two weeks in advance. Not sure if you need to do it that far in advance, but for sure do a reservation. The stop is about the restaurant Isabel kno The restaurant was extremely busy and we made reservations about two weeks in advance. Not sure if you need to do it that far in advance, but for sure do a reservation. The restaurant is not far from the brown line Armitage (sp?) stop.

title: Great Spanish small plate tapas varieties
review: The happy hour's are 4-6pm Mon.thru Sun. Eat at the bar section. The atmosphere is quite pleasant & comfortable. The food came out quickly & everything was delicious. You can try bite size tapas from $1-$3.25. We had a single large olive with white anchovy & piparra pepper from the $1 selection.We also had chicken & ham Croquetas, Moroccan chickpea stew, roast dates with bacon in Apple vinaigrette & handmade beef empanadas. The Estrella Damm draught for $2.95 hit the spot.

title: Best Spanish Tapas in America
review: Cafe Ba Ba Reeba was so much fun. Relaxed casual atmosphere. Indoor and outdoor dining. Great wine list and drink options. A fantastic small plate tapas menu which was really extensive. There were 3 in my group and I think we tried 9 or 10 different things. Most enjoyable. The service was also excellent.

title: Excellent Tapas Food!
review: Family chooses tapas to meet each person's dietary needs. This tapas restaurant has been a favorite.No wait time with reservations, excellent table and service. Waitresses and waiters were helpful and attentive. Food was fresh and delicious, variety in sangria and food choices. The fresh bread was delicious, plentiful and served with oil. A little noisy but most restaurants are, not always easy to converse with a group of 6 at a round table.

title: Awesome!
review: Had an awesome experience ! We ordered the pinxtos platter and several tapas, sangria. Every dish was fantastic and the service was perfect. The atmosphere is very lively and fun. Highly recommend the pinxtos platter- get to try 6 different things. Octopus was amazing. Cheese plate was an excellent way to end main meal. Save room for a tiny dessert - at $3.50 each you have to try something. The butterscotch flan was super.

title: Buena comida! And fun atmosphere
review: Our group of five visited Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba a few weeks ago, at the recommendation of family. The place was buzzing on a Saturday in the very early evening but we had a reservation and were seated right away. Lots and lots of food options and there is no way anyone could leave here hungry. We ordered a variety of tapas and pintxos and every dish was great. Service was splendid. This is one of my son's favorite places, and we can see why.

title: Something for Everyone, True Authentic Spanish Tapas
review: After recently visiting 10 cities in Spain and enjoying numerous genuine Spanish Tapas Restaurants I can attest to the fact that Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba is the real deal. It has been years since the last time I visited this restaurant but I have to say they have been and continue to be very consistent in every good way, quality, quantity, efficiency, pricing, etc. Their timing for delivery of your order is perfect and this is key in a Tapas restaurant, to soon and you have too many plates on the table, too late and your siting there with nothing to eat. The variety of cold and hot tapas is second to none and I can guarantee you that there is something to satisfy everyone's palate. There is parking on the street depending on the day and time of the week and there is always Valet parking available. There is a very large bar area where you can order drinks and food. I always recommend reservations for any evening, although this place is huge it is always packed, Anita will most likely be taking your call and she has been there for over 12 years which tells you a lot about this place, she is a sweetheart and efficient like everything in Ba-Ba Reeba's.

title: Excellent Tapas spot
review: For this special occasion that brought us to Chicago, we wanted to dine something more "different" .We're not disappointed! The tapas are exquisite, please do try the squid & octopus...there to die for!The Sangria is also notable!Very nice decor, with a nice bar and even some outside seating.The waterboy was a bit slack, but it didn't tint the overall experience!

title: Great time!
review: Matt our server made eating at this fun place more enjoyable! He was helpful in explaining amount to order and his food recommendations were spot on. Even if you can't be lucky enough to have Matt- highly recommended for a fun night!(Try to be seated on the patio)

title: Delicious!
review: The food was absolutely delicious and everything we tried was perfect.  Service was great and the atmosphere made for a fun night out. They offered a blueberry sangria special and it was wonderfully refreshing.

title: Traditional tapas with a twist
review: Celebrated friend's birthday here. They claim to be the oldest tapas restaurant in Chicago. The place is huge and busy (reservations recommended). The ambience is good. The service is good as well, but felt a little rushed as our waiter had a fairly large section. Was surprised that traditional olives were not provided (you have to buy them), which was a little strange. The tapas were mostly traditional with a little twist, i. e. baked bacon-wrapped dates with apples in apple vinegar reduction. Good sangria. Overall, good place for tapas, would recommend.

title: Great food and service
review: Excellent tapas restaurant.  We ordered six dishes plus desert and all were flavorful and excellent.  Service was very attentive as well.  Atmosphere was fun.   Would recommend.

title: Great food!
review: My friend is a Spanish teacher and had been to this restaurant before, so she made reservations for us. She loves it and now I know why. There was such a good variety of food to choose from. Because they're smaller servings, we had several different menu items and I loved them all. I wish I lived in Chicago so I could keep going back to try more things.

title: Delicious tapas!
review: Our cousins took us to this delicious Tapas restaurant for dinner. Although we had reservations, we still had to wait 15 minutes but it was worth the wait! We were escorted to the room by the bar and immediately saw the huge loaves of bread! We then decided on several plates of goat cheese and bread, salmon toast, beef empanada, mushrooms, and potato and onion omelettes. All were delicious and the wait staff was attentive and nice too.

title: Tapas on Halsted
review: Great tapas and music on Halsted. A great address in Chicago, has been there for over 20 years and still going. I haven't tried it this last time, went there but because it was over thanksgiving, it was closed.

title: Nice busy Tapas place
review: Wanted to try other versions of tapas from what we were used to and found this lively place in north side near Lincoln Park. Wait staff in bar was especially good and tried a variety of dishes there before going into the restaurant. Chicago is really a great restaurant town and this place adds to it with variety and a nice atmosphere. Food was good, not exceptional, but worth it.

title: Great food
review: We went for dinner.  The food was amazing.  Service was great.  The decorations are very Spanish.  The tapas are very good.  Try the Spanish omlet it is a must.  All we tried was great.  Highly recommended.

title: Best tapas in Lincoln Park
review: Must haves here are the sangria, baked goat cheese, and the paella.  Yummy food and vibrant scene.  A favorite for years!

title: Loved this place
review: Had a fun brunch here. Great Bloody Mary bar, loved the innovative tasting menu concept with dishes like bacon wrapped dates and deviled eggs with spicy jam. Had the sampler platter too - it was all amazing - nothing left!

title: Great tapas and service!
review: This is our second time here. Not disappointed!! Great food. We were late for reservations due to traffic. No problem seating us right away. We had an excellent cheese platter, curry chicken salad, spicy potatoes and meatballs tapas. This is from my wife and myself who spent four weeks in Spain last year eating tapas. The service is great.

title: Still awesome
review: Great tapas and sangria. The bonus is happy hour, when many tapas are 1/2 price. Killer sangria pitchers and reasonably priced beer at happy hour too. Very vegetarian friendly. My favorite choices are the spicy potatoes and the Spanish tortilla (omelet). I hope to come back next time I am in Chicago. Fed four adults with drinks for $25 per person easy. Great service.

title: Tapa Done Right
review: We were a group of 4 which is good because it allows ordering a much larger variety of small plates. We were in a back room which allowed a very relaxed experience. Subdued lighting, not too noisy, clean. We were early in the evening and the place filled up as the night went on. The food was excellent. We felt the service was fine (we weren't in a hurry) but the server comped us dessert - I guess because he felt there was some delay in dishes! The grilled octopus was soooo good. The pintxo platter is also a fine choice. With hotter weather coming in the Sangria (pitcher) hits the spot.

title: Reused skillet for Paella?
review: The Seafood Paella came with very hard rice kernels, suggesting that the skillet used was reused from previous orders, causing me to nearly break a tooth instead of enjoying a soft and moist dish . Flavor was good as was the size of the shrimp and scallops, but the signature dish left much to be desired overall. Sangria, another favorite came watered down. Passion fruit flavor was minimal unfortunately. Patatas Bravos tapas were great, as was the Queso de Cabra. The massive production of this once charming and popular Chicago landmark that was originally located on Lasalle has taken its toll. Try it for fun drinks and appetizers, but there are better options for a full meal or graduation celebration.

title: Tapas
review: I went here Friday night on a date. First of all I live in palatine which is about 40 min drive without traffic. Our server velibor was very personable and engaging . The sangria is always good and the food is amazing . Everything was great except for one thing and that one thing made a Huge difference from the last time I visited. My favorite item on the menu had been removed and needless to say I was highly disappointed and even upset . Item # 68 which is the pork ribs with the sherry glaze had been inexplicably taken off the menu . I don't know If there is someone sitting in an office somewhere making these decisions but whoever it is needs to rethink his/her decision . The pork ribs are BY FAR the Best item on the menu and the reason why I tell all my friends and family to visit the restaurant . I even told my date just wait til you have the last item ( saved the best for last ) when I realized it had been replace with a subpar choice . I asked to speak to a manager which is something I never do ( due to the fact that I work In the industry ), mike the manager came over and was very polite and professional and I appreciated his understanding . I would have given this restaurant 5 stars if it wasn't for this extremely poor choice of removing the pork ribs, but instead I only gave it 4. I truly hope someone at the corporation reads this and makes the decision to return this item back to the menu . I'm really hoping that the next time I visit cafe ba ba reeba I will not be disappointed once again.

title: Excellent for gluten-free
review: Had a great dining experience here last night. Three of the four of our group have wheat, gluten, and dairy issues. The waiter (Jose S) could not have been more accommodating and gracious. While there was a slight mix up with some bread that was served with the cheese platter, it turned out alright and he was very apologetic (another server made the mistake). His recommendation of white wine was very good. Each of the tapas we ordered were very delicious. I highly recommend and look forward to returning.

title: Delicious!
review: A friend arranged for a fixed menu and it couldn't have been better. The food was incredible, presentation was perfection and the service was great. My favorites were the short ribs and goat cheese in tomato sauce but the croquets, meat balls and brussels sprout salad were fantastic too!

title: Authentic Chicago experience with distinctive style and food!
review: We were looking for the food and experience of a classic Chicago restaurant... got it and more with Ba-Ba-Reeba! Our party of 4 included ages 23 to 87 and everyone enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Attentive service. Responsive to slight reservation change. Good cross-section of food that was delightfully sharable! Love the neighborhood too as it's close to plenty of other entertainment and hotels. Definitely will return!!!

title: Best Spanish restaurant in Chicago
review: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. It's been around for a very long time. One of the original successes of the Lettuce Entertain You restaurant empire. It was an original inspiration 40 years ago and remains to this day. Better than the closest 3 competitors (Chicago metro area), sorry to the competition. Menu's continue to be fresh and inspired. This time we had gambas a la plancha, pincho de solomillo, patatas bravas and the cold salmon platter. All my favorites. Strawberry mojito's x 2. Very romantic restaurant for a date. Also good to impress business guests from out of town. They have excellent shows like Flamenco night or paella cooking class. After your are done, take a stroll in the neighborhood, one of the nicest in Chicago.

title: Great food and drink, service a bit rushed
review: I recommend this restaurant, as the food is great, the craft cocktails are tasty, and the house tempranillo goes down easily. But we got our first three tapas within seconda of getting our drinks, and our waiter checked in too often to ask what else we wanted to order. We fixed this by letting him know that we were not in a hurry.

title: THE BEST
review: We are foodies that seek out creative fresh dining when we travel. We agreed that we had one of the best meals of all time tonight. Delicious wine with the tapas sampler, hanger steak, short ribs, stuffed mushrooms and brussel sprouts salad topped off with the kahlua truffle and butterscotch dessert were all over the top. We had great service from our bartender and had his name to give him proper credit for all of his recommendations. My first stop when I return to Chicago!! Thanks for a fabulous evening!!

title: Lively tapas spot in Lincoln Park
review: We enjoyed the wide variety of tapas choices at Lincoln Park's bustling Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba. We ordered a few at a time until we were full. Wish we'd had room for more. Each dish was delicious and enough to share among the 4 of us. A perfect place if you're in the mood for tapas.

title: Wonderful Customer Service
review: We ate here during a trip to Chicago & loved it. It was very smoothly run from the time we walked in until our departure. We had an incident with broken glass & they have been lovely about resolving it. The bacon wrapped dates & the grilled lamb were outstanding. We wanted to get everything on the menu!

title: Great atmosphere, great food and drinks
review: I've never really been bothered about tapas before but we came here after a friend told me it was really good. We've now been twice and both times were excellent.On our first visit we came for lunch. Our waitress explained the menu nicely, giving us an idea of how much food to order (we ended up with 6 plates between the two of us). She also brought us samples of all the sangria's they have so we could decide which one we wanted which was a nice touch. The tapas were really good. Evenything tasted really fresh - things came as and when they were ready which is always a good sign! To cap it off we got a free desert because it was our first visit! On our second visit we came with a larger group for brunch and had the breakfast paella which was well worth the long wait (again providing it's made to order). We had the same waitress again and she was great again.We have already been back but would go over and over.

title: Great food and fun
review: Great spot for tapas.  It was busy and loud but not in a bad way.  The food was fabulous and varied and we had great drinks too.  Definitely a nice unpretentious low key dinner place.

title: Still a favorite after many years
review: Yummy tapas and refreshing sangrias. Don't skip desserts because they are as good as all the tapas. There's always great food and a fun atmosphere.

title: Delicious Tapas
review: Everything about this place is great. We made reservations on Open Table a week in advance. When we arrived, the place was packed, but we were escorted to our table right away. Four of us split a pitcher of sangria and 7 tapas. Each of us loved every plate! We all wished we could have made room to order more, but we were stuffed. The waiter was knowledgeable and efficient. The ambience was lively and the price was right- only $60 per couple including tip. You can't beat that!

title: Long time favorite
review: Used to go here lots in the 80s & 90s when lived and worked in the city. Wonderful to see it still has great food, sangria and an excellent vibe! We had reservations for a Saturday night which is the way to go... very crowded! Excellent service and love the paella, bacon wrapped dates, potatoes salad, meat balls and everything else we ate! We got a pitcher of white peach and red sangria, definitely the way to go, has about 6 servings per pitcher. So lovely, we'll not wait so long and be back very soon!

title: energy, flavor, warmth
review: Interesting food, energetic but not chaotic atmosphere, knowledgable servers, flavors, flavors. great dining experience

title: Spanish tapas & sangria? Count me in.
review: It was our first time here and I'm sure there will be plenty more visits in the future. Don't forget to make reservations ahead of time, especially if dining on the weekends. We were lucky enough to get last minute reservations on a Friday night. The place was already packed even before 6 p.m.Right off the bat we got a pitcher of the white peach sangria. Just the right amount of sweetness and super refreshing. Probably could have drank the whole pitcher to myself it was THAT good.For the tapas, we got a little too excited and ordered more food that our stomachs could handle. Between the two of us we ordered 6 plates and a dessert, which were:- Chorizo wrapped dates (#1)- Deviled egg (#5)- Spicy potatoes & tomato aioli (#30)- Citrus cured salmon (#40)- Octopus (#43)- Serrano ham, salchichon, & chorizo (#61)- Caramelized bananaVery satisfied with all the items we ordered. Everything was delicious! Can't wait to come back and try more, especially the paella. They also have happy hour at the bar Monday-Friday from 4 to 6 and Friday/Saturday 10 to midnight, which includes $16 pitchers of the classic sangria, $1 pintxos, and select tapas for less than $3.50.*Tip: if you check into Yelp, you can redeem a free dessert!

title: Excellent Tapas in Lincoln Park
review: I love Cafe Babareeba! So much fun for a date night, friend get together, or party. The food always comes out quickly and the menu changes regularly to give some new options. I always get a pitcher of sangria, passion fruit is my favorite but they have several flavors. The bacon wrapped dates are a must, but I've loved pretty much everything I have tried here. The brunch is great, too! I'd make a reservation if you're going on the weekend, as it gets very busy. If you enjoy tapas and sangria, give it a try next time you are in Lincoln Park!

title: Wow! Wow! Wow!
review: We had some friends pick us up at our hotel and take us to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for my birthday! It was absolutely incredible. The tapas and sangria are both amazing. We were able to relax, dine, and visit with no pressure to leave. Very relaxed atmosphere. We will most certainly go back there on our next trip to Chicago!

title: Still wonderful after all these years
review: Hadn't been here in many years and decided to revisit. Went on a Tuesday night. (half priced bottles of wine) It was not crowded and we had wonderful service. We each had the mixed plate of 6 small tapas. Each was a unique taste treat. Then had the pork paella which had pork cooked several different ways (all great). Don't ignore the delicious bread either. We're already planning our next visit since we want to try the small plates which we couldn't really do in addition to the paella.

title: Very good tapas with great service!
review: Very good reasonably priced tapas - nice place for a group or smaller party.   Waiter was top-notch, didn't rush us and had good suggestions.

title: Love this place
review: Authentic tapas. All are amazing. Great sangria. Definitely a must, especially with shareable plates for everyone

title: After so many years still one of my favorite
review: We came on a Monday evening and we're seated immediately without a reservation. Twinkle lights & candle light create a warm ambience. Our server, Jesse, kindly talked us through the menu and recommended the pomegranate sangrias, which were terrific. We tried six or seven different tapas, each equally delicious. Several girls were enjoying a girls night out, couples were on dates & families were gathered together. It's budget friendly & a good place for an evening out for all.

title: A unique experience
review: This is an energetic, crowded restaurant with fun, unique small plates. The dishes are innovative and delicious, but the service is sporadic, sometimes a long wait between plates. Must have a reservation. Definitely worth the effort to get there. And they have valet parking for $13.

title: Disappointing
review: I deeply love the atmosphere of the restaurant. But please do something with the air conditioning, it was cold and zfter so hot and so cold. Do something for that cause its not good. You take your coat you take it off thats annoyingSangria is good but not wonderful. A wide variety of tapas, olives are so disappointing no flavor, nothing. Mushrooms were good. The bavette was quite ok too. The mozza buffala was not good at all, i didnt like it. The tomatoes on the bread to go with had no flavor, had some thyme and salt. The chorizo salchichon and manchego was pretty good. Price are okay

title: Very good food and excellent service
review: Been here for the first time, arrived a bit earlier then reservation time and they seated us right away. Very busy and decor was cool.Ordered the black raspberry sangria strong and fruity. Ordered the date, chorizo and deviled eggs from the tiny bites menu....the dates were the winner the eggs were a bit salty but tasty.Then ordered the Brussels sprout salad (delicious) give you a lot for one plate. Great nutty flavor. Shrimp were delicious more tastier then I thought. Scallop plate was okay.Hanger steak was good but I was a bit underwhelmed.Burrata was great quality the tomato jam was awesome!Dessert had the chocolate cake which was rich.The service was excellent, can't complain everyone was friendly.Would definitely come back next time I'm in town.

title: Great food. Make a reservation.
review: This very popular tapas restaurant won't disappoint. The bacon wrapped dates are terrific, the atmosphere is fun and you can easily hear one another talk.

title: Very good
review: Friendly staff, good food. Cheese and charcuterie plate was very good. Fresh baked bread and wonderful  marmalade.  The filet with blue cheese, garlic shrimp and salmon tapas were the favorites. Dessert favorites were the chocolate truffle and cheesecake.  Waiter was great!

title: Need flavorful tapas any time?!
review: We popped in mid afternoon and enjoyed delicious tapas straight away. Engaging rustic atmosphere and decor, we enjoyed the variety and flavors.

title: Best Tapas!
review: Delicious tapas! Absolutely love so many dishes on the menu! The Sangria is excellent. Favorite is the classic Red Sangria. Always enjoy the Bacon-Wrapped Dates, Baked Goat Cheese, Beef Tenderloin & Blue Cheese, Meatballs, Spicy Potatoes, and Seafood Paella. Must try the desserts as well! Perfect for any occasion. Always a great experience.

title: Nice Sat lunch
review: This place is awesome. Nothing better then sharing small plates. Little bit of everything for everyone. We selected 5 small plates and I had the white wine flight. 2 of the 3 wines were varieties were Spain's varieties and very good. So 3 different wines - very good and 5 different small plates. Perfect food storm. It is a little load - so sit close or talk loud. Look forward to coming back.

title: Fun Night with Friends and Great Food
review: We were there in January with a group of teenage girls and a couple of moms. I was a little worried that the teenagers would not willing to go out on a limb and try new things....Boy was I wrong! We ordered a few plates to share... meatballs, bacon wrapped dates, potatoes, empanadas and croquettes. The girls really enjoyed it all! The potatoes were their favorites!!! The sangria was outstanding....This is a really fun place with a great atmosphere and great prompt service. I am looking forward to my return trip whenever I'm in the city!!

title: Great, Great fun and Great food
review: From the moment we hit the front door and the smell of garlic and other spices hit our noses we knew it was on! We started at the bar and we're going to get a table but our waiter at the bar table was awesome. We let him make the decisions and the food kept coming. One thing after another and one thing better than the next! Go! Go right now!

title: Very good Spanish. Large selection
review: Large selection of Spanish items. Everything we had, there were 4 of us, so a lot of small items, was very good. First time I tried the moroccan chickpea stew. It was excellent. Other items which I regularly have at another suburban spanish restaurant were also very good but not quite as good as that other place. Specifically referring to the patatas bravas and the pincho solomillo. Food comes out very fast. You may want to stagger your order so you can have a more leisurely meal.

title: New Restaurant to add to my list of favorites
review: We celebrated a late x-mas with my son's fiancee'.  First time there.  Loved it.  Lots of action--it was packed on a Tuesday night. We had beef, chicken, Octopus, scallops, seafood paella. 2 types of Sangria.  We will be back!!

title: Great for big group
review: We had dinner with 10 and sat at a long table in front of the restaurant. Tapas style worked perfect because the dishes can be shared and it is fun to discover the different flavors. We ordered 20 different dishes, had a big jar of sangria and yummy deserts. All enjoyed the evening. Only that was missing was a big salad, will order that next time

title: Comfort food
review: We had about 10 of us and did family style. No idea what all the things we had were but the simple truth is everything was really good. We tried all the flavors of SanGria and they were solid. They had a bar next door and I wish we had time to hang out as it really looked like old style Chicago haunt (very cool). Will go back for sure

title: Unique style
review: If you want to make eating an experience Cafe Ba Ba Reeba delivers . My family prefers tapas as you can try variety . There were very unique items on the menu which we have seen no where. Amazing taste. Brunch options on weekend which allows you to explore both lunch and breakfast menus. The spicy Bloody Mary is great too. One is sure to repeat. The Spanish server and the local Spanish ambience does not look mad up!

title: Almost perfect but reservation was an issue
review: The atmosphere and food at this restaurant are great, We normally visit a different tapas restaurant in the city and gave this one a try. It started badly as they did not have our reservation on file even with I having the reservation confirmation email and number. After a while we were told that they were running 15-20 minutes behind which made me wonder why I even made a reservation since everyone there was seated before us anyway. Once we were seated the food was great and the service was also great. The place was packed but things went well. They forgot to bring us one of the dishes but a quick reminder and it was brought out immediately. I highly recommend the croquetas and the empanadas.

title: Favorite Tapas Restaurant in Chicago (Lincoln Park)
review: I eat here every chance I get when I visit Chicago. It's a quick cab ride from the mag mile and well worth the visit. We usually go with a group of 6-8 so we can order a variety of small plates. Even my teens love it here and we comment that we have never ordered a plate we didn't love. It's all fantastic and the sangria's are the best around!

title: Great everything
review: The food is amazing!! we tried 6 different dishes and all of them great. When we arrived the kitchen was about to close and they were still able to accomodate us and serve us amazing food. The food and beer menu is pretty authentic and has many Spanish items.

title: Good but not great
review: Came with a large party of 9. The food was tasteful but somewhat inconsistent. We had 2 orders of each tapa and 2 types of paella. One of the paellas was "al dente", the others rice was fine, one of the calamaris was soggy and rubbery the other one was fine. One of the short ribs was stringy, the other fork tender.The cava sangria was only so so. The deserts were great and being small "tapa" portions adequately sized and not the enormous portions one sometimes gets. Servers always kept our water glasses filled and waitress was always checking in on us. The place is a little noisy but not excessively so.For about $35 per person it was good value but you can get better tapas at smaller establishments. Maybe thats the problem here, its almost like a chain restaurant.

title: My favorite!
review: Will never get tired of this place!! The tapas are great, they have amazing gluten free options and the quality is always the same. My favorite options are the bacon wrapped dates, the patatas bravas, tortilla española and the pimientos de padrón. The classic sangria is my favorite drink.

title: Amazing Tapas in a great setting!
review: We've had Tapas all over the world, and who knew that Chicago would have one of the best Tapas menus anywhere? The food is delicious, authentic and the variety of choices is vast. Don't miss the Paella choices - several and all of them great. The sangrias are terrific and, again, several good choices. The excellent meal was matched by superior service. Cannot recommend Ba-Ba-Reeba too highly - everything is a treat!

title: Great food and great atmosphere
review: Our favorite restaurnt in Chicago.  Delicious food, reasonable prices, very pleasant and attentive waitstaff

title: Always excellent!
review: We have gone to this restaurant about 10 times and we are always amazed at how consistently excellent it is. It is a tapas restaurant so you order several small dishes. The service is excellent as well as the food. It is a Spanish tapas cuisine.

title: Unusual tapas;  great sangria!
review: Very innovative tapas dishes.  Service was great;  liked the appetizer sampler so you could get a small bite of all the appetizers.  Sangria was great but they also offer wine flights, etc.

title: Worth a visit
review: Nice tapas restaurant in Lincoln Park. We stopped here on a Sunday with our kids. We were seated immediately. The restaurant is charming but the area we sat in would fluctuate from evening cold to warm. The menu has ample choices. Wine menu is acceptable. They offer several flavors of sangria. Staff is friendly and attentive. Food is prepared quickly, but not so so quickly to feel rushed. Food is good but I agree with previous reviews that nothing we had was a "wow that was incredible". Definitely a good place though. Family friendly and worth the trip.

title: Amazing Food!
review: Our daughter made reservations for my birthday. Unfortunately, her mock-trial contest delayed us and even though we called to inform the restaurant we would be delayed, we still had to wait almost 40 minutes. Once we were seated, the wait staff was extremely helpful and attentive. Our bread bowl and water glasses were never empty. The food was made extremely fast and was delicious. The desserts were delicious. We were shocked that 6 of us had alcoholic beverages, several tapas plates and dessert for less than $20 per person. It was a memorable birthday because the waitress brought my dessert out with a candle and everyone at our table sang Happy Birthday to me.

title: I'd settle for Cafe Ba Ba Reeba
review: While it's definitely not my favorite (or even in my top 10 favorite) tapas places in the city, it does have a great/friendly/helpful staff and fantastic atmosphere. The choices on the menu are good, it's just that I've never been blown away by anything I've eaten there (nothing where I said, 'oh wow, that's amazing!')It's also located in Lincoln Park, so it's easily accessible - and there is plenty to do before/after you eat!

title: a 'must eat' on my visit to Chicago!
review: passionate staff who introduces you menu in details.  the cuties thing is that I thought the staff is from Italy (cute accent) then he is actually from Ohio. XD XD delicious food, good portion, great wine, good price!  definitely will come again next time.

title: Bday party
review: This is a mixed review. In their favor, they sat us even though we were late for our reservation. Initially the service was on point but as the evening progressed we got less and less attention from our server and often had to ask other people for him or other foods we wanted to try. They were accommodating for a drink that tasted like socks (the mezcal mule- DO NOT GET IT) and the bursts was cold which I would have rather had warm but then braised short ribs without a doubt stole the show. The Brussels sprout salad was delish, the calamari was fresh and tender and perfectly fried. Overall, delish food, mediocre service.

title: great brunch
review: we arrived in Chicago on a Sunday and havng brunch was mandatory. We managed to book a table at this place and we did not regret it. Many different options, food was very tasty (we had a few mimosas, eggs benedict and a tempura pumpkin special), although a bit on the oily side. Service was also very good and price was fair. Would definitely come back here again.

title: Great Food - Great Atmoshere
review: My wife and I went with our son and his girlfriend. Since this is a Tapas restaurant, we ordered 10 different dishes and shared it all. All I can say is that all 10 dishes were practically wiped clean and all four of us were thoroughly satisfied with each plate. This was a great experience.

title: Food.....Done
review: Fantastic spot. If you're in the area definitely a place to hit up. Food is full of favour and would recommend 3 dishes if you're hungry. Make sure you book. Thankfully 6.30pm suited us. But that's all they had. Awesome problem to have

title: Like Being in Spain
review: My daughter and I had been in Granada Spain a few years ago and enjoyed Tapas everywhere we ordered a Cerveza or Tinto Verdano. We relived that experience at Café Ba=Ba-Reeba. We sat at the bar and had several different tapas. The bartender was especially happy that we ordered the Morcilla (blood sausage). The croquettas were also fantastic.

title: Fun time great food
review: Unique and fun place to spend time enjoying out of the ordinary foods. Sampled a number of the topa's and they were all delicious. Friendly helpful staff and servers.

title: Loved the Bites!
review: Cozy Large room. We enjoyed a date night on a Sunday Evening and the room was packed. Took a journey through the Tapas menu. Love the Shishito Peppers. Listed as Fried Green Peppers finished with salt..lovely tasty surprise. Loved the Manchego stuffed dates. The bread basket was great. The cocktails ... give those a 3 and the service a 4 ...servers take the orders and someone goes through with a loaded tray of bites..drops them off ..have a nice day. They had a tasty Octopus special that we we enjoyed. Bites were presented in a simple fashion. Overall nice experience...tasty bites we recommend trying everything!

title: Great tapas
review: Great selection of tapas and delicious food. The place has a great bar and lively atmosphere. The restaurant was surprisingly big but service was a bit slow and we waited for dome time to be seated despite having reservations. Good for a night out and sharing with friends.

title: Cafe BaBaReeba
review: What a pleasant surprise this restaurant was. We had dinner with family there and the food was outstanding. It is a tapas restaurant with a multitude of selections. In particular you must try the paella. Our server was excellent and explained our choices.we tried all the desserts....yum

title: Fun time with any group
review: Tapas...as long as you understand the concept of getting a bunch of items this place is a blast. I went with my wife and son and we tried about 7-8 dishes all of them were good but we all picked a few which made it a more enjoyable experience! With a big group grab a pitcher as the normal cocktails can get pricy

title: Something for everyone.
review: Festive atmosphere with lots of attentive servers. Good variety of tapas including veggie dishes, plenty of meat dishes and paella. Try the brussel sprouts salad. Tasty sangria as well. In Lincoln Park close to blues and Wrigley.

title: Delicious Tapas!
review: Loved everything! Get a pitcher of their classic red sangria and be sure to put your paella order in early! The staff does a great job of bringing out the dishes and is very attentive. The place is loud and a great experience - so it is not the right place for a quiet dinner. If you have never had tapas before - make sure to tell the staff so they can assist with your ordering!

title: Recommendation
review: This great Spanish Tapas Bar was recommended to us by the concierge at our hotel in Downtown, as we were heading out to Lincoln Park for the evening.To be honest, if I had just been passing I would not have looked twice at this place but I would have missed out.It is a lot bigger inside than it looks, had a great atmosphere, great menu and great Sangria.Our server was very helpful and the food excellent.

title: Gluten Free/Celiac: Tapas!
review: They have a gluten free menu of tapas that are entirely appropriate for someone with Celiac, such as I. We had garlic potato salad, hanger steak, chicken/chorizo kabob, braised short-rib, chocolate cake (YES! GLUTEN FREE!) and carmelized banana with ice cream. And sangria. The best of the bunch was the hanger steak and the mashed potatoes on the short rib plate. Sharing these small plates was great. Service was speedy and friendly. We really enjoyed the food, the waitstaff, and our time.

title: Good food
review: The food was good but nothing to write home about. Very packed and took 40 minutes to be seated. Great looking establishment

title: Excellent dinner
review: Everything was super. Ordered 5 plates for 2 of us but really needed only 4. The shrimp and the mushrooms was excellent. Sangria was ok but not great. I recommend this neighborhood place

title: Excellent tapas, fun atmosphere
review: Excellent wine menu and good variety of both cold and hot tapas. We tried the patatas bravas, gambas al ajillo, croquetas and jamon iberico. Great service, awesome value for the high quality food.  We will definitely go back

title: Love this place!
review: The red wine sangria is excellent!  Stuffed mushrooms were great!  We were 4 people and ordered 4 tapas and the pork paella for 2 and it was plenty!  Fun spot!  Lively and attentive servers!

title: Outside-the-Box Brunch
review: If you're looking for a unique brunch experience and menu, this is a good place to start. Tapas for breakfast, WOW. Small plates of deep flavors...even the mini pancakes and waffle bites. The Bloody Mary bar was our friend's favorite...virtually a meal in a glass. We only visit Chicago but our next trip will definitely include another visit.

title: Boring food, I won't go back
review: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba had a lot of hype. I organized to meet friends there, and was sorely disappointed. Parking is definitely a problem. You can hunt around the street, but be prepared for a long hunt. About the only option is the valet, so be prepared for $20 including tip.The restaurant is weirdly layed out. Big, as it wanders around into the far back recesses. But it is loud, tables are close together. Not a good environment for business discussion at all. And be prepared to have others listen to your conversation as you talk loudly due to the din, and proximity of other tables.Food is too expensive, and not that good. We ordered a selection of tapas. By Chicago standards, the portions were even smaller than usual. And at about $5-$10 each the price can add up quickly. The most important thing I can say is that 2 days after eating there I couldn't even remember what we ordered - just that ordinary.Every Spanish restaurant should have fantastic paella. But Ba-Ba-Reebas was not good at all. We found the dish to be terribly over-spiced, losing any sense of delicate flavors. After a few bits most people will have their fill, as the after-taste makes the paella less enticing with each bite.The Sangria is OK. And that's the best I can say. Sangria is a drink that reflects the atmosphere of the chef, and it can be quite good. But at Ba-Ba-Reeba it was a lot like what you buy in a bottle in the liquor store.If you don't live in the neighborhood this restaurant is hard to get to, has no parking, and mediocre food. I wouldn't make the drive again, as there are far better places to eat - and better Spanish restaurants in Chicago. Try Cafe Iberico - which is far better and less expensive.

title: Amazing Tapas! A must in chicago!
review: Great service, great food, nice ambiance, loved it!! we had 5 tapas in total for 2 people + 2 deserts! Great mango sangria as well!

title: Still my favorite tapas place!
review: My husband and I have been going to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for over 15 years, but have not been there in the past 2-3 years (only because we no longer live in the city, not because we don't enjoy going to this fabulous restaurant).We took the kids (ages 7 and 10) with us for the first time and were very pleased to find the same festive atmosphere and the same delicious food! We ordered the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, spicy potatoes, beef tenderloin w/blue cheese, chorizo wrapped dates and cheese, seared salmon, and meatballs in tomato sauce. My 7 year old ordered the Mac n cheese from the kids menu. We also ordered a pitcher of red sangria. For dessert, we had the chocolate truffle cake and blood orange sorbet.Overall, we were very pleased with our most recent experience. The only things that disappointed us were the beef tenderloin (under cooked) and the sangria (tasty, but weak). Very glad to see that Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba still delivers on excellent tapas and service!

title: Take your mama here if she's buying !
review: The food was all so tasty! The only complaint was literally how long I had to wait for water and that there is no Parmesan with the bread and olive oil. Great for any occasion!

title: Delicious!
review: Went here in March as part of a Bachelorette weekend and it was really delicious. I can't tell you exactly what we had because we ordered so many different plates but everything we had was good. The sangria was really delicious too and the service was on point. It was a beautiful restaurant, exposed brick walls , nice lighting. There was nothing not to like.

title: Awesome Tapas Experience - rivals the best of Madrid
review: We were visiting Chicago and looking for a convenient Friday lunch. Ba-Ba-Reeba was a 5 minute walk that I'm glad we took. I visit Madrid a couple of times a year for work and have to observe that the Tapas here rivaled some of the best I've had there. The atmosphere was "authentic" though I found the restaurant to be a bit too dark - especially on a sunny September afternoon. Once we got going though all was wonderful. If you know or like Tapas - this is highly recommended. If you haven't had them before - come with an open mind and an appetite.

title: So much food
review: Come hungry! I love tapas because I like to sample many dishes. Prices a Lil high, but about right for location.They offer valet.The food comes out quickly. We enjoyed everything and got 6 dishes for the two of us. Since it was our first visit we got a free dessert.I highly recommend the sangria and we did a half pitcher as it was cheaper since we were both drinking the same sangria.

title: Something for Everybody!
review: One of the finest Spanish tapas meals we've had outside of Spain. Authentic menu, high quality ingredients, and awesome vibe. There is something for everybody here, even if you don't speak Spanish or know tapas. The only knock is how small is the serving of the jamon iberico plate ($20). Aside from that, a place we will hit again and again.

title: Incredible place.
review: We left the ordering up to our waiter and he did not disappoint. Everything that was brought out was fabulous.  The food kept coming until we couldn't eat anymore.  I highly recommend hitting this place when you are in town.

title: Tourist Trap
review: I used to live in the area 26 years ago and loved this place. The food was outstanding. I was excited to return only to find food that was as close to shake and bake as you get. Seriously, the highly yelped about spicy potatoes? Haha...cut up some potatoes, place in baggy w olive oil, paprika and cayenne and bake. We also had shrimp - yawn. Six pieces - we ate two. Barely ok and undercooked. Nothing to write home about and nothing you can't do on your own. The highly touted beef pastry thing? LOLOL. The only thing we can say was "pretty good" was the beef tenderloin and blue cheese. But still, grill a filet and add blue cheese! Done. So sad to report but in my opinion this place has become a tourist trap with it's hard to get reservation, etc. Pass on this one. Chicago is FULL of authentic, and amazing restaurants.

title: It's A Marathon no a Sprint!
review: Everything about this place is top notch!  The Bloody Mary Bar and Sangrias are amazing!  The food will not disappoint!  A must in Chicago!

title: Best tapas
review: Loved everything about this place...great service! We got a free piece of chocolate truffle cake because it was our first visit and boy was it delicious! We had drinks, tapas and coffee. Went for Saturday brunch, it was crowded, but we had a reservation and were seated right away. Everything we tried was excellent ! Can't wait to return!

title: Excellent Brunch
review: Great options, food delivered quickly. Chose the tapas plates and loved that they staggered the delivery, so it wasn't all there at once.  Waffles with berries, tenderloin Benedict and waffles with citus and goat cheese - all delicious!

title: Fun, cozy atmosphere with wonderful service and great food
review: Made a reservation for a friend's birthday dinner, and it was a huge success! We asked the server for dish recommendations, all of which were fantastic. Small, tapas-style plates. Lots of meat and vegetarian options for those with preferences, and are accommodating of allergies. 100% would recommend getting one of the paellas and a pitcher of sangria for a group. For all the food we got - couldn't even finish it all - the final price was such a deal. Amazing value. Would recommend for any and all!

title: From the Tapas to the Sangria to the fun ambiance - This is a great evening of food and fun!
review: The concierge at the Ritz Carlton told us about Cafe Ba Ba Reeba when we asked for a recommendation to find a Spanish tapas restaurant. We had great food and fantastic sangria. They don't take reservations so arrive early or plan to hang out (which isn't hard if you're with friends!). You can order single item pinchos (appetizer that is generally one or two bites) or tapas to share. We did both and enjoyed a great variety of dishes and flavors.We enjoyed shaved brussel sprouts salad with marcona almonds (yumm!); goat cheese baked in tomato sauce with delicious bread; octopus with green harissa sauce; and citrus cured salmon. The pincho I ordered was chorizo-wrapped medjool date with melted cheese... delicious!!

title: Great Ambiance, great tapas
review: Café Ba Ba Reeba offers a huge assortment of options for whatever you have a craving for, and an even bigger selection if you don't know where to begin. They have beef, chicken, pork, veggie, and cheese options. My absolute favorite was the homemade beef empanada. The crust was so flaky, buttery, and had just enough bread to match the meet ratio inside. The pulled beef inside was flavorful and not dry at all. I wanted to order another one but had to save room for olives, cheese plate, chicken thighs, steak, and deviled eggs. I loved everything. Waitress, Madilyn ( I believe) was so nice and helpful, she suggested the chicken thighs which were great. Buttermilk fried with a yogurt harissa sauce, and a salad with celery, onion, radish, and carrots. May sound weird, but it was an amazingly refreshing combo. We also tried the squash blossom frittata which I especially liked because of the flavor of the roasted veggies inside (zucchini, peppers, onion) and the wonderful avocado sauce on top.

title: Amazing Spanish tapas! Almost like being in Spain!
review: We walked over a mile from the closest L stop to get here. Admittedly that made me a bit cranky because it was hot and I was tired. However, once we got in and got seated, my crabbiness disappeared.I don't give excellent ratings easily because any place I visit or stay at must pass certain criteria. In this case, because I have been to Spain so often and love Spanish cuisine, they had a high bar to meet. I was not disappointed. We had an excellent meal made up of a handful of different tapas and washed down with sangría.Very great staff. Our waitress missed part of the order - she brought a full pitcher of sangría when we ordered half. No problem - we were able to keep the full pitcher for the price of the half. I am pretty sure this accounted for the fact that I wasn't crabby walking that mile + to get back to the L. It also accounted for the nap I took when we got back to the hotel.The place is popular and it was packed when we got there. We didn't make a reservation, and we arrived about 2:00 on a Sunday afternoon. I would wait for a table if I get the opportunity to eat here again.

title: Faboo tapas!
review: Fantastic food and a huge menu. The restaurant is busy & noisy. We had very brief wait for a table both Friday and Sunday night with no reservation. Huge menu and plenty of vegan/vegetarian items. They were also happy to hold the cheese on a couple of things to make them vegan. Tip - get 2 orders of the anchovies. YUM!

title: Great experience!
review: My wife and I chose this because of the name and solid trip advisor reviews and it ended up being one of our very favorite meals together of a two week trip. While we often think of tapas as super expensive, Baba-reeba had enough bread and other filling options that allowed us to mix-and-match options that weren't too crazy on the wallet (still mid-price range). The bacon wrapped dates were our absolute favorite. The red sangria was also really really good.

title: Good but not great
review: I am spoiled by Barcelona's in St. Louis, so my tapas expectation is really high. The food was good. The bread was GREAT. The sangria wasn't very good and I love sangria with Tapas. The atmosphere was ok, maybe more of a lunch place. We were on a girls trip, that was long overdue, so we were going all out. I loved the area of town. This might be a great place for locals but I wouldn't send visitors, there are just too many great places to eat. If they improve their sangria, I would go back for lunch and just eat BREAD and the goat cheese. The bread they bring to the table is all you need with the goat cheese, forget the toasted bread. The table bread is delicious.

title: Tapas !!
review: Had some of the best tapas without having to go to Spain !   Tapas Recommendation when at Ba Ba Reeba  Beed Empanada  Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce   Nice ambiance , Great food. Perfect recipe for a wonderful tapa evening !

title: Much better than we expected.
review: I will be brief.This is where we held a small reunion dinner and were at a table in the main dining room and ordered off the regular menu. When we first made contact, management wanted us to order off the party menu, which is better for them but not for us and our many individual tastes.CBBRB specializes in small plate servings that are pretty generous and well-priced. The end result was that we tried and shared many different dishes that were all very-well prepared, much tastier than we expected for such a noisy, mobbed place. The joint was packed early on a Friday evening and I can promise you that everyone was having a good 'ol time.The service and red sangria were great. All of our orders were delivered to the table as they came out of the kitchen, and the little kids dishes arrived before anything else. We arrived via cab. There is no parking lot, and I don't know if they offer valet parking.We will return when we next visit Chicago.

title: Too many tapas!
review: We needed more time and stomach space! As it was, we snagged a spot at the bar since reservations for a table were hard to come by. Tried 6 tapas and were not in the least disappointed by one little bite. Try the pitcher of sangria as well. Yummy!

title: An amazing experience!!
review: Had dinner here for the first time and it was extraordinary!! The deviled egg and olive starters were wonderful and the garlic shrimp was superb. It was the perfect amount of food. I'm not a huge dessert person but I loved the cheesecake. We tried the red and white wine flights with dinner and it was fun to experience wines from Spain! Our server Cody was super friendly and helpful with the menu. This was a fun dinner. I look forward to my next visit.

title: YES! Be sure to visit!
review: We've been here twice and have loved it both times. We love the variety on the tapas menu and like that you have the option on the weekend to do regular tapas or their take on brunch. We sat at the bar both times and have found the bar staff to be extremely friendly and attentive. We found the prices to be reasonable.

title: very good food in a "old world" setting
review: this is a busy restaurant in a busy neighborhood, so parking can be a challenge. I like the old brick feel of the interior. this is tapas style eating, so try lots of stuff. we had the chicken dish and short ribs that were both very good. also had the scallops that were excellent. booked our res. on open table.

title: Lovely...
review: You should book ahead. Opentable is useful here. Vibrant young crowd. Nice ambience. Great food. Try as many tapas as you can eat/afford! Nothing bad.

title: Tapas for everyone
review: Great food, really fun atmosphere. Great cocktails. Excellent small plate menu. Reservations are a must as the place is very popular.

title: Great place for Tapas (small plates). good drinks and service
review: Great place for tapas(small plates) and good drinks and service. Shared: Goat cheese baked in a delicious tomato sauce and toasted garlic bread, & beef tenderloin & blue cheese & the boneless fried chicken thighs, & garlic shrimp – which was to die for. All delicious along with their delicious homemade bread, great drinks and lively atmosphere made for a great dinner. They also have many sangria to choose from and a variety of paella.Yes, it is handicap accessible if you eat in the bar area. A note of caution, depending on your disability there are two steps to get to the bathrooms irregardless of where you are seated.

title: Eclectic and trendy
review: Great tapas in an eclectic and trendy setting.  The tortilla is phenomenal and the best item on the menu.  Bsure to make reservations well ahead as it is popular.

title: It was ok
review: This restaurant is quite large. The service is excellent and it's quite a popular place. I felt that the restaurant was very warm though. We asked to be moved, but it was still too warm. They need better air conditioning. I felt it took away from the enjoyment of our dinner and we were anxious to leave. The food was mediocre. I had hoped for better.

title: Always fun, always tasty
review: This was a return visit to this cafe up near Lincoln Park. We went for brunch and had some wonderfully inventive breakfast tapas. Although I had been to the cafe before, my guests had not and the verdict was unanimous - we would all go back next time we are in Chicago. Good service and a nice mix of savory and sweet on the menu. French toast is my weakness and their tasting portion hit the spot.

title: Great Tapas, Fun Atmosphere
review: Six of us visited this restaurant for a wonderful meal-we had a variety of small plates, including fried calamari, a satisfying paella, bacon wrapped dates, and wood oven roasted vegetables. Our waiter helped narrow the menu by pointing out the most popular dishes, and accommodated dietary needs. The only less than stellar item was the really boring Sangria, but the rest was so good, I won't hold it against them. Go! Eat! Share! Yum!

title: Very enjoyable dinner
review: Had a great time with friends, everything we tried was very good.  Would recommend and I certainly will go back

title: Go hungry, leave full!
review: We went here on a Sunday evening as part of a group of eight (one of our party made reservations - not sure if you can only do this only for large groups but if you can make them,I would recommend this as it was crowded on a Sunday at 7:30). We enjoyed a large assortment of tapas and all were excellent (patatas Brava, squid, Brussel sprouts salad were just a few). The paella is excellent and a larger portion than the tapas. The sangria (four varieties) is refreshing although the alcohol content seemed low - not a bad thing. The desserts (we tried two- the chocolate cake and the marcona almond caramel bar) were the perfect size to end our meal on a sweet note. Only complaint is that the noise level is a bit high so it made it challenging to converse with our group.

title: Decent food, but not authentic Spanish
review: Maybe I'm not being fair because I lived in Madrid for nearly 2 years, but for me Ba-Ba-Reeba doesn't quite cut it. Like many Chicago tapas bars you pay more for less food and get what would be free in Spain with a drink purchase. Also if you go on a Friday or Saturday plan to spend your evening with at least 4 bachelorette parties. I'm serious.

title: Fun family dinner!
review: Lively atmosphere, excellent authentic tapas. Great service. Our teenagers enjoyed trying out the different small plates and our server was very helpful recommending a nice wine.

title: What a dinner!!!
review: Was impressed with the space, it was huge. The service was was excellent, especially from the waitress. Then the food, just WOW! We split six plates and each one was delicious! Can't wait to go back :)

title: Great Sangria
review: This place is a Lettuce Entertain You tapas place. The setting and the ambiance are nice. The Tapas menu is not complete, in that it does not describe the dishes. Example-- Artisan Cheese Plate. Well that can be many different things. The folks who brought the food to the table did not explain what each thing was, either. The Sangria was excellent, and many of the meat dishes were delicious.Our server caught a group of 20 after we arrived. It severely impacted our experience, and we were neglected. The stuffed figs, meatballs, beef tenderloins, empanadas, and baked goat cheese with tomato were very good. The scallops and shrimp with red pepper were excellent. The desserts were delicious, especially the flourless chocolate tart and the caramelized bananas.

title: Delicious !
review: Thanks to Trip Advisor reviews for directing my wife and I to this fantastic neighborhood tapas bar. Our waiter Juan was excellent in helping us navigate the extensive tapas menu and paella choices. We ordered four tapas - baked goat cheese in tomato sauce,,, shrimp with garlic, olive oil and red pepper flakes,,, buttermilk fried chicken thighs with piri-piri sauce and shaved vegetables and lastly rioja braised short ribs with manchego mashed potatoes with rioja glazed sauce. These are only 4 of over 60+ tapas choices. All of our tapas where delicious and filling. We splurged on three tapas deserts which were good but not as great as the dinner tapas. Make reservations as this is a very popular restaurant. We were there on a Saturday evening and by 6PM there were people waiting to get in.

title: Never disappoints
review: Been coming here for years and they never disappoint. The service is good and the food is delicious. The dates wrapped in bacon are our favorite. Mmm

title: Reminds me of Spain
review: If you have traveled to Spain and want to reminisce about the wonderful paellas and tapas and sangria of your European trip, then Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is the go to place. Enjoy a vast array of hot and cold tapas with a large and very affordable pitcher of sangria, and then indulge in a pan of paella, that is made in a large pan that is per person pricing. Bring a large group, as the atmosphere is great for a party or a small group will feel comfortable as well.

title: Loved the tapas and sangria!
review: We had a fantastic large group meal here. The waiters kept the tapas and sangria flowing! The pork paella was fantastic. There wasn't anything I was served that I didn't like. I would definitely come back here when in Chicago again.

title: Great for a wedding rehearsal dinner
review: Threw my family a curveball by reserving Reeba. 15 of us were positioned in a quiet corner where we could have a good time and sample the food. Sangria was flowing and is also exceptional. The wait staff were very attentive and courteous. Every Time I've been here I never regret it!

title: Love it!
review: I've dined at Ba-Ba-Reeba countless times and I've never been disappointed. The red sangria is the best I've ever had! I highly recommend the spicy potatoes, bacon wrapped dates, and beef skewers with horseradish sauce. Anything you order will be great!

title: Awesome ambience!
review: The dishes are really small and great for sharing! The wait staff is really fun, and the food was delicious!

title: American Tapas with a Spanish Twist
review: If you are hoping to enjoy a nice night of Spanish tapas then definitely avoid Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba like the plague. Everything at the restaurant, especially the paella, tastes like you are dumping a spoon-full of salt directly onto your tongue. The only thing that even remotely reminded me of the Catalan dishes I had enjoyed a few weeks before were the croquettes. I would recommend a better tapas place if I had one, but my attempts at finding authentic Spanish food in Chicago have been fruitless thus far.

title: Very nice!
review: This was my first visit to Ba-Ba-Reeba and it was very good. The place was much bigger inside than I expected so we were able to get a table without reservation. The service was very prompt and food was really tasty. We each ordered 2 plates which was a little too much (had some leftovers). Nice selection of Sangrias.

title: I would go back!
review: My friend who lives in Chicago loves this place, mainly because it's still stylish and cute inside but it's not in the all time busy downtown area (about 10-15 min drive from there). Located in Lincoln Park community, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! was super busy on a Friday evening, with different ages crowd. The wait for a table was 1.5 hours, but luckily you can order off the main menu at the bar as well. We were there around 8 pm and were barely able to snag the last 2 seats at the bar. This place offers a variety of Spanish tapas. If you order a paella, make sure you specify for how many people. It was two of us and they must have assumed we ordered paella for two and boy was it A LOT of it! My favorite part of the evening was the passion fruit sangria - it was DELISH! Very easy to drink too hahahaThe cafe offers valet parking, as well as plenty of Ubers driving around.I would go back!

title: Fave tapas
review: I love this place . This is my second time at this place . I have been to chicago twice And for me a trip to cafe babareeba is a must . I love the paella , tapas and their sangria . I have been to several tapas restaurant in LA and Northern Cali and this place tops it all . I cant wait to go back .

title: Mixed Feelings
review: We visited for a late lunch 10 days ago on a Friday. The restaurant was mainly empty, just a few diners in the outdoor seating area and us. The hostess was not happy when we asked to be seated inside, but did accommodate us after speaking to a server. We were seated directly across from the bar. When our server approached he asked if it was our first visit to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. We indicated it was. Usually, that elicits a, "Great! Do you know how our restaurant works." Instead, what we got was a sign and "Do you at least know how tapas works?" Sorry, but that feels like you think we are stupid and uncultured if we have never been there before. (The fact that we drove over 90 minutes to come to this area of Chicago apparently never entered his mind.) He suggested we order 3-4 small plates per person. We did not take his recommendation and still had too much food.We ordered a half pitcher of the peach sangria for the two adults in our party and a flavored iced tea for the teenager. Given that we were driving home after eating, the shared half pitcher was sufficient. The sangria was good and if we had been staying in the area for longer after, I would easily have gotten the full pitcher. Our selections included a lovely brussel sprout salad, meatballs, fire roasted vegetables, a chicken empanada, a flame broiled salmon, and the mixed olives. The marinated mixed olives consisted of just two types of olives - Nicoise and Kalamata. Our other tapas experiences always included at least three kinds and usually a marinated garlic or onion as well. They were okay, nothing to set them apart. The fire roasted vegetables were delicious but slightly more done than I would have preferred. My teenage daughter, however, loved them. It should be noted they are served in a crock with lots of tomatoes making them rather soupy instead of a fork-ready vegetable. The salmon was simply delicious. We could easily have ordered more of this. The accompanying sauce was delicate and really added to the salmon. Stand out dish! The meatballs were basic meatballs covered with a tangy marinara sauce. I think there were 4-5 small ones in our dish. They were a good value for the money and great for those less-adventurous diners. The empanada was the other stand out dish. The crust was super flaky and the filling was just the right amount of spice and flavor to accentuate the flaky crust. Easily the best empanada I have had, even in six trips to Mexico. Expensive for amounts given.

title: Crazy Ba Ba Reeba
review: the best coffee ever and entertainment, perfect music and lovely relaxed atmosphere the waiter was wonderful, the food delicious and the prices are affordable.

title: Fun Fun Fun
review: We had a delightful dinner, with friendly staff and a buzzing background of happy customers. With good reason, Each dish was better than the next--and the first (the grilled hangar steak with chimichurri sauce) was terrific. The last (before dessert) was the best though: the buttermilk fried chicken. We almost ordered another dish but thankfully saved room for the camelized banana dessert. Drinks were great too. We'll definitely return next time we're in Lincoln Park.

title: revisit after many years
review: Visiting Son and family in Chicago and tried out Ba Ba Reeba again after some years since last visit. It was really excellent - must be almost at an "instituition" level owing to longevity and (on our visit) still whizzing up great food. Absolutely packed but we had snappy service and the food was delicious - completely over ordered of course as is usual with tapas and us. Son now has this place well and trully back on the radar-lucky him!

title: This Is The Stuff That Memories Are Made Of
review: First off, in nearly 100 Tripadvisor reviews, this may be the first time I've scored a restaurant a 5 in every category. From the initial greeting and our time at the bar to our table, food and service, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba offered an unforgettable dining experience. Great atmosphere in the well stocked bar and the dining room. The layout is clustered enough to feel that you're part of a social scene but with enough breathing room to enjoy private conversation with the person across from you.In traditional tapas tradition, the menu is varied and I have to say: EVERYTHING we tried out of this world. Highlights included: Grilled Octopus with Harissa, Chorizo-wrapped dates and the Hangar Steak with charred Green Chili chimichurri. All offered different flavor experiences but tied together so nicely.If you are looking for tapas or just an excellent meal while in Chicago, walk, jog, sprint, bike, hoverboard, Uber or drive yourself to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!

title: Try it all
review: Everything we tried was lovely! Service was excellent! The atmosphere was perfect and comfortable. Appreciate the small things in life and this should be one of them!

title: Wow!
review: Amazing! Fun! Food was fantastic and the service was even better. I wish I got the waiter's name as he deserves to be recognized. He explained everything and brought out the dishes at the exact right time. Every little plate was great. The Sangria was delightful (there are 4 different kinds). Make a reservation early - this place books up 5 days in advance. One thing that amazed me was that they had a wedding going on in their adjacent space - this had no impact on the service or food. They seriously know what they are doing here!

title: Amazing tapas
review: We stopped In for brunch on Saturday and we were not disappointed. We love Chicago and this was our 1st visit to the neighborhood. The food and service were amazing! A definite repeat on our trips to Chicago and Lincoln park.

title: Awesome Sunday brunch
review: We decided to try the brunch and we not disappointed! The Bloody Mary bar was a great start with all kinds of things to add from bacon to shrimp to pickles all for $10.00! It is a tapas menu so we share 6 different pintxos for brunch with pancakes, yogurt with granola, deviled eggs, and French toast. Then we added lunch choices with the hangar steak and roasted potatoes. Finally some calamari and dessert was a nice butterscotch custards. Prices were reasonable. Only thing is parking. We did valet for $13.00

title: Great tapas and sangria!
review: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has been on my radar since our last visit to Chicago two years ago, so of course when we were there last weekend, it was high on my list of must-visits. We were there for lunch on Friday, April 15 and with our 12:30 reservation, we were seated right away. We ordered the full pitcher of sangria (which we probably could have gotten the half pitcher in retrospect, but oh well--vacation), which tasted like true Spanish sangria with brandy and other liquors. Read: not all sugar. We ordered the patatas bravas, which were roasted with a spicy mayo on the side, which, in our opinion, were perfectly seasoned and roasted. We also ordered the chicken and chorizo skewers, which were okay, but the chicken was lacking a bit in seasoning or flavor, so we found ourselves dipping it in sauces from other dishes to get rid of the blandness. We ordered the shrimp, which appeared to be broiled in a small pan with olive oil and red pepper flakes, which was a nice change from the usual fried shrimp dishes at tapas restaurants. When I went to the bathroom, I saw a sign that said if you check in on Facebook, you get a free dessert, so I checked-in and we ordered a chocolate truffle cake, which was a small portion, but so rich and dense, it was the perfect size for us to share. The service was average; nothing to be blown away by or anything, but we have virtually no complaints. We had a fantastic time and would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Chicago!

title: EXCELLENT Paella!
review: We loved everything about this restaurant, from the atmosphere to the food itself. The tapas were delicious but the real highlight of the dinner was the paella. It tasted about as authentic as you can get outside of Spain, and was well worth the wait.

title: Outstanding Dinner, very tasty food, lots to sample
review: We had dinner here last night and really enjoyed the whole experience. It was a Friday night so, as expected, it was busy. We had an 8:00pm reservation, thank goodness.
