We started with a few cocktails, I had their version of the Moscow Mule and it was excellent.Sangria is a house specialty, they even have it on tap!We started out with shrimp, a skirt steak and Brussel sprout salad, that was more like cabbage, but very tasty and a new way to enjoy them. We had paella with clams, shrimp and plenty of flavor. I was quite full after all that! But we did find room for three small deserts, and all three were awesome.So a great meal, if you like the Tapas experience. The quality and freshness was awesome, everything we ate was outstanding. The wine list was a little limited because most people seem to enjoy the sangria. But they also have beer. The service was excellent and very attentive. The atmosphere is very fun and highly energetic. It is a really fun experience.

title: Great Tapas (small plates) and service
review: Q-tips say: Great place for tapas(small plates) and good drinks and service. The Q’s shared: Goat cheese baked in a delicious tomato sauce and toasted garlic bread, seared sea scallops with leeks and seared oranges, & beef tenderloin & blue cheese. All delicious along with their delicious homemade bread, great drinks and lively atmosphere made for a great dinner. They also have many flavored sangria and a nice selection of paella.Eat hearty or share plates - but go and enjoy. We did.

title: Delicious tapas and an inviting ambiance on Halsted
review: We dined at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba on a recent trip to the Windy City to visit my brother. This was not our first time there and certainly won't be our last. We love the great selection of tapas and the fun, energetic vibe of this restaurant. The service is great and the cuisine even better. It's a destination for us each time we're in the Windy City.

title: Excellent Spanish!
review: This is a hopping spot with some excellent Spanish food. We had a variety of authentic tapas and an excellent paella. (After the tapas we split the paella for two between four people and it was plenty). The sangria was very good and the tab came to an extremely reasonable amount.

title: An okay visit
review: We came here with a small group of friends. I found the food to be okay, but really nothing to write home about. The papas bravas were delicious but the tortilla espanol was seriously lacking the flavor which was disappointing since when I visited Spain that was one of my favorite dishes I discovered. The sangria was okay but the restaurant itself was loud and rather drafty. It wasn't a bad time but I won't be going back or recommending it.

title: The Bloody Mary Bar, God help me....
review: I was there with girlfriends for some pre-partying and "fueling" on our day of shopping and have never had a more delicious bloody mary bar experience!  The food was amazing too.  Can't wait to go back!

title: Best Tapas
review: This place is very inviting, cozy, and fun. We loved the food here and friendly staff. It does get bit crowded and have to wait a while in the weekend so opt for a weeknight dinner. Foods that we really liked and will order again are, Goat cheese, and , spicy potatoes. little pricey for portions but its also the area you are in. Give it a try!

title: Do yourself a favor and save the trip
review: Very nice waiter and staff but the food is greasy non healthy and for sure not tastySorry but not sure how they are open for 30 yearsWe tried 10 different tapas, maybe 2 were okThe drinks are very low on alcohol We don't mind paying for great food, but you won't find that thereWe skipped the desert and went to a different Restaurent ( Bavettes for the desert) which was the best thing we ate that night.Sorry but they need to check and reevaluate the dishes they serveMajor disappointment considering the rate they are getting on trip-advisor

title: A bit pricey, but good!
review: This is Tapas restaurant, a bit out of the way, but a short Cab ride got us there. We had both the peach sangria and blackberry, they both were good but served with liquor and not wine which I found weird. The food you order comes in small plates to share. I can't tell you about everything on the menu but I will say what we had and would order again. The meatballs were great, the shrimp dish was fishy, the beef empanada was good, but could have ordered two for 4 people. The Paella we had was good but I have had better. Overall I would not go back, it was worth one trip but so many other places to eat at. It was pricey, service was good, and our table was in a separate room which gave us good space.

title: Almost perfect
review: Maybe a little unfair but my expectations are always elevated when I see a highly rated restaurant.My Job as a Senior contributor is to give an accurate account of my experience. Unassuming from the front, this place is well laid out & huge inside able to accommodate any group or function. Surprisingly cute & quaint vibe inside buzzing with dozens of employees doing a high volume. Amazing & efficient job by the host staff ! The menu is creative Tapas with lots of options.Sangria was good , food flowed well and the quality was also good.Our server was a competent care taker. So bottom line is that, at the table, everything was just very good but not excellent.

title: Birthday
review: Fun and friendly restaurant. We tried most of the topas small dishes and we had a hard time picking our favorite all of them were very delicious. We would go back.

title: Awesome place!
review: Great food and atmosphere! Be prepared to try some items you've never had before, and you won't regret it

title: Great food, amazing service
review: We rarely had such a professional waiter. Perfect timing, great attitude. It is especially difficult in a tapas restaurant, because dishes are small and must be warm. Everything we had was very, very good: grilled octopus (may be the best), scallops with leeks (surprisingly good combination), lamb with eggplant side, pork belly skewers. Deserts are small and excellent, too. The restaurant was full early Monday night! If you are lucky, there is street parking in front of the restaurant (you pay $6 instead of $13 for valet).

title: Yummy Tapas and Friendly Staff
review: Our first visit here, and the waiter was patient in answering all our questions. His recommendations were spot on, and we loved the sausage paella and the bacon wrapped dates. We ate early, so it was quiet, but the place was getting busy as we left. Nice place to meet friends.

title: Nice meal
review: I went with my wife, daughter, and wife's friend on a Saturday night. It was our first time. Our waiter, Joe, did a great job all evening. The place was packed, yet it was amazing how quickly how fast the tapas were served. Joe did a nice job of recommending entrees. 3 of us don't like Brussel sprouts, but the Brussel sprout salad was amazing. You can find anything you'd like on the menu. For those of you in the Western or NW suburbs, a comparable venue is Meson Sabika in Naperville. Meson has a larger menu and is just slightly cheaper. It is also in a historic mansion. Both are great meals.

title: Just okay
review: Just okay. Service was okay. Food okay. Shrimp were drowning in oil. Small portions. Lack luster staff When out to dine, I like better than okay. Defiantly would not return.

title: Favorite tapas in Chicago!
review: We love Café Ba-Ba-Reeba for their consistently excellent tapas, trendy-busy atmosphere, and great service. I go-to spot whether you're looking to have a great meal with friends or a more romantic date!

title: Nice romantic trendy quality spot for dinner
review: So much fun and top notch food! We went here on a recommendation and we're pleasantly surprised. The food was fabulous-from beginning to end. The tapas choices were vast. You can order a couple, eat them, and order some more. The sangria was phenomenal -blackberry. So light and delicious. The dessert is small also, and just great. Flan is the best.

title: Great romantic restaurant!
review: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is my go to spot for romantic dinners. They have great wines, my personal favorite being sangria. They serve Spanish cuisine and the waiters are very resourceful when asking for recommendations or explanations. I always get chicken tapas and they are great!

title: Delicious tapas, great ambience
review: Once in the restaurant, I find myself in a cosy yet classy environment. I'm not artsy but something about the restaurant makes me feel at home...Since it's our first time in this tapas restaurant, we ordered all five favourites (the reds in the menu). They come in small portions, but don't let them fool you! It was too much for us two to finish all the deliciousness! We are into the 3rd dish and already almost comatosed (maybe we are small eaters?)Highly recommend the paella rice and iberico hash. Also their fried potatoes are to die for! Not sure how they cook them but yummy! All the food surprisingly goes really well with coffee :)

title: Crowd pleaser
review: Delicious and interesting food. Fun to visit with friends to celebrate a birthday or some other occasion. The more the merrier. It gets loud but every group is loud.

title: Fun way to share and taste with family and friends
review: I have eaten at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba several times and always enjoy the experience. This restaurant is best enjoyed with others who enjoy sampling and sharing. The sangria is delicious and with so many choices of tapas, there should be something for everyone to savor.If you're looking for a quiet dining experience this may not a suitable restaurant.

title: So glad we went!
review: One of our favorite stops while in Chicago. Great tapas! We were shopping at Bonobo's and looking for something to eat nearby & mentioned that we love tapas. Thank goodness the nice young man told us this was the place. Even if we weren't in the area, it's worth a quick uber ride to get there!

title: great PJ brunch
review: great food, spicy potatoes are awesome. There was an event called pajama brunch - you had to be dressed in PJ and you would get back whatever you spent in the gift cards. great idea, a lot of fun.Place is much bigger than it looks from curb appeal.

title: Great Atmosphere.
review: We really enjoyed this restaurant. The atmosphere was fun, casual, bar like, outdoor patio like (even though it was snowing in Chicago). The tapas style was good and different. I found it to be a satisfying meal. One thing not to skip is the desserts. We almost skipped and so glad we didn't. It was my favorite part. Good night out!

title: Fun experience, Chicago staple
review: After living in Chicago for 7 years, this is one place I tell people they must go. To this day, it is still the best sangria I've tasted (the simple red/white are fabulous, but the other flavors are also great) - and, the atmosphere is fun and energetic. The tapas are delicious - some of my favorites are the patatas bravas, garlic shrimp and goat cheese. The paella is also great, however takes extra time to make (but, definitely worth the wait). Enjoy!

title: Great tapas
review: Went with my family 6 of us. Ordered a lot of dishes and my adult kids kept ordering more dishes. I was afraid to see the bill. Shock!!!it was less than a meal at a lot of restaurants we go to. Now the food so good the spicy potatoes to die for we could not get enough. Not crazy spicey just a great flavor. Beef tenderloin say no more we had a lot of those at the table. I love how the small plate lends you to become more adventorous. So many great tastes.We have come to this restaurant a lot and have never been disappointed.Make reservations

title: Amazing Tapas and Sangria, Fun Environment
review: This was my Husband and I's second visit to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and my third, but will not be our last. I highly suggest coming hungry because there is so much delicious tapas to try! Everything I have tried has been good, my only suggestion is a group of 3-4 is ideal because the plate sizes are big enough that everyone gets a big bit or two and you can try a lot of different things. I feel you don't get to try as much with 2 people or you don't finish what you order so that you can save room for more. I haven't had their Paella but I have seen plenty of people order it and it looks amazing! The portion size is quite large also. I would strongly recommend reservations on the weekends otherwise you will probably end up waiting awhile, they can easily be made thru opentable. The prices are very reasonable considering it's downtown Chicago as well, my husband and I's bill came to $85. Would definitely recommend giving this restaurant a try, it's fun and won't disappoint!

title: Very disappointing for a Lettuce Entertain you restaurant
review: Went to Café Ba-Ba-Reeba with another couple before a show downtown. We had reservations for 5:15 and were seated promptly. Our table was in the back of the restaurant wedged between a table of 15 and a very busy isle used by the waiters. In reality there should not have even been a table there as it was cramped, noisy and two of us continually got bumped by the wait staff.That being said, the food at most Lettuce Entertain you restaurants is usually top notch as is the service. The food here was average to poor. Each Tapas we ordered that was fried, was overly greasy and devoid of any flavor. The three meat Tapas we got were very tough and seemed as if they sat out for quite some time.The blood orange sangria was flavorful but did not seem like it contained any alcohol. It was watered down at best. We switched to draught beer for our second round which was much better.The worst part of the dinner was the poor service. Our waiter disappeared for long stretches of time. On two occasions, he forgot one of the items we ordered. Other wait staff then brought the item 3 different times even after we finally received it. When we asked for the bill we explained that we needed to leave as the dinner had taken 2 hours and 15 minutes and our show was starting in 30 minutes. The waiter than disappeared for another 10 minutes with our credit cards.We made the show, but the whole experience was bad. If we wanted this type of dinner we could have gone to any national chain restaurant and not spent over $200.I will still give Lettuce Entertain You spots the benefit of the doubt, but this one is off the list permanently.

title: Wonderful 30th Restaurant Anniversary Event!
review: We recently attended Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba's 30th Anniversary event and had a wonderful evening. Absolutely delicious foods and beverages and excellent service. Kudos to founder/ executive chef Gabino Sotelino and the entire staff. If you've not been to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba - GO! We will certainly go again and again.

title: Consistently Good Tapas ~ Reservations are encouraged!
review: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba (CBR) is one of our go to restaurants when we want to eat Tapas. We were celebrating my son's birthday last Saturday and made reservations online thru Open Table. This restaurant gets SUPER busy, even at 5:30 pm, so be sure you make reservations. Parking is permit only in the neighborhood and there is no garage. CBR does have a valet service for $13. Totally worth it, Lincoln Park is super busy on the weekend and it's very hard to find street parking.We began our evening with cocktails; they offer many flavors of Sangria. I usually order 1/2 a pitcher of red wine Sangrias. You get about 3 full glasses from 1/2 a pitcher. It's more economical than individual glasses. CBR also offers full pitchers. My sons ordered a margarita and a mojito. We discovered that many places offer a mojito but there is an art to actually making a good mojito, CBR fell short on this mojito. Not mixed correctly. Margarita was fine.Tapas is a great way to try several dishes with your companions. Tapas are appetizer sized portions of Spanish dishes and arrive at your table in no special order. We usually start off with 2 per person, keep a menu handy and order more as the night progresses. We've been to CBR a few times and have tried pretty much everything on the menu and have been happy with taste, quality and quantity. If you order the paella, allow some extra time for it's preparation. Our waiter, busboy and servers were very efficient, even thought the restaurant was packed! They never forgot about us and were quick to refill our water glasses, clear dishes and bring new dishes to our table.When making the reservation on Open Table I did note that we would be celebrating my son's 22nd Birthday but, no complimentary dessert was offered to him :(.Note: The noise level does get loud due to the high ceilings, kinda hard to hear your diner companions sometimes.

title: Reservations are a must
review: Luckily we had a reservation @ 7pm for Friday's dinner- there was a big crowd waiting to be seated. The restaurant facade is deceiving, because of the extensive size of several dining rooms. The tables are are crowded and there is a lively atmosphere. Our table of four enjoyed the variety of delicious entrees served as Tapas cuisine- goat cheese toast, garlic shrimp, short ribs, beef skewer, bacon wrapped dates, spinach stuffed mushrooms, meatballs, beef with blue cheese, salmon with dill sauce. The servings are small and passed around the table. It was all so good. We brought our own bottles of wine. The service was excellent & helpful.

title: Amazing!
review: What a great restaurant!! We were greeted and sat right away upon arrival. Our server was friendly and efficient. All of the food we had was excellent!! I recommend the tomato bread, so good!! The Brussels sprouts salad was one of the best I've had. Highly recommend!!

title: Above average; not phenomenal
review: We enjoyed the dinner. There was nothing bad, but also nothing outstanding. The place is a little on the big side, service is a little hurried, and comparing to other Spanish restaurants I have tried the dishes were good but not overly creative.

title: Pricey Tapas in Chicago town
review: Really fun spot to go with a bunch of friends. Most of the dishes were very good. We were a party of 5 and got 2 of each dish to share between us and that was more than plenty. Top notch dishes for me were the Squid, the beef tenderloin with blue cheese and the spicy potatoes. There was also a date and chorizo thing for $2 - can't remember exactly what it was, but that was delicious! The butterscotch dessert was divine and even though the deserts were all tiny they were the perfect size for just a sweet treat after dinner. Low points - the shrimp - very oily and the goats cheese in tomato sauce - didn't see the point of that one. The staff were great, very efficient, there was a steady flow of dishes coming to the table throughout. It was an expensive proposition, but over the Christmas one tends to splurge more, a lot more! It was my second visit and I would definitely go back.

title: Authentic and Satisfying!
review: Some friends and I came here from a recommendation from a relative and we were not let down. We hadn't made reservations but we called ahead to see what the wait would be for the time we were planning to come and were told about an hour, however when we got there, we were seated right away although the place was clearly busy. The service continued to be great all night, and our server made excellent recommendations on the menu. I was concerned that the food wouldn't be authentic Spanish tapas because I've been to places before, claiming to be authentic when in fact they are not, but that was not the case here. The food seemed as authentic as if we were actually sitting and enjoying it in Spain. The pitcher of Sangria was enough for three to split and enjoy two or so glasses each, and out favorite dish was the patatas bravas which I recommend. Overall, we had a great experience and highly recommend it!

title: A party for your taste buds.
review: Instead of buying Christmas gifts this year we decided that the adults should go out for dinner instead this year and we chose Café babareeba and what a great time we had. We let our kids order what they wanted but shared everything and we really had some interesting dishes. Even my daughter in law who is a picky eater found some new things to enjoy. The goat cheese was an especially big hit as were the skewered chicken. We ordered 2 paellas and the serving sizes were huge. It was great but next time I'd pass on that and try more of the tapas. The dessert selection was also interesting and delicious. We over ordered but enjoyed the leftover the next day. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

title: Anchovy-stuffed olives!
review: Have been here many times. Consistently good food and service. Very busy New Year's Eve when they could have cut corners but they didn't. The lamb was great! Also recommend the chorizo-wrapped dates.

title: Excellent in every way!
review: This was a wonderful experience. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and took the time to explain everything to us. He knew all about every menu item and drink, which was very impressive. The tapas were delicious. The dates wrapped in bacon were exceptional. Next time we are going to try the paella. This is a must visit. The atmosphere is very fun and lively.

title: Yummy, Fun, Yummy, Good Buzz.
review: My wife and I took our four adult kids here today for lunch. We just ordered small plates in waves and passed them around and then ordered more. The selections came out quickly and were overall very tasty. We started with one shaved Brussels sprouts salad $6 and eventually had ordered 3. Terrific and I don't like Brussels sprouts. Our least favorite was the lamb $15. We love lamb. It was just ok. Small portion and not very tender. Bacon wrapped dates are always good. I had the beef tenderloin eggs Benedict $8 and it was great. Can't go wrong. Very nice helpful server. Gluten free menu. Try it.

title: Just Worth It!
review: A friend and I randomly ended up here one night and order 4 different items. Everything we tried was amazing! We even ended up ordering seconds on a few things! Do yourself a favor and try the bacon wrapped figs (one of our seconds).

title: Bustling, busy tapas,
review: This is a fun spot to enjoy spanish wine and tapas. We shared 8 dishes all of which were authentic and good- tortilla, meatballs, gambas, and squid to name a few. We wanted to try the paella but it is served for a 2 person minimum and we were too full by then. The wine list has tons of great choices representing all regions of Spain (as well as other countries and sangria etc.)Be sure to make a reservation as the wait on a Friday night was over an hour. The only negative is that it is very loud because of the tile floor (which feels like is a bit coated with the grease of the ages). PS- have been told that the restaurant is the longest operating tapas bar in Chicago. Interesting.It is located in Lincoln Park which was about a $10 uber from downtown.

title: First visit won't be the last!
review: Stopped before a show at the Royal George theatre. Waiter was very informative about the menu offering suggestions when asked. Great food, will be back.

title: Worth checking out...
review: I was staying downtown for a conference but had planned to do some shopping in the Lincoln Park neighborhood. My hotel concierge recommended this as a lunch spot. Wow, was it a good one! My waiter suggested spicy potatoes and buttermilk fried chicken thighs--both served with incredible sauces--and I went with them. I also had the deviled egg with crispy jamon serrano. Everything was fantastic! I also indulged in the sangria of the day, which was divine. The generous portions are meant to be shared. And even though I was by myself, I felt at home and happy. It's definitely worth the journey!

title: Always great!
review: No complaints about this dining option! AlwAys a great place for smaller groups - since tapas is shared you can try a wide variety of options. They even have a gluten-free menu. Brunch is ok, but I think the dinner options are tastier. Sangria specials are great too.

title: Excellent Spanish Food in Lincoln Park
review: I love the atmosphere in this place but I love the most about Cafe Baba-reba is their tapas, sangrias and vegetarian paella. If you are vegetarian don't hesitate to stop by here because there are plenty of options here.Lastly, do not forget to try the flan, it is really good too!

title: A bite far from downtown... but WAY worth the ride!
review: I was in Chicago for a business trip, and planned to meet up with a former colleague who is a foodie. I looked up the restaurant and made a reservation, without checking where it is located... A 15-20 minute ride from downtown Chicago near McCormick Place. But the food was well worth the ride. Perfectly made tapas, great house margarita, and just-the-right-size dessert. It was not too noisy so that we could talk, but not so quiet that you would need to whisper. Highly recommended.

title: Great for quick and reasonably priced tapas!
review: I used to go to the Vegas outpost quite a few years back and being at the original didn't disappoint. I sat at the bar and the barman was quick and offered excellent suggestions. I already knew I wanted the bacon wrapped dates (A MUST!!!!!) and I went easy with the ham and cheese croquetas, which ended up having the texture and appearance of cheese sticks, but were tasty especially with the accompanying sauces. The barman recommended the short rib and that was seriously on point. Sangria is poured from a tap, so while not quite having the taste of completely homemade, it is still damn good. I didn't try the paella, but the couple next to me did and it had the look and aroma like the ones I used to have when I lived in Valencia. Highly recommend if you're into tapas, pinchos, and sangria. Plus, the place is nice and upscale with dark wood throughout.

title: Excellent Tapas and Pintxos!
review: Amazing flavor in every dish! Perfect place to bring a bunch of friends - or even a date night for a couple. The paella choices are yummy -- order 1 to share between 2-6 people (yes, it's a good sized serving) and then order at least 3 tapas choices each! Their Sangria selection is pretty good, and they even offer a seasonal flavor. I tried the white peach and it was refreshing! The Pintxos tray selection kicked things off for us - it's good to share for about 2-3 people. They have no problems bringing out more little dishes for you, so that the flavors don't mix. If you check-in on Yelp, you can even get free dessert! Try to call in for a reservation - or be prepared to wait especially for dinner. Everything was pretty good. Thank goodness they offer valet parking!

title: Yummy tappas
review: In a nice neighborhood and just down from our B and B.  Good food and very popular on weekend nights.

title: This place is Hopping!
review: This place is also huge with seating capacity for 300. But it's not so big that service suffers or too noisy so you can't hold a conversation. The tapas is very good and a bit eclectic as are the infused sangrias and cocktails. Maybe not a five start restaurant, but four stars across the board. Everything was very good, no complaints whatsoever in any department.

title: Tasty Tapas
review: Visiting Chicago and cafe ba ba reeba was highly recommended. So glad we went. The food was amazing. From the tapas, to the paella, even the sangria. Great service and obviously a poplar spot.

title: Delightful tapas
review: Excellent food. Busy upbeat atmosphere. Fun neighborhood. Service was helpful and quick. Restaurant was a wee bit loud, but I expected that. Nice bar, casual restaurant atmosphere. Tapas are top notch. Will be back again!

title: Dinner experience
review: Everything was spectacular.  This was a happening place, very busy with a good energy, and was excellent food.  Highly recommend.

title: Delicious
review: Absolutely amazing food and drinks. Had a great meal with great friends. We had tapas and paella. Both delicious. Plenty of choice and absolutely everything on the menu was tasty!

title: Birthday Brunch was great!
review: I went here with a large group for my birthday after hearing great things about their brunch menu. Let me tell you- you will not be disappointed! The Bloody Mary bar was great and the food was fantastic. It's small plates for sharing and it's a little pricey for breakfast but it's a great experience. I loved every sip and bite!

title: Great share plates
review: We spent 5 nights in Chicago and ate at 5 great restaurants; however, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba might have been my favourite. You can easily get to this restaurant from downtown on the Brown Line. It is in a great little neighbourhood. Restaurant is quite large, with lots of seating. Great ambiance. Our server, Josh, was very knowledgeable and was able to guide us through our tapas selections, pointing out "fan fans" as well as his personal favourites. We had grilled squid, spicy potatoes, chicken piri, short ribs and grilled pork shoulder. All amazingly tasty! Great sangria selection. I did not have dessert however, others in my party had the peach empanada and the caramelized banana and thoroughly enjoyed each.

title: A must go restaurant in Chicago
review: This fun restaurant hit all the right marks on a recent trip to Chicago. It was a lively Saturday night and every table was full. The ambiance was warm and friendly, wait staff were attentive, the wine list had a nice mix of options and the tapas were excellent. I would highly recommend this restaurant to others.

title: Great Tapas - Great Ambience
review: As you walk in the door you get a sense of a warm, bustling cafe with a very large bar and friendly atmosphere. The selection of tapas will satisfy a variety of tastes. There are traditional favorites such as fried calamair with jalapeno alioli and beef empanadas. The patatas bravas are the best I've had in Chicago -- crisp and spicy on the outside, fluffy and light within. The beef skewer with horseradish cream and red onions was perfectly prepared, and the datiles con tocino were lightly seasoned with an apple vinaigrette. And for those heartier appetites, there are a variety of paella offerings.

title: Nice ambience Good Tapas
review: A few family friends joined us for a brunch at cafe Ba-Ba-ReebaIn Sunday. The ambience was nice and the tapas services were Good. The Bloody Mary bar was a hit as some of my firings were having repeats. Personally unfold some of the tapas items deeply fried but perhaps that's because of the items we ordered. Overall it was a nice experience so would recommend a visit.Per

title: Great place
review: We arrived in Chicago and to our lodging super early so we stopped here before we were able to check in. The place is super big and our food came out very prompt. The mac n cheese with bacon is a great value and delish! Staff was attentive and knowledgeable.

title: Best Tapas!
review: Wonderful food and ambiance! Everything is always delicious (garlic potato salad is amazing) and sangria is great as well!

title: Great food.
review: We called in at Happy Hour 4pm - 6pm. Lot's of cheap Tapas etc, as well as beer. All the food was really good. The barman was very helpful in taking care of us. it's a neat place and well worth a second or third visit.

title: The real deal
review: Three of us dined here last night. The restaurant looks small from the outside but is much larger once you get inside. There is a bar and multiple dining rooms which allow for a lot of seating without being too noisy. Our waitress was helpful and worked with us on a dietary restriction. We tried multiple tapas and shared the seafood paella. We loved everything, especially the bacon wrapped dated and the grilled octopus. The serving sizes were ample to share. Prices were reasonable for what we ordered. The beer and wine we chose was good. The place was packed and I can see why. Delicious and authentic food!

title: Ole Tapas
review: Wonderful experience.  Great food, wonderful service.  A fun time all around, we will make a return visit.

title: Oh yes!
review: Came here for my birthday and had an amazing meal. Staff was more than accomidating, considering we were running a little behind. The peach sangria, spicy potatoes, beef skewers and curry chicken salad were delicious. Sadly, I left no room for dessert. Definitely returning soon!

title: Tapas!
review: My wife and I love tapas. We ordered 5 and had drinks they were all good none were great. Was disappointed in the Brussel sprout salad. Service was great excellent wine and sangria.

title: Bad experience but good manager
review: We stopped by for brunch at this Lettuce Entertain You restaurant. I had the recommended #81 - eggs benedict. The english muffin was hard as a rock so I sent it back. The second try was just as hard as the first one, so I sent that back too. The manager came by and said she was going to work with the kitchen to correct the problem and comp'd our bill. I was appreciative of her gesture - but left hungry.

title: Tastey dinner!
review: We arrived in Chicago this afternoon and decided to go to dinner at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! And we're very glad we did! For drinks, we had flights of red and white wine and margaritas on the rocks. For dinner, we had roasted vegetable pisto, Brussel sprouts salad, hanger steak, grilled pork, scallops, chicken thighs, calamari, and curry chicken. All were very good! The service was excellent, and we all agreed that our dinner was a very good value!PS Our only negative comment, the wine flights were a bit "short" ...

title: Girls night out
review: We had a great time. Food was wonderful. Tapas and Paella. Atmosphere was great. We asked our waiter for suggestions and he explained the menu and recommended the items in red as they were chef favorites. He also told us that they make their sangria in house and said the mango sangria that was the special for the month was great. It was wonderful! This place is very busy so make reservations.

title: Holy tapas, Batman!
review: The food at Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba is easily some of the best I've ever had. We ordered mango sangri, pork shoulder, stuffed mushrooms, beef skewers, potato salad, and beef empanadas. Our friends ordered the paella and we were able to try some. WOW! Definitely worth the wait!Best meal I've had in a long time!!

title: Excellent place to try many things at once
review: Everything is delicious. Pinxtos platter allows you to sample many things. Brunch is ok, but the Bloody Mary bar looks fun!

title: Go With Friends, Order Lots
review: Wonderful tapas, delicious and well-prepared. Great selection. From what I understand, they're pretty authentic Spanish but with some twists and inventions added. Try the sangria, too!

title: Great tapas restaurant but a little pricey...
review: Great place to unwind and get a drink. Excellent place to take friends and family. Their tapas are unique and tasty. Atmosphere and service is very nice.Sangria is excellent. Cons: - Tapas can get pricey as you experiment thru each of your favorite ones. - Prices may come to you as a surprise if you over indulge in Sangria, always keep a watchful eye on how much you order. - Avoid getting a glass of Sangria and opt for the pitcher. - Can get very very busy call ahead to reserve.

title: pretty good, lots of seating but in secluded little coves
review: This restaurant is a good solid choice. It has lot of seating. There is a small patio and a lot of inside seating. There are all kinds of nooks and crannys that have tables so you never feel like you are in a huge restaurant. Our server was pretty good but not great on refills and drinks. No big deal once we realized to make sure to ask ahead.THE FOOD:I feel like we ordered a little of everything. In the top section get the deviled egg. AMAZING.The chicken dish we got was boring but everything else was great. The steak dishes- delish! The shrimp in garlic sauce....yum. Overall the steak and egg are the 2 items that are most memorable. For 6 with some wine and beers our total was 200 before tip.

title: OK, But More Expensive Than We Thought
review: This was our first visit to this popular Tapas type restaurant. The menu looked reasonable and most of our choices were good (but not great)- except one, which they cheerfully took back and did not charge for. The bill was about twice what we expected (about $80 for brunch for two, with half pitcher of Sangria). I doubt if we will ever go back.

title: girls brunch, a lot of fun
review: first thing: attentive service, but out of our way once the food was on the table. Date-glazed bacon side: order it. Pintxos platter: one of us ordered it, but with all the other tapas we ordered, this didn't quite get finished. The platter is enough for one person if other dishes are not ordered or are at a minimum. The spinach/artichoke crepe was sharable; the crepe and perhaps one other tapas would have been enough for one person. If you're order various tapas, order just a single paella, not the platter for 2-3. Very good gazpacho (serves one). The brussel sprout (cold) salad is crunchy, not spicy, kind of bland, but good because it's a nice break from the other spicier tapas. If I went again I would order entirely different items - there was plenty we didn't try. The place was very busy at 1pm on a Saturday, but a few empty tables remained. Lots of tables.

title: Happy Hour - the Best!
review: I've heard about this spot, as it's one of the Lettuce Entertain You restaurants, so I've been wanting to try it. I went during happy hour and sat at the bar. There was a small but good selection of happy hour tapas - some for $1 (1-2 bites each) and others for $3 (pretty standard size small plates). Since they were small, I was able to try about 6 things. There wasn't a clunker in the bunch. All were fantastic. The chorizo wrapped dates, the deviled egg, mushroom toast, meatballs, chicken empanada...all were spectacular. I had wine, which wasn't a happy hour special, but wow did the sangria look good. All in all, I got to try lots of different things in a great atmosphere with a friendly wait staff, all at a great value. This place is sure to become a more frequent stop.

title: Fun with friends or for date night
review: This is a great spot for a fun and festive night. Service definitely varies- some nights (and not necessarily the "busy" nights) an individual tapa may take upwards of 30 minutes to come out, which can get frustrating when you need more than a few to get a satisfying meal. Great for a celebratory occasion, girls' night out, or a fun date. Definitely recommend a sangria pitcher (there is always a daily special) and a Spanish sausage tapas plate every time.

title: Dinner
review: Ate here last night. Solid tapas place. I was impressed with the shrimp and salmon dishes as well as the Sangria. Less than impressed with the pork cheek (dry). We had fun though.

title: Delicious tapas and sangria! You can't go wrong.
review: This is our go- to restaurant for family fun and incredible food. We love to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, and soon we will be celebrating our daughter's rehearsal dinner before her wedding. We always have wonderful service and the food is not only delectable, but so are the amazing drinks. If you like sangria, be sure to share a pitcher so everyone can enjoy it. The atmosphere is lively and fun, and the staff is eager to help you pick out just the right tapas to share. Delicioso!

title: Excellent Cocktails and Wine
review: Service was very good and so were the drinks. My friends who had the mojitos said they were the best they've ever had. The food was good but not drool-worthy. It's a very nice atmosphere. All that being said, I think we have more restaurants to explore in the city rather than return, although, I would definitely come back for the cocktails and wines! I hope nobody reads this as a bad review because that is not my intention; we just weren't oohing and aahing over the food.

title: Hard to believe that so many years later this place is still awesome
review: I first went to Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba the first year it opened in 1986. It was awesome then and it is awesome now. I took my family there a few weekends ago and my son born in 1986 was shocked when I told him the restaurant was the same age as him! The service is great and the choices are unlimited. How amazing is it that 30 years later this place is still going strong!

title: So delicious and great happy hour deals on tapas!
review: Go during happy hour for $1-$3 tapas! Delicious food and the best squid I have EVER tasted! They have excellent specialty sangria, as well, though I opted for a local brew.

title: Great tapas
review: I love this place. It's tapas and are fun to share with a group of friends. My favorite is the grilled octopus. The sangria is also pretty amazing. The prices are fair for the portion sizes. I have never been disappointed here.

title: Tapas done right!
review: We're never disappointed with this pick, and the crowd, food, service and drinks are delicious.  I'd go back any number of times, and highly recommend this place for a fun and tasty evening out.

title: Large plates.
review: We 3 loved several plates from the regular menu. We enjoyed it so much we decided to try the happy hour at the bar mid afternoon. Where can you get a great tasty small bite for $2-$4? The specialty beer hit the spot as well. We were to full for dinner.

title: Best Tapas
review: We called to see if we could get into the restaurant Saturday evening and was told there was a two hour wait, So we made reservation for Sunday evening. Couldn't believe how full the restaurant was when we arrived at 6:30. This was the best place to celebrate the ending to a wonderful weekend spent in Chicago. There tapas list is extensive and a marvelous choice of different combinations. They also have a good wine and beer list. My daughters and I have eaten in several tapas restaurants, however I think this was the best. They also have a delicious dessert list, we tried four different desserts.

title: Disappointed, expected more
review: I had heard so many good things about this place I decided to book it for my wife's and I wedding anniversary. Frankly it did not meet expectations and out of the last three Tapas restaurants we have recently been to this ranked a distant third. It was not that anything was bad but we had 11 different plates and none of them were great, the best we could say was that the best dishes were ok. The Sangria was tasty and frankly raised the review by a star

title: Great Place!
review: Very good brunch here the food was excellent as was the service. The bloody Mary bar was great and the staff was very pleasant the food was plentiful there were 8 of us and we all had left overs. I would highly recommend this place for brunch!

title: Tapas and sangria!
review: Our son took us here during a weekend in Chicago. Wonderful dinner! We started with a pitcher of sangria, which was very good. We made dinner out of several tapas dishes, all of which were excellent. The grilled sausage skewers and the citrus cured salmon, especially, were outstanding. We finished up with a flight of sherry - four different sherries - and the butterscotch custard, which was amazing.I'd give this place a 5 rating, if it weren't for the service. After being seated, we waited at least 10 minutes for a server; finally, my son had to catch someone's eye before we were helped. Service was then OK, but not good. The servers who brought our food were excellent, but the woman waiting on us was less than attentive. When she finally brought our check, she brought us a check for another table, which had already been cashed out. What the heck?! At this point, we were so fed up with her, we summoned the shift manager, who apologized and took the sangria and dessert off our bill.All in all, it was a terrific dinner. If the service had been better, it would have been amazing.

title: Solid tapas and Spanish fare
review: This is an old stand-by. Good food with some stand-outs like the morcilla, potatas bravas and the short rib. The croquettas are as good as I've had in Spain and shouldn't be missed.

title: Fun, Crowded and Tasty!
review: In a very nice neighborhood we found this great restaurant. We made reservations and were promptly seated in one of the back rooms which was spacious and already full. The restaurant and bar got full even though this was a Wednesday night and it is a sign of its popularity with the local crowd.The food was tapas and they had a varied menu. We ordered multiple plates and they were all good. Particularly the octopus which has to be well made or it becomes very chewy. We also had their sangria which was sweet and very enjoyable.This is a very lively place with a lot of good, young energy and much fun.

title: Tapas for people who don't usually "do" tapas
review: Our Cuban/Mexican friends said we'd do Sunday brunch and took us here. We're not tapas people usually -- and not brunch people usually -- but this was one of our most memorable meals in Chicago. We sat at a table near the bar with sangria to start with and looked through a comprehensive menu. The conversation switched into a Spanish consultation with our friends and our helpful and efficient waiter on what to have and what was day's specials. We sat back and let it happen and it was amazing. Beautiful food came out a couple of dishes at a time so that it was always hot and fresh. It was busy with a sociable buzz and all tables filled. We had booked in advance and there was no waiting when we arrived. We were not rushed at all, and service was efficient but not intrusive. Unlike some tapas places we have visited, the dishes are large enough for four to share so you can have a range of dishes and feel like you are actually having something to eat...not just a little nibble of this and that. Mushrooms with spinach, spicy potatoes and some little pulled pork rolls were great, and there were also seafood dishes and cheeses. After sangria starters our friends ordered a California red wine that complimented the food wonderfully well.Don't come if you are in a hurry, and it's best to come with a few people to justify ordering a range of dishes. Four was a good number in terms of portion sizes. A memorable brunch and well worth a visit.

title: Great tapas, excellent service.
review: The most impressive thing about this restaurant is the quality of the wait staff.  These are professional waiters, not just college students there temporarily.  The food was quite tasty.

title: food amazing
review: I love all warm tapas and glass of red sangriaits my fav spot in Chicago I don't like to eat giant portion so its perfect for melast time while sitting in the bar with my auntie one guest close by paid my check :)it was the best ever happen to me

title: Hipster Tapas in Chi-town
review: Cafe Ba-ba-reeba has been around for many years and has consistently been good. My wife went to school and lived in Chicago for many years and swore by the food at CBBR. We were visiting the Windy City for a couples retreat without the kids and decided to revisit this old joint. Tables are still quite hard to come by and you have to get lucky to score a reservation, but it is worth the wait. The food is Spanish Tapas, so lots of small plates of various items, but don't let that fool you into over ordering. We ordered less than the waitress recommended, but actually had food left over and were totally stuffed. The various items were all tasty and inventive, and the Sangria flavors were really fun and refreshing. Overall, I would say this is a spot worth visiting in Chicago. I gave it 1 less star because it is a bit pricey for what you are getting, but overall, good job.

title: Excellent!
review: I read the reviews here and decided to try it. It doesn't look like much from the outside but this restaurant has a lot of character once inside. We were seated in what I would describe as a sun room. Our waitress was new to this restaurant but she was great. I decided to try the goat cheese everyone here recommended and I can see why it came highly recommended. We also tried the octopus (wonderful), spinach/manchego stuffed mushrooms and last but not least the paella. Had we had room, I wanted to try the spicy potatoes everyone here recommends.My only complaint is we were told the paella would take about 45 minutes. Knowing this is tapas cuisine, we planned on taking our time sampling the different dishes. We ordered the paella first then ordered the other small dishes. The paella came out in about 10 minutes so we felt a bit rushed because we wanted to eat the paella while it was still hot.Aside from that, everything was great. The paella was served table side out of the cast iron skillet. We have the pork paella and it was wonderful. After ordering everything mentioned above we didn't have room for the I would recommend the strawberry/rhubarb empanada but this may be a seasonal item.If you're looking for a reasonably priced, excellent Tapas restaurant, I would recommend you try Ba-Ba-Rebas. You will not be disappointed.

title: Not My Style, But...
review: I am a pretty simple guy. I am not hip. Give me a good steak joint or even good ethnic food am I good. Our son has been trying to get us to go to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for the last couple of times we have visited him in Chicago. We finally aquiesced. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is not my style but I can see why it was crowded.The plates are served tapas-style and the plates are really good. Between the three of us, we tried maybe six different dishes, from beef, to veal, to a brussel sprout slaw. All were done very well.The part I did not care for but other might is the place is hoppin'. We arrived around 7 pm on a Tuesday night and the place was full... and loud. There is definitely a vibe about the place. Maybe it is because I do not hear well but I prefer a more quite setting, but that's me. We sat in the bar. I noticed a lot of "fun" drinks. Again, that may be for some. I prefer a good wine list. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba certainly does not have the latter. If a full bar is what you want, then this may be your place.Our waiter was good. He could have been a little quicker with the check but other than that, service was acceptable.So, will I return? No, probably not. That should not stop someone else, though, that is looking for a lively environment with top notch food. All of those people surely cannot be wrong...

title: Great Tapas
review: What a great tapas restaurant located in Lincoln Park so if you are downtown you will need to take a taxi. This is a Spanish tapas and the food is delish!! We had the bacon wrapped dates, bacon mac & cheese, potatoes with an awesome aloli. The wait staff was helpful and friendly as was the bartender. I would highly recommend the taxi ride out to eat here.

title: Tapas and paella
review: Great find up near DePaul university.  Over 40 different tapas,small plates as well as paella.  Nice wine list, full bar, sangria.  Very busy, we had a reservation.

title: Favorite tapas in Chicago
review: I have eaten here several times and have never been disappointed. The sangria is amazing and the food is so flavorful. Even save room for the wonderful desert. I highly recommend this restaurant for great food and great environment. Waits can be busy during the week and weekend during dinner hours.

title: Excellent Place for Brunch
review: Every time I'm in Chicago (several times a year), I always have to go to Ba Ba for Sunday brunch. Their food is outstanding and I love the make-your-own bloody mary bar. Full of everything (and more) that you could possibly want in your Mary. The tenderloin benedict is out of this world! This is definitely a place I will be returning to over and over again.

title: Best authentic Spanish food!!
review: I visited Spain a few years ago and miss their food all the time! This restaurants tapas taste just like Spain and the food is decently priced and authentic! The desserts are delicious and no matter what tapa you get, it's going to be good! MyFavorites are the spicy potatoes, bocadillo, meats and cheeses, the apple turnover, and many many more! Such a unique experience that I thought I could only experience in Spain, but now I can get a taste of it in Chicago!

title: Great group dinner
review: Several family members met in Chicago for a long weekend and this was the perfect place for dinner. Food is Spanish tapas, so you order several small things (we did 10 things for 8 people) and taste lots of different foods. My favs were the fried green peppers with sea salt, beef empanada, and chorizo wrapped date with cheese. We also ordered their seafood paella which was mixed table-side and was excellent. The restaurant can accommodate groups easily. Atmosphere is very loud and dimly lit, but didn't interfere with having a great time.

title: Terrific Tapas!
review: I made reservations at this restaurant mainly for its close proximity to where we were going to be but had no idea how the food would exceed my expectations! Three of us shared several menu items to sample a variety of the items. We were very full but could not resist the amazing dessert selections, also tapas size, which was perfect! Service was great and it is quite popular, so I would highly recommend making reservations if you can.

title: Tastebud explosion
review: Tapas the way it should be - every dish an exciting surprise in taste! Add to that the great service and awesome bread, we'll be back for sure. Even though this area has so many other interesting looking restaurants, we will find it hard to walk past Ba-Ba-Reeba.

title: Most of the food was great!
review: Most of the food was great! There were two of us and we each ordered 2 pinxtos (chorizo/date thing was amazing) and then we ordered 5 tapas to share which was almost too much food. The ham and chicken croquetas were my favorite! Wasn't impressed with the hanger stake at all. The ambiance was fun, only complaint was that the chairs were super uncomfortable. Overall I really enjoyed it and would definitely recommend! If you are staying downtown and want to try it, I would suggest taking a cab or uber...our uber was only $10 to the loop area

title: Great Place for Sunday Brunch
review: We went for brunch. The service was excellent and most of the food was really delicious. It is very hard to decide how much to order when you have a big group of 12 people from three generations. I would highly recommend asking for the quantity in each dish as some are as small as one piece(deviled egg - delicious!) to others that are enough to feed a hungry adult a FULL breakfast. Also take your time ordering- they do not rush you in any way. We were disappointed in the French Toast. The rest of the food was great -- waffles, pancakes, eggs, bacon, spicy potatoes were a big hit with all of us.

title: Great Tapas
review: What a great Dining experience, The tapas choices were plentiful. The Sangria is also very good. definitely great service.

title: Excellent tapas restaurant!, great service and fun atmosphere!
review: Saturday evening tapas couldn't get any better! Seated quickly, greeted by waitress immediately, ordered and served in a snap! The special drink of the night was mango sangria--sweet white wine mixed with fruit juice and spiked with apple and orange pieces--served very cold which made it very refreshing. All the tapas we ordered were excellent: very fresh-tasting, piping hot, served with appropriate side sauces. Our favorites were the goat cheese with tomato sauce, the ham croquettes and the beef empanadas. Don't forget to try a dessert--the chocolate truffle cake was sinfully delicious! Great service, fun atmosphere!

title: Yummmmmmmy!
review: I loved everything about this restaurant. We were able to get a 4:30 Saturday reservation for 8 two days in advance and parking on the street in front of the restaurant was much easier than we expected. The atmosphere is wonderful and even though the restaurant is busy, it doesn't feel like it and the staff does a wonderful job attending to everyone. The food is fantastic, the sangria is delicious and the coffee is a perfect way to wrap up dinner. They allowed us to bring a cake in and served it at no charge. The entire evening was delightful and my only regret is that I can't go back regularly since I don't live in Chicago.

title: Our favorite Chicago restaurant!
review: Every dish is fabulous! It's fun to be able to have a variety of different dishes, as this is tapas. Our family shared a big pitcher of sangria and we all loved all the different dishes. They went overboard to accommodate our gluten-free member, with fresh gluten-free bread. You usually need reservations, and if you can get in the patio area, it's lovely.

title: Delicious Tapas!
review: Delicious tapas and sangria! Lots of interesting and delicious tapas options, and very good sangria. The staff was kind and helpful. The resaurant was packed, but it was still quiet enough to have a pleasant conversation. Would definitely recommend.

title: Our favorite restaurant!
review: We love Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. We always get delicious food and good service for a good price. This was the first time we went for brunch and we will definitely go again. We love the patatas bravas, baked goat cheese, bacon wrapped dates, and braised short rib, but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. My advice though is to have a reservation or be prepared to wait!

title: The place was crowded but I don't get it
review: While visiting friends they suggested we stop here for appetizers. We each ordered several appetizers and they started to arrive at our table a couple at a time. Several that showed up were not for our table so we would send them back. The waiter never came back to see how we were doing so we would signal him to let him know what had not arrived yet. We sort of ate in shifts. The highlight of the evening was when the bill arrived I found out that the wine that we had ordered was provided at 1/2 price. We only found out they were promoting a "wine tuesdays" promotion as we were leaving and paying our bill. The place is noisy and crowded, the food ok at best and the sevice is poor to non existent.

title: Awesome Tapas and Sangria!
review: I was with a group of about 10 folks for a business dinner and thoroughly enjoyed the food, atmosphere and experience! We had the back room which was a perfect size for our group. We had a dedicated server who was right on with everything we needed. We had about 10 different tapas and they were fabulous. I loved the brussel sprout salad and the spinach/manchego stuffed mushrooms. I actually liked all the different flavors and selections. I didn't think I would get full but by the time we were getting dessert - I was stuffed. Not too stuffed though to not try the chocolate truffle cake - oh my goodness!!! If you like chocolate - you will love this. The restaurant specializes in many different types of sangria. I had the Peach and the White. The peach was very flavorful but I preferred the white with a softer taste. The group also had pitchers of the black raspberry that I did not try but they said it was fabulous. I'm ready to take my husband there now!

title: Great Tapas - real tapas!
review: Yup...dates wrapped in Spanish chorizo. This is a great place. Iberico jamon that is well-priced. I did not see one tapa with piquillo peppers...so that is odd. Let's add piquillo peppers stuffed with goat cheese and make this place even better! The Patatas Bravas is served with the sauce on the side...nicely done.

title: A gem - not really hidden!
review: Chorizo wrapped dates. I think I could stop there... they were absolutely incredibly and unique. Two of us split 4 tapas and walked away stuffed. I'd recommend a reservation, but there is high table top seating and a bar if you want to chance it (it worked out for us). Highly highly recommended!

title: Great Tapas Place!!
review: I was visiting Chicago in May and I went for dinner here with some friends.It took sometime to get us a table, so it's best to make a reservation ahead of time.We ordered a pitcher of sangria to share, well, actually two, one with red wine and another one with white wine and some peachy flavor, it was really good. Once we were seated, we ordered what didn't seem like much but ended up being more than enough. I really wanted some rice but the paella is minimum 2 servings and nobody seem to want any so the waiter suggested to order rice from the kids menu, it was a small portion but it was very yummy. This portion isn't advertised on the main menu, so now you know if you are looking for some rice but not a mountain of it. We ordered skewered chicken and chorizo sausage (good but my least favorite, it was bland compared to the other flavorful dishes), spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms (delicious!), spicy potatoes (we ordered 2 of these, they are very good!), meatballs (also delicious). The surprise of the night for me were yummy roasted dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette. I don't like dates and I thought the mix of ingredients was weird, but a friend of mine loves them (lives in Chicago and visits often) so I tried them and yup, she was correct, they are quite good!!! Must try if you are adventurous :)Service was quite good, our waiter was nice and made suggestions. It's a busy place so reservations is recommended. Overall a great place for dinner and drinks, would definitely go back if I visit again!

title: Authentic Tapas in Lively Atmosphere
review: This is a great "date night" location. The tapas list is extensive, the wine list exceptional and the service is very attentive. We had two types of paella (chicken and seafood) and  5 different tapas; meat and veggie. All were outstanding.

title: Delicious Tapas!
review: Great tapas selection. Consistently delicious. Great service. Have returned time and again.  Must try!

title: Fun place for a happy hour
review: I went here with a group of friends from work and we had a blast! We tried a few different types of sangria, they were all fresh and fruity tasting! I also got a mescal mule, which was a fun twist on the Moscow mule. It was smokies and spicy compared to a typical one but I loved the twist and I would order it again! We did order a few appetizers, I didn't get a chance to try them all. I did try the patatas bravas, which were flavorful but dry. I also tried one of the meat empanadas, that was crunch on the outside and yummy, warm and creamy on the inside! I had heard good things about this place and I had wanted to try it for a while. I didn't get to try very much of the food, but the food I had wasn't too impressive (patatas bravas). But the drinks were fun and it was a great happy hour place!

title: not to be missed
review: if you like tapas. hopefully you will get Daniel as your waiter... unless he finally gets a 'real acting job'. He made the evening as fun as can be.. and the food was terrific.

title: Great Sunday Brunch choice
review: My son took us on Sunday for the Bloody Mary bar (awesome) and lunch. Mixed up cold and hot small plates and split a paella- lots of food. Service was average but it was busy. Food was good, but the hit was the Bloody Mary bar. If you like Spanish tapas, this is a very fine choice.

title: Outstanding tapas, atmosphere, and personal attention
review: If you love tapas and you love food with a flare from Spain, this is the place to go.Tucked onto Halstead St. in the LIncoln Park neighborhood. At 7:00pm there was a lively crowd at the bar and seated in various areas of the restaurant. I had called ahead for a special occasion delivery of cupcakes to be served at the table. The catering of the restaurant was so very accommodating and followed through with the details of the arrangement. Our party of six ordered fried green peppers with course salt, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, calamari, shrimp, chicken & sausage, and beef skewers, also spicy potatoes. Each tapas that arrived brought a new treat of flavor. The chicken and the beef skewer had only one skewer which really only was a one person serving. If you like these get two of each to go around. The beers from Spain were a good pairing, Berry Sangria was full flavored with fruit and not overpowering alcohol. Good pricing for area on food and drinks. Service was prompt, attentive, and servers were pleasant and personable. The atmosphere was fun and lively, music was great but not overwhelming for conversation. A great tapas place for a little or a lot. Next time, I will try the Paella which was served around us and looked and smelled great. I will return and highly recommend to others.

title: Top tapas and charm
review: With the feel of a hot new spot Lettuce Entertain You did it again. Great service. 4-5 star tapas. We had the 5 best sellers we heard waiters suggesting. Goat cheese . bacon wrapped figs. Salmon. All memorable. They were all lively. The desserts were all tasty and small portioned. Perfect ! The only question mark was I ordered a 3G ( Tres Generaciones) tequila and he brought padron and lightly said "I'm out enjoy this instead. "...Wha?I sent it back. It felt bait and switchy. You don't order a fine ribeye and casually accept a fajita taco lightly. Baba cmon. You betta than that! My medical student son was pumped when we picked this spot. I'll feel the same next time we go. Suggest you make res. --place was packed.

title: Best tapas in Chicago
review: We really loved this place. The food was excellent, very tasty and perfect for sharing. Our favorite dish was the grilled squid!Great ambiance, the seating, the atmosphere, the music.Service was A+, our server stayed with us even past the closing hour, and got us complimentary deeserts!

title: If you LOVE Tapas! You'll Love it Here!
review: This is another one of my favorite go-to places in Chicago, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has an awesome tapas menu! It can be a little loud in there, so if you are looking for a quiet dinner, this is not the place. I have had most of the menu (been going there for years) and I have loved everything!Two thumbs up!

title: Great for a Date Night or Large Party!
review: I wish this was in our city! We would visit all the time! A very well done tapas restaurant, with great service and great food quality at pretty good prices. Our fave were the berry sangria, the chorizo dates, the garlic shrimp, and dessert trio. Great experience start to finish. Fun and lively, with funky decor.

title: Tapas for the Group
review: We had a large group meet here at a recommendation from a local friend. The food was delicious! We had a set meal for everyone based on recommendations by the restaurant. We had a nice mix of different things. The brussel sprout salad was quite delectable...yes I said delectable. The bacon wrapped dates and grilled squid in olive oil and garlic were delicious also. The squid was so tender, not chewy at all. We had a multitude of desserts for everyone to share. The one that really stuck out was the marcona almond-caramel bar. They were sweet and tempting to the tummy, I had 2.

title: Fun, affordable, and worth the wait!
review: Three of us showed up without a reservation at 7:30pm on a Saturday night - and while we couldn't get a table, we were encouraged to grab a drink and wait for bar space or a high-top table as it shouldn't be too long of a wait. Within ten minutes we were seated at the bar and ready for our food experience. Everything we tried was excellent, but must highlight the baby back rib, and the squid which were fantastic. The red sangria was ok but being on tap and fruit added after the pour - I've definitely had better. Our bartender/waiter must have been having a bad night as he wasn't super friendly, and we had to ask for bread, drink refills, water etc. All in all, I would definitely go back as the food really was good, and surprisingly we had more than enough to eat and drink for less than $80 between the three of us!

title: Nice tapas restaurant in Lincoln Park
review: My wife and I went to Cafe Ba Ba Reeba recently for lunch. Restaurant is located in heart of Lincoln Park. We went for lunch on a Saturday and it was very packed. We decided to sit at bar area. The service was excellent and friendly. There is large range of various Spanish tapas type dishes. There was bloody mary bar on Saturday along with multiple types of Sangria. The food and drink was very good. It is nice and casual setting. And, they were showing Spanish soccer game which was great. I highly recommend place if you are in Lincoln Park area for lunch or dinner.

title: Just average
review: We tried the original red sangria. It was horrible. We had to return it. The garlic shrimp tapa was good. The 3 pork paella was just ok. The pork belly was kinda fatty. The dessert tapas butter scotch and chocolate cake were really good!

title: Good value great food with nice staff
review: Cafe Ba Ba Reeba is definitely worth our trip to the Lincoln neighbourhood. The octopus and the paella was just lovely... And the tapa size desserts were perfect guiltless options. We had a great time.

title: Delicious birthday meal!
review: We went here to celebrate my husband's birthday before going to a show. We didn't know but they were participating in Restaurant Week when we went and they had some great deals. We just chose our own range of tapas -and thoroughly enjoyed them. The ingredients were fresh, the flavouring delicious. We also had some beautiful desserts -compete with a candle added by the staff. The staff was very knowledgable and helpful. Our food came out in a timely fashion and the sanrgia was yummy. All in all, I would definitely go back and wish there was a restaurant like this close to where I live!

title: An Experience
review: This was my second time at Cafe Babareeba and it didnt disappoint! The food is amazing, atmosphere is great and staff is friendly and informative. If you've never tried tapas before THIS is your place. You wont be disappointed. Each plate if food is so carefully thought out and executed. One of my favorite Chicago resturants for sure.

title: Fun While Eating
review: Very neat, warm, vibrant Spanish style restaurant near heart of Chicago. Lots of tapas to select from with friendly and upbeat staff the aromas reminds one of traditional Spanish or south European restaurants and the homemade breads & dishes will guarantee that you'll return. Need to call ahead for reservations as both the well appointed, classy bar and restaurant areas were packed with people having a great time.

title: Delicious
review: A very lively, busy restaurant with good service and delicious tapas. Its nice to get out of the MagMile touristy area to eat with the locals.

title: World favorite!
review: 47 countries in to my travel, Cafe Babareeba is literally my favorite restaurant in the world! Chicago is the original location, and the Cafe in Las Vegas is equally as fantastic! It is a tapas experience. I go for the foodie experience, but many enjoy the beautiful pitchers of sangria. You can chose the tapas portions, or they have paella and other entrees. Personal favorite is the dates/almonds/goat cheese plate. They always have fabulous soup options- sometimes a home made cream of mushroom or gazpacho. They have citrus marinated olives, several tenderloin dishes (with delicious accompaniments), poultry, pork, beef and seafoods. If you are in Chicago, it is a must:)

title: Very good and fun
review: Excellent tapas and sangria, with consistently good food.Great place with something to please everyone.

title: Fun!
review: Fun tapas restaurant! Great selection, and everything was consistently good. Tried the paella as well and enjoyed it. Great Spanish wine list as well. Was very busy on a Monday night so can only imagine what the weekend wait must be. Reservations recommended!

title: Best Sangria
review: This place has the best atmosphere. It is so pretty inside, yet still a laid back atmosphere. The people who work there are always friendly and welcoming. The tapas are for the most part good, but the sangria is the best! Some tapas are more delicious than others and come with a bigger portion than others. I like the fact that they bring out your food as it's ready so it's always freshly cooked and you get to enjoy each dish.

title: Wonderful tapas and sangria
review: The tapas and sangria here are delicious! We had the potatoes, beef with bleu cheese, and bacon wrapped dates. Everything was absolutely wonderful!The service is great, and they do not rush you at all. The atmosphere is warm, casual, and cozy. I will definitely visit again when I come back to Chicago!

title: Best tapas in town!
review: If you are looking for a good tapas restaurant in Chicago this is definitely a place worth checking out. The overall atmosphere of the place is very warm,and welcoming, the decor is very simple but cozy, and all of the staff is wonderful. One of our favorite servers Velibor, always makes the experience so much more for us, and the food speaks for itself. If you get a chance to try out Babareeba you will enjoy their amazing food, great atmosphere, and I must admit for me personally I had better tapas here than I did in some of the tapas restaurants I tried in Madrid.

title: Great Tapas in Lincoln Park
review: This place is excellent, but be sure to make reservations! We went (as a party of 4) on a Sunday night around 7 pm and waited about an hour. Once we sat down, the wait was well worth it. The four of us ordered two servings of Paella and a few tapas plates. The Paella was some of the best I've ever had and with all the different tapas options, you're bound to find something you like.

title: Good food, friendly service
review: The food was delicious, service was friendly and fast, good spot for dinner.  Nothing too remarkable. It was busy even on a week night so make reservations.  nce remar

title: Loud+Fun, Good Food
review: Very 'Lincoln-Park'ish, but this place is huge and always packed so definitely get a reservation. The menu is what you'd expect from spanish tapas, and they do it well. Order the Paella if you have the luxury of time and aren't seduced by the crazy array of tapas and pinchos.

title: Best Tapas ever!
review: Went here with a group of friends amd let me rell you it is well worth the hassle. Parking sucks but train is somewhat nearby. I enjoyed the potatas bravas. The sauce on them is amazing I wish I knew the recipe. The braised short ribs with manchanego cheese mash is Devine. I could probably eat this eveey day! Overall the service was great. Can't complain, everyone seemed to be on top of their toes. I can't wait to go back!

title: This place is great
review: I can't say anything except this place is great. The staff and food were amazing, portions and prices are appropriate for a great tapas place and the sangria is sublime. The only downside if it has one is street only parking so either plan ahead for finding a spot or take a cab, either way once you sit down you are in for an amazing time.

title: For lovers of Tapas and outstanding Sangria.
review: Great service with an extremely knowledgeable server. Outstanding Tapas menu and an excellent selection of Sangrias. We went with the server's recommendations and were not disappointed. Their contact information is now on my mobile because we definitely will visit again next time we are in Chicago, which is 2-3 times a year.

title: Top Tapas Restaurant in Chicago
review: This is definitely the best tapas restaurant in Chicago, and I have been to most of them. The food is wonderful and is always of good quality. Everything I have had from there I have thoroughly enjoyed! This is a very popular spot so make reservations if you want a table.

title: Can't stop eating here
review: This restaurant is a great Tapas restaurant with excellent quality and a menu that does change. The grilled chorizo and three other sausages. Included in this sausage Tapas is a blood sausage that is beyond flavorful, it is a revelation. The pinxtos, little bite sized tapas are always incredible, from the bacon wrapped dates and deviled eggs. The endive salad is excellent and sometimes it disappears from the menu. Their breakfasts are just as good. Filet mignon eggs benedict. pretty good.

title: Thoroughly enjoyable
review: This was a great gastronomic delight, beginning with the diverse range of delicious starters. It got even better as the entrees came out on the table. The service was outstanding with good attention to detail. The atmosphere was lively and felt good. A thoroughly enjoyable experience.

title: Incredible Sangria and Tapas
review: This place was amazing! The tapas dishes were incredible. I would definitely recommend their deviled eggs, goat cheese in tomato sauce, and the ham and chicken croquetas. Everything we ate there was delicious. And their white peach sangria was some of the best that I've tasted. Whatever you do, do NOT miss the butterscotch custard with salted caramel. SO. SO. GOOD.

title: Great food, great service!
review: I was recently at Cafe Babareeba to celebrate the end of an interesting year with friends. We sat at the bar and were deftly handled by the bartender, Nico. He was tons of fun and fantastic at his job. We had the sangria sampler followed by dates wrapped in bacon for an appetizer. You can never go wrong with bacon... I would strongly recommend a reservation as the place got really busy after 6pm. They have valet parking which makes it a hassle free evening! Go and have an awesome time!

title: Lively Tapas Restaurant new Lincoln Park
review: This is a fun,lively restaurant with a very diverse menu. The stuffed mushrooms, garlic shrimp and autumn salad were outstanding. The grilled octopus was very tough and chewy and I would not recommend it. The seafood paella was very tasty, but could have been served with more seafood and less rice. All the desserts we sampled- the natilla flan, the mini ice cream sandwiches and the truffle cake were delicious. I would return again if I lived in Chicago.

title: Piece of Spain in Chicago
review: Perfect place for lunch. Big variety of tapas to share with friends or family. We have chosen 10 different and everything was excellent. Definitely good salmon in all options, very good seafood paella. reall nice place to come and have fun tasting different meals.

title: Best meal of a fabulous food weekend!
review: Probably the best paella I've ever had, plus an array of delicious tapas. Every one was excellent, as was the apple cider sangria.

title: Tapas are over-rated
review: I just find this approach to dining very unfulfilling.  Give me a real dinner to enjoy.  The rest of my family enjoyed it.  The atmosphere was lively, although they were having some temperature control issues - alternating between too hot and too cold.

title: Great food but service is lousy--again and again
review: Have been to this restaurant three times in last 3 months. The food is fantastic, everything we have ever had (been going to this restaurant since I believe 2000). I have to complain about the service I have experienced the last three times we have been here. Once again this trend where the waiter does not serve the food. In fact I was kind of angry because the food delivery people just fling it on your table without even saying here is your food--I almost knocked off one dish with my elbow because I did not know he was serving the food. And then the food delivery person "runs" away from your table, if something is wrong where is your waiter--not to be found. Also, you should not reach across someone to fill up water on your left. Ask if they want water and do not reach across their personal space--basic serving 101.
