And do not hound us to remove every plate two seconds after we finish--they seem to notice empty plates before empty wine glasses. This place is too good to have such sloppy poorly trained service. I felt like I was eating on an army base it was so hectic. Almost a bad experience, if not for the fantastic food.

title: So much fun!
review: This was an experience and highly recommend.  The peach sangria was great, the service was outstanding and the food worth any wait.  On a very busy Friday night, still treated like we were the only ones there.  Don't miss an opportunity to try it.

title: Great food little pricey.
review: We had a family visit and loved the overall experience. Sangrias were great and we tried the black rasbery and passionfruit both great. Tapas were very good so the meat and seafood payellas. Check was not too much but not a great value either.

title: Great food--always a good time!
review: The food is always great here, and it always seems to be filled with people having a great time. (Even on an out-of-season Monday night). It is loud, so if this is a problem for you, request one of the more quiet rooms--although these will still be quite noisy! I have never sampled anything here that I didn't like. The white peach sangria was nice and "sturdy" (another person stated that it was watery--ours was not). Order your paella while you are looking over the other tapas on the menu because it takes about 20-30 minutes to prepare--we had the seafood paella and it was excellent. Unfortunately, we had filled ourselves a little too full on other tapas and had plenty of paella leftover. The waitresses are very helpful in explaining different flavorings, and the menu changes frequently. This is a great place to celebrate an event with a group, or TGIF!

title: Don't miss that!
review: Very popular so you better make a reservation. Waiters very nice and really helpful in choosing your tapas. Everything we ate ranged between very delicious and delicious. It's an experience you must go through. Strongly recommended.

title: A revisit after many years
review: First visited with group of girl friends many years back.  Wonderful experience then and once again this trip.  From MI so unable to frequent.  Attended Apollo Theater and it was within walking distance, if one likes to walk.  Great food, friendly wait staff!

title: A hidden gem!
review: From the eclectic ambience to the large tapas style menu, there is something for everyone at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! I absolutely adore this restaurant. I love to experience a variety of foods when I dine, and this tapas style setting encourages it. The service was impeccable. Make a reservation! This place is always busy.

title: Fantastic yet again!!!!
review: This is one of my FAVORITE Chicago restaurants, the food is always amazing but I keep coming back for the off the charts Sangria!!!  Not to miss!!  Small plates are reasonable and very tasty as well!!!

title: One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago!
review: Cafe Ba Ba Reeba is best shared with a group of friends, but I imagine it'd be perfect even on a romantic date. We had about 8 in our party and we were able to experience a wide variety of dishes. The pitchers of Sangria are really reasonable if you're splitting, but not too pricey even if you aren't. You can't miss the bacon wrapped dates. This was actually the first place that I tried them, so if you don't think you'll like them - still give it a try! Every one I know that said they wouldn't like them ended up loving them. Our service was great too and we felt like the value was there, as we walked out extremely stuffed.

title: Loved every dish!!
review: This restaurant is fantastic!! I loved every dish that we tried. The bacon wrapped dates were delicious, the short ribs were so tender, you could cut them with the fork. And the octopus!! I was expecting something rubbery but they were wonderful. We also tried several desserts- the marcona tart was everyone's favorite!! I would definitely recommend this restaurant and will go again the next time I'm in Chicago.

title: Horrible sangria!!!
review: If you choose this restaurant for it's fame... Please, this is not the spot if you have the sense of culinary "tapeo" the worst "flavored" sangria. Tastes like Lipton tea and drops of wine. Viva Cafe Iberico.

title: Spot On
review: The food was delicious and the pallea was best I have ever had. They did mess up on our order, but the manager handled it like a boss. All the staff was friendly and pleasant, atmosphere was fun. If I lived in Chicago, I would be a regular here.

title: Amazing Paella and Tapas
review: After 23 years we returned and found this place just as amazing as we remembered it being. If you have no clue what a "Tapas Bar" is it is generally a Spanish themed restaurant with smaller portions that you share. We started with the shrimp and deviled egg "Pintxos". Fabulous.Order a shrimp "Paella" when you sit down as it takes awhile but is the best paella anywhere!For tapas we ordered calamari, two kinds of lamb, beef short rib (decadent), scallops, meat balls and something else!We did get two "small" butterscotch like creme brûlée desserts.Fabulous!

title: Great restaurant, delicious food!
review: There were 5 of us that dined here just last night and it was a great restaurant! The menu is fairly large with a lot of great offerings. Two of my friends lived in Spain for a few years and this place definitely took them back. We ordered about 8 different things and it was all very tasty & the service is great! Must try the warm potato & onion omelette!

title: Great food in small plates
review: This Tapas restaurant is one of the best I have ever eaten at. The food was fresh, wonderful tasting and very nice portions. The short ribs were the best ever with that nights Chilean sea bass special exceptional. All the dishes were well prepared with a delightful presentation. Try the Carmelized bananas dessert if you have room.

title: So Good!
review: My best friend took me here while visiting her and her boyfriend in Chicago. We love tapas-style meals and sharing food, so this was perfect. We probably ordered about 10 things off the menu and a couple pitchers of Sangria, and everything was delicious.The meatballs, however, were definitely the crowd pleaser. We ordered two rounds of those. Don't know what they put in the sauce, but we couldn't get enough of it!

title: Yummy!
review: Everything was great here. We ordered just a couple things and once we tried those we ordered more things to try! It was our first time trying it and someone on the train told us about this place and boy am I glad we got to try. I have told other people visiting Chicago to make sure they check it out. Very busy so I recommend a reservation. We got lucky and got 2 seats at bar right away but I don't think that's typical they were super busy. Great service even though....

title: Interesting food, nice atmosphere
review: The tapas and lively atmosphere at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba provided us with a great backdrop to meet up with friends over interesting food. We especially enjoyed the bacon covered figs, the empanadas, and the nice selection of vegetable options. Good, attentive, but not overbearing service. Recommend trying to get a seat outside on their porch, and booking ahead.

title: Good food
review: Really nice place. Food is awesome and service is great. Tapas are really good. Went there on Friday for lunch and didn't have to wait at all. Worth visiting.

title: You'd swear you were in Spain....
review: No visit for me to Chi-town is complete without a visit to Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba! The tile, ambiance, smells coming out of the kitchen and the hussling waitstaff, make this place one of my all-time favorites! The pitchers of fresh Sangria are fruity and tangy. The wide assortment of Tapas offer a little something for every palate. Give this place a try...in 10 plus years of going there, I've never been disappointed!

title: Always amazing!
review: This was our third time here. Never disappoints. It was our first time with our boys, ages 8 and 11. They loved it as much as we always do! Awesome food, sangria and staff. The OpenTable reservation was spot on time. Such a great night at Cafe BBR!

title: Experience authentic Spanish tapas and sangria in Chicago!
review: This is a favorite restaurant of mine and I keep going back over and over and never get tired of this place. You can tell a lot about a restaurant by reading the faces of the wait and bus staff. Are they frazzled, slow, tired, hard to find? Here they are genuinely friendly, know the menu, continuously clear away the many plates, and refill water glasses with great speed and efficiency. They work extremely hard serving many hot and cold dishes to each table throughout the course of a meal. The wait and bus staff deserve as much recognition as the kitchen staff. Take your time, keep a menu, and just keep ordering whatever sounds intriguing. Chose a variety, share, and try things you never ate before. Remember, these are small plates and that's half the fun! The pace is timed perfectly by the servers. Special sangrias of the day are offered, but my personal favorite is the classic red, the gold standard. Favorite menu items are bacon wrapped dates, deviled eggs, salmon, meatballs, and octopus, but everything tastes delicious. It can get noisy, so I prefer the small rooms in the back or the sunroom on the left. Request those if you like things more quiet. Enjoy!

title: Great tapas and good fun
review: We had been talking about going here for a long time and we finally got there. There was a little bit of dithering at the front desk about our reservation but we got seated pretty quickly. The place is quite large with several big rooms and one smaller one. I think there might have been a private room in the back. There is a big tapas list and everything we had was very good or better. some of the high points were the roast chicken empanada, the meatballs, the serrano ham, but as said everything we tried (about 13 items) was good with no disappointments.The restaurant is fairly loud and got louder as time went on. Despite the large number of people you did not feel at all crowded and the seats were quite comfortable. The main beverage is the sangria (5 types, we had both the red and the mango) but there is both a large Spanish wine list and a medium beer list. We had 4 of the desserts. All were good with the butterscotch pudding and the mocha almond bar being excellent.The crowd was heavily female (about 5 to 1) with lots of either bachelorette party or girls-night-out groups. Seemed to get a little younger as it got later. By 8, there were lots of people waiting at the bar and to be seated.When the bill came I was surprised how reasonable it was since we had stuffed ourselves.

title: Great Spanish tapas and sangría
review: I am going to sound repetitive but this place was, for us, as good as Café Ibérico. Service was quick and friendly, tapas were fantastic and sangría was tasty and refreshing. We recommend it highly, the prices are very reasonable and, in spite of having many customers, we could carry a nice conversation.

title: Amazing tapas, great service
review: Being a vegetarian, my options were always limited. Was surprised to see the number of vegetarian options Cafe Ba-ba-Reeba. The tapas are outstanding and we absolutely loved the food. One best part of this restaurant is they don't wait for all the dishes to be cooked, they serve you stuff as and when it's ready, so you need not starve for long. "Spicy potatoes with tomato alioli" and "Fried green peppers and coarsed salt" stand out among their other vegetarian tapas's. Not to forget their market vegetable paella. Ask for their daily special sangrias.. you might be in for a pleasent surprise :)Oh-oh, last but not the least, must try their butterscotch custard! One of the best desserts that I've had!!

title: Loved it! Great tapas with amazing flavors
review: We arrived during dinner time without a reservation, however we were still seated promptly. The restaurant did get much busier when we were there however, so i would recommend a reservation to be safe. The atmosphere was lively with very friendly staff. Plenty of variety of food and drinks to choose from. I had the pork loin kebabs, and short ribs tapas while my boyfriend enjoyed the stuffed mushrooms, grilled squid and shrimp tapas. Everything was very tasty!. I also had passion fruit sangria that was a little watered down. Our waitress even gave us a free dessert because it was our first time there! Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

title: Loved it!
review: We were seated right away and the waiter was very helpful explaining all our options. My wife requested a gluten free menu and had a lot to choose from. We don't go out for tapas often so I don't have much to compare it to but we both left satisfied. Save room for the flan!

title: Loved all......except the Paella
review: I'm from Europe and have been in Spain plenty......also visited plenty tapas restaurants in the USA....I will keep my review simple.....I liked all the Tapas we had.....aside from the Paella.....it tasted more like a "dirty creole rice" ....certainly not a Spanish paella with yellow rice......come on Ba Ba Reeba..,,,you have a great place there.....improve your Paella !!!!

title: Great Tapas
review: I celebrated both my 60th and 72nd birthdays at this restaurant plus have been here many other times. The tapas are outstanding with a tremendous variety. I spent two weeks in Spain and these equal any I had there. The atmosphere is lively and colorful. Do save room for dessert. I am not a sangria fan, but those whom I have been with who are deem it superb.

title: Always FUN
review: I love coming here with a group of people. The food is great and its perfect for sharing. One of my favorite parts of eating here is that they bring things out as they're ready - so you're never waiting long for your food. Cafe Ba-Ba- Reeba can get really busy so I recommend always making a reservation. Waits can be up to 2 hours on weekend nights. I LOVE the brussels sprouts salad, the short ribs and any sangria :)

title: Good Food...Gluten free bread!
review: I really like Tapas restaurants that have gluten free options and are willing to adjust their menu to fit gluten free as well.  This restaurant is nice on the inside, has outdoor seating, and plenty of street parking.  They have gluten free bread as well.

title: NEVER disappoints
review: This place is just entertaining and always great...food, drinks, atmosphere - they hit on all of it. It is noisy and you will have to wait but it's all worth it. Every time we are in Chicago we find this place...we say "OK, next time let's try something new...and then there we are back at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! The neighborhood can't be beat either so it's just all around great.

title: So Good
review: My local friend made our reservation well in advance so our indoor patio table was waiting for us. It was difficult to narrow down our choices from the menu. Our waitress was able to help us select by describing the items in detail. The two of us ordered 5 plates plus dessert and we felt like we had too much food. This would be a great place to make a repeat visit to try more menu items.

title: Best Tapas Place!
review: Oh, my gosh...best and most delicious assortment of tapas I've ever seen or tasted! Loved that we could just look over the list and choose from each category; the size of each order was perfect for my daughter and me, the wine list was just right, and the price was very reasonable. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!

title: Great food! Great prices!
review: It had been about 10 years since I had been, but my rave reviews are still very much warranted! The chorizo wrapped figs, the shrimp with garlic/red pepper flakes, bacon wrapped dates, deviled egg, blue cheese tenderloin and stuffed mushrooms were fantastic! The shrimp and figs were out of this world. Had a 1/2 pitcher o f classic red sangria, which was the perfect compliment to the tapas. The whole bill came out to $64 before tip, this fed 2 of us, which compared to some other places is an amazing value.

title: Ba Ba Tapas!
review: We went to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba with a group of four. After Divy'ing over from Lakeshore (have you rode the Divy bikes in Chicago? SO fun), we were seated immediately despite how busy the restaurant was. We had a reasonably priced bottle of wine and really enjoyed the tapas. The meat plates were interesting; my favorite dish was the meatballs. Be sure to order as many 'favorites' on the menu as you can!

title: A Taste of Spain!
review: This is one of the Best tapas restaurants in Chicago area....Great atmosphere..always bustling and indoor outdoor patio to enjoy when weather is pleasant. Paella is by far best I have had. Try it if you have been disappointed at other places. The only drawback to the paella is that it is filling and you may not have room to try all the other great tapas..My husband's favorite is the patatas bravas....a bit spicy and a great sauce on the side. The stuffed mushrooms with spinach and cheese are Mouthwateringly Good!! I like to break up the tapas with a nice little salad..All are good here and inventive. No room for dessert..But I would bet on them being delicious!..Brunch items are just fabulous!! A Must Go to!

title: still a great place to eat
review: we went back (second time) late, after the theater, and Baba was still hopping (in fact, there was DJ going hot and heavy in the other room). our service was pretty quick, and our server was very attentive. we ordered the specials, and half a dozen other plates-- I mean isn't the whole point to try new and interesting dishes? they were all yummy. as was the sangria. and as a birthday treat, the server comped a dish of mango sorbet, on which he put a lighted candle. when we left near midnite there were still several couples and couple of large groups, everyone looked like they were having a good time.

title: Wonderful Tapas & Paella!
review: We had a $100 Let Us Entertain You gift card and decided to give Cafe BaBA Reeba to celebrate ours and our friends Anniversary. When making our dinner reservation I was asked if it was a special occasion and I told the hostess that we had two anniversaries to celebrate. The restaurant is and easy 30 minute walk from the Clybourn station on the Union Pacific Northwest line. The menu was large with a great variety of Tapas small plates to choose from. Some of our favorites were the Seared Spanish Sausages, Grilled Octopus and Beef Tenderloin with Blue Cheese. The Seafood Paella with monkfish, scallops and shrimp was excellent. We had five in our group and ordered four servings of the Paella which was plenty since we had already eaten five different Tapas entrees. I highly recommend the White Peach Sangria, it had a wonderful peach flavor and was refreshing. At the end of our meal, we were surprised when we received two complimentary desserts in honor of our anniversaries. We will definitely plan on returning to Cafe BaBa Reeba again in the future.

title: Buzzy atmosphere crowded and busy
review: We had a great meal at this Tapas style restaurant. It was Friday night so the place was packed! A god lace to meet friends before going down the road to the local B.L.U.E.S bar. Good fast and efficient service. We enjoyed lovely wine and I liked the blue cheese steak, garlic prawns and selection of cheeses.

title: Good Food, Service a Little Slow
review: I entertained another business group here. Loved the atmosphere and the food was good. We had the group menu with several dishes selected. Unfortunately, they each came out one by one, and there was some considerable time between each one, so the dinner dragged on for what seemed to be forever. It would have been nice if they brought out all the appetizers at the same time, and then all of the main courses, etc. I know it is a tapas restaurant, but I think people still like to have more than one item on their plate at a time.

title: A little bit of everything.
review: I just LOVE this place! The sangria is delish.. and you get to order small plates to share with your friends and/or date.  We sat in the bar by the window so we could people watch as we ate. Its in a great part of towna dn the service is impeccable. I love the ambiance. Its dark with candles and the decor make the place rich. The tapas are prepared so differently than I expected. Tons of flavor and definately enough to go around. My favorites are the: meatballsspicy potatoesdeviled aggRosted chicken empanadas.I wont get the salmon again. It was good but it was raw and different than I was expecting. Love the thick warm grain bread on the table with olive oil.We will be back next week!

title: Pretty Good!
review: I was just there on Friday night, for a friends birthday dinner. I have to say the service was PERFECTION! I love to go places that have GREAT service and this place was it. Now with that said we were a group of 15 and they accommodated all our needs, but some of the food was no bueno. (garlic roasted chicken) so good going down, horrible coming back up the next day! The garlic potato salad, on point! the garlic shrimp and empanadas amazing also the coconut flan (one of The reason I would return)..All in all this place was great! Parking is a beast though, so good luck on that. The sangria was also a huge hit!

title: Exciting Tapas Brunch
review: Recently spent an afternoon in Chicago to visit with my daughter and went to Ba Ba Reeba on a friend's recommendation. This is a very vibrant place so if you are looking for a quiet intimate restaurant environment, this is not the place. It is the place for an exciting well serviced brunch or dinner with a versatile and unique menu. We stopped in around 11:20 am on a Sunday and this place fills up quickly!!! Frankly, we had (8) breakfast menu items with bloody marys and all were wonderful. I can't even pick a fav as everything was excellent. Highly recommend. We will definitely be back.

title: Crowded, Noisy, Tasty!!!
review: One of my son's favorite places, he wanted to treat us. Friday night wait was over two hours, but we were able to make it to the bar within minutes.Ordered various tapas and took turns sampling from each other's plates. Quick service, very tasty! Heavy, noisy crowd was a bit tough to handle for too long. But we had no problem sitting long enough to enjoy the food.Go early to avoid the crowds.

title: Amazing!
review: YOU HAVE TO EAT HERE! A Chicago colleague recommended this place when I mentioned we'd be coming from St. Louis to celebrate a special birthday. I was a little nervous when I called the restaurant a couple hours before our 7:00 Saturday reservation to see if we could make it earlier and the gal made it sound like even our 7:00 wasn't necessarily going to be seated on time. No worries. We kept it at 7, we showed up at 7, we were seated shortly thereafter. Service was cheerful and prompt, and the plates kept coming. Every single bite was sensational! And amazingly, the prices were very reasonable. Can't wait to go back!

title: Love going with a big group
review: I love coming here when I'm with a bigger group of people. That way a ton of plates get ordered, and you can try a bit of everything without getting TOO overstuffed, which often happens when I come with smaller groups of three or four. Love the drinks. If you're not sure on what to get, always ask the waiters for their recommendations. Great atmosphere, great food - and a GREAT Bloody Mary bar! One of my favorites.

title: Excellent food and crowd
review: Food was good. Drinks was superb. We had almost everything on the menu and it was excellent plus it was crowded with people all night drinking their cocktails. Best tapas experience in chicago.

title: Surprisingly good
review: We stopped here on a whim as we were passing by and were hungry. This place probably has the best tapas we have had in the Chicago area. It was SUnday and they were packed for lunch. I think they had a brunch going on. People were obviously locals. We would be back! We loved everything !

title: Highly recommended
review: We had a leisurely early dinner last week. Very large and accommodating restaurant. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Tapas were very good. Nice selection of wines ( if you're not sure of your choice, ask for a taste!). Would definitely recommend to a friend.

title: Very tasty tapas and sangria!
review: I came here for brunch. They have a separate brunch menu, plus brunch tapas, plus the entire menu of regular tapas to order from. They have a make-your-own bar for bloody mary's, but we opted for the sangria (red) and it was great! We shared one "brunch" tapa-- a savory crepe, and two other tapas-- croquetas and stuff mushrooms. Everything was great. I will be back to test out their paella and other tapas. The place is fairly large, but not overly crowded.

title: amazing brunch!
review: a really cute brunch place with the best pancakes and bacon i've ever had. there are so many interesting flavors and foods. i will definitely come back next time i visit chicago! there can be a wait so make sure to come right when it opens :)

title: Great Tapas
review: Great tapas experience, would definitely recommend. Most of the dishes were fantastic. The chorizo wrapped date was incredible as was the chorizo and onion special and the beet and goat cheese cristini. Definitely go for the goat cheese and tomato sauce, shrimp, meatballs, and scallops. Great cheese board with delicious orange marmalade. I'd say pass on the brussels salad, chicken empanada, spicy potatoes, and dessert. Pretty good blood orange sangria. Standard service. Restaurant was shockingly large which fortunately meant no wait however atmosphere was slightly compromised when in some of the smaller rooms rather than main dining area.

title: Great FUN with Friends!
review: Ate here with my wife, brother, and friend on a Saturday, at about 4PM. They recommend ordering a bunch of small plates and sharing them with the group. This was a great idea! The decor is great, staff friendly and attentive, and food is high quality. Total bill for 4 people, a few drinks per person, and more than enough to eat was $160. Keep in mind we had a few drinks! Considering they are continuously bringing out food, the staff does a great job of keeping the table clear. Atmosphere is trendy but not too 'hipster' or uncomfortable. Our server was great with recommendations and even served the one piece of shrimp on the tasters menu separate because of my allergy. Make a reervation as this place gets busy very fast.

title: Fun with Great Food
review: Very lively atmosphere, the staff makes you feel very welcome. Sangria wasn't anything special, but a great selection of wines. Overall very reasonably priced and just a fun time with good food. I HIGHLY recommend:- Octopus- Bacon wrapped datesOther great items that we had:- Padron peppers- Goat cheese with tomato- Bay Scallops- Patatas Bravas

title: Great date night spot
review: My husband and I recently dined here after the restaurant was recommended to me by many coworkers. We made a reservation and were seated right away (even 30 mins early). The atmosphere was fun and light and the service was phenomenal. Every time a plate was empty, someone was at our table to clear dirty dishes, refill water, etc...The food was delicious! We ordered Sangria, paella and about 5 small bites between the two of us. The beef empanadas, blue cheese sirloin and paella were my favorite. My husband and I kept commenting about what a fun restaurant this would be to bring our family to when they come to visit. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone I know!

title: Spicy Food
review: The Jumbo laya is spicy but good and the gumbo is excellent as well as  the desert is delicious and the place is beautiful and it is crowded

title: Awesome food and ambience. Slow service
review: One of the best tapas restaurants I have been to. Must try the goat cheese, chorizo and mushrooms. We always get the white wine sangria - goes so well with the food. Value for money too. The place is big and the ambience is very lively. The service is usually slow, but everything else makes up for it.

title: It's been a while.
review: The polar vortex, a restaurant being closed for a private party, were elements that steered us to Cafe-Ba-Ba-ReeBa. We hadn't been there in years. The food was good, but the service was dicey--and I am being kind. I still remember the clumsy waiter pouring wine from the miniature carafe. He held it at an angle that allowed the wine to curl back and form a nice pool on my table that then spilled on to my pants. He apologized and used my napkin to wipe most of it up. Apologized again and then left. We did not see him for over ten minutes. The table was empty next to us so I grabbed one of their napkins to wipe up the rest, but I was still without a napkin. This sort of late, nonchalant service continued throughout the meal.The food was good, but it will be a long time before we go back to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba, if ever.

title: Birthday Brunch with Family
review: My wife planned a surprise brunch with my siblings here for my 40th Birthday. Bloody Mary bar was fun because we were able to create our own concoction. Omitted the Vodka after the first one and used water for the remaining 3. We had a great time, food was tasty and service was very friendly. Will definitely return.

title: Awesome food
review: Visited this restaurant with daughter and daughter-in-law before a play. The food was unbelievable. Bacon wrapped figs was one of the highlights. We lingered over our dinner, enjoying our wine and savoring each of many delicious plates, all wonderful. Also loved the brussel sprouts with pine nuts. We sampled a few desserts, each exceptional. You can't go wrong with this restaurant and we cannot wait to return, next time, with the boys!

title: Great food, great time!
review: Great place for a long dinner with good friends! I haven't had a thing here that was not delicious. The service is great and the atmosphere is perfect. The only thing that can be annoying is sitting in the bar area when there are no tables available because they announce all the reservations over a loudspeaker in the bar area. We also went on NYE and they had the usual menu which was so perfect! We didn't have to pay extra or have a modified menu.

title: A taste of Spain in Chicago
review: We decided to make a return visit since our first a year ago. We were not disappointed. Our server, Daniel, made it a special occasion by not only recommending his favorite tapas but also perfectly pacing their arrival at our table. We had goat cheese, jamon iberico, grilled octopus and topped the meal with a shared pork paella. Definitely worth the trip. I have had tapas and paella in Barcelona and the ones served here can compete with any I have sampled there.

title: Lovely time once again
review: This was our second visit and we took the 14 year old... the picky 14 year old. The food was amazing as always, we like to pick 4-5 dishes and then 2-3 deserts... the caramelized banana was to die for... I am not even sure i remember the other two deserts that was so good... i did not share well with the other people at the table. Beef tenderloin with blue cheese was very tender and once he removed the blue cheese Mr. Picky liked that a lot. the chicken and sausage skewer was my husband's favorite. We did like the Sea Scallop dish they had prior more than the Bay Scallop dish but it was very good. First visit we did the Pintxos all 6 and that was a fun way to try new things. I have had all of their Sangrias and honestly we like the classic red the best.we will be back...

title: Always Great
review: This is my Spanish Tapas Stable. I think the portions for their tapas are actually quite large too, thus very affordable. Never had a bad time there. But note! It's ALWAYS packed.... so make a reservation if possible..... or, stop in early and plan on either having a drink at the bar for an hour- or go shopping.

title: Disappointed again
review: When we lived in Tennessee and visited Chicago occasionally on the way to see relatives, we often ate as a family at BabaReeba. It was one of our favorite places. I, years ago, took a group at a convention to eat there; it was terrific and since I was hosting, I was glad it was also not expensive. Family members had a rehearsal dinner there a few years ago; also great.But that last time we ate there it was terrible. I thought maybe it was an off night and so we headed there again over Thanksgiving week with visiting family. Tapas is a fun way for a group of 7 to dine and everyone was enthusiastic.Alas, disappointed again. Several of the dishes were tasty but as a whole, they tended to be heavily over salted and often overcooked. Just not good. The fried calamari in particular was virtually inedible. It was so covered in an oversalted spice mix that it ended up not even being totally finished by 7 people. There are better Tapas places in Chicago. This one seems to me to coasting on fumes and doesn't live up to my memory of its better days.

title: Everything Delicious
review: Man, this is one of my favorite tapa restaurants in the US.  The section, prices and service are great.  In Lincoln Park.

title: Excellent 1st intro to Tapas! Std has been set!
review: Happened to be in this area of Chicago visiting & decided to explore Tapas since they were new to us. Oh my! You must try the blackberry sangria, bacon wrapped dates & spicy potatoes! Extremely tasty & reasonable price too! We also had the #61 meat platter & it was our least favorite as just nice cold cuts on a platter. The waitress was friendly, knowledgeable & helpful without being pushy. She also spaced out the delivery of our Tapas so we didn't get everything at once & could better enjoy each plate. Like others commented the place was up tempo without being loud. We were casually dressed having just finished a run that morning and were treated well. We will definitely stop here again when in the area!

title: Favorite restaurant in the world!
review: I've been here 5 or so times and it is my favorite restaurant in the world. The atmosphere of the restaurant and interaction of ordering tapas throughout your meal is great to begin with, and the food is amazing. The best way to eat here is to share everything with the group of people you're with, then you get to try a little bit of everything and end up only eating what you want since you order 2/3 tapas at a time and keep ordering until you're full. Make sure to leave room for dessert though! I think if you order your own food it's a little expensive but if you do the group option it ends up being very reasonable, even if you order sangia (in pitchers to share.) I went with a group of girls recently and we all had everything we wanted to eat and 3/4 glasses of sangira each and we each paid under $30. Everyone I've taken here has loved it as well.

title: Wonderful Tapas!
review: Went here on my niece’s recommendation, who lives nearby. These were the best tapas I’ve ever had. Really! I will definitely go back here again next time I’m in Chicago. It’s a large, comfortable place, with great atmosphere. Chris, our waiter was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. I’ve had better sangria, but we managed to drink an entire pitcher, so it couldn’t have been that bad! Definitely worth a visit if you’re a tapas lover!

title: LOVE!!!
review: I have been here twice, and I have not been disappointed!! I wish I lived in Chicago so that I could come here more often. The sangria is delicious, especially the pear and peach flavors. I could eat the goat cheese with tomato sauce every day and be happy! The roasted dates with bacon are also amazing, and the beef tenderloin with blue cheese is a must! If you are looking for a fun place with a lot of assortment, and small shareable tapas this is the place!

title: Great tapas
review: Went with a party of 8 on a Sunday night. Place was busy but got a great table. Decor is rustic with exposed brick and old hardwood floors and big wood beams. The service was great right from the maitre de to the server to the bus boy. The food was excellent. Once again I didn't take any pictures. Their spicy potatoes with tomato aioli was great and seemed like everyone around us were ordering it. Their curried chicken salad, the octopus, the steak with blue cheese were all great. We also ordered a paella. We ordered four servings amongst the eight and still had some to take home. Overall a great dining experience.

title: Bustling, Noisy, Busy, and Fun
review: We gathered at Ba-Ba Reeba this month for a meet and greet the families affair. My daughter and her fiance' arranged for our respective families to gather and get introduced to one another for the first time. Ba Ba Reeba was just the right venue. The serve tapas and a multitude of Spanish specialties, each of which was served promptly with courteous service. Each sampling was very tasty and they provided everyone at the table with something to meet or exceed their culinary expectations. The bar provided excellent mixed drinks and festive pitchers of Sangria. I really like dirty martinis and they were mixed to perfection with a generous amount of spirits in each. It is the ideal place for a group outing or just for any couple looking for a fun and different experience. I did not see any small children, but this might just be the place to introduce them to a variety of different offerings to let them become familiar with foods that they might ordinarily be exposed to.

title: Fun Sunday Brunch
review: Lincoln Park is an up and coming neighborhood. Our family went to Cafe BaBa Reeba for Sunday brunch and it was a hoot. First of all it is much bigger than it looks from the outside. Once seated, our waiter was friendly and funny and willing to answer a series of questions even though it was crowded. He explained the differences between the tapas and brunch entrees and several anecdotes about each offering. He told us about the Blood Mary Bar and encouraged looking before ordering. It worked so that almost everyone in our party chose that option - it is like a salad bar for Bloody Mary's. The food was tasty and plentiful.But overall, the specialness of this restaurant is the energy and laid back, fun atmosphere.We are all definitely coming back here on our next trip to Chicago.

title: Tapas Galore!
review: We enjoyed an incredible meal at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. The Tapas seem to be unlimited and there is something for everyone. You name it and they have it! We enjoyed mutiple Tapas with our son and his fiance along with crafted coctails & sangria. Our server was very helpful in explaining each dish and was very attentive to our needs. Don't miss the potatoes...they are great! We enjoyed the "left overs" upon our arrival back home in Minnesota. We will definately dine here on every visit to Chicago!

title: We Love Paella
review: We had such wonderful service at Ba-Ba-Reeba. The food was great and the pricing was more than fair. Our server was attentive, helpful in getting questions answered, and very friendly. Lots of extra points for having a gluten-free menu for my wife to go off of. We will return here if we make it back to Chicago.

title: Good food
review: Went with a group of 4.  All happy.  One member of group actually is Spanish and he enjoyed the food.  Good service. Nice ambience.

title: Excellent tapas in Chi-Town!
review: I'll start off by saying that I've been here twice, but can only comment on one of my two visits. My first visit was in April 2011 for my own bachelorette party, organized by my very well-meaning sister-in-law and my best friend. Unfortunately, the dinner part of the evening was planned for quite late at night, and after a long day of activities I ended up not eating, to say the least. So, my review focuses only on my second trip to Cafe Ba Ba Reeba, which was substantially different than my first. I went here for a friend's 30th birthday party, so the menu was pre-determined. Nonetheless, I could not have picked a better selection of tapas to sample: meats (cold cuts and warm selections), cheeses, seafoods, bacon-wrapped figs, potatoes, salads, mini desserts, etc. It was all so GOOD! My husband and I really loved it. I love tapas, but I find that many (if not most) tapas restaurants fall short of knocking me off my feet. Not so with Cafe Ba Ba Reeba. I'm not sure if we were just particularly hungry or what, but my husband and I both left agreeing that it was a fabulous-tasting meal and some of the best tapas we've had. It's hard to pick a favorite dish, but I think my favorite was the diced potatoes with aioli sauce. Sangria was also yummy and fruit-filled.I should also add that it's good for groups. The birthday party we were at was fairly substantial in size and they were able to accomodate us pretty well. I belive it was in the same private room as my bachelorette party, but my memory of that is a little fuzzy :)Go here for delicious tapas when in Chicago! Truly some of the better tapas I've had.

title: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba RULES AGAIN!
review: Late Sunday morning in Chicago and wondering where to have brunch? Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is the place to go. We sat in the bar to watch part of the Bear's game and created beautiful Bloody Mary's at the Bloody Mary Bar. Plenty of shrimp and horseradish make them special. The tapas were great as usual. My favorites were the bacon wrapped dates and the stuffed mushrooms. Don't miss the salmon or the calamari. They are also wonderful.No matter how many times we come, we are always glad we did.

title: Insert witty title here
review: I'm not sure what to say really. I liked the place but I went on Jan. 1st and they offered a deal for anyone who came in their pajamas. It was so crowded and the service wasn't all that great. The food was good but be prepared, the portions are very small for the price. Over all it wasn't a terrible experience and I did receive a 10 dollar gift card that expires in October. I will be making the trip back and hopefully this time around it will be much better.

title: Nasty
review: With all the good Spanish places in the city, I don't understand how this one is still in business. Seriously, I'm probably too used to good restaurants, but this one is disgusting. And I don't think it's a matter of taste, we all have different taste, it's a matter of quality! More or less all Spanish restaurants offer the same things and i have been to quite a few to be able to compare and tell the difference. I went there for the second time, first time I didn't like it, but I was willing to give it another chance. Done, they won't see me and my friends anymore.

title: Baffled by negative reviews
review: No idea why so many people are disappointed. The several times I've been to Cafe Ba-ba-reeba, the dishes were incredibly delicious and worth every dollar. Wonderful, sweet sangria and a great variety of tapas flavors, goat cheese and tomato being the highlight! And of course, the service can't be lightning fast - it takes decent time to prepare all the dishes, so I can't really complain. I'm not sure why people didn't like the noisiness inside, I wasn't disturbed at all by any neighbors. A definite favorite in Chicago!

title: disappointed at a recent visit
review: Café Babareeba is an old stand by for us. We go there every 3-6 months. It's amazing because regardless of the day of the week it's always busy, but you can usually find a table in the bar. Everything was at its usual standard until we hit the octopus. It had the weird aftertaste of spoiled seafood with the vinegary ammonia taste. It was a taste that was hard to get out of your mouth. They need to check the freshness of their seafood better if they're going to keep it around. Luckily we didn't get sick, but it'll be a while before we go back again. Too bad. They've always been so good

title: Wonderful dinner
review: This was the first time I had been to Café Ba Ba Reeba, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was great. Our waitress Lauren was great, she was super friendly and helpful in explaining how to order and making menu selections. We sampled the pintxos, four different tapas and three different desserts. Make sure to make a reservation to eat here or you may have to wait. I would come back again.

title: Cafe Ba Ba Reeba
review: The only authentic tapas I've found in the Chicago area. If you concentrate on tapas for dinner, an order of 6 plates is sufficient for 2. They offer different types of paella, but I've never had it, since I'm used to all of these ingredients mixed together in Spain. A good wine list. Service is always good. Consistent since they opened.

title: Wonderful!
review: What an amazing tapas cafe! Our waiter Johnny was so friendly and helpful with making our menu selections. We sampled eight different menu items, and every one of them was delightful. We were wishing we weren't so full so that we could sample more delicious food.

title: More for the atmosphere than the food.
review: Nice place to meet friends; good selection of drinks and tapas. Tapas were average.  Good flavors but nothing exciting.  Emilios tapas on Ohio was much better for the food.

title: Got Better (And It Was Already Very Good)
review: Returned for first time in a couple of years. Ba-ba-reba still has "it".Started with the pinxtos sampler. Most of the six items were very pleasing. On to the octopus, fried peppers, patatas bravas, chicken empanadas. Octopus may have been the best we had on our Chicago adventure. The patatas were wonderfully fried and spiced. Empanada was as remembered; very good. And the padron peppers were flavorful and salty.Add to this a half pitcher of fruity mango sangria and the usual very good crusty bread and a good time was had by both!Better than we remembered from our last trip. Will be back again in the not too distant future.

title: Great Tapas Getting Even Better
review: This is the 2 nd time I've reviewed Cafe Babareeba. I have always loved this restaurant. This time was the BEST!We tried a couple of new dishes this time.....the grilled octopus with potatoes and olives and fried pedrone peppers. Both were excellent. The peppers look like jalapeños but aren't hot. Very good.The octopus was even better than octopus at our favorite Greek restaurant. We also shared our faves from the past: patatas bravas (yum) and chicken empanadas.Our waiter was helpful, friendly and very un snobby.

title: Best Tapas outside of Spain
review: Let me mention if you are an out of towner, going with Lettuce Entertain you group is a safe bet! Cafe Babareeba is a big place, and it should be pretty easy to get a reservation. The tapas here are amazing! Good value for what you get and each tapa is pretty good. I like that this place was affordable and good. In Spain tapas costs 1-3 euros, its alittle more here but in comparison to other places. GREAT VALUE!

title: Hip, Noisy, Expensive, Food so-so
review: Popular, with a delicious (perhaps too ambitious) tapas menu, in a great neighborhood, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! was an expensive disappointment. We ordered (way overdone) bacon-wrapped dates, portions of seafood paella for three at $13/pp, which included two-three shrimp somewhere in the 10 forkfuls of oily rice and bits of other seafood (?), and a pretty much bland tapas sampler plates (goat cheese croqueta was the star), along with three kinds of sangria (stick with peach). The fried calamari was okay, as was the beef empanada, but again, both were just....bland. Lots of "complimentary" bread and olive oil helped filled the hunger gaps. Not the place for a romantic evening or good conversation, as sound seems to bounce off every surface. Service was provided by a half dozen or so people, with our primary server hovering, as if we needed to hurry up and order instead of taking our time to peruse the menu and enjoy our sangria cocktails. One tapas plate removed before we'd finished what was on it, too noisy to get his attention to get it returned.We really wanted to like this place more than we did, a "never again" in our book.

title: Yum! Tapas & delectable Sangria!
review: My husband and I had a early reservation for dinner on Saturday. The patio area was louder and happening but we opted for a quieter table inside; by the time we left, even that room was quite boisterous. We ordered about 2 "small bites" a bread topping and about 4-5 tapas. I had 2 glasses of sangria - white peach & blackberry. The blackberry was so great my husband ordered a glass for himself instead of another beer. Then the tapas -- th favorite date wrapped in bacon was not to my liking, but the goat cheese croquette was delicious!! The bread spread was good. But the main tapas - we enjoyed the patatas bravas (delicious aioli!), yummy mushroom caps, and a perfectly cooked tenderloin with blue cheese. We were going to skip dessert but our server enticed us with the fact that they were small bites, similar to the tapas. The butterscotch cream was to die for!!! We could eat a vat of that stuff! The apple empanada was also good but was overshadowed by the butterscotch cream. Will definitely come again...

title: Some good tapas, but sauces are overdone
review: This is a very attractive restaurant with a wonderful partly-enclosed patio. The tapas menu is extensive and many of the tapas started out as good but (to my taste) were spoiled by the addition of heavy, overly-flavored sauces. When the basic ingredients are good and the preparation is excellent, tapas don't need heavy sauces!

title: Best tapas in Chicago
review: Paella, tortilla Espanola, Patatas Bravas, Baked Goat cheese with garlic bread, garlic potato salad. red sangria great staff and management. What a great place outdoor patio too!

title: Some plates a homerun, others just OK
review: My friend and I went to this restaurant based on Tripadvisor and a Chicago native's recommendation. Some of the tapas were amazing. I highly recommend the pintxo's listed at the top of the menu. It was a nice way to start the dinner, and it was enough for my friend and I to split each one. The only disappointment was the bacon on the bacon wrapped shrimp was not crispy enough. The fried calamari from the seafood section of the menu was also amazing as was the Spanish ham plate.Just OK: the manchego and spinach stuffed mushrooms, asparagus with manchego cheese, rioja-braised short ribs (ribs were very tender, sauce was bland, mashed potatoes tasted like they were from a package), meatballs with tomato sherry sauce, chicken and ham croquetas (way too much cheese, not enough ham, looked like a mozzarella stick).Our waitress was very nice and helpful. The atmosphere was great- there was a live band halfway through the night. This restaurant needs more of their plates to be consistently amazing. I would actually give this restaurant 3 1/2 stars.

title: Fantastic tapas
review: This was our family's first time at a tapas restaurant and we really enjoyed. Our kids 14 , 12 and 9 loved it. Sangria was great. Service was great. Atmosphere was perfect. Nothing fancy just a comfortable laid back feel We tried about 10 items and I have to say each one was very tasty This is the kind of place that I would go to every time I returned to Chicago. Highly recommend

title: Outstanding!
review: One of the best meals I have ever had.  Surprising new and delicious foods, makes it hard to choose. The endless homemade bread is terrific.  The waitstaff is great, very attentive and friendly.  Very big place with great decor.

title: One of our favs.
review: We've been here several times and on an average, the food has always been great! Once or twice, I wish that the service was better but food makes up for everything. So right from when you walk in, to the time you walk out, the place is awesome! Yes, from the beginning of the meal to the end it's always an outstanding experience. The ambiance here is warm and cozy.The food is delicious, creative and plentiful. They have the best tapas. And not to forget, great sangrias. Every dish is nicely presented and is worth every penny. We highly recommend this.Note - Please don't forget to make reservations.

title: Great Tapas!!
review: This is a must for us everytime we come to the city. This place has the best Sangrias and Tapas that I have ever had. This last time we were here we also had small children with us and theree were many things for them to choose from and well accommodated. The menu is very broad with so many different things to pick from and great daily specials. Associates do a great job of explaining menu items and also elaborating on daily specials. Outside dining area is very nice also. This is a dining an experience and I highly recommend!!

title: Always outstanding
review: I have never been disappointed here. Food is consistently good. It's a Spanish tapas restaurant, so we started off by ordering quite a few tapas to start. I should ,emotion they are a very gluten friendly restaurant, they take it seriously even provide gluten free bread for dipping. I will highlight what we ordered and loved, beef tenderloin and blue cheese,, melts in your mouth. Shrimp with garlic, ordered two of theses. Spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, to die for. Roasted dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette, it's a party in your mouth it's so good. We were five people and based on what we ordered to start waiter suggested only ordering the paella for two people, it was outstanding we ordered the chicken and vegetables. They bring it to you in the paella pan and plate it for you, very nice. Service excellent and decor authentic. It's located in Lincoln Park and worth the short taxi ride if you are staying at hotel in the city. Oh must mention the most fabulous sangria, many flavours, we ordered pitcher of passion fruit.

title: Grad party
review: at my daughter's request we had a graduation party here on Saturday night with friends and family. sampled about a dozen different things and the red sangria. food was very good. RESERVATIONS ARE A MUST. The place was packed early on Saturday night. Casual atmosphere. WILL GO BACK next time in Chicago

title: Great tapas brunch and sangria
review: Came here for brunch with some girl friends and we had a great time! We ordered many different types of breakfast dishes and split them. You HAVE to try the sangria and I highly recommend the waffle batter chicken stick (basically, its a corn dog for adults). Atmosphere was nice, seating was comfortable, wait staff was friendly and helpful, prices were pretty reasonable (3 women ate a decent amount of food and a sangria for $15 a person). Will be going back for sure.

title: Off the beaten path. Great find: delicious food and fun, casual atmosphere.
review: 5 of us went here for a casual business dinner. The atmosphere is tightly spaced tables and noise from everyone talking, enjoying great food and one another. It's a fun, relaxed atmosphere. Our waiter provided excellent suggestions for tapas to try and share and the food was really delicious. We happened to dine on the 1/2 price wine night (Tuesday) and he recommended an excellent red that really made the meal.We ended up at Cafe Ba Ba because one of the 5 of us knew of it from when he had lived in Chicago - ten years before - and there were several conferences (incl. ours) in downtown Chicago so all the "typical" business restaurants were full. It was a great choice and the fact that the restaurant is still in business, and BUSY, 10 years later is indicative of what a great choice it is. With tax, pre-tip, the bill was $215 for 5. This included a bottle of wine, 6-8 pints of beer and more than enough food.If you want a really formal, totally expensive meal, choose an appropriate downtown/loop restaurant. If you want a great find, off the beaten path go to Cafe Ba-Ba in Lincoln Park area.

title: Still our standing favorite in Chicago
review: Time after time they have never let us down, and believe me they have a high bar to mount up to. Service was excellent as always, the potato salad was as creamy as I remembered it. The octopus was perfectly cooked, and the goat cheese as rich and savor as anything you have ever eaten. Its truly one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at and it proves itself time and time again why. Always a great crowd, people in love, falling in love and huge families always enjoying themselves. I could go on, but you need to try it for yourself.

title: Tapa's and more...
review: One of Chicago's best restaurants. The white Sangria is devine. Tapa's are a delight with everyone sharing a taste. Staff is wonderful. Be sure to make a reservation Thursday thru Saturday.

title: Learn how to handle advanced reservations!
review: I have dined in this establishment before, so I knew the chances of it being busy on a Friday night, but this was bad even for them. As always, the food is very tasty and the Sangrea pitchers great! The issue here is service. I made 7:30 reservations on 5/24 via opentable.com. When we arrived, we were told that it would be about 5 additional minutes before our name would be called and we would be seated. We were not seated until after 8PM. The host stand was announcing parties to be seated overt their PA system. The odd thing was that there were many more parties being seated without being called. (Friends of the staff perhaps?) At 8, I returned to the host stand to enquire as to what the delay was. Within minutes later, our party was called.About 10 minutes after we were seated, a manager arrived at our table to apologize for the delay in seating. While that was a nice small gesture, a nicer thing would have have been to comp one of our small plates or something to that extent. Given the volume of business, I am not suprised that service recovery is not practiced in this establishment, as there was no shortage of sales...so why bother? The food is always great there, but be prepared to wait another half hour even when making reservations. I am sure I will be back, but I will be going out of my way to dine there.

title: great date spot
review: Babareeba has it all. A fun atmosphere, a covered patio, chefs to watch, a fun bar and great food. The only slight negatives were the Sangria I'd had better actually despite other positive reviews. The dates wrapped in ham are out of this world and the goat cheese with tomato sauce and bread is to die for. Service was solid, not overbearing, and I felt it was good value. You can spend a lot or keep it reasonable depending. We thought it was between 4 and 5 starts but rounded up for the dates. Oh, the Iberico ham is amazing too if you're a serious pork aficionado.

title: Boyfriends bday
review: The food was SO good! They bring out the plates just in time so web you finish one another is right behind it. The classic sangria was also very tasty! My favorite was the bacon wrapped dates and steaks with blue cheese! Make reservations ahead of time bc it was packed. Even with the reservations we waited about 10 minutes but still better than nothing. I'd go back again soon! And they're part of lettuce entertain you so I was able to use an old gift card that was just taking up space in my wallet.

title: Went for anniversary.
review: Poor service,  tasteless, tepid paella that seemed to be sitting around a while,  too loud to hear normal conversation. And I love Spanish food.

title: Don't miss this place
review: What a fun spot!  Strolling musicians, friendly and knowledgeable service, and excellent tapas and paella.  Our favorite.

title: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba
review: This is my barometer for real tapas,after living in Spain.  Any other place is judged by this. Their menu changes occasionally. They have a monthly flamenco show and a paella cooking demonstration. Prices are reasonable.I have gone here sine they first opened. years ago.

title: Its All Good, Everytime
review: Menu items have been freshened up and the food is hot and flavorful. Easy on the wallet. Drinks are mighty fine. i love going there in the summertime with my galpals.

title: Great place to dine with friends
review: Saturday night after a visit to Second City can be busy at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. When we arrived at about 6:30 without reservations, we were told there was a 2 hr wait. If you find yourself in the same situation, here's a little known fact, just head for the bar area. You can sit at the bar or better yet find a table in the bar area and get full service, first come first serve. That's what we did and were very lucky to find a table right away for the four of us. Don't pass up the sangria. A pitcher of red was perfect for the four of us. We came for the tapas and each chose two to share with the help of our waitress. The ones printed in red on the menu are their specialties. That was perfect for our evening meal. Go to Ba-Ba-Reeba with friends and have a great time!!

title: Tapas, tapas.......terrific tapas
review: awesome atmosphere, casual and chic. super menu, delicious sangria. A favorite of locals, great value. super  memory of this long time Lincoln park institution

title: A New Favorite
review: I make 3 to 4 business trips to Chicago per year and I like to sample the different restaurants in the city. One restaurant that was always on my "go to" list was Cafe Ba-Ba-Reba but, somehow, we always ended up going somewhere else. On the most recent trip to Chicago we finally made it to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reba. I have been to other Spanish tapas restaurants in the Chicago area, but this one is now my new favorite! I went in a group of 5 and everything on the menu looked so good that we were concerned about ordering too many plates. I said something to the waitress about too much food and she said she would help us judge. She did a great job, recommending selections and how much paella to order for our group. I think the consensus of our group was that the grilled scallops and the grilled calamari were our favorites, but everything was wonderful. I described the dinner as one new flavor sensation after another. Prices were very reasonable, service was excellent and the food was scrumptious. My only complaint is that the restaurant is a little far from the loop, but I will put up with a little longer cab ride to go back to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reba on a future trip to Chicago.

title: Spanish Food Done Right!!
review: I really love this place and I honestly never get tired of going. I've take a lot of out of town friends and family here and they love. You may want to make a reservation due to the fact that this place is pretty popular and the wait time for a table can get a little annoying. They have awesome Sangria and really great food. Great outdoor seating that nice in the summer.

title: A Chicago staple for good times, food and drinks with friends
review: Tapas is a great concept and they've been doing them here for over two decades. Goat cheese is brilliant, as are most all the dishes if you like the basic ingredients of them (heck, even if oyu aren't sure and you just know you like robust, flavorful food in manageable portions, you can order many, many dishes and share/get a taste of what you love and some new items). Yes, the sangria is good... just don't have TOO MUCH, or you may regret it the next day, especially if you are going out after dinner :)

title: Average tapas
review: We went for lunch on Sunday. They have a brunch menu and limited tapas menu. We tried several items. My sister enjoyed the gazpacho special. The lamb kava s were chewy but flavorful. The stuff mushroom filling was good but the mushrooms tasted like they weren't fresh and had a fishy flavor. The tenderloin with blue cheese was the best tapas. The croquet s were okay and the chicken empanadas were very good. Server neglected us and had to be hunted down for drink refills and the check. The restaurant was bust tho not full. I would not go back.

title: Fun and Authentic
review: As someone who lived in Spain for several years, the food is very authentic and terrific. The sangria is good, but not outstanding (needs some brandy and more juice), but the tapas are terrific. The spicy shrimp, croquettas, etc. all yummy. Besides, it sits in the middle of a great shopping area, so do some shopping and then take a break with some tapas!

title: Our favorite restaurant
review: Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba is our favorite restaurant.  The food and sangria is amazing!!  The atmosphere is great and so is the staff.  I can't say enough great things about this restaurant, it is a must go!!

title: Exceeded my expectations!
review: I am always reluctant to go to any restaurant that features Spanish tapas. My mother is from Madrid and I have been lucky enough to enjoy many tapas in Spain. Seeing large Serrano hams hanging from the ceiling as we walked in made me feel optimistic. Having heard it was a busy place we made reservations and were seated within a few minutes after our arrival. The tapas were authentic and delicious as was the paella (something I am also wary of ordering when out). The service was excellent and we didn't feel rushed. The bottle of Ribera del Duero wine we ordered was very tasty too. Lovely evening. Definitely returning next time we're in town!

title: Fantastic tapas and excellent service
review: Very busy place: best Tapas I have had outside of Barcelona, had a fantastic evening. We had a wonderful evening.

title: Great GF Spanish Tapas
review: Loved everything. Many Tapas to choose from, potatoes aioli, vegetable and seafood options, and desserts. Wonderful Sangria, and a great atmosphere.

title: Impressive but wait is too long...
review: Tapas were the best I have had outside Spain. They were a little under par for true Spanish tapas- the difference is in the actual ingredients. You can can not get the nuances of the local ingredients approximately 8,000 miles away. Wished could find a place of equal in NY. The service was good-- actually extraordinary. The cafe is like a machine. We had a seating at 830pm. Ate and drank to about 10:15 still about 20 minute wait. Place was packed. If you were watching Barca match I am sure this place is crazy. Would like to experience that. Reminds me of La Flauta in Barcelona.Only downside is the wait. I can tell you wait was over the top. When we arrived... we were told a 2. 5 hour wait. I said put our name on and then if we stay in the area will go back. I am happy that we stayed. We went to have drinks at this nice place on the corner while we waited. Unfortunately I can not remember the name but it had a Schlitz sign out in front of it and was on corner of Halstead and W.Armitage. .

title: Good Spanish ham...
review: The Spanish ham is wonderful, but very expensive. The other tapas we ordered were not very Spanish, though the quality of the food was good and reasonably priced. I would not return if I were looking to eat Spanish food.

title: Tapas doesn't get any better!
review: The atmosphere, amazing. The food, amazing. The sangria, amazing! There isn't one bad thing I can say about This place except make a reservation if you're planning on going here for dinner on the weekend. I have been here multiple times and never disappointed! The white peach sangria can't be beat! Cheers!

title: Delicious tapas and fun environment!
review: I visited this restaurant with my friends for dinner and had a great time. The bacon wrapped dates are fantastic! I would also recommend the sangria (made fresh there!). It can be busy for a larger party, so make sure to make a reservation ahead of time. The only drawback was that it was a little loud, so it made it more challenging to hear someone a couple seats away, but that is pretty common at every restaurant. It was also a great value, a group of 7 of us went and we only paid $20-25 each for tons of food and pitchers of sangria for everyone. I love this place!

title: Good tapas & sangria... Experience is not the best.
review: This is a good place for friends, families, and couples. The food is pretty good. The sangria is pretty good - it's not too sweet (I do not like sweet sangria). There was a sewer smell that wafted up every 15 minutes or so the last time we had dinner... this really spoiled the experience. And my husband was served a drink in a cracked glass. I hate the chairs, they are very uncomfortable!!! We have been here a few times and there is always something off about the experience. We are always sat in the 'outdoor' covered area... perhaps the other side is more comfortable...

title: I Love This Place
review: The service is awesome the food is out of this world and you get to have so many different things and you are so full.  I will go here may more times

title: EXCELLENT!!
review: Fun, delicious, good service, good variety, amazing atmosphere. Everything you can ask for a date or having a good time with friends. Super recommended

title: Crowded and noisy, but surprising.
review: This place is filled with teenagers on dates, so you can't get in on a Friday or Saturday night. But the food (tapas) is surprisingly good and interesting, and the wine list -- not used by the crowd, which mostly drinks horrid Sangria or beer -- has some real Spanish gems on it.

title: Delicious and Reasonably Priced
review: My boyfriend and I ate at Ba-Ba-Reeba after having a disappointing experience at another tapas restaurant where the food was bland and way overpriced. He had been to CBBR before, so I agreed to go on his word that it was good.It did not disappoint. We shared 4 or 5 small plates and got Diet Cokes all for around $40. The food itself was also delicious. The patatas bravas with the tomato aioli dipping sauce are a can't miss. We liked them so much we tried to recreate the recipe at home.They do get very busy though, so I would recommend a reservation, especially on the weekend. It's also pretty loud in there, so just be aware of that. The only real negative thing I could say s that our original waiter was great, but his shift ended toward the beginning of our meal, and the one who came on wasn't as attentive.

title: ok and yeah just ok
review: food was good, but not great.  atmosphere was bland.  service was good and that was a nice surprise.  just not a "gotta go here" type place.

title: Best tapas in town
review: Make reservations or you will wait forever. Great food and a huge menu. Definitely a place to go when in Chicago.

title: Get there early
review: Luckily for us, we got there a little after 5 on a Saturday evening. The hostess made a point of saying immediate seating was available, even though we hadn't asked about a wait. Clearly, they were already in a "busy night" mindset. It wasn't long before the place was packed, and people were waiting in the entry corridor.The good:Everything was perfectly prepared. The jamon iberica, though eye-poppingly expensive, was exquisite. The shrimp, cheese plate, albondigas, patatas bravas, all magnificent. The sangria was an absolute delight. The service was warm and friendly. The busing staff was prompt and attentive about removing used plates from our table. In a tapas restaurant, that's important. The noise level in this busy restaurant was acceptable, at least where we sat.The bad:(1) Parking. It's on the street, and a very busy street at that. We got lucky. Someone was pulling out as we arrived, and we were able to avoid the pricey parking meters. (2) The place is a bit cramped. I was very conscious of foot traffic around me. It appears they've undergone at least a couple of expansions over the years, but they're due for another. (3) I don't know what happened, but one of our orders was delayed mightily. We were finished with everything else before the waiter noticed that it had not arrived. It didn't ruin our night (or the waiter's gratuity), but I was a bit surprised that we weren't offered some sort of goodwill make-good gesture at such a reputable establishment.If you enjoy tapas restaurants, this is a great spot with great food. It just needs a bit more elbow room.

title: New Year's Pajama Brunch
review: My friends and I have been visiting Ba-Ba-Reeba on New Year's Day in our pajamas to celebrate the new year. Roll out of bed in your favorite jammies and robe, and head out to Ba-Ba-Reeba. If you dine-in with your pajamas, you will receive a Ba-Ba-Reeba! gift certificate equal to the price of the meal (minus tax and gratuity), for a future visit. Oh and don't forget the bloody mary bar! I love eggs so the small plates of heavenly brunch items are awesome. Come in a group in your pajamas and have fun!

title: Dissappointing Experience at Cafe Bad Bad Rebad
review: I've been a couple of times as I live in the hood and never super impressed. I recently dropped in to get some gift certificates with my little son and decided to have a snack. First, I want to say that we went really early, before 5, so the place was really empty except a few tables here and there and the place is really big with multiple rooms. So what do they do? Sit me right next to a large loud party of 10 or so, right next to the bus boy station with clanking ice and forks dropping. I was like, "oh please, this place is empty, why are you placing me here? cmon"...and they immediatley moved me to an acceptable spot but how annoying. I would love to hear why they thought that was a good idea. Anyway, then I order a "trio" of dips...it would be perfect for my son to dip. He likes that. So three jars on a plate came with toast. It was pretty evident this was bought from European Imports. They opened the three jars, put them on a plate, toasted some bread, and brought it out. I even told the waiter what it was and he denied it but it was pretty obvious. Then I ordered lamb skewers which were good but a small portion for $11. Then I ordered octopus with potatoes which was also good, but more potatoes than Octopus. Anyway, there are many tapas places in the city, and I would certainly choose another one over this place going forward.

title: The Best Tapas & Sangaria !
review: I totally love everything about Cafe Ba Ba Reeba they have the best tapas, Sangria, ambiance, and decor ever. It's a great date spot but it's also the best get together with friends and order everything spot. If you have never ever been go at least once and I promise you will go back again and again:) MMM SO gOOD

title: Excellent real tapas
review: Great service, reasonalble prices ,great wine. Loved the sweet potatoe dishes. Also dates wrapped with bacon

title: Decent Place for Tapas
review: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a festive and energetic venue to have a date night or share tapas among friends. The other night a group of ten of us got together to celebrate successfully completing marathons; while OK eight of us completed marathons - one in the group had a good excuse (she was eight and three quarter months pregnant) and one not so good (I am too lazy to train for a marathon, so settled for a half). Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba features a vast array of tapas and breaks them into categories including pintxos (bite sized tapas, kind of like a Spanish amuse bouche but harder to pronounce), vegetarian/cheese, seafood, beef/lamb, and chicken/pork. There are also a few nice paellas to choose from and housemade breads with dips (there is also complimentary basic bread service with olive oil) and of course desserts (there are full sized desserts of dessert pintxos). Sangria is quite popular here (available by the pitcher, half pitcher or glass and in traditional or flavored - there is even a Cava based Sangria); for those not fans of Sangria there is a decent list of reasonably priced Spanish wines (running as low as $28 per bottle and many selections under $50) as well as beer (including some on tap) and cocktails. Adding value there are often freebies you can redeem if you check in via Foursquare or Yelp.As we are distance runners, we tend to have hearty appetites and this enabled us to order a huge variety of tapas (we must have consumed nearly half the menu)! Nearly everything we tried was good, but I would not say there was a single must have dish and the menu did not seem to have changed much since I was last here a couple of years ago. Since my fine dining kick I have been on for the past year and a half I am always nervous returning to venues I used to love before becoming spoiled by Chicago's top tier restaurants, but Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba did not disappoint. For $40 a person (including tax, tip and moderate alcohol) we were able to eat like kings. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is open nightly for dinner and also has Friday lunch and weekend brunch. They post special events on their website such as a Flamenco Dinner Show with music and dancing and Paella Cooking Demos. The atmosphere is lively and casual and the decor is made to transport you to Spain without being tacky or overdone. Service is reasonably attentive and adequate. Ba-Ba-Reeba is a popular venue so it can be a bit noisy and reservations are recommended (they are on Open Table). There is a large bar where you can enjoy a glass of Sangria as you wait for your party to arrive, but I did appreciate that they sat us before our entire party arrived. The menu has a nice variety of food to choose from (even the vegetarians in our group found plenty to keep them happy) and while the food is certainly not outstanding, for the money it is a good choice if you are in the mood for Spanish tapas.

title: Very impressed and great place to head before a night out!
review: I went here on a first date and didn't quite know what to expect as she picked the restaurant. The atmosphere had a great vibe to it and the wait staff was very friendly! Helped calm the nerves for sure. Tapas is great for enjoying delicious morsels of food and not feeling super heavy afterwards especially if you're going out after. The spicy potatoes to this day were some of the best I've had and my next trip to Chicago definitely will have to make a stop here.

title: Best Tapas outside of Espana!
review: My title says it all.  Best tapas! No doubt about it!  Not only that I love coming here for Barca games! They also host Flamenco shows once a month.

title: Tapas, Tapas, Tapas
review: Had the opportunity to go to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba last night with 3 other people. The menu is absolutely perfect, as there are enough selections without being overwhelming which is a common problem when you go to tapas restaurants.We had a nice sampling during our two hour dinner. I definitely recommend the scallops, the braised short rib, and the filet medallions. Outstanding!! The potatoes with the spicy sauce are also absolutely amazing...how they make simple potatoes taste so good...I don't know.For dessert, I had the butterscotch custard, again, absolutely delicious. My colleagues had the bananas and ice cream which they devoured.I'll definitely be going back next time I'm in town.

title: You must eat here... if you like tapas
review: Best tapas ever, lots of choices, perfectly cooked. Wait staff very knowledgeable. Quick service at a reasonable price. Get there early (6PM) or be prepared to wait.

title: Well Done!
review: Wonderful place! I could not get reservations for a weekend night so I made them for brunch We go to order off brunch menu and tapas menu. The baked goat cheese and the chicken on a stick were amazing. Ever dish we ordered was divine and the servers were very friendly and accommodating. The place is big and atmosphere was nice, although there were quite a few children in the restaurant.
