This was one of my top 5 tapas places I ever ate(including ones in Barcelona) you must give it a try.

title: Yummy tapas and excellent service
review: I called and made a reservation for a Sunday night at 7PM. The girl on the phone was very pleasant. When we walked in at 7, we were immediately sat. We were sat all the way in the back by the bathrooms. The downside of that was that we were near the bathrooms, on the other hand, we were in a corner so it was nice to not be surrounded by people since we were on a date. Our server, Daniel, was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the menu and specials. He recommended 2-3 tapas per person. We ordered 6 total and it was perfect! The tapas portion (not sure if they always offer this or if it was just because it was the Paella festival) of the paella was awesome and the perfect size. The patatas bravas were also really great. The meatballs were okay, but they weren't anything special. The white peach sangria was delicious. It came out to $57 total. I would definitely recommend this restaurant! When we were walking out, a staff member asked if we needed a taxi, and got us one immediately. Excellent service all around!

title: Surprisingly good for a weekend hot spot
review: Thought the busy, young crowds would mean the scene rated higher than the food. Much to my surprise, the food was well prepared and quite enjoyable. Some dishes almost approached authentic Spanish cuisine. Portions were fair, prices reasonable and Sangria was tasty. Would definitely recommend and return.

title: Good tapas
review: This is a very popular spanish tapas place on Halstead in Lincoln Park. We were there for lunch. It has a fun vibe and the food was tasty but all those small plates get pricey with a group of people. Great sangria!

title: Great food and drinks
review: I highly recommend going in a group of 4 or more. Between the four of us, we ordered about 10 dishes and a pitcher of sangria. The food and sangria were excellent

title: True authentic Tapas in the heart of Chicago
review: Great sangrias!  excellent tapas, true spanish style, from beginning to end.  Excellent choice, right in the heart of Lincoln park.

title: Wonderful Dining Experience
review: We decided to eat here before attending the Million Dollar Quartet and had a wonderful time. The atmosphere, service and most importantly the food were all fabulous. Our waitress was very friendly, attentive as well as helpful (this was our first tapas experience). At her suggestion, we shared five tapas between the two of us which was just the right amount of food. All of our dishes were delicious. We'll definately come here again the next time we're in Chicago. I'd highly suggest getting a reservation. They were booked solid when we were there on a Saturday night.

title: fun, intimate, great scenery
review: Great place to order small dishes and get a taste of everything. Good cocktails and great sangria. Love the ham and sausage!

title: Wonderful in every way.
review: We had heard good things about this place prior to visiting, but even the glowing reviews couldn't do justice. We simply had a wonderful morning here... Great food, an entertaining and knowledgable waiter, and great atmosphere. Everything that makes a dining experience great. The make your own Bloody Mary bar was truly exceptional, and the vast array of tapas was overwhelming in the best possible sense. Everything we had was fresh and delicious. If we hadn't been so full, we would have been tempted to order some of the other wonderful dishes we saw at neighboring tables. I guess we'll just have to pay another visit.

title: Excellent Service
review: I had dinner here this past Saturday. It was very busy, but the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The food was excellent as well. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone! Great place, great atmosphere, great wine!

title: THE BEST SPANISH TAPAS
review: Great food, great prices, great staff!! Deff a must go to! I go every time i visit Chicago and it is always consistant.

title: Eyes Bigger Than Stomach
review: Ba Ba Reeba, what a great place for food. Relaxed, casual atmosphere, easy to get to by cab and cabs running by all night so home to hotel afterward is easy. Tapas, paella, whatever, was excellent. The choices were bountiful and the food beyond expectations. I will return and reccommend wholeheartedly

title: Good for groups
review: Pros- good for groups- great sangria- tasty food- good vibe- nice decor- helpful staffCons- tapas aren't big enough to share with more than 2 or 3 peopleIt's the perfect place for a dinner group. Each 2 or 3 people picked and shared some tapas. We had - mushrooms with machego ***Melted cheese on top of the mushrooms. It wasn't my fav.- lamb kebab with mint *****It comes with a delicious tomato sauce. It's really delicious.- octopus with olives and small potatoes *****It was terrific! The octopus was tasty and tender.- grilled squid ****I enjoyed it but I liked the octopus better. - roasted dates with bacon and apple *****The mix of flavors was amazing!

title: Never dissappionted on any visit
review: When visiting my family in Chicago always pop in to this delightful resturant . Food is very good and no matter what day of the week you visit it is always busy. You can have different types of Sangria they usually offer you the choice. Great way to eat and share if you are with friends, you won't be dissappionted it's on a good bus route as well so if staying in the city you can get a cab or hop on the bus.......

title: Great Atmosphere, Great Food!
review: This is one of my all time favorite restaurants. I used to live right down the street and I went several times a month. It's a very fun, vibrant atmosphere that's great for dinner with friends or for a date. The Spanish style tapas are all amazing and the sangria is pretty good too, though not the best I've ever had. I've honestly never tried a dish here that I didn't like, but some of my favorites are the endive salad, the beef tenderloin with blue cheese, the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, the dates and the spicy potatoes. I highly recommend making a reservation if you want to eat on the weekend or from about 5-9pm. It can get very crowded and you might have a significant wait without a reservation.

title: AMAZING BRUNCH!
review: This is a hidden gem for brunch! The Bloody Mary bar was extensive and a great value. (top shelf was available for the same price) The food was fantastic! Get the Chorizo and Manchego omelette! Delish! The breakfast potatoes they served were an orgasmic take on a tater tot. My favorite tapas was the paella rice with egg. The saffron and garlic took over your pallette! Amazing! The atmosphere was great too. The dining room has the effect of being outdoors without the city sounds and pollutions wafting in. One downfall is that the waitress seemed distracted.... running around.... she was never to be found. Seriously! Go to brunch here!

title: Lively full of energy tapas eating
review: This is a lively very social place for eating. Staff is nice and food is really good.  Drinks are nice as well.  If you r lokking for a romantic/ quiet dining experiencing this not the place for u. Reservations are also highly recommended.

title: What a great way to dine!
review: My wife and I had dinner at CBBR last Saturday night. We were seated in the south section of the restaurant in a very "earthy" room-- brick wall with huge mirrors on one side and a wood-sided wall on the other. Our server was casual and helpful, and gave good recommendations when asked. The busman was exceptional-- clearing empty plates and refilling our water glasses promptly without being overattentive. The food was as delicious as it was varied. There was just the two of us so we stuck with the tapas. I'd like to go with a group and sample the paella some time. (There is a two order minimum.) We had the red sangria and it was the right beverage for the food and the room-- casual and light. I can't believe it has taken me so many years to get there for my first time. If I lived in the city I would certainly be a regular! Looking forward to my next trip there.

title: Okay place.
review: White sangria was very sweet and WEAK. Food was adequate. Service was very good. They were accommodating with one of us with food allergies.

title: Vibrant Tapas Restaurant
review: In early August, our family had the good fortune to drive into downtown Chicago from our airport hotel to experience the wonderful food and ambiance of Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba. The place was packed, even early on a Thursday evening, and we were glad we had made reservations so our wait was only about 10 minutes.My daughter's smartphone brought up an online appetizer special worth $9.00, and we had three tapas each for the four of us. The excellent wait staff just kept bringing out the food, and the selection and diversity was unbelievable. The portions were not skimpy, and we all had a lot to eat. The wine and draft beer selections were excellent as well.Our overall bill with tip was $125.00 which was very reasonable for a downtown Chicago restaurant. The only negative was the noise in the restaurant which made it a little difficult to hear our waiter. But it was well worth it when you factor in the fantastic food and drink!We all thought it was the best tapas restaurant we had ever experienced and look forward to returning whenever we visit Chicago.

title: The best Spanish tapas
review: This place really should be in the top 10 places to eat in Chicago. We went at 8.30 on a Friday evening and this place was packed with a 2 hour wait. Luckily they allow free seating at the bar and we got really lucky and found an amazing spot. My favorite thing there was the red sangria ,, hands down the best sangria i have ever had... we ordered the Quintox platter, the goat cheese sweet poatato bravas , lamb kebobs, and the sausage platter. Everything was delicious !

title: Amazing food, wonderful atmosphere. Just go!
review: We went with a group of six. We called ahead for preferred seating and were escorted to our table not long after we arrived. The first thing you'll notice about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is the decor and energy. Lots of rooms beautifully decorated, and if you love hustle and bustle combined with high energy (it works here), this is your place. Our server did a good job explaining how to order, but three or four dishes per person is too much food! Too much wonderfully delicious food, but too much nonetheless. :) Two or three is fine for most groups, as they are much bigger than typical tapas portions. We had a variety of items off the menu -- seafood, chicken, vegetables, pork -- and each one was superb. Cannot wait to return.

title: Great place to experience a variety of foods
review: We were a party of three adults and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We started off with a berry Sangria and shared a pitcher. There was also a special on wine by the bottle that evening - there is a fairly wide variety of wine offerings. Fresh crusty bread is brought to each table. The tapas plates were enough for each of us to have a couple bites of each offering and are brought to the table as the kitchen gets them ready, so if you stagger your order you can have a steady stream, of food. We started by each picking one plate then took turns adding others one at a time as we went. Our favorite was the beef tenderloin & blue cheese - tender and tasty. Our second favorite was the citrus-cured salmon, cucumber, crema & toast. Other choices that were all good were the following: roast dates with bacon & apple vinaigrette, grilled chicken skewer with zucchini almond pesto, warm potato & onion omelette (generoud serving), and grilled squid with olive oil & garlic. We also asked for a second bread basket and were pleasantly full with no room to taste the dessert offerings. The service was excellent and staff very friendly. Although very busy, we were easily able to carry on a conversation as tables are staggered well..Reservations are accepted and I would suggest them if you don't want a long wait. Lots to try - a something for everyone kind of place. Put it on your to-do list of dining in Chicago!

title: AMAZING food
review: We went Sunday at Brunch. We ordered off the Brunch and Lunch menu. It is a fun place with amazing food and great Sangrias. Do not miss this place. It was one of our favorites in Chicago.

title: Wow Delicious!
review: I cant say any more, but we went here with two other couples and order a total of 19 small dishes and we shared all of them. Tapas are really good and the bacon wrapped danes are the best. The service was great and our waiter made drink suggestions and menu suggestions. This is a little bit of train ride on the brown line where I am live, but it is worth it!

title: Great food, affordable
review: Came with 2 girlfriends, we had made a reservation in advance. Great food, fun atmosphere, great sangria! The server wasn't the best, more annoying than anything but attentive nonetheless. We had a pitcher of sangria and 8 tapas and we were stuffed and very happy that our tab was only $80 or so!

title: Loved this place!
review: I am not sure which I liked best...the sangria, tapas, or amazing Paella! This place was delicious and great for a group.  They have a great selection of tapas that were fun and tasty to try. Great atmosphere and great food.  Definitely recommend it!

title: Not very good.
review: We had dinner here before a show on Sat. night.  It was recommended by our hotel.  I love Tapas and I love Sangria.  Both disappointed.  The place felt dirty and the food was mediocre at best.  I would not recommend.

title: Fun place for dinner
review: My husband and I ate here during restaurant week in february.  The atmosphere is loud and fun,  great music, and fun decor.  We really enjoyed the tappas menu, it was fun to taste small amounts a lot of things. We were absolutely stuffed when we...More

title: Awesome tapas!
review: I love this restaurant. The tapas breakfast is my favorite. Service great, cozy atmosphere. Cappuccino was made perfectly.

title: Great atmospherw
review: great grilled octopus and sangria. A nice spot for people watching!!

title: Great food and fun
review: This place is always a ton of fun with groups.  Tons of food to try, great sangria, and the atmosphere is lively.  Prepare to be here awhile especially on weekends, tapas is a process.  Worth it though.  And the paella is amazing.

title: Terrific Tapas!
review: My husband and I went to Chicago at the end of June/beginning of July 2012.  At the suggestion of a waiter in another restaurant, we sought out Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for a great Tapas experience.  We were not disappointed.  Despite the fact that place was bustling...More

title: Sangria Me Please!
review: Go for the tapas, guzzle the sangria~nothing better on a warm day to help cool you off! Still an excellent choice after all these years!

title: Quite Possibly the Best Tapas Restaurant in Chicago
review: The variety and quality of food was absolutely amazing! I'd go here again in a heartbeat!

title: Great Place!
review: I have been to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba quite a few times.  We love it!  Some of the best menu items include:  Patatas Bravas (spicy potatoes), baked goat cheese in tomato sauce (OMG), the scallops (just had them for the first time and we're miserable that we...More

title: OMG! Love the Blood Mary Bar!
review: Went here for brunch and had a wonderful time. Tried all 4 of the brunch tapas and a couple others from the lunch menu for a group of 3. The bloody bar was great. I loved being able to mix and add what I wanted to make it the perfect blend.

title: Excellent for groups & fairly close to Apollo Theatre.
review: A party of 9 ages 24-80 and we all loved it.  The sangria was delicious and all the small plates were well received.   It was chosen due to the location (walkable) to the Apollo Theatre and Million Dollar Quartet.  It was a winning combo.

title: Old tapas favorite in Chicago
review: Always like this northside cafe -- much fun and good memories. Menu has changedbut still many good choices.My favorites are the shrimp with garlic, grilled octopus andsquid plus always the morcilla! Paella is a good too. For red wines, the Ribero del Duerochoices are good. If crowded, then try sitting at the bar -- usually good service.

title: Tapas near Depaul
review: very good tapas usually crowded every night good quality food at fair price good for family or business

title: Top this tapas!
review: An excellent time was had by all. Bloody mary bar was a nice treat.

title: Can't make up your mind....Eat Tapas!!
review: Our group stopped into a crowded Ba Ba Reeba. I love the concept. Small plates of great food to share amongst friends. Had the garlic shrimp, Octopus, goat cheese and sauce, potato salad and many others. Everything I tried was great and the service was spot on. A constant flow of interesting plates kept hitting the table. The only problem was not being able to try everything.

title: Wonderful service, excellent tapas!
review: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a great Spanish restaurant. The food is authentic Spanish cuisine and the staff are very welcoming! I recently took a group of students here and they gave my students a tutorial in Spanish cuisine, which was neat because my students had already learned about Spanish food before coming to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. The paella, tortilla, and mushrooms were extremely good!!

title: Very good tapas, several fine choices.
review: Is Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba going to knock you socks off... maybe. I had a few dishes that were outstanding and some that were just good. I think that is pretty good, especially for tapas when there are generally so many choices. I liked the Spanish food (though to be fair, I generally do) and Ba-Ba-Rebba was good. The waitress was pleasant and gave good suggestions. I really enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates and spicy potatoes were a couple of the highlights, but there were several options that I enjoyed. I went with 4 friends last time and we ordered almost everything on the menu to try them. That is one of the great things about tapas, if you are with a couple people, you get to try a lot of different foods. I do not think you will be disappointed by your experience here, though you probably will not be floored either.

title: Rather have a steak
review: My wife loves Tapas. I can live with or without them,  What really bothered me is the waiter or kitchen got two of our 8 tapas wrong, Good points for the food, lousy for the service.

title: Delicious food, fun atmosphere, friendly staff
review: I recently went to Cafe Ba Ba Reeba with a group of girls as part of a bachelorette party. First of all, the mango sangria is delicious! We ordered pitcher after pitcher. The tapas were great (and this is coming from a pretty picky eater). My favorites were the baked goat cheese and all the different meat skewers. Our waiter was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. I can't wait to come back again!

title: Great experience!
review: This is the perfect place for groups, and the atmosphere is really nice. I'm usually a picky eater, but I was pleasantly surprised that I enjoyed everything I tried! The garlic bread with goat cheese and tomato sauce was a great combination. The spicy potatoes were some of the best potatoes I've ever tasted! The chicken skewers were yummy, and the chicken paella was even better! I definitely had more than one serving! The tres leches cake with caramel and whipped cream was absolutely delicious! What a fantastic meal, and I would love to go back!

title: AMAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZIN
review: I love this tapas place, it has the best sangria! I love their menu, always fun with a group of epople you can try a bit of everything.

title: Always great
review: This was my favorite restaurant when I lived in the neighborhood in the early 90's.  I try to make it there whenever I am in town, and it NEVER disappoints!  Great food, great service and great atmosphere.

title: Great time for 3 generations!
review: Went here for a birthday dinner with my mom and 3 teenagers. You know how difficult it is to take teens anywhere with grandma. Well, to my surprise at the end of our meal, the teens reported it was the best dinner they ever had! They enjoyed choosing different tapas and sharing plates. I will say it took quite a few plates to fill up the boys, but it was a special occasion and I was planning to spend a lot on dinner. Our favorite plates were the sweet potato with pomegranate aioli and the grilled octopus. It was packed on a Saturday night, the chairs are rather close together, but we were seated immediately with a reservation. This is a loud, bustling place for a fun dinner.

title: the original chicago tapas restaurant- I think
review: interesting place, good service, good choices, even for vegetarians-

title: Fun restaurant, good food, great selection, outstanding Sangria
review: We dined here in mid-March with a party of four.Overall, the food was very good. Naturally, some dishes were better than others.Winners for us were the goat cheese and tomato sauce, the grilled calamari, the grilled pulpo (octopus), the artisanal cheeses, and the chicken empenada. The fried calamari was also very good.The beef short rib and the beef empenada were only so-so. We had a pitcher of the Sangria of the day, which was Mango. It was excellent. Not too sweet and full of flavor.The service was excellent, especially considering the restaurant was beyond full on a week night.Overall, a fun restaurant and reasonably priced for a tapas bar.

title: Still great!
review: I have wonderful memories of dining here years ago & coming back was just as great!

title: Great variety of food
review: Looking for a taste of everything Cafe BaBa Reeba is a wonderful choice.  Great for meeting friends and enjoying small portion tapas to pass around and share

title: Good but not outstanding
review: This is one of the Lettuce Entertain you restaurants which are consistently good but not outstanding. The menu is tapas style and there are many options to choose from. My favorite was the baked goat cheese in tomato sauce. The fried calamari was also nice. Our service was very good and our waiter was attentive and offered good suggestions. He also let us sample several different wines before deciding on our selection which was nice. The restaurant is causal and open so it's rather loud but not enough to prevent conversations at your table. It's a fun, casual place to go with friends in the Lincoln Park area. It's located on Armitage and Halstead. We went on a Saturday night and I would highly recommend reservations. Every table was occupied.

title: Great Tapas Bar in Chicago
review: Great resturant to experience tapas bar. Instead of large portions enjoy a sampling of delicious bites from appetizers to desserts. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a great place for couples or groups. Nice place to eat before the theatre too. Loved it at first bite. I will go back to this resturant again and again!

title: Great tapas
review: Another great LEY restaurant which works better than most of the other tapas restaurants in town.  The only problem is that it is farther away than the others, but it is worth the trip.

title: I love this place!
review: Every time I go back to Chicago this is the place I always make time for.  Fun atmosphere, excellent sangria's, and the food is absolutely wonderful, not to mention great service.

title: Yummy.
review: Tapas done well.  Lots of delicious small plates to choose from.  There's often some cool entertainment options.  The place is not quiet.

title: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!
review: The silly sounding name is terribly misleading. The terrific atmosphere is intimate enough for date night, discerning enough to bring the finest company to, and comfortable enough for a family outing. This modern and exciting restaurant is not shy on flavor by any means. Every...More

title: Tapas Fun
review: Great variety of great food.  We went with a big group so if you do, order two of each tapas so you don't feel guilty taking it away from someone who didn't get a taste.

title: impossible to get to
review: Now that Spanish Jamon is imported into the States it no longer necessary to go to  Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba to get my fix of dry cured, acorn fed ham.

title: Great Tapas, beautiful atmosphere
review: We had 5 Tapas: Spicy potatoes with tomato alioli - awesome taste (5/5) Goat cheese baked n tomato sauce - good (4/5) Spinach & manchego – stuffed mushrooms - a little dry for my taste (3/5) Rioja braised short ribs, mashed potatoes – your usual...More

title: Fabulous food!
review: This tapas restaurant in the Lincoln Park shopping district offers small plates of the most scrumptious food. The paella is offered for 2 or more diners, but it's worth ordering & taking leftovers home. Some of our favorites are the endive salad, bacon-wrapped figs &...More

title: I was really fooled by all these reviews
review: After reading these reviews I thought this was a sure thing.  I couldn't have been more wrong.  The service was very slow and indifferent. The food was just plain terrible.  Potata bravas were soggy greasy lumps, octopus was as tough as rubbery as I've ever...More

title: Always Wonderful
review: We always come here when we visit Chicago. The best Tapas, the best Margarita's in the city. Fun to order all kinds of food and share. The bartender Jay was so friendly and entertaining, plus he makes a killer Margarita. We love this place!

title: Great food, consistently
review: Great food, can't go wrong with themThey will accommodate requests for large partiesService is good and food tasty - great place for vegetarians and those that love spicier foodCan get crowded so make reservations or get there earlier than you want to sit and eatCan be noisy but worth the tasty food

title: Great Tapas
review: Returned again for second time. It was just as good as always.The empanadas were wonderful; great texture and flavors. The stuffed piqueno peppers are addictive. And, of course, the patatas bravas are genuine comfort food.Happy hour in the bar is a real treat and cost effective.Just a few blocks from a "Brown Line" station so very accessible.Give it a try.

title: A bustling restaurant
review: We were impressed with the lively atmosphere and efficiency of this restaurant. It was 6:30 p.m. when we arrived but the place was already packed. But the service was fast and the food was served quickly. We have limited experience with tapas restaurants but this one seem authentic. My husband is a fan of paella so he ordered the seafood paella. I felt the serving size was on the small side for the price point but he was happy with the dish. I ordered the appetizer combo to get a variety of flavors and enjoyed it also. Overall it a pleasant experience and we would definitely return to this restaurant and try new dishes.

title: What delicious fun!
review: Love the lively atmosphere at Ba-Ba-Reeba!  We ate on the patio, the ambiance was great.  Enjoyed delicious tapas; a fun pitcher of Red Sangria; and, one of their yummy and perfectly sized tiny desserts ~~ everything was terrific!  Looking forward to our next trip back.

title: Best Spanish Tapas Ever!
review: I've been to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! 5 times and every time it has been great! If you're looking for good tapas and in the Chicago area, don't miss this wonderful restaurant. The atmosphere is active and festive. The service is good. The food is great!The last time I went here, I think they had expanded as it looked quite a bit larger, but still had the same feel to it. Although it's always been a popular place to go in Lincoln Park, I think it's grown tremendously. I went very early - I think it was around 5pm, and the place was packed! My recommendation is to get there early.If you're with a larger group, get the paella and sangria, then order some tapas. I personally like to skip the paella and sangria (both are excellent) and go right for a varierty of hot and cold tapas (this is the real reason I go). I have never had a bad tapas dish there ever! I have yet to try them all, but I've tried almost half of them and they are all excellent. By the time you get done sampling all of the little tapas dishes, the cost can quickly add up, especially if you have an appetite. It's well worth the price, but just be aware of this.This restaurant is highly recommended and one of my all-time favorites in Chicago. Go - you won't be disappointed.

title: MY FAVORITE PLACE IN THE CITY
review: which I actually should not have said since this place is already overcrowded. It is a wonderful place with best sangria in the city and small tapas (ladies' favorite). I personally love special menu to try new items - I would love this place never changed!!Keep in mind to bring huge parties here because this way everyone has lots of different dishes to try, will not complain, and wine will make even the fussiest person happy!!

title: One of the best values in Chicago!
review: We've been going to Chicago for about 11 years and this place is always on our list as it is great value and great food. We have never had a bad dish or experience, This past trip was during one of the torrential downpours that can happen in Chicago. We were seated on the patio under the awning when the heavens opened up. After about five minutes, the drainage system on the awning gave away at the far end and some water came cascading in. Where we were seated a few drips came down so we moved our table away from the wall about six inches. The waiter asked if we wished to be moved inside, we said no as it was not that bad at all. When our bill arrived we were pleasantly surprised that the management had made a generous adjustment for our "inconvenience" due to the rain issue. It was absolutely not necessary for them to have done this, but we thought it was a very nice gesture by the restaurant. They have ensured that we will continue to dine there t when in Chicago and to also recommend it to our friends too.

title: Great food and atmosphere
review: When on a business trip with some chefs. And they all agreed food and atmosphere of this restaurant are great. we shared the entire list of ( favorites) on the menu and we were rarely dissapointed. The service is kindda slow, but if you go there to relax and enjoy the outside terrase or the crowd at the bar, it' snot a big problem. Will be back next year.

title: Food was good; but very overpriced
review: This was my first tapas experience. I really enjoyed being able to sample a number of items. It was also easy to converse with so many bite sized items. However, at $8-12 per plate I found it to be extremely expensive and not worth the money.If you do not care about the price I would recommend it.

title: Almost as good as I remember it
review: Good variety for Tapas.  Bathroom kind of dated though.

title: Fantastic!!
review: One of the best meals we had while in Chicago. Service was excellent, food was fantatic. Pretty great prices too! I'd love to eat here again when I'm back in Chicago.   Didnt get the palella - but it looked amazing.

title: Incredible food and a fun atmosphere!
review: I was traveling with my staff for a conference and we had dinner at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba. Shared six tapas among the three of us and loved every one of them! My favorite was the special empanada, which was a Moroccan-spiced chicken with raisin chutney, but I also loved the shrimp and crab dip, the baked goat cheese in a tomato sauce, the scallops with couscous, and the mushroom empanada. My only regret was that we were too full to try any more tapas or the paella! The black raspberry sangria was fabulous as well! I would return to this restaurant any time I'm in Chicago in the future!

title: I wish I had 2 stomachs, it was so good.
review: I haven't eaten so well and so much in a long long time. This place was amazing! If you enjoy Spanish food and sangria drop everything and head over to Cafe Ba Ba Reeba!! There menu offers many traditional Spanish Tapas and sangria on tap! Choose from Sangria flavors like: Peach, Blackberry and Mango. The place was packed and the wait was still on when we left at 11pm. Make a reservation as early as you can as they fill up fast. Tapas are a more pricey food anywhere, so expect to pay a little more than you would at a typical restaurant. But you get what you pay for here. The food was incredible and the service was good too. Don't miss this gem while you are in Chicago!

title: WASTE OF MONEY & VERY DISAPPOINTING
review: Read a mix of reviews and I LOVE tapas and Spanish cuisine so thought I'd give it a try. To keep it short and to the point: food was HORRIBLE, sangrias were WATERY (2 pitchers and not even a buzz and we aren't big drinkers), items OVERPRICED. I've lived in NYC and Washington, DC so used to paying high $$ for great food and honesty don't mind if it's mind blowing, but this stuff was mediocre at best. Just don't waste your time and money here. I'm baffled at the great reviews of this place. There are certainly much better places to eat in Chicago. Do yourself a favor and SKIP IT.

title: Great food, atmosphere and fun!
review: Our office chose this restaurant while downtown for a nice dinner. The atmosphere was amazing... Food options endless .... And the staff was helpful and had great knowledge of the menu. They were able to suggest foods that we would never order and it was AMAZING! So amazing that were taking a special trip back next month!

title: great time and tasty food
review: we reserved a table after the marathon and while it was packed, they seated us within minutes of our arrival. our server was very attentive and asked about any food allergies since we had someone who couldn't eat shell fish. the food was very good but the butterscotch cream for dessert - MUST BE ORDERED - we ordered two and still think about it and are trying to recreate it tonight for friends! it's a great place for a casual dinner - only gripe was they didn't have padron peppers and they brought out others that were too hot and not good. we should have been informed they didn't have any BEFORE substituting others.

title: Great way to sample food at the table
review: With the Tapas menu, this makes it great to sample a little of everything that is ordered and be full at the end of the meal! My party loved the Paella with the chicken and veggies. For desert Milk Cake all around! The atmosphere is very pleasant. Parking is the only draw back.

title: after 3 bites, we left!
review: this was our first time to chicago and we had really been enjoying ourselves. the first two nights here we had great meals and lots of fun. however,this place is like the chuck e. cheeses of tapas. if u r in the mood for watered down cheap sangria, a party on college atmosphere, and food that is very mediocre, with lots of it to choose from, then head here... the place is gargantuan and focuses more on feeding the herd than anything special. my wife and i are foodies, and after a couple nibbles of their "pintxos", bite size appetizers, we knew right away it was not for us.we had 3 different things and one was terrible. the "ahi" was like it was from a can of star kist tuna!the piquillo pepper stuffed with short rib was bland and boring, and i'm not even gonna mention the third.so ,we left to go get a great meal somewhere else.

title: Great Tapas + Fun Atmosphere + A LONG Wait
review: YUM! The tapas at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba were delicious. However, although we had made reservations, we waited out 35 minutes before our table was ready. As a party of 8 it was difficult for them to find a table for us. As we were finally seated tightly, around a small table probably meant for five people, we got a look at the menu. There was a wonderful array of choices, including stuffed mushrooms, calamari, spicy meatball, and ahi tuna. After choosing our favorites from the menu, we waited, not long for our first small plates to be brought out. As we passed around the plates, and tasted a little bit of everything we were very satisfied with the food. It was flavorful and delicious. As we continued with the tapas ordering, the meat with cheese on top, and some wrapped dates with cheese, we all had our favorites. And then, the paella came out! Wow! The rice dish was spectacular! Following was dessert, which did not fail to impress. I would recommend this restaurant to diners who like to try a little of everything. This is probably not the best choice however for small children, as there are not many choices for them and the restaurant is a little loud. However, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! is a fun restaurant with food you will savor.

title: Excellent
review: We loved this place. Our server was super friendly and helpful. Food was excellent and full of flavor.  Great atmosphere. Reasonable prices!

title: Fun Off-beat
review: This was my first visit to a tappas and I will go back. You order 2, no more than three dishes and share with your friends who also get 2-3 dishes. That's the fun...sharing and experimenting. The plates came at odd times throughout the evening, not all at once. It was like getting a present each time becuase we didn't know who would get it and what it would look like or taste like. The best dish was the bacon covered dates. YUMMMM. The roasted potatos were a close second as was the cheese and date dish. Oh...so many. It would have topped off the evening if there were live music which they probably do on weekends. The peach sangria was better than the red.

title: Great Tapas & Sangaria
review: We went here for my dinner birthday and it was really delicious.  The wait staff was very nice and helpful.  We had pommegranite sangaria that was to die for.  It made for a very fun birthday.

title: I love this place for tapas!  Fun experience, delicious food! Bring lots of cash.
review: I love this place for tapas!  Fun experience, delicious food! Bring lots of cash.

title: Tapas for the masses!
review: My wife and I heard about this place from a friend at the conference we were attending, and took an "L" train out to see it. In a cool little neighborhood, this was exactly what we were looking for!The pintxos platter was an excellent start, followed by some recommendations by our server of a fascinating Spanish Caesar salad, spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, beef tenderloin with bleu cheese, seared scallops, and chorizo-chicken skewers. We wanted to try a vegetarian dish as well but were too stuffed!The server was excellent. Even though we passed on dessert, she brought us out two small bite desserts that were phenomenal. She kept our drinks full and our experience quick without rushing. I would highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for the best tapas in Chicago!

title: A fun time and yummy food.
review: While visiting Chicago we stopped by Cafe Ba Ba Reeba for their annual New Year's Day Pajama Brunch which a Chicago native friend of mine highly recommended. They had a build-your-own Bloody Mary bar, a wide selection of sangria, and if you show up in your PJ's between the designated hours on New Year's Day, you'll receive a gift certificate equal to the price of your meal for future use! (We're not local, but this was a great way to compensate our friends/local tour guides.) The food was unique/delicious and the Bloody Mary hit the spot. Plus it's a great way to recover from a long night out - just plan ahead and call for reservations well in advance (i.e. 5+ days in advance). We had so much fun going out in our PJ's that we saw a movie directly afterwards! If you have the chance to go, I'd definitely recommend trying this destination!

title: over-rated and over-priced
review: Here for the first time. Wow, what a dissappointment! I had high hopes for this place. The portions are small for the price. Waiter brought the wrong order to our table, took off and it took a long time to get him back. After we tracked him down, and told him about the mix up, there was no apology.I had the paella for two and it just enough for one! The seafood was not fresh, the shrimps small. Sorry, but not returning to this place.

title: Yummy Cheap Kitsch, sympa, good value.
review: Yummy Cheap Kitsch, sympa, good value.

title: Outstanding food!
review: This restaurant is fabulous- the food was amazing (really, like one of the best meals I've ever had), the service was great, and the atmosphere is fun and laid-back. I really have nothing negative to say! Oh, and it is moderately priced for what you get!

title: Good...and so much fun.
review: Good...and so much fun.

title: Dissappointing; Overrated; Better in Early Days, Too Big For Britches Now
review: Dissappointed. This place is not what it used to be 10 years ago. Menu has been shortened. Tapas not as special. Most were too salty. Mussels were not fresh -- even served us a couple of closed ones (where is quality control?). Sangria is overpriced, and overiced; tastes like coolaid. -- better value, better choices, better taste elswhere.

title: Overpriced for small dishes
review: Well, it's a tapas place so the dishes are supposed to be small. But didn't see a lot of delicious options for a vegetarian so really wasn't my preferred place and we won't be back. Pricey for what you get and crowded as well. We ended up being so tired waiting for a table that we sat at the bar and ate. We saw them making the sangria in the back using crappy boxed wine. But I shouldn't be so judgemental as boxed wine isn't bad and we drink it at home sometimes. I suppose though that we were suprised by that because of the prices of everything there that you expect a bit more in terms of quality. Oh well.

title: Been around forever, but...
review: Been around forever, but still fun and delicious; especially for a group.

title: Oh, one of my Chicago Fav's
review: Oh, one of my Chicago Fav's

title: Tapas nice, Sangria - save your $$!
review: Was expecting more according to the reviews. Service was great, tapas were nice, (except the lamb), sangria was like coloured, sweet water! Could hardly hear ourselves talk, as the overhead tarp was used because it had been raining and was threatening rain again - very loud. If you've had authentic Sangria in Europe ( or even made it yourself)...forget this overpriced sugary offering!...tried the Peach and the Red one...blah! (and expensive).

title: Pretty good tapas.
review: I have been to Barcelona so it's not the most authentic but I love coming here for a drink or two and a few small plates after or before a movie. Try the bacon and dates--truly a classic and one of their best. The wine list needs a little work though.

title: Great Tapas, Great Times
review: We love tapas restaurants because even if you order something that is only so-so, you aren't stuck only eating that one dish for your dinner. If you like the concept of tapas, this is a great choice in Chicago.The restaurant is located in the Lincoln Park neighborhood of Chicago. There is valet parking but the restaurant can be accessed by a three block walk from the Armitage station on the EL brown line. There are lots of restaurants in this area but this place obviously holds its own by the crowd that had gathered here on the Friday night we were there. This restaurant takes reservations and you probably want to make one if you are going on a Friday or Saturday night. The restaurant has a farily good size dining area and also an outdoor area if the weather is nice. There is a private dining area as well, which was reserved the night we were there. As for the tapas, we loved any of the croquette dishes. These were breaded balls of goodness (similar to a fritter). While we were there they had a rice and mushroom croquette and a ham and cheese croquette. I also really liked the pork shank, the goat cheese with tomato sauce and bread, and of course the chocolate truffle dessert. All of our dishes we chose, however, were all good. As for drinks, they have a full bar with four or five different sangrias on tap. The beer list is fairly small but they do have the local favorite Goose Island. When we are in Chicago again, we would definitely return to this place.

title: M-m-m-m-m...Chicken Empanadas
review: On our recent trip to Chicago we tried Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba to compare with our previous favorite tapas restaurant.  Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba won.   The empanadas were great...along with the albondigas and the potatas bravas.

title: Fantastic Tapas
review: Let's keep this short and simple: Great authentic and creative tapas at fantastic prices. Reasonable to good portions. Awesome sangria with great bar atmosphere. Excellent desserts. The paella has a huge disappointment; stay away from it. The paella is over-priced and barely edible and probably the worst ever even though they claim they make it from scratch. Can't wait to return (will never order the paella again....)

title: Best Tapas
review: I loved this restaurant...great atmosphere, great service and great food. The menu is unique but authentic. The portions are enormous!!! My husband and I wanted to try a lot of things but we didnt want to waste any food....most of the plates range between 3 and 8 dollars so you definitely get your money's worth. We ordered several plates, dessert and a pitcher of sangria and our bill was about $60....amazing! I highly suggest checking this place out if you like tapas or latin food.

title: One of the best Tapa's restaurants ever
review: The food is delicious; the service is great, but the sangria is so-so. All of the small plates we ordered were wonderful. The paiea was good, but you had to order at least 2 servings (which ended up being $20). The white sangria did not taste like it had alcohol, so don't order it! The red was good though. Overall, it was a great dining experience and the only complaints were the ones that were voiced.

title: Not so much . . .
review: Not so much . . .

title: Great Tapas! Great happy...
review: Great Tapas! Great happy hour price- $3 Tapas at the bar. Good sangria

title:
Met up with a friend around 9 and sat at the bar. Had some very delicious peach sangria,braised lamb with
spinach and...
review: Met up with a friend around 9 and sat at the bar. Had some very delicious peach sangria,braised lamb withspinach and couscous (the lamb was so tender and flavorful), bacon-wrapped dates withapple vinaigrette, and roast eggplant saladwith fresh goat cheese. Ended the meal with a mini-flan, which was excellent. Definitely go back

title: I live in Spain and still crave Ba-ba-Reeba!
review: Great tapas! Authentic options as well as tapas not as readily found in Spain. Dates with bacon are a must. I love the citrus cured salmon with cucumber bread. Patatas Bravas. Sangria. the baked goat cheese. seared spanish sausages. just get everything... it's all good! two downsides... some of the hostesses are rude.. and no arroz con leche... a Spanish favorite!

title: One on the best tapas restraunts in town.
review: One on the best tapas restraunts in town.

title: Im a huge fan of tapas when I go out with friends, but unfortunately Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba doesnt offer many options, and...
review: Im a huge fan of tapas when I go out with friends, but unfortunately Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba doesnt offer many options, and even fewer kosher (pork free) options. Although what we ordered was good, it wasn't anything memorable.

title: I don't get it.
review: I don't get the obsession with ba ba reeba.  It's always over packed, over crowded, the food is generally cold and you feel like a number.  The one savior is the sangria - it flows wildly and cheap so you forget your experience.

title: Their tapas was great!!
review: Their tapas was great!!

title: Good food, bad at managing their crowd, but fun for a party night!
review: Good food, bad at managing their crowd, but fun for a party night!

title: Hands down best spanish...
review: Hands down best spanish food in the city!

title: Favorite tapas in the city.  Like all tapas places, best for really large groups.
review: Favorite tapas in the city.  Like all tapas places, best for really large groups.

title: Best Spainsh food this side of the Atlantic
review: Very authentic! I lived in southern Spain for over two years and this is the closest thing other than actually being there. The jamon serrano and chirizo were great along with their various types of sangrias which are a must to have during the meal. Everyone in our group tried a few tapas and we split a paella valenciana. The portions were perfect and even allowed us room to try some of the desserts which were also in "tapa sized" portions.The staff was great and the dining room was quiet enough for all four of us to carry-on conversations. Our whole group absolutely loved the place and highly recommend it for everyone.

title: Great tapas.
review: Love this place. Great tapas. Sangria- just OK. Has had some great berry mojitos in the past. Great setting for a group. The more the merrier and you can try even more stuff. Paella Yum. Haven't found too may things on the menu that we do not like. If we have a group in town or want a fun yum time out- this is the place

title: Great tapas!
review: One of our best dining experiences during a recent visit to Chicago--we went there after a show at the Steppenwolf. The waitress was very helpful in her suggestions, and no tapas dish disappointed. We loved the roasted eggplant (could have made a meal of that with bread!), the beef tenderloin with blue cheese, the garlic shrimp, the cheese plate. Very good passion fruit sangria, too.

title: My absolute favorite place to go in Chicago
review: Everytime we go to Chicago which is about 3 - 4 times a year. We have to go to Cafe Ba-ba-reeba. It has the best atmosphere, the best tapas, and the best sangria. We have tried about everything on the tapas menu and we have not been disappointed. We of course have our favorites. And don't miss the desserts they are wonderful. It is a good place to go with your friends on a Friday or a Saturday evening. We highly recommend it.

title: One of my favorite places to go for a fun dinner
review: I love this place and we always go when in Chicago. The pricing is very reasonable, food delicious, and the atmosphere is fun.The spicy potatoes (patatas bravas) is one of my all-time favorite foods!Highly recommend!!!Just went there on Friday with a group of girls in town for the weekend, we loved the passionfruit sangria, but didn't like the red sangria or cava sangria as well.

title: Awesome Tapas!
review: Great tapas -- lots to choose from. Wonderfully flavored sangria! Staff was wonderful. Would recommend and would go again.

title: Fun, rowdy spot. Food is...
review: Fun, rowdy spot. Food is great, service is sometimes not. Good sangria, especially the white. Expect to wait.

title: Love this place! Great atmosphere and tasty food! LOVE the sangria! Gets really busy.
review: Love this place! Great atmosphere and tasty food! LOVE the sangria! Gets really busy.

title: White sangria wasn't as...
review: White sangria wasn't as good as Tapas Las Ramblas. White anchovies were good.

title: good tapas and sangria. What else do you need!
review: good tapas and sangria. What else do you need!

title: Dates wrapped in bacon
review: Dates wrapped in bacon

title: The food is good (enough), but this place gets so packed and noisy I don't enjoy going there that much.
review: The food is good (enough), but this place gets so packed and noisy I don't enjoy going there that much.

title: Great experience with not so great food.
review: The service was nice and I saw no problems with the place itself.  We shared many of the tapas and found most of them to just be "okay" - nothing wow'ed us.  The desserts were fantastic - those did WOW us.

title: love the paella..
review: love the paella..

title: My favorite Spanish Tapas!  I only wish Florida could have a place half as great as Ba-Ba-Reeba!
review: My favorite Spanish Tapas!  I only wish Florida could have a place half as great as Ba-Ba-Reeba!

title: It's Okay...
review: It's Okay...

title: Good tapas...good stuff...
review: Good tapas...good stuff.  Dig that sangria, baby!

title: Great tapas!
review: Excellent tapas and atmosphere that really reminds me of my time in Spain. Go between 4-6 for $3 tapas at the bar.

title: Terrible Service
review: I made a reservation through Open Table for 7:30 pm on May 25. I received 2 emails confirming this reservation for 7:30 pm. When I showed up to the restaurant at 7:25 to check in, the hostess informed me that I did not have a 7:30 reservation and that I was a no show for my 6:30 reservation. I showed her my confirmation email for 7:30 on my blackberry, but she rudely told me to contact Open Table because the restaurant had me in their system for 6:30. I have used Open Table successfully close to 50 times in various cities and I have never had an Open Table reservation disregarded in this manner. I am extremely dissatisfied with how the hostess treated me. With thousands of other restaurants in Chicago, I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

title: Probably the better tapas place in Chicago.
review: Click to add a comment

title: over priced.  not better.  nice outdoor patio though.
review: over priced.  not better.  nice outdoor patio though.

title: Want small portions of many delicious dishes? Come to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! Where they spice up the dishes Portugese style...
review: Want small portions of many delicious dishes? Come to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! Where they spice up the dishes Portugese style! Try their many tapas such as their blue cheese steak, marinara and goat cheese dip, and their yummy dessert. You won't regret it!

title: A must have for pallela and sangria!
review: This was an excellent place for dinner. The place was crowded and noisy, but that is to be expected on a weekend. The food was great, especially the paella. The sangria is a must have and there are many types to choose from. The staff is also attentive and at least in our case was friendly. This place is well worth a visit.

title: Great Spanish tapas & a...
review: Great Spanish tapas & a fun place to go with friends.

title: Not worth of your money
review: Not worth of your money

title: Great sangria, and a fun...
review: Great sangria, and a fun place to go with a lot of friends.

title: awesome tapas! as of now, the go-to place for tapas IMO
review: awesome tapas! as of now, the go-to place for tapas IMO

title: I love this place!!!
review: I love this place!!!

title: Little gem in Lincoln Park
review: I love this place because you can sample a variety of foods all in one meal. It is best to make reservations since this place fills up fast. Lincoln Park is a nice neighborhood to stroll around. Best part about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is the price. I have never paid more than $40 for myself and that's including sangria. This has the same menu as the one in Las Vegas.

title: Fun place but not amazing
review: As a Chicagoan, I can tell you that there are many places that serve tapas. Some are better for the food than the Cafe but are lacking in other important qualities. The atmosphere, service, and food all add up to a great experience. There really isn't another tapas place that I would recommend to travellers over Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. They also handle large parties well without reservations.

title: I love going to this place -- the best Sangria, so far i've had.  Love their Tapas Bravas......
review: I love going to this place -- the best Sangria, so far i've had.  Love their Tapas Bravas......

title: Great busy atmosphere.  Cheap.  Tasty, but untraditional, sangria
review: Great busy atmosphere.  Cheap.  Tasty, but untraditional, sangria

title: The first time I went here I loved the tapas, but it didn't impress on future visits.  The menu doesn't change and gets...
review: The first time I went here I loved the tapas, but it didn't impress on future visits.  The menu doesn't change and gets old after a while.

title: Okay food, but not even...
review: Okay food, but not even close to Cafe Iberico.

title: Paella is yummy, sangria...
review: Paella is yummy, sangria is also very good.  All beef is made really well.  Servings might be a tad smaller than at other places.

title: Excellent tapas!  The atmosphere is great for going with groups.  The sangria is top notch and I highly recommend an...
review: Excellent tapas!  The atmosphere is great for going with groups.  The sangria is top notch and I highly recommend an unusual flavor like guava, instead of the the traditional.

title: best tapas in the city
review: best tapas in the city

title: favorite tapas place
review: favorite tapas place

title: Great Tapas. Hard to find seats, though.
review: Great Tapas. Hard to find seats, though.

title: Pros: Phenomenal Food! Love the Spicy Potatoes, the Olives, the Beef Torro and the Sangria; $10 Cork Fee on Wine Bottle...
review: Pros: Phenomenal Food! Love the Spicy Potatoes, the Olives, the Beef Torro and the Sangria; $10 Cork Fee on Wine Bottle (call for confirmation)! Cons: Too crowded; Even with a reservation, you need to wait for a table until your whole party arrives.

title: i had a terrible experience here, but it is usually a fun vibe and decent food.
review: i had a terrible experience here, but it is usually a fun vibe and decent food.

title: Savory, unique, INCREDIBLE. Too many outstanding dishes to list. Plus fabulous sangria. Great atmosphere too. Love it!
review: Savory, unique, INCREDIBLE. Too many outstanding dishes to list. Plus fabulous sangria. Great atmosphere too. Love it!

title: This is a terrific place...
review: This is a terrific place to meet and be merry. The tenderest, most flavourful tapas I've ever had. And their variety of delicious sangrias are heavenly.

title: Was the first resturant...
review: Was the first resturant in the area and really put Lincoln Park and Halsted on the map in that area.  Great Brunch Too!

title: absolutely wonderful
review: Struggling to find a place to book our company holiday party- I stumbled upon Cafe Ba Ba Reeba. I contacted them as a "last-resort" feeling as tapas weren't exactly holidayish... and I couldn't have found a better place! I worked with Alison in the event department- she was a pleasure, and completely understood my panic in finding a place when everywhere was booked. She explained the menus, service, and was very detailed. Within minutes, we booked the party and my panic was gone. Service was excellent- we had our own room in a very busy, crowded, lively restaurant! We had our own staff- friendly and prompt- they anticipated our every need, and worked around a few late-comers. Needless to say the food was delicious, and all of Alison's recommendations were right on target- we added toros to one of their packages. EVERYTHING was perfect- everyone had a great time, and complimented my choice in a venue...We'll go back again next year, and hopefully a few times before then as well!

title: Terrific food and service
review: My husband and I just returned from a quick trip to Chicago, and we chose to eat one night at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba after reading about it in a hotel publication. It has a fun, colorful decor, and since we arrived at about 5:30, we didn't have to wait long for a table. We were eating early in order to get to a nearby play on time. We told the waiter we had never been to a tapas restaurant before, and he seemed to relish the opportunity to tell us how to order, what portion sizes to expect, etc. We, too, like a previous poster ordered the bacon wrapped dates, and they were so great. The date was so moist I was convinced that it had been soaked in something, but the server said it hadn't. The two flavors don't sound especially complementary, but the differences in textures is quite nice. We also ordered a three cheese dish that was good, a really tasty scallop dish, and a very flavorful chicken kabob. We ended with a mango sorbet that had such an deliciously intense taste that the shot-sized glass it was served in was just the right size.Our waiter couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, and when he presented the check, he said that the sorbet would be on the house!We ate at quite a few great places on our trip, but this was our favorite!

title: this is a great place to...
review: this is a great place to go with a group and share a bunch of food.  the sangria is also great here

title: Fun place for a date, party or dinner with friends. They have a huge menu and great sangria.
review: Fun place for a date, party or dinner with friends. They have a huge menu and great sangria.

title: Awesome tapas restaurant!
review: Awesome tapas restaurant!

title: Great tapas restaurant; the paella is usually great but has its off days. Sangrias are worth checking out too
review: Great tapas restaurant; the paella is usually great but has its off days. Sangrias are worth checking out too

title: Solid tapas joint.
review: Solid tapas joint.

title: Great food.  Great time...
review: Great food.  Great time.  Just a little pricier than most tapas restaurants, but not bad enough to keep me away.

title: What a delight!
review: This place is noisy and crowded. That's the only bad thing I have to say. The service and the food are both excellent. I was overly impressed with the portion sizes. I expected these "tapas" to be tinyportions, but instead they were reasonable and scrumptious. Our tableof four ordered about 12 different items from the menu and we shared.Each plate was better than the next. From the chicken to the beef to the fish and veggies and dessert, everything was outstanding. Even the wine selection was better than expected. The Spanish wines by theglass were actually quite tasty. This is the first place I will go next time I am in Chicago. MAKE A RESERVATION. We were seated immediately with our reservation, but non-reservations had a 90 minute wait.

title: Yummy Tapas!
review: Food, Service, AND Atmosphere were great!  I could not believe the amount and quality of food we ate at such a resonable price.  Make reservations, the place was packed.  Also, more of a local place (Lincoln Park) vs. tourist crowd.

title: Amazing!!!
review: Oh my god!! This place is so good! From the atmosphere to the staff to the tapas, overall a wonderful meal! Very crowded on weekend nights, so a reservation is a must unless you don't mind waiting over an hour, but you will see why it is worth it. Tapas is such a unique dining experience--sharing, talking, eating, talking, more eating, perfect for a date, even better for a group! Try the bacon-wrapped dates--you will dream about them for nights afterwards. I cannot say enough about Cafe Ba Ba Reeba--a must-experience dining adventure! I would recommend this to any and everyone who goes to Chicago. Yay!

title: Good flavor, poor performance
review: Decent enough when it comes to flavor, but was extremely disappointed in the 'undersized' bun and found it extremely difficult when attempting to eat.

title: Excellent burgers, etc
review: My daughter and son-in-law and I wanted a lunch that was easy and so we tried this place- take out. The menu and choices are amazing- pick the burger but then you need to pick the various spices to put on, then the type of bun, then the complimentary toppings (basic) and then the optional premium toppings such as avocado, cartelized onions, mushrooms, foie gras, etc, and then cheese options. Then you can pick sides or salads and drinks. My daughter and I ordered the grass fed prime beed burger and my son-in-law got the salmon burger which looked great. The burgers were delicious- tasty and well seasoned and the salmon burger looked larger than expected. I also ordered the spinach salad which was very good. They also have hand made milk shakes which I will have to get next time I go there.

title: "Like nothing you've ever seen before"
review: Here it is, under one roof, a neighborhood burger counter and old-fashioned butcher shop, chef Allen Sternweiler's latest culinary creation. As advertised, it is "like nothing you've ever seen before." Located at 1021 West Armitage Avenue in the Lincoln Park neighborhood, Butcher and the Burger goes a long way in answering the often asked question: "Which restaurant serves the best hamburgers in Chicago?" Burgers are the priority here. But patrons also can enjoy shrimp, fresh salmon, cube steaks, home-made potato chips and frozen custard. And they can take home ground patties, meatballs, house-made meatloaf and marinara sauce. That aside, the primary issue for debate is which burger do you prefer? Grass-fed prime beef burger or sirloin steak burger or House blend prime beef burger? And which toppings? And which bun? Well, I chose the House blend prime beef burger on a whole wheat bun with lettuce, tomato, raw onion, ketchup, yellow mustard, American cheese and Benton's Tennessee Mountain smoked bacon. With potato salad and potato chips. My wife opted for a sirloin steak burger on a croissant with BBQ sauce. We washed it all down with root beer and a chocolate shake, then treated ourselves to chocolate frozen custard for dessert. If that wasn't enough, we took home some meatballs and marinara. Butcher and the Burger is open from 11 to 9 Sunday through Wednesday, 11 to 8:30 on Thursday and 11 to 10 on Friday and Saturday. I wonder if Allen Sternweiler has any other ideas in his chef's hat.

title: Delicious!
review: On the quest for Chicago's best burger and this place is definitely making a run for the crown. Maybe it was my hunger and the fact I'd been walking around all morning, but after that first bite of burger I was blown away.The burger is the choose your own adventure variety. Pick the protein type, the rub, the cheese, the bun, and all the toppings. The standard ones are free, but the "premium" toppings will add a bit extra. I chose the regular beef burger with the ghost pepper blend and all standard toppings (no premium) and with a MexiCoke the total was under $15. Seems a bit pricey, but not that different from other premium type of burgers. The ghost rub was the perfect amount of kick for me. I didn't think it was "spicy" though I have a high tolerance, but it was just enough to add a bit of oompf to the burger. The burger was cooked perfectly to my liking (mid-rare) and they have the charred taste and feel of backyard burgers right off the grill. So no, you're not getting one of those pretentious burgers per se, but a real down to Earth burger. I was disappointed I didn't try the fries, but I definitely am looking forward to going back again. Now I have an excuse to try the fries and perhaps add some accoutrement off the premium toppings. The place is kinda small. There aren't a whole lot of tables, but there is a long counter with stools. I came in on Friday at/around 13:00 and it was busy, though two large groups seemed to enter literally right before me. Still, I did get the window seat!

title: All about the burger
review: The burgers are solid. I like the house blend, and the sirloin burgers. Both are packed with flavor. Add a spice blend (Cajun blend and the Chicago Style Steakhouse blends are very good) and you have a taste treat. Nice choice of buns, sides and cheeses. They also have some good premium toppings like the Benton Bacon or the BBQ pork belly.They also have turkey (Good),Lentil brown rice (Vegan), and a few other burgers.Fries are good with the black truffle mayo.Small place with a few tables. They have outside seating in nice weather (About 5 tables). Parking is street side, and pretty easy to find.

title: House Blend Prime Beef Burger
review: 6/10 overall. I'm not gonna lie, you cannot ignore the quality of the beef, but once mixed with the toppings and the bread it kind of loses it's quality - the staff was not the most welcoming. The fries were disappointing. Side note: they don't sell beer. I do recommend it, but is not a place I would visit frequently.

title: Great Variety of Burgers Made to Order
review: This popular restaurant makes all kinds of burgers made to order - a few types of beef, shrimp, salmon, veggie and brown rice, etc. Then you choose your seasonings and toppings- many are unique- and additions like fries, etc. Really tasty. Best to go at off hours, as this place gets really crowded.

title: Backyard Burgers!
review: The burgers you get from here taste like they've just come off the Weber in the backyard. No joke. And what's even more amazing is how much they let you customize your burger down to the seasoning and bun. I'm a traditionalist and like a plan cheese burger, so there is no hiding the taste behind rabbit food or condiments and these burgers are VERY addictive. So are the fries with the truffle sauce. The prices are a little high, but for the quality its not stopping me from coming back. And the service here is friendly, especially for a first timer who might need a 101 on the menu.

title: Best burger in Chicago
review: This is seriously the best burger in Chicago. This is my 10th year living here and tried way too many restaurants in the city. This place has by far the best and neatest burger. You can tell the meat is of excellent quality and the ingredients are fresher than ocean breathe. I go with the grass-fed patty, Chicago style spice, split top pretzel bun, sriracha mayo, lettuce, ketchup, and definitely the chipperbec fries. It never fails me! The salmon burger is also great.

title: Great Burgers and Fries.
review: We like this restaurant because it has s wide variety of burgers, especially veggie & fish. You can get a salmon burger or shrimp burger or brown rice and lentil burger if you don’t eat meat. And since every order is customized, it can taste different every time. It’s a very small restaurant, and it’s often frequented by DePaul students and people living in the neighborhood. Do to avoid having to wait for a table, I recommend going at off hours.

title: Burgers!!!
review: Great neighborhood place to have more upscale and delicious burgers.  Love the vibe and decor of joint.  Friendly service too.  Definitely would return.  I forgot to take pictures of my burger and potato salad because I was enjoying them and place.

title: Yummy, Yummy, Yummy!
review: Went adventuring with our college daughter.  What a great find!  We all had different burgers, and they were all delicious.  I'm not typically a burger person, and there wasn't a crumb left of my Haymaker special!  Delicious.  Fries were tasty, too!

title: nice people, wrong day
review: we picked the wrong day to visit this place--the air conditioning was out and it had been 90 degrees outside. nevertheless, we'd found a parking spot so we soldiered on. we all tried variations on the house blend burger and we shared a large fries. everything was very good. it's counter service, not table service, which we didn't know going in. the people are very nice. things are a little pricey for counter service (it's build your own burger and items add up fast) but very tasty....but not when you're sweltering. will return in winter time!

title: Lunch stop
review: Stopped for lunch with my wife and 2 yr old. I was a little worried at first because of its size if a highchair would be available and it was. The man that took our order got us situated nicely in a window table. We had the 100% prime beef burgers with an order of the hand cut fries. Everything was excellent! Burger was done perfect, seasoning was great! We all loved the fries as well. Great food, great, friendly, service. Can't go wrong here.

title: Super burger!!!
review: Seeking for the best burger in Chicago is an adventure. After reading a lot of reviews we went to try the Butcher and the Burger. The place does not accept reservations but they are very fast. Once you entered the store the kind host explained to me the philosophy in the menu and the thinking on ordering. You can have a tailor made burger, or,choose one of the favorites. All American classic is,a superb choice. Highly recommended for burger lovers

title: Lunch
review: Me and my gal stopped in for lunch and we were very happy with the service and the food.  It will be a must the next time we are in Chicago.

title: So good, I went for round 2!
review: Granted, I'm not the burger expert, I'm no connoisseur, and I haven't been to the most cities in the world, but I do know that I'm not the kind of person that will eat twice at the same restaurant whenever I visit a new city, but Butcher & the Burger is one of the only times I have ever broken that rule (the only other time: the Dutch in NYC for oysters). So it must've been a good burger. The place is a small, hipster neighborhood burger bar. It's BYOB, burgers can be pricy but I was on vacation so I didn't really care, and it was the first time I've ever seen a burger place have so many options for different combinations of burgers. You choose your bun, your seasonings, your toppings, sauces, etc. They have many options for burger patties too including black bean, fish, turkey and grass-fed beef (which is amazing). It's messy (as a burger should be), delicious, and my incredibly healthy low-calorie diet friend saw my fries and couldn't help but order some. This isn't a date night kind of place, I wouldn't go with a large group, but if you want to get lunch and catch up with a friend or two or if you just don't feel like cooking after work and need a quick bite to eat, this is your place and you'll be guaranteed an amazing burger.

title: Tasty and Messy
review: This restaurant has a multitude of different burger options including turkey, salmon, shrimp, and vegan lentil and brown rice. Then choose your seasoning and toppings, and you've built something you should enjoy. Just have plenty of napkins on hand, as this meal is really messy. And come during the week or on off hours, if you can. This place is very popular and gets crowded quite fast. It's not very big. There is limited outdoor seating as well.

title: Good burger but overpriced
review: If you're feeling a burger and in the area this is a good place to go. Lots of options for spices and toppings. Definitely price for a takeout burger joint

title: Great burgers with many options and a BYOB!
review: We went to this restaurant for the first time and had a great experience.The salad was great as were the turkey burger and Bison burger. There are so many great toppings. The dining area filled quickly but the customers moved in and out fairly quickly. There is also a larger outdoor seating area.

title: Tremendous Burgers & Selection
review: This burger place is unusual and excellent. You order your burger, and they custom make it with the usual garnishments plus special sauces, seasonings, cheeses, and more. The selection of burgers is also unique. For non-carnivores, there is a lentil and brown rice burger. For fish lovers, there are salmon burgers and shrimp burgers. They are very messy to eat but indeed tasty. The French fries are great too. It's a small restaurant, so seating is spare (and hard). And the place is noisy, so don't go with a headache. But we will definitely return to try other menu items.

title: Excellent craft burgers, good service
review: B&B is one of our neighborhood places we recommend to people from all over the city. It's definitely worth the trip. It's almost always crowded because it is so good. LOTS, and I do mean lots, of burger combinations are available. I personally love so many cheese selections and the fact that they will cook your burger to temperature...you don't have to settle for "medium" like everywhere else. The fries are really good, too.They have a small outdoor seating area during the summer months and service out there is good, too.

title: Make your own burger!!
review: It was my first visit in Chicago and I felt like a real American burger! Friends recommended this place! I was very hungry and couldn't really figure out what burger to build but it's actually a great idea to create your own burger! You choose your meat, flavour, bun, cheese, and toppings! Very very fresh and yummmy! Definitely recommend if you feel like a real burger!

title: Amazing
review: This is a fantastic restaurant. I've been there at least 20 times and never had a bad experience.The staff is super friendly and helpful. The food is outstanding, and well worth the price. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming... I just wish there were more indoor tables! I suppose that would detract from the vibe and charm, though.It's absolutely worth a visit if you've not been.

title: One of the best burgers I've eaten anywhere, and loved BYOB.
review: Had heard great things about this place and been meaning to try. Met and surpassed all my expectations for quality of the meat, fixings, and preparation of their burgers. I had the Chicago blend spice recipe, and it was excellent. I like that they give you several different ways to spice the meat, and will try one of the other ones next time. Price for quality of the burgers is more than fair, but be warned, if you try the bison burger it will Be pricier at over $15. Thoroughly enjoyed BYOB, and I brought a little cooler with beer for my son and me.Definitely worth the trip to Lincoln Park to try this place.

title: My goodness
review: This was a spur of the moment decision for us. It was probably our favorite meal on the trip. The burger was incredible, the service was fun and no-frills, and the CUSTARD. My god. We got the caramel custard after we ate and we were so happy that we did. Do not miss this neighborhood favorite.

title: Mediocre burger in the heart of Lincoln Park
review: Friday night, burger on the brain. Mission: feed the beast. Let's go! First stop, Au cheval...obnoxious wait...per usual. Beast can't wait. Google search...4 stars for Butcher & the Burger, here we go!Get there, no wait. Umami burger, fries and iced tea. Requested Medium on the burger...it was well. Like very well. Who eats meat like this?!?! Fries were meh, iced tea was meh. 4 stars? !?! Ummm, not in Chicago. Perhaps rural Iowa somewhere. FOH. No bueno. Next time, i will tame the beast for a 2 hour wait at Au cheval....that is all.

title: Simple but fabulous
review: This unassuming little place is just opposite the Armitage CTA station so it is very easily reached by public transport. It is on a strip of interesting boutique shops and has an outdoor side patio. The concept is simple choose a meat - about 5 choices here including regular beef, grass fed beef (our choice) some game I believe and a vegetarian concoction. Then choose the spice to mix in, request degree of donenes, chose the bun type - we chose lettuce and it worked surprisingly well - choose fixing many cheeses, sauces etc and add ins such as fries. We looked longingly at the fries, but skipped them this time. The grass fed beef was superb. The lettuce bun held together. The staff were knowledgable and helpful. Simple unpretentious excellent food. Endless variations on the burger theme are possible.

title: Fun, friendly local burger place
review: I stopped in on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. There was no line, the staff was very friendly. There are many options for seasonings on the burgers. Recommendations came quickly from the staff. Pretzel buns are an option for the burgers and worth the extra cost. The outdoor dining was pleasant, but the sidewalk is notably uneven so you need to be 'flexible' with your seating. The inside has the basics for seating but nothing about it creates a fine dining experience. It's a down to earth place where you want to enjoy a good burger in the neighborhood.

title: Lunch
