review: Thanksgiving dinner at Chez Moi was the perfect way to enjoy family and delicious food in a delightful atmosphere.  The service was excellent too.  I am looking forward to another opportunity to dine in this fine restaurant.

title: Thanksgiving dinner
review: This is the second Thanksgiving dinner we've enjoyed at Chez Moi. Both times the dinner was excellent. They offer both the traditional turkey dinner with a French twist and a few other options. It is a three course fixed-price menu for Thanksgiving at a price that is moderate for Thanksgiving dinner at a Chicago restaurant. The service was excellent. This year we were seated in the back dining room where it is a bit quieter.

title: Totally French!
review: Athena made our French dining experience at Chez Moi fabulous! From appetizers to desserts, including the bottles of wine, her suggestions were spot on. Looking forward to coming back to try their brunch.

title: Great Place for an Anniversary!
review: We celebrated our 5th anniversary weekend having dinner at Chez Moi Friday night. I had mentioned in the notes on Open Table that it was our anniversary. It was a beautiful night so we decided to sit outside which was romantic. Immediately we were brought 2 glasses of champagne and our waiter wished us a Happy Anniversary.My husband had the Duck and I chose the filet en croute. Both were delicious. Really yummy rich sauces. I had the onion soup to start because I always order it when I'm at a french bistro. My husband had the pate. Again, both were very yummy. The service was great and at the end of the dinner they brought us a creme brulee. All comped. It was just a really special feeling. It really made our celebration better.We love French Bistro cooking and are looking forward to going back so we can try more dishes.

title: Nice French Bistro
review: Bottom Line: It's a pleasant night out with most of the French bistro classics you'd expect competently prepared in a friendly atmosphere.Food: You'll find the classics like Alsatian Tart, Onion Soup, Mussels, Roast Chicken, Steak Frites, etc. They're prepared and presented well. Pretty straight forward with nothing really special or interesting about done.Beverage: The wine list is good, but a bit on the expensive side. Wines by the glass are poured a bit on the stingy side for what they are and what is charged.Service: Friendly and efficient. We were looked after very well during our visit.

title: The French Touch
review: From start to finish, Chez Moi gave us the French Touch. One had the feeling of being in a French bistro. Our party of four started with a salad, the onion soup, the charcuterie plate, and the foes gras -- thumbs up for all of the "pour commencer" dishes. For the entrees, we gave high marks to the cassoulet and the skate (portions large enough to share which we did). We divided one dessert -- the Gateau Breton Salidou, Brittany cake with salty caramel sauce and formage blanc ice cream. Formidable! As usual, we dined at 6 PM and had enjoyable conversations before the restaurant filled up. Chez Moi also has an outdoor seating area with good spacing between tables.If you are wanting for a more down home French experience, go directly to Chez Moi. Well priced for the quality of the food and experience.

title: Lincoln Park special restaurant
review: We celebrated our anniversary at Chez Moi and were happy we did.  Excellent service and food.  They even surprised us with a complimentary pre-dinner bubbly drink for our anniversary.

title: Very impressed
review: We dined here on a beautiful evening so we sat outside. One other reviewer mentioned that a planter box behind the bench seat where they were sitting was digging into his neck all night. Why not move the bench seat and table forward like we did? Problem solved. Staff were attentive and the meals were delicious. The bread was especially good. For dessert we had a delicious apple tart but I think the addition of the caramel sauce spoiled it. We enjoyed our experience at this restaurant and will definitely be back.

title: Surprisingly awful
review: Our party of 4 was really looking forward to our first visit to Chez Moi. However, it turned out to be one of the worst dining experiences we’ve ever had. It started when we arrived and the hostess only had one menu for 4 of us to share. She promised to return with more but never did. We were taken to a table in the back of the restaurant. (it's divided in 2 with the kitchen in the middle.). Perhaps it was because of the hot weather that day but that back room was unusually warm and stuffy. The smells from the nearby kitchen made it even worse. The menu problem was a harbinger of things to come as the service was dismal at best for the rest of the evening. We had to flag someone down every time we wanted anything….including the opportunity to order. Our reservation was at 7pm and we finally left at 9:45 but not because we enjoyed lingering over our meal but because it took forever to get anything including the check. Plates weren’t cleared, water glasses not filled, drink orders not taken. Then we sat with dessert menus for 20 minutes and no one ever returned to take a desert order. To make matters worse, no one at the restaurant ever acknowledged that there were on-going delays and sloppy service. By the way, the food ok but it was hard to enjoy.There are many good even great restaurants in Chicago. This is not one of them.

title: Nice brunch
review: We enjoyed our brunch at Chez Moi.  I had the Florentine Benedict and my husband had the French toast with fruit.  Both were good.  Service and ambiance was also nice.

title: Underwhelming
review: We were looking forward to Chez Moil after reading the reviews and hearing the raves from our concierge at our nearby B&B. Sadly, it did not live up to its reputation. First, we ate outside because it was a lovely evening and inside was dark and gloomy and empty; everyone else was sitting outside so we joined them. But the tables were very close together, wobbly and very uncomfortable (one person had to sit on a long bench that had a planter on the back top--which meant that the back part of the bench kept digging into his neck and back). Then there was the food. I ordered one of the daily specials--duck in a peach sauce, supposedly a Julia Child recipe but Julia would never use canned peaches! What's more, the duck was overdone, stringy and tough. We didn't risk dessert. The bread was good though!

title: Great service, very personal, cassoulet was great.
review: wonderful attentive service. perfect setting, good bar. each course was wonderful. waitress was a genius at pairings.

title: A Wonderful Place for a Small Celebration
review: On a recent trip to Chicago, I attended a brunch celebration at this restaurant. The hosts had reserved this bistro for several hours. The attentive staff poured never-ending mimosas throughout the affair and also attended to a variety of other beverage needs including non-stop coffee. The preset menu was served family style. The platters were filled to the brim. The first course was Salade Maison Chez Moi. This delightful starter had a tad too much dressing. The homemade bread baskets needed to be replenished at most tables.The main course included three entrees that were served in succession. Truites Beurre Blanc, Quiche Provencale, and Crepes Printemps. Despite the size of the crowd, all the platters were served piping hot. While I'm accustomed to eating a diet that has less butter, cheese, and cream, all the entrees were tasty and complimented one another.The finishing touch was Les Patisseries Chez Moi. These bite sized samples added to the caloric overload. After nibbling on a couple, I had totally maxed out on my saturated fat intact for the entire week, but was happy that I had indulged.Celebrations are meant for splurging. There's no doubt that Chez Moi can successful cater to a small crowd eager to be wined and dined.

title: French restaurant in Lincol park
review: Very nice atmosphere, ideal for a romantic dinner, a little expensive on the wines.Overall the experience was nice, we went out on a saturday night and the food was delicious. Not a big choice on the wine and overall a bit xpensive. A bit delusive on the desserts.

title: A Comfortable Bistro
review: A French bistro was a fitting choice for dinner after a Van Gogh exhibit at the Art Institute. Chez Moi offers a typical ambiance that is both welcoming and comfortable. Colorful walls with dark wood accents frame large paintings. The long, narrow room starts with a bar on one side and tables filling the rest of the space. Michael, our server, was prompt, efficient and very helpful. His friendly demeanor was a real plus to the evening.Classic cocktails were a bit pricey but generous and made with top shelf spirits. Craft beers and a good range of French wines appropriate for the menu are available. Buying a bottle generally is a better choice than by the glass. The menu is typical if a bit unimaginative. Bread for the table was excellent. Our mussels arrived in a quaint kettle with a generous mound of really good fries. The charcuterie plate was good but the sausage was missing. Entrees were well-portioned but had a few issues. A rack of pork was a bit under-cooked but it was corrected immediately. The Idaho Lake Rainbow Trout, though good, bore little resemblance to the description on the menu. Desserts were very good including a Brittany Cake and a superb Apple Tart.Chez Moi is a case of the whole being greater than the sum of its parts. Nothing was bad and everything was good to very good. The room and staff were inviting and our dinner was enjoyable. Yes, there are some better or more authentic bistros in Chicago but we had a very nice evening. And, isn’t that what It’s all about?

title: They forgot how to be French
review: Don't expect an omelette as you would get in France, just another boring American omelette! The Salade Lyonnaise was under seasoned and did not meet the real definition of "lardons". Fries were undercooked and soft - not real French Fries, more like British "chips.". The quiche would have been unrecognizable in France. At least the burger was well cooked and presented. Under performing service staff. A real disappointment overall.

title: Enjoyable visit
review: What a nice restaurant for weekend brunch - delicious omelette and not too expensive. Staff were very attentive and nice.

title: Sweet Surprise
review: Hubby brought me here for Valentine's Day as he knows I love French cuisine...We sat in the back dining room this time and passed by the kitchen on the way there - lots of hustle bustle there but everyone was friendly and warm.The tables were very pretty strewn with rose petals....I had the Scallops & Mussels with polenta & bok choy which was one of the Specials and highly recommended by our server. Delicious, rich, decadent. I would have preferred my Scallops perfectly pan seared but still really enjoyed my dish. Hubby liked his Fish dish which they made a combo of the 2 (Salmon & Trout) as he loves the Red wine reduction part of one.Pinot Blanc was a good accompaniment to the scallops. The Reisling was not as light & sweet as we would have liked.Hubby had gotten me some luscious desserts from Swedish Bakery waiting at home so we skipped dessert here this time.

title: Cosy and intimate, with lovely food.
review: We visited this restaurant with friends who live locally. It is small and cosy, with appealing decor and friendly staff. The food was very good and reasonably priced - we shared a small cheese plate between 3 for a starter then had cassoulet, lamb shank and lamb stew special. All were piping hot, good sized portions without being overwhelming. There was a good choice of wine and the staff were attentive and helpful. We'd certainly go there again.

title: New Years Eve at Che Moi
review: Couldn't have been a better choice: nice restaurant, great food, great atmosphere! We were even encouraged to stay for the Midnight celebration with personel and staff. Owner and chef made the point to come and sit and visit with every table, as if we were longtime friends. It sure felt like this. Going back there this Friday! Can't wait!

title: Popular but stunningly mediocre
review: We had a group dinner before theater at $55 prix fixe for 3 courses on a Saturday night. Most were happy enough with dinner. I was not. Onion soup Ok but it had some mediocre American cheese on top rather than gruyere. The roast chicken dish I ordered was dried out, served on top of mashed potatoes with a few springs of broccoli rape and overflowing on a too small plate making it hard to eat neatly...why the overly small plate? The dessert...creme brûlée was merely tolerable.Service pleasant. Owner proud of his culinary skills but hard to see why.

title: Pleasant Ambience, Yummy Food
review: Chez Moi has done a terrific job at updating and lightening up the interior from the previous restaurant. The entrance is met by an intimate bar. The dozen or so small "engraved or branded" tables, some against a booth extending the length of one wall, present an uncluttered ambience. The rustic wooden floor and simple light fixtures add to the simplicity.Service was pleasant and attentive. When asked, our waiter advised that the salad would be large enough to share. Like the restaurant itself, the salad was simple but served with a well seasoned, light vinaigrette. The bread was hearty with a very crunchy crust and perfect for sopping up gravy. The house merlot was fragrant, and perfectly accompanied both the lobster ravioli with seared scallops over creamy polenta and the lamb shank with grilled veggies and cous cous bathed in a rich broth. The portions were generous and filling, we were grateful we had split the salad. We perused the menu and found the prix fix menu to be a very tempting choice for a return visit.

title: Not Yet
review: A relatively recent arrival on the Lincoln Park Scene, Chez Moi replaced an institution when it arrived in the present location almost five years ago. The new decor is working nicely, with better tables and chairs, and the arrangement remains tight and cosy. The menu, which offers all the stalwarts of Brasserie cooking is ok, without being excellent: my steak was not very warm, and not rare, either. The wine list is compact and French-heavy, as it should be.

title: Scrumptious onion soup
review: Our party of 5 dined at 6:00 pm on a Sunday. The restaurant was full and lively. Tables are a bit too close together so ask for seating by a wall. Three of us hat the 3 course prix fix menu. The first course onion soup had the right amount of broth, onions bread and melted cheese. Other great choices were the fois gras (with a glass of Sauternes) and escargot. The fish and chicken entrees were very good. However the vegetarian entree had vegetables that were overlooked and the cous cous was very scant in the dish. I would select a different entree next time. Desserts are awesome and very shareable.

title: Friendly "French" away from the downtown bustle
review: My husband & I visited Chez Moi after strolling through Zoo Lights at Lincoln Park Zoo. (It's several blocks directly west of the zoo.) It is a warm & inviting spot & we immediately felt welcome. Some people consider French cuisine too frou- frou but we found some perfect winter comfort food on the menu: French onion soup, mussels, goat cheese salad, bacon-onion tart. There were several other larger entrees but we passed in favor of dessert: crime brûlée & Breton shortbread cake. Everything was delicious. We are looking forward to a warm weather visit so we can enjoy the outdoor cafe seating.

title: Delicious
review: Thank you Chez Moi for a lovely evening in your cozy restaurant. Our attentive server was so helpful, gladly explaining menu items and making recommendations. The lamb dish she recommended was excellent- aromatic, tender, and tasty. The French onion soup was also very very good.

title: A La Carte Chicago class
review: I attended the (h)amburger class. What a fabulous time! The chef was a master at combining layered flavors on the three "hamburgers" he served. The food was SO good. I cannot emphasize the SO good enough!! There was a tuna, duck, and cheese (only) sandwich...all served on mouth watering brioche buns.The three were paired with delicious beers. I was fascinated with his preparations and learned a lot. It was a great class. I can't wait to attend the A La Carte Chicago dinner or another meal there.

title: A unique French bistro in the heart of Lincoln Park
review: Chez Moi opened in 2012 and was immediately acknowledged as one of the best new restaurants in Chicago according to Chicago Magazine. Located at 2100 North Halsted Street in the heart of Lincoln Park, it is a unique French bistro that was created by chef Dominique Tougne, who was chef de cuisine at Chicago's Bistro 110 from 1996 to 2011, with the help of former Chicago Blackhawks player Cristobal Huet. Translated, Chez Moi means my place/home. The restaurant is intimate and comfortable, the service is warm and friendly and the food is feasty and delicious. Crystal chandeliers serve as a twinkling Parisian sky. Candles are street lamps and an oversized clock looks like it came from the Giant of Casteinau's wristwatch. Many of Tougne's recipes come from his grandmother's restaurant in Bordeaux, such as the beurre blanc sauce of his wild mushroom ravioli and the spices of his cassoulet, a slow-cooked meat casserole that originated in the South of France. Or how about his gateau breton salidou, described as "the biggest and best shortbread cookie on the planet" by one food critic. The menu is so appetizing and unique that you want to bring four or six people to the table and order different items, then critique them all. For example, which appetizers do you prefer--mussels or escargots or Charcuterie plate or bacon and onion tart or Boudin aux Pommes or Quail in a Pot or sauteed foie gras? Soups and salads? As you might expect, the French Onion soup is one-of-a-kind. So is Green Beans Perigord. Entrees? You can't go wrong with Beef Tenderloin en Croute or Braised Lamb Shank Tagine or Salmon Filet or Lobster Ravioli and Maine Scallops Duo or Idaho Lake Rainbow Trout or Canard (Duck) a l'Orange or Chez Moi's Burger (beef, braised short ribs) or Wild Mushroom Ravioli or Steak Frites au Poivre. Something for everybody. And save room for dessert, either Gateau Breton Salidou (Brittany cake with salty caramel sauce and Fomage Blanc ice cream) or Profiteroles (my wife's favorite, which you don't find on many menus) or home-made apple tart or Vacherin Fruits de la Passion (Vacherin Passion fruit sorbet, fresh raspberries, mini meringue) or dark chocolate mousse. It's so good that you might forget that you have a pair of theater tickets in your pocket.

title: Chez Moi’s Mussel Fest Is Outstanding!
review: Chez Moi is also a great after-work hangout. They offer Happy Hour specials 5:00pm to 7:00pm… Half-price wines by the glass and half-price appetizers.I dined at Chez Moi on Sunday evening September 20th and the restaurant was packed. The General Manager, Donald Whitcomb, knew many of the patrons by first name.They have great food, at a fair price, with excellent service in a warm and inviting atmosphere. What else can you ask for?The All-You-Can-Eat Mussels promotion runs in September and is a must try. The mussels are brought to your table with a full portion of French fries.The price is $25 per person. In my opinion, this is a great deal!I recommend you try a serving of the four types of mussels.· Marinières Mussels: White Wine, Shallots, Parsley, Butter, Lemon· Belgium Mussels: Beer, Cream, Bacon· Mediterranean Mussels: Tomatoes, Saffron Rice, Onions, Basil· Lobster Bisque Mussels: Lobster Cream

title: Gorgeous Pre Theater Dinner
review: My husband and I had a Groupon to use at Chez Moi. We were welcomed on the phone and on our arrival. Our server was top notch! We remembered our server from the previous restaurant on the premises. The wait staff was also nicely attentive! I asked for some wine recs and we got great ones! I ordered the cassoulet and it was fantastic! I also ordered the salad with fried goat cheese and it was just delicious! My husband ordered the whole red snapper that he loved! He also ordered the spinach soup that was delicious! We were too full for dessert! Will definitely go back!

title: Yummy
review: Wonderful food, atmosphere and service. Try a specialty martini and the escargot. We all tried different things for dinner, lobster ravioli, half a chicken and beef, all very good. Found this on a groupon for a wonderful deal and glad I did. Our server heard us talking about our daughters upcoming birthday and brought her out dessert with a candle.

title: Not Bad, Not Great
review: Simple, French fare. Nothing all that special. The steak frites were just okay: the cut of beef was pretty low budget, and stringy, and the fries weren't all that good. But the rest of the meal was decent. The wine selection is average as well, with not-very-good negociant wines populating the list. The service was somewhat cloying, as if personalizing the interaction guarantees authenticity. All in all, I'd frequent this place if I lived near by, but wouldn't go out of my way to eat there.

title: Rich, Heavy French Food
review: A romantic dinner. We had the sauteed foie gras. That was rich and fatty. She had the duck orange. Turns out she is not of fan of duck. Too fatty. I had the braised pork rib. So good, and so rich. We felt heavy and full. But, there was dessert. Creme brullee and cake. Amazing. But, we felt even heavier. By then, we called it a night. Thanked the chef and place. and went back home. Eat here on an empty stomach. I mean totally empty.

title: Late Evening Bite to Eat
review: Great atmosphere and very helpful staff.  The Sauteed Foie Gras was great as well as the wild mushroom ravioli.

title: Superb experience
review: Beautiful restaurant with an interesting (varied, fresh, nice combinations) menu. I had the Brussels sprouts soup to start, my husband the roasted beet salad. My entrée was the wild mushroom ravioli; my husband had the lobster mousse ravioli with scallops. We shared the Brittany cake with salted caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream. Every thing was tremendous; the scallops were the best my husband had ever had. Wish we lived closer (we are from Portland, OR) ... I'd make this a routine must!

title: Good food. Price not too outrageous.
review: Took my wife and daughter last night on Monday. Very much enjoyed our meal and whole experience. Elizabeth was our server and she saw to it that we had a nice evening. I had the lamb shank which lay on a bed of mashed potatoes. It seemed to have a bit of an Indian flair to it. Maybe a little curry in there. My wife had the beef in puff pastry and my daughter had the kids steak. We were all quite pleased with our main course. We also had French onion soup to start with as well as an onion tart. Both were outstanding! Since it was my wife's 40th birthday they offered us a free house dessert which was a sweet bread pie with caramel sauce and ice cream. If I weren't so full I would've gotten another one. Hope we can go back soon.

title: Nice quiet spot!
review: WE had dinner here on Saturday night before Steppenwolf. It is a lovely little French restaurant with a very quaint atmosphere. The food was very good. We had the skate fish and the chicken. Both were well prepared and presented. The 3 course dinner at $29 is a great value as well. I would recommend if you are in the neighbor and want a nice quiet spot for dinner. If you are going to Steppenwolf, you can valet here and walk to the theater for $10...a better deal then parking again down by the theater.

title: Friendly staff with an exceptional menu of delicious fare!
review: This is a lovely, quaint french restaurant. We were greeted by a gracious welcome and big smiles. You felt like they honestly appreciated you dining with them. Our meal was excellent, crab cakes, delicious bisque, fantastic roasted chicken, the best bay scallops on half shell ever and all beautifully presented. I took my husband to this treasure spot for his birthday and we left wanting to return as soon as possible. I had heard the Chef is from France and was thrilled to eat his creations! A must go to bistro in the heart of Lincoln Park!

title: Wonderful food and staff
review: Whether you are coming after a night of heavy drinking or simply want to have a great brunch with friends, you will not be disappointed. My husband and I stopped in on a snowy Sunday morning and fell in love with this place. We have been several times since and each time is better than the last. We are working our way through the menu and so far we have not been disappointed in the least. Great people and authentic french brunch food. Their cocktails are also great and I highly recommend their Mimosas.

title: Tasty French Bistro fare on Halsted
review: French onion soup was phenomenal on a cold nite. The roasted beet salad was even better. The server helped us pick nice French wines. Steak au Poivre was tasty and the Cassoulet was delicious. Do not miss the Profiteroles. We will be back. The prix fixe three course menu looked like a great value, we may try that next visit.

title: C'est magnifique!
review: A small French bistro in Lincoln Park with fabulous food and a happy chef! Appetizers are large and can serve for a meal if you have a small appetite.  French onion soup is to die for.  Save room for the chocolate mousse!

title: Quaint bistro bday dinner
review: Enjoyed a lovely little dinner with hubby on my bday here :Quaint little bistro, chef comes out to check on us, friendly service, decadent French food...Escargot - garlicky & buttery!The special was bouillabaisse - fresh & yummy!Hubby liked his trout as well.They brought out a delicious cheesecake with salty sweet caramel lit with a candle. Very nice....

title: Just so average
review: We have been here four times, as it is fairly close to our house. We really love classic bistro fare, and have really tried to like this place. Unfortunately, we come away disappointed every time. Food is routinely overly cooked and overly salted. Servers are earnest, but frantic (even when the place is not crowded), and food arrives sporadically, and sometimes in the wrong order. When there last week, the waiter delivered the wrong soup, then blamed the face that there were four different prix fixe menu specials going on, and thus he couldn't keep things straight if he tried. There are many better places to go for the price.

title: Uncooperative
review: we had a groupon which clear stated $65, and in the fine print it said must include ordering 2 meals..So we did- we ordered 3 different appetizers (I'm vegetarian and most main courses were meat) and my BF ordered a main course..At the end of the night the server refused to honor the Groupon bc she claims we did not order two meals..Very poor business direction as we were obviously there testing the place out- which is the point restaurants do Groupons and because of her poor customer service we will not be back.

title: Good food, relaxed atmosphere
review: We enjoyed our dinner at Chez Moi very much. The restaurant is a ten minute walk from Steppenwolf Theater. The food was excellent. When I eat in a French Bistro I expect really good roast chicken and Chez Moi met my test. The wine list was interesting and the waiter was able to make good suggestions. The service was also very good. The staff was friendly without being intrusive.

title: Real French cooking
review: We celebrated last Valentine Day at Chez Moi : with a room full and very busy, service was as attentive as possible. Food was great as usual. Cassoulet was better than many I had around Castelnaudary ...Do not hesitate to order boudin [blood sausage] : you won't find many like that one in the Greater Chicagoland.As for desserts, choice is difficult between Creme Brulee [my favorite], Mousse au Chocolat et Tarte aux Pommes. A real toss-up.Enjoy !Jack M.

title: New Year's Eve dinner
review: Food was good to excellent. Beef Bourguignon was delicious and our favorite dish. We also liked the French Onion Soup and the Cassoulet. I had to send back the Cassoulet because the first dish was not hot, but the second dish was very good. Nice carafe of specialty New Year's punch. Two negatives of the night were the restaurant did NOT honor their prix fixe menu despite we were there for a pre-theatre dinner and the Gâteau Breton Salidou sauce was buttery and creamy, but the cake was dry and slightly too salty.

title: Not so much ambiance, but very tasty...
review: The French Onion Soup was too bready and had the stronger tasting sour dough bread than it should have. More onion and cheese would have made this much tastier. I had the Beef Tenderloin in Phyllo Crust and the crust was too well done to be enjoyed. The beef was very tender and perfectly prepared and tasty. The La crème brulée de Chez Moi was very tasty...

title: Great French restaurant
review: This restaurant looks like a restaurant from Paris.French food is typically rich but the chef has made modifications keeping the flavors and yet not very rich.

title: Truly Outstanding Food and Service
review: This chef creates wonderful meals, perfectly cooked, incredible tastes, and does it without the pomp and circumstance of his competitors. Everything was delicious from the steaks to the fish to the Cassoulet. Desert was super, wine list extremely reasonable, and service was like being in your Mom's home, so welcoming, friendly, and yet professional. This is a restaurant not to be missed!ZB

title: Great food and service
review: The Mushroom Cigar was not only delicious but we used the rustic bread to finish off the red wine sauce. The dressing on the lentil salad was light and only enhanced the taste of the fresh vegetables. My companions finished every drop of the French onion soup as well as the Cassoulet. My bouillabaisse was perfect especially after I mixed the aioli into the broth. Although the mousse was light and rich, it was the Gâteau Breton Salidou that stole the show.

title: C'est Magnifique!
review: I have eaten at Chez Moi several times since it opened and can say with authority that it is nothing short of wonderful! From the moment you enter the front door, the whole experience is a treat. Gorgeous food - can't say enough about the cassoulet or the duck - a creative range of apperitif offerings - and a chef/owner who puts a whole new spin on congenial. Chef Domi is a combination of gentle giant and culinary genius. His classical training in the kitchens of such luminaries as Paul Bocuse shines in every dish coming out of the kitchen. He makes a point of visiting with his guests as they dine, sharing wonderful stories of his childhood in France. You'll hear as much French as English spoken at the tables around you - testament to the veracity at the heart of every item on the menu. The building itself is a gem with speakeasy history and stunning architecture. Don't miss a chance to visit!

title: A delightful Bistro!
review: We had a delightful dinner at Chez Moi. We were there in-time to take advantage of their Early Bird prix fixe menu which is a tremendous value. We started with the Soup du Jour (cream of asparagus) and the Green lentil salad. Both were excellent. Although their cassoulet has chicken instead of the traditional duck, it has a rich flavor that includes rosemary and mixes well with white beans. It is also a very filling dish. The Idaho trout with sorrel and quinoa offers complementary flavors that enhance the fish. Also as expected, Chez Moi serves an excellent complimentary French bread that's crusty on the outside but chewy on the inside. For dessert we would recommend the Gateau Breton Salidou which is a dense butter cake topped with a scoop of not too sweet ice cream in a caramel sauce. You can control the overall sweetness by how much caramel sauce you use. We have found that the wines by the glass are very pricey. The Staff was very friendly and attentive. The meal was served at a good pace. The room is conversation friendly. If you like bistro food, don't miss Chez Moi and take advantage of their Early Bird prix fixe..

title: Excellent Sunday Brunch
review: Excellent crepes and ham and cheese sandwich. Wonderful intimate French decor for small restaurant. Cappuccino was excellent would have been even better in a large cup for $5. Bloody Mary was also good but rather small glass.

title: An authentic French Bistro in the heart of Lincoln Park
review: Chez Moi offers a menu very much like any you would find in a good Parisian restaurant. I ordered the trout with artichokes and mushrooms, which came with two filets and a good helping of vegetables. The profiteroles were were served with Chez Moi homemade ice cream, a light puff pastry, and one of the best chocolate sauces I have ever tasted.The warm bread comes from La Fournette, the authentic French boulangerie on Wells Street. Chez Moi has a three course fixed price menu for only $29, a value considering the quality and the amount of food.The service is attentive and polite. I felt like an regular from the moment I walked through the door.They have outdoor seating, or a comfortable dining room.Valet parking, of course. Chez Moi is on the site of the old Cafe Barnard. The new restaurant is at least as good, and in many ways even better.

title: I've found my French restaurant in Chicago!
review: On Friday evening, we planned to attend a show at the Greenhouse Theater, and I was looking for a restaurant within walking distance. I found Chez Moi on Google Maps and noted that it was a short walk away from the theater, so I checked it out on Yelp, not having ever heard of it. The reviews were good, so we went there with high hopes, and we were not disappointed!First of all, Chez Moi has a very attractive menu, with a $29.00 prix fixe menu offered from 5:00 PM to 6:30 PM. All the starred items can be had on the prix fixe menu. For a starter, I ordered the Soupe Gratinée à l'oignon, for my main dish the Poulet Rôti with mashed potatoes, and for dessert I had la crème brulée. My husband had a green salad with roasted pumkin seeds, garlic croutons, and tomatoes. For his main dish, he ordered the Cassoulet, and for dessert, he had Gâteau Breton Salidou -- Breton cake with ice cream. My crème brulée was wonderful, but the Breton cake was amazing! I asked our very friendly waiter, Mike, which of two Rose wines was better, and he replied without hesitation that the Château Haut-Sarthes, Bergerac was the better wine, and he was right! I'm now looking for a bottle. I also asked him about the bread. It was so good that I thought maybe it had come from La Fournette, and he told me that it did! The chef is wonderful, the food was perfectly prepared, and the staff was very efficient, as well as friendly. The chef, from the Alsace region of France, came out and chatted with all the diners. He spent a leisurely time chatting with us about Paris, where he lived for fifteen years. I have no complaints about Chez Moi, and we will definitely be back!

title: Promising But No
review: My wife decided we wanted French and started to head to Le Sardine. On the way we passed chez moi. We were greeted at the door with a big enthusiastic smile and taken to the chef's room. It was nice, quite and sort of romantic. Our waitress greeted us almost right away and had the same enthusiasm. She helped us with the menu. I got asparagus salad, my wife French onion soup. We shared froglegs from a crippled frog because you only got three. No prob. Eventually my wine came and my wife liked it so she kept it and I ordered something else. I had duck confit and it was really good, not great. My wife enjoyed her scallops. We both had the Brittany Cake which was good and different but really sweet. The problem is that I had to wait forever for my wine. Plus a super loud table of four was a romantic buzzkill next to us. That's not why this gets only three stars. The obnoxious table came in after us, ordered after us and got served before us. We felt forgotten after the wine and had too watch the table next to us get served consistently ahead of us. There are great French restaurants in Chicago, kiki's bistro, le sardine etc. in retrospect we should have just kept going.

title: Food not good, greasy and expensive
review: We had escargot and a kindaskillet stuff plus both soups,mushrooms and onions.mashrooms tasted like from dried and not fresh and onions was just ok. Escargot was filled with butter,garlic but that's how it has to be,maybe and the skillet was IDK a leftover of the fridge all cooked together with an egg and no meaning and,of course butter butter butter. Wine:2bottles one Bordeaux was worth the money the other was a 3$on the shelf sold x10. Very expensive but the spot is nice

title: Chez Moi is Tres Magnifique!
review: This was my first time here, although my wife and grown kids have raved about it. They weren't kidding! Dominique and his beautiful wife India, along with our server Brittany were quite simply...PERFECT. And that was before we tasted our first bite! The food is lovingly prepared, beautifully presented and tastes phenomenal. I can't praise this little gem enough. Please go, you will not regret it!

title: Neighborhood Gem - French Bistro
review: This gem of a French bistro in the Lincoln Park area does a dine job with the classics expected in such a setting. I ate here with a colleague on a Thursday evening and was quite pleased with the food, ambiance, and service.Be careful to make a reservation if you want to get in on a weekend, as the place will bet very busy. They have valet parking, but on-street parking is no problem during the week.

title: We thought it was good?
review: It was Chef's week and we both heard fixed price of $24. When we got our bill it was $44. So we questioned it and the manager offered us nothing but an answer that both go us were mistaken. Not a good way to treat customers. Don't go there they aren't interested in you!

title: As much as I hate to share this neighborhood 'find', I must...
review: ...since it's only fair that I recommend it to you all. Chez Moi is a gem--one that works for friends and families, for couples, for business, and even when you're on your own and want to indulge in delicious, authentic, true bistro fare. Each time I'm there, something else reminds me of beloved trips to France--even when all I hear around me is English. Try the fish dishes, as well as the braised pork, and save room for the creme brulee!

title: Chez More for Chez Slightly above average
review: I heard this place was a little more expensive and nothing notable, but decided to go anyway. My wife's steak was average but my ravioli was pretty good. Her soup French soup was average-my Foie Gras was good but small portioned. Ambience of the room was nice. I guess we crossed it off the list, but not sure I am going back as there are several other French places in Chicago that are better.

title: C'est magnifique!
review: I think we saved the best for last during Chicago Restaurant week--Chez Moi! On a cold, snowy night we were transported to Paris for a delicious, beautifully served three course dinner. We each tried different courses and all six choices were remarkable. The wild mushroom and potato gnocchi au gratin first course was so flavorful I found myself scraping the plate. Cassoulet, duck confit shepard's pie and two equally fabulous desserts were memorable. Attentive service.

title: Good French cuisine
review: Went here with 2 friends.  We split some appetizers and a few mains.  All were quite good.  The wine list was very nice as well.  I'll be back.

title: Dining Out
review: The food and service were excellent. The server was very knowledgeable not only about the menu items but also about the wine list. The restaurant was within a 2 block walking distance from the B&B and this was great as you did not have to take a cab.

title: Perfection
review: We went here last night and sat at the bar. We didn't have reservations, but the bar was empty. Though we arrived for a pretty early dinner (6:30 PM), the restaurant was already very full.First, the service was amazing. Even though we were at the bar, all of the staff was very attentive and did a great job any questions we had on the menu.I also loved the decor and ambiance. It's not stuffy, but still classy, intimate, and romantic. Most of the diners were an older crowd, but there were a few tables of people in their 20s as well.For our meal, we went all out. We started with the escargot that, though good, was a little bland. For main course, I had one of their specials, Bouillabaisse, which was absolutely amazing. I wish it were always on their menu - I'd be back every week! It was truly one of the best dishes I've had in quite a while. The broth was irresistibly delicious (I did dip my bread in it), and all of the seafood was cooked to perfection. I couldn't get enough! My husband also said his cassoulet was delicious and finished the plate. I tried it but still think my dish blew the cassoulet out of the water. We finished with the bread pudding. We are both big fans of bread pudding, and this was one of the best I've tried. It was moist, flavorful, and had a delicious caramel sauce.To drink, I tried the French 75 (recommended) and they had an excellent wine special ($35 bottle) which was delicious and very reasonably priced. We had a wonderful experience, and I am looking forward to returning to try more of the delectable menu!

title: Small, intimate and unique, but expensive
review: Very unique items on the menu, only about 10 tables in the restaurant, nice waiter, but pricey. I haven't spent enough time in France to say if it was authentic, but they had a lot of items that you rarely see on menus. My friends and I all ordered something we were unfamiliar with and were surprised, but dinner and 2 bottles of wine among 4 people was $50 each.

title: Nice breakfast
review: We ate outdoors which is nice since it is not on main drag. Inside looks appealing for late lunch or dinner

title: Intimate, friendly place to stop in Lincoln Park
review: Strolling and shopping with a girlfriend in the area, and we came across Chez Moi. We were just looking for coffee and dessert, and the posted menu seemed to fit the bill. When we went inside and saw the lovely bistro decor, and were asked if we had a reservation, we thought we might be turned away, but they were very friendly and accommodating. We had a slice of double chocolate cake, and the waitress recommended the house special dessert, the Gateau Breton. It's hard to describe how good this is - shortbread-like cake with warm caramel and a beurre blanc ice cream. Delicious. Service was friendly and attentive, and we didn't feel rushed, even as the restaurant started to fill up with local regulars for Sunday dinner. Can't speak to the full menu, but if the dessert is any indication, I'd certainly come back.

title: Worth the visit
review: I was with a group which pretty much had reserved the whole of this small neighborhood bistro. Because of the size of our group, we had a pre-set menu with specific entree choices. As such I did not have an opportunity to experience the menu, but ordered the salmon from our offered choices. My meal was thoroughly enjoyable, the salmon was moist and flavored perfectly. The appetizers were pre-ordered, and likewise were very good. I like the neighborhood ambience and would return here.

title: Disappointing
review: We hubby and I went here for our anniversary trip to Chicago, we were so excited for the French food we had heard about on this website. We ordered frog legs as our appetizer, which were very good, but there were only 4 for two people and anyone who's had frog legs before knows that is like only having one wing at a bar. It came on a bed of ratatouille, which was the best part of the meal. The wine was fine, not the best but not the worst. I had the rack of lamb, it was fine, cooked properly but there were only four tiny pieces that were literally one bite each, the ratatouille was excellent, but the eggplant that came with it was awful, but luckily my hubby finished it. He had one of the steaks and it was the worst steak I've had. The cut was cheap and so tough his jaw hurt after only eating half. I tried a few bites and was thoroughly disappointed as well. We tried to recover the meal with the Brittany cake which our server recommended, it was so hard and stale we couldn't finish it. The worst cake we've ever ate. We were so disappointed. The only good part other than the ratatouille was the atmosphere with was cozy and very lovely, however, if we were older we would have needed more than the tea-light candle to read our menus. Our bill for 2 was over $100, not worth the price.

title: A Unique French Bistro
review: It was girls' night out and we were celebrating a birthday. We needed to eat fairly early so we could get to a show nearby. A call was made to Chez Moi and we discovered that they offered a special $29 three-course menu for reservations seated before 6:30. So, at 6pm, we entered the charming bistro and from salad to dessert, enjoyed every morsel of an absolutely delicious and ridiculously filling (but too good to stop eating) meal. Because we had some special diet concerns, Chef/owner Dominique took the time to stop by our table and discuss the menu options. He's the father of two children who have food allergies so he understands and is willing to accommodate allergies and food sensitivities. Be sure to state any special needs when you make your reservation. It was truly one of the best meals I've ever had and I eagerly anticipate the next visit.

title: Delicious French Bistro in inviting Chicago neighborhood
review: For lovers of Steak Au Poivre, Chez Moi is the place! The best I've ever had outside of Paris! And great bread, perfectly dressed very fresh salads and not-to-be-missed desserts! What more can you ask for? And great service too!!

title: Real French Food with Nice Service
review: Again, one of those small places that we rely on for regular visit. Nice French food that you can find in the city. The service is always nice. Dominique is most friendly chef you can find. :-) Great place to enjoy a nice casual food.

title: Great FRENCH food as if you were there
review: Was there with a group of friends for an informal meeting, they have greatly welcomed us.The staff was very friendly and the buffet they had set up for us was excellent.The smells coming from the kitchen really want me to go back and taste more.Plus Dominique the CHEF was very involved with our group making sure all was fine.If you want to make a “quick trip to France” while you are in Chicago “allez Chez Moi” you will feel being in the a small local restaurant as if you were there.Bonne appétit!

title: My Favorite French Restaurant in Chicago!
review: We came here for Mother's Day brunch, and it was phenomenal! Everything we had was beyond delicious. I highly recommend this Chicagoan restaurant (it's in Lincoln Park) - it's better than any of those franchise touristy places downtown. My hats off to the chef! I will certainly be returning soon!

title: Good value
review: The prix fixe is an outstanding value. The menu is small and traditional Bistro food. My salmon in Buerre blanc was reliable but not outstanding. The sautéed spinach and asparagus were fresh and well prepared. I was call this comfort food. The wine list is small and mainly limited to the Alsace. I think I need to give this another try and see if my ting will change.

title: The best bartender in Chicago!
review: The food was good enough to go back a second time in a 4 day trip.....stay away from the chicken as it was dry and flavorless......the cassoleut was outstanding.....as was the creme bulee especially with blueberries......however, the best part was Micci the bartender who was lively, would accomodate all wishes and really made each evening special....eat at the bar for lively conversations and excellent service!

title: Nice atmosphere, friendly service, average food.
review: This is a relatively new restaurant in the same space occupied by a long time favorite. While the staff was very friendly and accommodating, we felt the food was just average. The escargot was nicely served in a puff pastry but were not as flavorful as one would expect. The steak I selected was quite tough and when I mentioned this to the waitress, she took it away and brought me another immediately and was very nice about it. Unfortunately, the replacement was just as tough. I think it was more about the cut of meat than the preparation. Neither filet nor New York cuts are available. This was something called a hangar steak. The chicken dish ordered by my friend was a very large portion, but there was nothing special about it. The ambiance is exceptional and the service is great but we were disappointed in the quality of the ingredients and the lack of imagination in the dishes we ordered. For us, French food is all about the sauces. We expected more because of the chef's connection with Bistro 110, another long time Chicago favorite. I don't mean for this to be a negative review. This is based on one visit on a Tuesday night and we only sampled three things on the menu. Overall, the experience was a good one and I would urge you to try it. Your tastes and selections may result in a totally different experience.

title: A delightful dining experience
review: I was there with 8 other business colleagues and we all LOVED our dinner.  The foie gras and Cassoulet were amazing.  I highly recommend the Gâteau Breton Salidou for desert!!

title: Transported to France!
review: Wonderful authentic regional French food, large portions, friendly staff. Will return often. Wish menu had smoked salmon or other light appetizer choice.

title: Wonderful local French bistro
review: My husband and I happened upon this restaurant while on a walk with our son last summer and ended up enjoying a delicious brunch outside on their sidewalk café. We've been back several times since then and find the service very friendly and the food delicious. They have a to-die-for dessert that we keep going back for, the Gateau Breton, that is out of this world! Nearly every time we've been there, either the chef or his wife come around to the tables and personally chat with the patrons. It's very nice.

title: Nice local bistro
review: My wife and I went to Chez Moi for Sunday brunch. This is a casual local bistro with an inviting atmosphere. There are a variety of French brunch offerings. We had the quiche lorraine which was very good.

title: Stay Away
review: A disaster in a nasty environment. He used to be a good chef. We booked a special birthday dinner and got a common sports bar atmosphere as they turned on a football game with blaring sound. The food was average. With good bistros like Mon Ami Gabi, Cyrano's Farm and Kitchen, Bistro Margot....the is absolutely NO reason to every visit this place,

title: Walk-In and Welcome
review: My wife and I took a chance on a recent stormy evening, walking into this new little bistro with no reservation and in search of a light supper, and were well pleased.The room is calm and quiet, tables decently spaced, atmosphere simple and welcoming.Wine selections by the glass are limited, but adequate. Salads were small and tasty -- my wife had the beet and I the endive. She followed with onion soup -- here nicely light and flavorful, when over-weight is a risk; I had the fish stew, which was very fresh and pleasant -- essentially a bowl of shellfish and salmon with broth up to the brim. In all, as an uncomplicated choice in the neighborhood, a welcome addition.

title: Dinner well below expectations
review: Wine very affordable but poor quality. Wine by glass mediocre but mercifully served in small portion. Cassoulet was uninspired;endive salad very small even for price. Mussels also just average. Trout, however, was well prepared and meaty. Clearly the restaurant has a following but there are better moderately priced French bistros. Maybe we just had a bad experience.

title: Wonderful Neighborhood Gem
review: My husband and I had a great meal with great service at Chez Moi. This restaurant being less than two miles from our home, makes it perfect for walking. We were escorted to our table as soon as we entered. Very welcoming ambience but, we were directed to the back room that is conversationally comfortable and our waitress was very helpful. I had the foie gras and the mussels that were delicious. Next time we go, I will order the hanger steak that my husband has this time. It was cooked to perfection and mouthwatering. The chocolate mouse was amazing with little pieces of crunchy carame. It is a chocolate lover's crown!Great place and I recommend it.

title: Great Neighborhood Bistro!
review: Chez Moi is a charming, delicious French bistro in the heart of Lincoln Park. Chef Dominique is a master of flavorful sauces that compliment his entrees and appetizers. The trout with a white wine butter sauce is delicate and will leave you licking your plate, the steak frite is classic and flavorful, and the seafood stew...oh the seafood stew! For the more adventurous, try the pigs feet. They are ridiculously decadent. And save room for dessert.The staff are knowledgable and gracious. The interior is charming and classy (I'm trying to figure out how to smuggle out one of the cool chandeliers out without anyone noticing). Overall, great for dates, friends and families.

title: delightful authentic French bistro in Lincoln Park
review: We were so happy to celebrate Julia Child's 100 th birthday at Chez Moi with her signature Pate Brisee, Boeuf Bourguignon, and glacage caramel; we arrived to a festive atmosphere and were immediately served the best kir Royal ( properly garnished with the tinest lime wedge) I've had since I was last in Paris! We arrived latish and so had the pleasure of meeting Chef Dominique Tougne as he strolled through have feed his adoring public. Chicagoians will remember Chef from his 15 years at Bistro 110. He's the real deal; loves what he does and likes uncomplicated dishes, which,in his words, contain 5 ingredients or less. And, boy oh boy, what he does with those five ingredients!!!!! He shared with us that he had met Julia Child twice and was proud that she also shared this sentiment.Love that he honored her; loved him even more. He's bigger than life with a stong handshake and beautiful accent that sung in my ears.Enjoyed his food for years at Bistro 110 and it was a happy discovery to find him in our neighborhood. it will be in our weekly rotation for sure!

title: Hot, New Bistro in Lincoln Park Has It All Together
review: This is about as good as bistro food gets. Small, attractive setting that is not overdone. Great service. Great food. Decent prices. And, as an extra attraction, a chef who looks like Hollywood central casting's image of a French bistro cook who comes to your table to see how you like the food. I am likely to become a regular customer.

title: great neighborhood restaurant
review: Authentic  French restaurant. Very good at reasonable prices. Not fine dining,  but very good bistro fare. Chef Domick is very  engaging and hospitable. Micheal, the head waiter from Cafe Bernard, is still providing excellent service,

title: Absolute gem!
review: Well located new bistro. We were greeted at the door by the owner and chef. Valet parking is available, but we easily had found street parking a short walk away. We started with the roasted garlic spread which comes with fries. (the fries are not noted on the menu.). I would never have guessed that fries would be fabulous dipped in garlic! Better than bread as we discovered. One criticism is that there are too few fries for the garlic, especially if the group avoids double dipping. I had the foie appetizer, the foie was melt in your mouth delicious, and the appetizer ( described as with oyster mushrooms in a pot wine sauce) comes loaded with asparagus, potatoes and a few other things. While I don't thing they are necessary for the foie, they elevated the appetizer to something a bit hardier. Others in our party enjoyed a beautifully prepared salad and onion soup. All plates returned to the kitchen empty!I had the mussel appetizer as a main course. Next time I would probably ask that it be up sized to a larger portion, not because I really needed more but because it was sooooo good. I like mussels, these were among the best I have had. I briefly debated drinking the remaining juices as a soup, I settled for lots of dipping of the bread into the bowl. Delicious!My husband was equally happy with the mushroom ravioli (I tasted it, very yummy) and our friend volunteered to return the following night for a repeat of the chicken dish. I ended with raspberry sorbet, good but too much. My husband loved his fruit soup!The service was great. Knowledgable and attentive without being overbearing. We will definitely be back.

title: Quaint and Friendly
review: Dinner after the Steppenwolf. Short walk from theater. Comfortable atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating. Chef/Owner visited our table and added to the enjoyment of the evening. Very friendly, jovial person. Had the chicken with light truffle sauce on spinach. Outstanding. If no one was looking I would have licked the plate. Fabulous flavors..."a party on my palate"

title: Excellent New French Bistro
review: This little gem of a place just opened in Lincoln Park at the corner of Halsted and Webster. The food was terrific and executed with French flair and artistry. Both of us ordered the trout and it was superb. Trout is easy to mess up, and no one makes it as well as I do, except this place. It was served on a bed of fingerling potatoes and chanterelle mushrooms with a wonderful beurre blanc sauce. The wine list was mostly French and reasonably priced although by the glass selections were expensive averaging aroun $11. Desert was also great. We chose a little salt cake and a creme brûlée both of which excelled.Service was attentive and friendly and experienced. We were delighted to see some of the same servers that had been with the previous restaurant on site, Cafe Bernard.ZB

title: Chez Dissapointing
review: After having read about chez moi on Urban Daddy we were willing to give it a try because we're fans of French cuisine and love to support independent restaurants. Our table was ready as we walked in the door and we were warmly greeted by the hostess. However from there the experience went straight down hill. Our server was both inept in his knowledge of the menu and accompanying wines and he also was no where to be found on several occassions while we waited for our drinks as they sat at the bar. The food was very forgettable and although the chef looked straight out of central casting he should have spent more time in the kitchen as we had dishes not properly prepared. The steak was very chewy and the pot pie was burned around the edges. When the bill arrived we had spent nearly $400 and we're all very disappointed as well as disgusted by the lack of value. We will go back to our old stand by Mon Ami Gabi next time which has is a model of consistency. chez moi, c'est la vie it was not meant to be

title: REAL FRENCH BISTRO WITH A REAL FRENCH COOK
review: Chez Moi is a new restaurant located at an old Cafe Bernard place. We knew Cafe Bernard for long time before the new owner overtook it, therefore when we first entered Chez Moi we were simply stunned. It was unbelievable how the place changed with the new and clean look. The menu was at the beginning difficult though because we did not recognize most of the dishes written with French phrases. Then, we met the owner and the cook. Mr. Dominic is really a wonderful person and great cook. He was born in France. He said his mother passed many recipes to him, which is priceless. He also has vast experience as the cook. He run Bistro 110 that is now closed and where we liked to dine. I do recommend the Chez Moi restaurant and I wish Mr. Dominic all the best. I am sure we will come here more often since the food was magnifique and it is the most important reason for us to return to the restaurant.

title: Wonderful location, and outstanding pizza!!
review: It all started with incredible service (thank you Caroline) and pizza was over-the-top delicious!! Perfect crust, fresh ingredients and fun dessert offerings (you've to to try the s'mores with vanilla ice cream...wow!). This place serves pizza the way it should be served...hot, well proportioned, with remarkable flavor!!

title: Great Food and service but a little bit over priced and greasy
review: Great service, even during covid. I ate outside on the patio. Received my food relatively fast; only took about 20 minutes to receive after server took my order. Ordered a medium pepperoni pizza and s'more ice cream for desert.Pizza was a little to greasy for my taste. The s'more ice cream desert a little to expensive. Not to bad though, I was craving ice cream that day.If you only a scoop of ice cream its currently $3, that's a great deal!Also, the restaurant is next the Brown line.

title: Great atmosphere and pizza
review: Great neighborhood favorite! Can get very loud inside. Great outdoor space when weather is nice.  Great food, service and drinks

title: So we ordered dinner from
review: So we ordered dinner from Homeslice and asked to have it delivered. The food was delivered cold (and not exceptionally prepared) an hour later and the order was incomplete, with my sons dinner missing. When I called to ask the restaurant how they would solve the problem related to the food that wasn’t delivered, they blamed the issue on DoorDash (who they use for their deliveries). But ultimately, I blame Homeslice - as I ordered from them (and even prepaid a $12 tip. They did commit to refund me for my son’s dinner. But ultimately, I ended up running to a store to buy food to make him as I didn’t want to wait another hour.

title: Good place to go for a group and share plates
review: We went with a large group, so we ordered several pizzas and salads to share. The salads were so much better than your average pizza place...nice variety and great ingredients. Try the Buffalo Blue Chicken salad...just the right amount of "spice" and not too spicy. Everyone liked the pizzas as well, especially the chewy crusts. Fun atmosphere as well.

title: Football Fun
review: Tasty Bloody Mary with a pizza slice attached. Hangover Helper drink with a donut attached. Goat cheese sticks appetizer was great, decorations, drink, food, service and atmosphere were all A++

title: Awesome food since day one, awesome staff as well!
review: Went there last night on a dreary fall evening on our way to an event and we didn't plan our time very well. Our server Matt was super friendly and helpful, brought our dinner out boxed to go and had the check to us in a jiffy so we could make our event on time. We used to live near by and haven't been pretty much since they opened, the interior looks even nicer than before, the staff is just as great, and the food has remained top notch!

title: For the win
review: Awesome place to grab a bite and watch a game. We stopped in for a very late lunch and had the Hughes Delight and a small was good to split for 2 people. Fresh and tasty ingredients and the crust was perfect and garlicky. The staff was nice and friendly and no matter if you sat inside or out you were sure to have a good time.

title: Great place to eat
review: I had the spinach salad that I modified bc I'm vegan. Salads arent always good but this one was AMAZING. I also had a slice if my husband's veggie pizza w vegan cheese and it also was AMAZING!! I am definitely going back. I had the matcha something drink which was decent tasting but was supposed to have vodka in it if it did it wasn't Much at all! The atmosphere and decor was really nice especially the view looking up

title: Loved the decor and atmosphere!
review: The outdoor area out back is impressive and cool!  The pizza is overpriced for what it is....over $75 for a family of 5 to eat pizza seems a bit much for me.

title: University hangout friendly to neighbors for pizza and apps
review: Pizza served hot with fun toppings...spinach-ricotta sauce with mushrooms...medium-size perfect for lunch for two...full bar, indoor, outdoor and roof seating.  Service is friendly, but a bit slow.  Lots of apps, too!

title: Delicious & Fun!
review: I love this place! It’s so festive, fun and laid back. The food is great, the service very good for a casual, neighborhood spot, and the ambiance can’t be beat!

title: Awesome atmosphere
review: It was a winter wonderland! Homeslice went ALL OUT with Holiday decor in their main restaurant and the patio (enclosed and heated in the winter). It was such a fun spot to go with a group of friends. There were plenty of options for pizza, brunch & drinks. Highly recommend

title: Great Neighborhood Pizza Spot with Excellent Service
review: Nestled on a quaint little street on Chicago’s NW side is a great little gathering spot serving unique pizzas, sensational salads, terrific appetizers and carb-elicious calzones. When you step inside you feel like you’ve been transported to a north woods lodge. Sitting out in back beneath the trees and twinkling lights is sort of magical and fun too and there’s also an outside sidewalk seating area which is equally enjoyable! The food is fresh and delicious and served by seemingly the happiest, friendliest, most inviting and laid back staff around. The whole “vibe” of Homeslice is just “cool”. I was recently there with friends and had been seated outside when a virtual monsoon hit. Our waiter, Dylan, handled the situation with ease, moving us and all of our food and drinks indoors, never skipped a beat with his excellent service. We ended up staying - waiting out the rain - for some time, but Dylan never rushed us, and actually encouraged us to stay and enjoy ourselves. That we did!I’d definitely recommend Homeslice for food, service, and ambiance.

title: Just awesome
review: It started with Nick at the bar finding me the best beer and Andrew putting up with my three friends and I as we worked our way through the appetizers and pizzas. Does it get any better? No this is the best neighborhood place in Chicago. Spoil yourself and come here.So good we came back before we left town.

title: First timers
review: Saw this place from the train and wanted to check it out. We had the veggie pizza, the Grand Teva with additional black olives. The service was quick and we were seated and attended to promptly. The pizza could have been a bit more crispy but overall it was very tasty. I would recommend this place.

title: Great find after a day of tours!
review: If you are looking for a fun, awesome place to have some pizza and chill after a day of sightseeing or touring the near by DePaul University then this is your place! Perfect on game day, with kids, friends or just to pick it up and go(if you must!), the pizza, salads and apps were amazing and worth going for! We will definitely stop there again as it really was great, fresh pizza and super atmosphere!

title: Happy find.
review: I found it after a long walk getting lost. About to give up and there it was. Didn't know what to expect, I saw it from the train and loved the look of the garden. Food was great, service was friendly, fast and helpful. Maybe the 'hot' wasn't that hot but with sauces and chilli on the table you can sort that out yourself. Definitely a great find.

title: Worse Pizza if you can call it that, not Chicago Style
review: First ordered two pizzas and was delivered wrong pizzas, not what we ordered., but came thru Caviar who also could not find our address. Second, this pizza might be good for some, but to us it was like a soggy piece of cardboard. Could not pick up in your hands, toppings slide right off. Nice restaurant, indoor and outside seating, service. Good beer selections in college neighborhood. Would not go back. Lastly, very pricey, over $70.00 for two 18"pizza's.

title: Overall, we love the restaurant except the bad customer service
review: My husband and I went to this restaurant for the very first time last week, and we were not 100% satisfied. 1. The restaurant is beautiful 2. The food is amazing3. The atmosphere is perfect4. Customer Service is horrible The only problem we had was with service. Horrible customer service specially with our waitress Nick. He had the most horrible attitude. He made our experience very uncomfortable to the point we wanted to leave, the second waitress had the same bad attitude, definitely they are not people person, but thanks to manager Cesar we were able to enjoy our food and the rest of the night. I wanted to thank you Cesar for taking over and for treating us the way a customer deserves...the 5 stars goes to you. Overall, we love the restaurant except the bad customer service.

title: Very tasty pizza with unique toppings
review: This is definitely worth a visit when in Lincoln Park. A cool lodge motif with a very interesting patio out back with an old Airstream trailer as one of the booths. Pizzas are nicely sized and filling and unique!

title: Delicious Italian Pizza
review: This isn't Chicago pizza. I feel i have to get that out of the way first.It is a delicious Italian pizza with a wide selection of vegetarian toppings as well as meat ones, a beautiful outdoor seating area where you are not in the least neglected by the staff. And the place has an attractive buzz about it.

title: Great spot for a fun family pizza night
review: All 5 of us in our family have a pizza obsession. :-) My boys and I are always looking for the next great pizza place for our family nights and Homeslice was it a couple of weeks ago! We had four different pies and all were delicious. My husband and I had drinks, the margaritas in a little metal tub are awesome! Music was good, service was excellent, ambiance was perfect for our rowdy crowd. I also enjoy Homeslice for work lunches, love the Caesar salads and mushroom soup. Overall , Homeslice is always a good experience with tasty, interesting pizza options. :-)

title: Atmosphere, Food and Service worth the visit
review: Great service....Rock was an amazing server. The Calzones were packed with flavor and ingredients...cheese bread to die for.....great craft beer and lots of tvs for game watching. We were with our teenage children and another family....very family friendly AND they were flexible when we needed another table in their busy time of the day! As near to DePaul as this is, i expected only college students and was thrilled to see all ages!

title: Good food at a cost
review: This restaurant offers a variety of pizzas and Italian dishes. We sat in the open area. Due to the loud sound of the train was difficult to talk. The rates however are much on the higher side

title: Late nite drinks and snacks
review: Stopped by on the way home for a nitecap and snacks. Wow this place has such a great vibe. Service was good. Only had breadsticks and marinara so can't really speak to the rest of the food but the sticks and sauce were great. Set will be back!

title: Holy Delicious!
review: What an outstanding restaurant! My wife and I were in Chicago for the day only and I desperately wanted to share some great Chicago pie with her. I wasn't certain whether it would be as good as I hoped, and Homeslice delivered! Crust on the calzone crisp without being burned, pizza was divinely cheesy and the sauce. OMG. The sauce is exceptional. Our server, Andrew was funny and fast. Great guy who made the experience even better. The surroundings are enjoyable and the food is perfectly Chicago. So happy we found it!!!

title: Excellent pizza!
review: Visit to Chicago to visit son.  Wanted good pizza.  Lots of great pizza selections.  Got multigrain crust.  Great beer selection.  Great pub /bar atmosphere.  Would go back.

title: Gathering place for meeting our sons in Chicago.
review: Food was delicious. Several choices for pizza, ranging from meat, fish, chicken and vegan. I personally adored the Funky Chicken Pizza. Our server was friendly and fun, knowledgable and prompt. The drawback is the noise. Outside is great but VERY LOUD with the train running directly next to the building. Will definitely go back.

title: Very unique and tasty
review: Visiting the area for the day and decided try a local establishment within walking distance of DePaul University. Found this place on TripAdvisor. It was a beautiful day so we decided to enjoy our lunch in the outdoor seating. We ordered calzones and my son had a slice of the pepperoni pizza. The food was very good and the service was helpful. I definitely recommend giving the place a try.

title: Good gourmet pizza
review: Homeslice serves unique pizza flavors which are mostly gourmet versions of traditional offerings. They also have several unique combinations. The tastes were very good and all our group liked their choices. HomeSlice also has a good selection of beers.During the summer, you can choose to eat on the patio or inside which has a rustic sports bar feel.

title: Nice surprise
review: Went here because it was close to our airbnb.  Was truly a great find,  pizza was fabulous!  Have signature drinks that are terrific.  The bar staff was so friendly and professional.  Glad we found this gem.

title: Great Pizza and Great Appetizers
review: The food is great and the service was on point.  The pizza is a thinner style for Chicago, but incredible.  Try to potato skins and breadsticks with goat cheese.

title: Great salads and interesting pizza combinations
review: The menu is on a wood plank with appetizers, salads an sandwiches on one side and the varied pizza menu on the other. The hummus appetizer is great for healthy eaters who are saving up for the pizza. Some have unusual names for typical pizzas, some other combinations look unusual, but the ingredients do work together depending on your preference.

title: Fun place but noisy
review: One of our daughter's hangouts, festive fun pizza place. Very popular and pizza was great, beer too. I guess people who live here get used to the L running by 20 feet away but I found it distracting

title: YUMMY!!
review: Best pizza I've had in Chicago so far!!! Great location, great staff, drinks were AWESOME, super cool atmosphere. This is another top go to location.

title: Great, Everything.
review: I had never been here before. The menu was interesting. I let my server decide for me and she knew what she was talking about! I had a Mexican style pizza (forgot the name) The atmosphere was rustic and delightful. There was a lovely beer garden area that would be a lot of fun on a friday night. The bathrooms were even cool. I will come here again.

title: Awesome pizza and bloody Mary's
review: My group had 3 different types of pizza.  The Alo-hot was one of the best tasting pizza's I've ever had.  The bloody Mary's come with a slice of cold delicious pizza.  I was stuffed and happy when I left this restaurant.

title: Awesome Spot
review: The place is a bit hidden under the train on Webster. Small yet busy atmosphere. The seating is great as I love booths. The music is very upbeat and current. The food is great. Overall a super cute place to eat and drink with friends. I will return often!

title: Large group setting is nice!
review: We had a group of 11 and we were seated in the back section/enclosed section of the restaurant. They have overhead heaters and staff was above and beyond accommodating. Once everyone was cozily seated in this "backyard patio couch" setting, we quickly received our drinks and placed our pizza order. All of the pizzas were delicious. The only tiny drawback is the noise from the train. If this is a hindrance, I recommend eating in the main restaurant but we were a fun, loud group so it did not stop our fun!! Located in a fun area of Lincoln Park...it seems to be a popular place so be prepared to wait!

title: Delicious pizza and ambiance
review: Loved our dining experience at Homeslice. Located in a great area. In my opinion, more of a must-do than typical Chicago deep dish. The pizza here is wonderful as well as pretty much everything else on the menu. Cocktails were strong and good. Would recommend to friends for a night out or even a date night.

title: Great Friday night....
review: Yum! Went here with our son & daughter-in-law during our visit to Chicago. Got 3 small pizza to share for variety... a veggie - Da-Duba, a meat - BMZ, and ham & pinapple, Lew-Wow. Good beer selection and pizza was delicious. We shared at a table and music was loud but enjoyed the atmosphere and music. Give it a try is you are in the area... you will enjoy it!

title: Great place with friends
review: On my first visit to America last year we visited here with local friends - who highly recommended the place. We weren't disappointed! Brilliant service, great pizza, wide range of drinks, clean and stylish surrounds. Will visit again.

title: Saturday well spent!
review: Great atmosphere and great service. This was a perfect place to watch football on a Saturday. The place was filled with a younger crowd catching the games. Our service was top notch and our pizzas even better. We will be back!

title: Laid back and Hip!
review: We stopped in for a quick dinner on a Monday evening. The weather was beautiful and all the restaurants in the area were busy. We were seated right away in the outdoor, enclosed wall, but open air area. The L train you could see and definitely hear the whole time, but it was a great outdoor space. The two pizzas we ordered were very good. Pepperoni, a little too spicy for my friends, but tasty, and the Red Behrens pizza, which was delicious. They were both medium size and plenty big enough for 4 people. The beer selection was great too!

title: Log cabin cool pizzeria
review: We found Homeslice as we were exploring Lincoln park and the DePaul campus.The pizza was unique and the rest of the menu was really interesting. Our server was a really nice young lady. She actually made a minor error on our bill and after taking care of the problem she gave us two cookie dough style desserts.We are looking forward to returning with our son to check this cool place out.

title: Great pizza, fun atmosphere
review: Very hopping place for dinner. At there with my husband this past Friday night and our waitress was super friendly and attentive, and the place was full. The small size pizza is plenty for 1 and I usually take 1-2 slices home. It's nice that there are so many choice and each person can get their own pizza. The wheat crust is very good and flavorable - give it a try.

title: Great Pizza, Great Salads, Great Service
review: Homelike offers consistently high quality food, beverage and service. They offer a good variety of pizzas, but they also allow you to customize the pizzas to your specific tastes. The salads are even better than the pizzas and they have several to choose from. The service is always very good as the entire staff is very attentive. It is definitely worth the trip.

title: Best Gluten Free Pizza Crust
review: Great pizza & the best gluten free crust I have ever had. Gluten free beer was also enjoyed.  Friendly, relaxed atmosphere with great service.

title: A solid pizza choice
