review: Homeslice is located in Lincoln Park/Ranch Triangle area and is a very good pizzeria. A wide selection of options for all pizza fans and a "build your own" option. Other items for non pizza lovers. Very good beer selection as well. Chicago has many excellent pizza options and this place rates.

title: Whoever heard of Oregon-style pizza?
review: I'm a traditionalist when it comes to pizza. Give me a Chicago-style pizza, thin crust with sausage and cheese, every time. No deep dish or pan or stuffed. No New York-style. So you can imagine my reaction when a friend recommended that I try the Oregon-style pizza at Homeslice Wheel House, which opened in 2013 at 938 West Webster in Lincoln Park. Whoever heard of Oregon-style pizza? Well, give it a try. Two Oregon transplants, Josh Iachelli and Clay Hamilton, got together a few years ago and came up with the idea that their Oregon-style pizza, with a thinner base and a fluffy outer crust, could be a success in Chicago. It definitely isn't Chicago-style pizza. But it's better than New York-style. The menu is as unique as the interior of the restaurant, which is outfitted like a log cabin. The 120-seat room features tree-trunk tables and TVs. You feel like a logger from the Northwest. Start with chips and home-made salsa or meatballs or mozzarella bread sticks or oven-roasted garlic bread. Or you might prefer a Caesar salad or mixed greens or Buffalo bleu chicken or Sesame Soy or raspberry vinaigrette. Or sample the Hungarian mushroom soup or the Yucatan lime with chicken soup. The main event, of course, is pizza, all 36 varieties, hand-tossed, chicken or meat or meat-free, 10 inches or 14 inches or 18 inches. Or you can build your own pie--sauce and base cheese and add meat--or purchase a piece by the slice. I prefer the Boyler Room (pepperoni, mozzarella, provolone and marinara), Benny-B (Italian sausage, green peppers, black olives, mozzarella, provolone and marinara) and Bennett's Beauty (pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, mozzarella, provolone and marinara). Calzones also are included on the menu. I recommend turkey. There are thousands of pizza parlors in the Chicago area but Homeslice, with its Oregon-style pizza and menu filled with unique items, is a restaurant apart from the rest.

title: This is Really Good Pizza
review: I was in town for dinner with some friends and we had pizza from Homeslice. It was my first experience at it was terrific.

title: OMG! So yummy!
review: Love this place! Great combinations to choose from in both meat and meatless pizza or make your own of course. Will not disappoint! Crust is perfectly balanced - not too thick and heavy but sustainable for the tasty toppings. Edges are crusty on the outside and soft doughy in - like I said, perfect balance.

title: Pizza and Beer for the college crowd
review: Homeslice is great little place in a great location near DePaul University that serves traditional pizza in a deep dish pizza town. Seems to cater to the DePaul crowd of beer and pizza loving college students. I went with my two daughters after making a visit to the DePaul campus. We ordered the breadsticks with goat cheese dipping sauce. The dipping sauce was fantastic, rich, creamy tomatoey. We also had a pepperoni pizza. Every inch of the pizza was covered with delicious pepperoni. The pizza however was a bit greasy and too saucy. Next time I order with light sauce. Over all a pretty good pizza place in a great old building in a great urban neighborhood.

title: GREAT gluten-free pizza! GREAT service!
review: Very tasty food and terrific service. Awesome pizza!! Gluten-free crust was amazing! Of course, all pizzas come fully "glutened" as well. :) Atmosphere is fun and comfortable. Restaurant is in a quaint and quiet neighborhood. I'd highly recommend this restaurant!

title: Not a sport bar but a great place to watch sport
review: Pizza menu is great and added bonus for veggie pizza. Different locations for tv's makes it a great place to watch games. Outiside sitting is nice and to my surprised, you can see the train passing near the rest (noise).

title: Better than Deep Dish!!
review: Lincoln Park/DePaul Area. Relaxed Urban Log Cabin atmosphere. The pizza menu is extensive and some combinations are very daring. The beer menu as well is comprehensive and our waitress (cannot remember her name;() was really helpful. We had plenty of leftovers which we wanted. The bathroom is really cool sounds weird but never have seen anything like it before - hundreds or thousands of pennies in the floor and walls- a beautiful copper hue.

title: Pizza not what we expected, patio very nice except EL whizzing by at intervals.
review: Visiting daughter in Chicago and decided to try a different pizza place than the usual. The interior design is log cabin, lots of TVs tuned to sports, many large tables and noisy even on a Tuesday night. We chose to sit in the back patio which was very pleasantly designed and much less noisy except for the frequent EL trains whizzing by over head. We were told the name of our server but she did not take our orders or deliver our food or drinks, She came by late in the meal to ask if we needed anything and later to give the bill-not sure who got the tip. The food: started with bread sticks with the feta/marinara dip-very good. The pizza we ordered was topped with Canadian bacon and pineapple.. The crust was OK, the bacon was very large slices and pineapple tidbits were cold, as if thrown on after cooking. All in all it would have tasted better if the toppings were under the cheese, cut smaller and hot.

title: Really cool place, great pizza - Don't order delivery
review: I love going to Homeslice. It's a really cool atmosphere - like a party log cabin? If you're there to watch a game, there's plenty of seating to do that; if you're there to chill at the bar, it's a cool bar with a decent amount of space to hang out around; if you're there to get lost in some delish pizza and great vibes, that's there too. I've eaten at Homeslice three times - somehow I've managed never to be seated in the patio (once was during winter, but the other two times I sat inside once, and out front along the sidewalk once). The patio is what first caught my attention, from the el. It's full of huge light-up signs that say "Be Awesome" and some other things, plus sort of shrouded in trees and just looks like the dream spot to eat pizza. Eating inside is cool too, though, and the sidewalk was really nice. Quiet and actually quite cute; the eating areas are partially covered, and surrounded by flower boxes and trees. The pizza is great. I LOVE that they have wheat crust. I hope it's whole wheat...it's a little ambiguous and I've never asked. In some spots they save "whole wheat," others it's just "wheat." At any rate, it makes me feel a little less guilty about eating an entire pizza; that, and the fact that these are a true 10-11 inches...not the 14" "personal" pizzas that I feel like are everywhere. They also have tons of different options. There isn't a "Build Your Own" option on the menu, technically, but there are so many options that you'll find something close to what you want, if not exactly it, and they're super good about substitutions. They've got a ton of toppings, too, and a bunch of different cheeses to choose from. I like that, because you really can create so many different sorts of flavor profiles... it elevates the pizza beyond typical pizza flavors. I will give one word of caution: pay attention to the base of the pizza you order. It's a little unclear in some menu descriptions, to me, that the base isn't tomato sauce. So, don't be like me and end up with a white pie when you were really pumped for some tomato action.My only final comment is that Homeslice is much better enjoyed at the restaurant than by delivery. My pizza wasn't cooked enough at all when it arrived via delivery (undercooked, and soggy/lukewarm as a result of travel is a bad combo). Not only that, but they forgot my tomato topping AND the online menu didn't make it clear, in my opinion, that this was a garlic and olive oil base, without tomato sauce. So, they left off my tomatoes, AND didn't put any tomato sauce. And then I had to cook it an extra 20 minutes in my oven. No joke. So, that was a disappointing experience...would have been way better had I been at the restaurant and able to have it fixed. (I did add some marinara sauce before cooking it, so was able to sort of fix the lack of tomato).Anyway, I really like Homeslice and think it's the perfect place to go with a few friends for good ol' pizza and beer. Oh yeah, they have a decent beer list, too. They definitely try at it... a little more ale-focused (read: hoppy) than I'd like, but good options if you like that stuff. Plus some good standbys on draft, and more on bottles/cans. Service has always been just fine... somewhat slow, and not friendly or especially welcoming. But otherwise attentive and pretty good.

title: Awesome food and atmosphere
review: Went to Homeslice my first night in Chicago with a friend and the pizza was delicious. I had the Zephy personal pie and loved it! And as a New Yorker I like to think I know Pizza! Everything about this place was great inside looked cool and had some great seatring. We ended up sitting out front and still had a great time. We each got cocktails off the menu and they were great as well. Location was great too, a few blocks from the L and from Homeslice we went to N Lincoln Ave and just bar hopped. Def a young area, but a rest for everyone.Would highly recommend Homeslice to others!

title: Neighborhood pizza
review: A fun neighborhood pizza spot with outdoor seating on the street and on a back patio. Inside gets a little loud with the music but the pizza, beer selection and salads are all good and I will get around to trying the calzones at some point.

title: Great food, awesome patio!
review: Homeslice is the place to be in Lincoln Park. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was great. Came to the restaurant with a couple of friends for a Blackhawks game and we had a blast. The back patio was great and servers and staff were attentive. Will be back soon!

title: Cookie dough balls & pizza
review: I knew i'd like this place as soon as I saw "Not Your Fathers Root Beer" on the drink menu.Low key, fun place with great pizza. My friends had the schulz bbq pizza and said it was meh compared to the other bbq one(don't remember the name). I had the Ava Lance and it was delicious! We followed pizza qith their cookie dough balls. Get one they are only $2. They have speinkles.

title: Great pizza...great patio seating
review: A little slice of pizza heaven in Lincoln Park. Very delicious pizza, with many choices of unique pizza topping combinations or make your own. Pizza by the slice as well.Inside is your typical restaurant vibe but outside awaits a darling patio with picnic seating, lounge areas, an old jet stream trailer outfitted with disco balls and tables...just too cute.Service was excellent and friendly. We were there for a weekday lunch so I can't speak to evening crowds. Nice selection of craft brews as well as cocktails.Great find! We will return on our next visit.

title: Amazing gluten free pizza crust
review: Great back patio, though the train passing by was a little noisy. I can't say enough about the gluten free pizza crust. It was amazing!

title: Great Pizza
review: My friends and I met here one evening. It was a lovely night, so all the doors were open, which had an awesome feel to it. I know Chicago is known for their deep dish style pizza, but absolutely give this place a chance! I had the Hawaiian pizza, and it was to die for! Additionally, we got a large pepperoni and sausage pizza which was also very good. The service is great. I will be back!

title: Fun atmosphere & great selection of pizza
review: Stopped for a quick bite ended up ordering a pizza to take home for the next day.  Friendly outdoor vibe in front or in back with Airstream dining included.

title: I love pizza!
review: Every pizza place has it's unique way of making pizza and combining toppings together, and Homeslice Pizza knows what they are doing. I was with 2 other adults and we split 2 medium pizzas (a meat one with marinara, and a chicken one with 4 cheeses).When I tried each pizza, the first thought I had was, "oh my gosh this is good."It's not your Chicago deep-dish pizza, but it was good.

title: Home slice with my Homegirl
review: My daughter lives in this neighborhood so we visited here one rainy Friday for lunch. We were first seated outside next to a group of 8. While there was ample seating away from this group (we were the only other people sitting outside) the hostess opted to "cluster seat" us which led to us feeling clostrophobic and less intimate. When the rain started, we were moved inside to a more private table. The restaurant has a woodsy, cool vibe. My daughter wanted to show me the patio (her favorite) but it was closed. To start, we ordered bread sticks with goat cheese. Then, the Sheffield salad, with mandarin oranges, Gorgonzola and lemon poppy seed dressing and the Lew-wow pizza made with a variety of meats and cheeses. All were very tasty and satisfying. Would like to return to experience the patio/bar area for a more festive atmosphere. Servers and employees were neighborhood friendly, a welcomed bit of hospitality for this southern girl.

title: Can't go wrong here
review: Lincoln Park location, so expect a younger crowd but everyone is welcome and feels at home. The food is excellent, from chips & salsa (amazing!) to salads and pizzas. Wait for outside table, the wait goes quickly and plenty of room at the bar. No reservations, but hostess stand is efficient and gets you in as soon as possible with a text to your phone.

title: Great brunch spot
review: My friends and I HAVE to come here for brunch every time we're in Chicago. Love sitting outside if the weather is nice. A mimosa and Breakfast Za will cure any hangover! They also have very delicious and unique bloody marys! Also a great place to watch the game.

title: Great atmosphere, Friendly service
review: I had a great meal including several local beers. The waitress Victoria was very helpful and friendly. She explained the menu and made great recommendations. The jalapeno homies were an awsome appetizer. And I picked up some great beer glasses and a Homeslice hat. And the interior is festive and well decorated.

title: Awesome!
review: Actually found this place online due to its awesome decor, so we figured we'd check it out and see if the food met the great atmosphere - it did! The pizzas were unique and delicious, as was our appetizer of cheesy bread sticks. Great beer selection as well! Definitely a place I'll go back to next time I'm in town!

title: Great pizza and service
review: They have really unique pizza offerings! Each of us ordered our own small pizza.  No one was disappointed.  Would go back.

title: Fantastic Outdoor Area
review: The outdoor seating was gorgeous - pretty much out of an HGTV show.  The pizza was also pretty exceptional. Highly recommend for a nice night out in good weather...plenty of seating so the wait shouldn't be too bad.

title: GREAT food but shoddy service
review: The atmosphere is cool and comfortable with a variety of seating and the food is wonderful (try the mozzarella breadsticks to bring back your childhood!) but you'll spend an eternity waiting for a refill or for the bill. I wanted to rate this place higher but after waiting 15 minutes for the check and another 10 for a drink refill, I just can't.

title: Nothing special
review: The atmosphere is cool, but can be hit or miss. Avoid being seated in the Airstream trailer out back if it's a sunny day, you'll cook. The "lounge" style tables in the back are a neat thought, but are ultimately uncomfortable and awkward to eat at. Then there's the pizza. The menu is full of great sounding concoctions, but it just doesn't live up to how it sounds. The ingredients are spread pretty thin, and many of them taste/feel like they just came out of a cheap can or jar. Definitely a trendy style and good ideas, but poorly executed. They'd really have to iron out some issues before I'd be able to justify coming back.

title: Quite Enjoyable.
review: Food was excellent. Pizza crust is quite tasty and the service was very good. We sat on the sidewalk part of the patio on a comfortable day and it was relaxing and pleasant. Bloody Mary is awesome as is the way it is served (with a tiny slice of pizza on top). Prices were average for the area. Since we sat outside, I can't comment on how things are in the main dining area.

title: Not what I expected
review: Let me be clear: the food here was very good. I shared a large pizza with two friends and it was great and we ate leftovers for a few days!I just was not expecting the "clubby" vibe inside the restaurant. I saw their sign from the el every day when I commuted from the suburbs and pictured the interior to be more casual and laid back.It's NOT formal, just more of a scene than I was expecting. Our pizza was also a lot more expensive than we expected because each topping we added was $2 and we had no idea - probably our fault for not checking.But we really liked our food!

title: Fun and great atmosphere
review: It was a weekend and around 9pm and no wait...the sweetest girl waited on us and there was a long wait but she made it bearable. They were definitely busy but the place is large so they have lots of tables. It was in our neighborhood so we took a chance and I would definitely go back.

title: Home of Gluten free THICK CRUST
review: ...Yes, you read that correctly. This place has thick crust gluten free pizza. AND gluten free beer that is actually good! Whoa. I'm going to have to sit down....We went here for Mothers' Day this year. A treat for all. Great servers, great looking interior, clean, and full bar to boot. And it's in Lincoln Park so I can go there a lot. Thanks to the boys from Portland who started this place.

title: Good stuff
review: I like this place! Great gourmet pizza with delicious crust. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Nice "woody" decor. Definitely would go back when in town again. The Mercenary pizza was very good and not as foreboding and spicy like it reads.

title: Great Local Spot with Outdoor Seating
review: Perfect  spot to grab a pizza with great outdoor table area in the back. Interesting pizzas and Gluten Free options. Good selection of MicroBrews - perfect spot on a great summer evening!

title: Great staff, delicious pizza
review: We came in 3 minutes til close and the owner apologized for a lack of fresh pizza but offered us the last three slices of pepperoni.FOR FREe! He felt bad it was the last bit but I thought it was very generous to let us in and at least offer us what was left. It still tasted pretty damn good too!! Looking forward to coming back during normal hours for a fresh $3 slice!

title: Great neighborhood pizzeria!
review: Delicious pizza! Such a variety available & quick, friendly service! The street side patio was quite charming!

title: Another great addition to the Chicago Pizza Scene!
review: took a party of 7 there this weekend for a late lunch...atmosphere is super cool and the pizzas were awesome...ordered a Meat Mary, Cheese Burglar, Veggie and a Mixed Greens Salad...all was great,  Can't wait to go back!

title: Mr.Sanchez - just one of their pizza names.
review: Located in Lincoln Park, Homeslice is a great place to spend a casual evening . In addition to great food, a full bar and a decent selection of regional beers, I really enjoyed the incredible interior. Inside, the ceiling, the tables, and some of the walls are made of wood, giving Home Slice a wonderful highlander-like feeling. Considering I was in the company of just one other person, we agreed to share the table with other guests, which created a commune table-like feeling - something we really enjoyed. It gave us the opportunity to meet interesting people. I also appreciated the fact that upon arrival, we were welcomed by the owner who told us the entire story of how Homeslide came to be. Some of the things I liked the most:1. The penny bathroom - the entire floor as well as one entire wall is made of US pennies. (both M and F bathrooms)2. Unique pizza names3. Regional beers

title: Fresh, Clean, and Happenin'
review: We wanted to try something different for pizza and were glad we picked this place off Tripadvisor. I couldn't have been any happier from the moment we came until we left. Service was very attentive and with a genuine smile, not in a hurry and with some conversation (Brought me a refill without asking. I like that!) The decor is original and on the money. Very hip and a happening place. Big windows were opened to outside so you could feel the city, And hear the el trains. The pizza was made with fresh ingredients and the taste was unbelievable for a pizza. I usually never get a pizza with so many extras, but, what the heck-live a little! One veg pizza had broccoli, olives, roasted garlic, portabella mushrooms with feta and mozzarella. Prices were very reasonable. They have some long hand-carved wooden tables for big groups. Parking is on the street with meters for $2/hr. This is how a business should be run. And the neighborhood was so energetic. I left with a full belly but didn't feel weighted down. We will go back.

title: In Chicago, where Pizza competition is fierce, this is a great place!
review: Came here for lunch. Great pizza! We had a specialty pizza with chicken and veggies. I really liked the crust too! They have a lot of different choices (maybe a bit too many to be honest), it's hard to pick just one. The service was excellent. The atmosphere is real neat, it's sort of like a ski lodge with a bit of glitz (they have shiny gold mirror bead-like things around the bar). Plus 2 huge TV's that I would think would have sports on at night. I think they've only been open for a little while.However in Chicago the pizza competition is fierce.....I hope they stick around for a bit. I would return.

title: Best Gluten Free Pizza
review: Anyone who has eaten gluten free pizza knows that Udi's crusts (or crusts like them) are everywhere and then you wonder why you couldn't have made it at home. But not here! This was hands down the best pizza I have had since going gluten free. So many choices of toppings, it was a great meal. My only complaint was the service, but the pizza all but made up for that.

title: Great, and welcomed our family with small children
review: Decided to check this out on a early Friday night with our 2 year old and 2 month old (a disaster waiting to happen, right?). A few things Homeslice did which made our experience actually pleasant -- took our cell and called us when our table was ready so we could play outside with our daughter nearby. They don't take reservations and wouldn't give us an estimate, but told us we were 3rd on the list which was good enough for us. Secondly, When we were called in, we got a corner booth and a high chair. The tables are all bar-high, but they have high chairs that are made for their table height which is great as I've been to other restaurants where they just stack a few high chairs which really isn't that safe. Third, our waitress was upbeat and friendly, and without asking brought us some blank paper and a few crayons midway through our wait. II had a wonderful pinot noir by the glass and my husband was pleased with the beer selection. We had a large pepperoni pizza and also bread sticks with goat cheese, and brought home more than half a pizza (which was totally our goal as we love leftover pizza in the house!). We will totally be back to this Lincoln Park spot with our family and will also recommend it to others. The owner/manager (not sure who, but you knew he was in charge) helped us on our way out and asked about our experience. I also saw him bussing food. I think that's a great way to run the show, so I hope he continues to be present on a regular basis.

title: A pie for everyone
review: Popped in here last Saturday night on a recommendation. There was a bit of a wait (to be expected on Saturday night) but the managers made us feel comfortable waiting from the minute we walked in. Great space. Very inviting. Saw a few families which was a nice relief from some of the other spots in the area. They have a bar section that is a little bit away from the diner section so you get the best of both worlds.The pizza was very tasty. Ideally, I prefer pizza that is a bit more on the well done side however this pizza stood up to some of the best I have had in this city. The Knife and Forkner is ace. They have 30+ options and you can make your own if you want to. I will return.

title: Pizza in Lincoln Park
review: I had been watching the space for a long time. Finally the new pizza joint was open for business! Homeslice was worth the wait. Wonderful atmosphere and charming wait staff. The noise level was lively without being overwhelming. We will certainly go to Homeslice again.My husband and I shared a small "Sheffield" salad that was very generously sized. We went on to build our own pie. We stuck with our old tried and true cheese and sausage-delicious. The crust had a unique taste that I enjoyed. Next time we will more adventurous and go for one of the many appealing combos on the menu.Homeslice is a great addition to our neighborhood pizza selections. I recommended it to a friend who was very happy with his experience. I recommend Homeslice to you too.

title: Great place for food & friends!
review: Homeslice is a neat place to grab great food and drinks. The place is located in the Lincoln Park neighborhood. If driving there is street parking available. Homeslice is decorated pretty neatly. The theme is based on tree logs. Tables, booths, and bar have tree logs all around. The bathrooms are neatly decorated with pennies all over (floor, walls and ceiling). The food is very good with great taste. One can taste they are using the freshest ingredients. Items ordered: pizza, yucatan lime with chicken soup, smoked ham and avocado calzone. The food was brought out timely. Waiting for a table was not too bad but be prepared to wait for a long time specially if visiting during weekend. The waiting area is very small so I would recommend walking around the neighborhood (there are plenty of shopping places) while waiting (unless it is winter).Besides having great tasting food it is also a great value. It is best for groups. The place is loud so be prepared to speak up in conversations.As if food, location, decor weren't great already...per Homeslice's packaging it is endorsed by the Green Restaurant Association (dinegreen.com).

title: Stick to the Cupcakes
review: I would recommend the cupcakes but not the lemon meringue pie. With a dozen bronzed peaks, SMB's pie looked so graceful! However, the dense meringue overwhelmed the lemon filling in both amount and flavor. Because this whipped and baked egg white and sugar topping was not light and airy, I suspect that a stabilizing agent was added to prevent weeping and collapse from the heat. The lemon filling was not tart enough, the crust was very soggy, and the price was $32.00!

title: Yummy
review: The cupcakes are so good! The staff was just so friendly! I loved their sugar cookies with the harder frosting, those are my favorite!

title: Always top shelf
review: We have had cupcakes from here that have been amazing As a birthday surprise someone brought my favorite banana cream pie What can I say they have one of the best. Very light cream filling full of fresh bananas and the whip cream fresh cream light and delicious Highly recommend

title: Excellent Bakery
review: Recommend the double chocolate cupcakes, vanilla, and carrot cake were great. The velvet just ok, picked up dozen cupcakes and would highly recommend their products  Order early waiting lines to pick up

title: Not a run-of-the-mill bakery
review: Sick of our boring life during the lockdown and fed up with home-cooked creations, I went on a search for cake. It's hard to find a bakery anywhere let alone in downtown Chicago Sweet Mandy B's is now on Ontario so we went there knowing nothing about it. What a find! This is not a run-of-the-mill brownie or cupcake. The banana cake/ chocolate cupcake was the best dessert I've had in a long time. We at the brownie at night and have to stop ourselves from eating the rest of the cupcakes until tomorrow. Not expensive at all, especially considering the quality. The cafe is really cute too so it will be on my list of things to do when we can all eat in again. But until then, Sweet Mandy B's is a find.

title: Cupcakes on the Fly
review: We picked up cupcakes to go. One of the best cupcakes I have hadThe double chocolate was to die for along with the carrot cake and vanilla sprinkle The red velvets cream cheese frosting was a little overbearing and the mixed bar was too sweet Overall great

title: Expensive and Just Fair
review: This sweet shop was disappointing. We bought a cookie and a cupcake. The cupcake was dry, and the cookie was average. But the bill for the two items was high. We won’t return.

title: Found on trip advisor
review: Amazing selection of cupcakes cakes pies cookies..... worth the Uber drive for sure! Gluten free and vegan options. Also dairy free/GF coconut cookie which was amazing.

title: Cookie Heaven
review: We just happened to pop in and I wish I bought more than the 1 sugar cookie!  It was delicious!  Probably best for my waistline that I don’t frequent as there are so many options that looked amazing!

title: Butter infused delicasies
review: Everything literally in the shop is to die for...cookies, cakes...pastries...special order treats. Every special event in our family has been celebrated with a SMB's treat. We are always running over before closing time, or during the day to nosh on something sweet and buttery. You can't miss.

title: Birthday Fail!
review: Been a patron of Sweet Mandy B's since they opened. Normally they are wonderful to work with. This occasion was not. I called on Tuesday AM to preorder a cake for Sunday pickup. They told me that this would not be possible and I could just come in and get a cake they had pre-made. I've had 50/50 luck when doing this previously so I called on Sunday morning to order over the phone. They girl was beyond rude and was doing her best to brush me off the phone as quickly as possible. What happened to their friendly approach? Went to pick up the cake and this is what I was presented with!! How disappointing. Sloppy handwriting and smudge marks clearly showing they messed up. When I confronted them about fixing this I was again met with attitude. It doesn't matter how good your product is, if your staff represent your organization with an elitist mentality you'll never be the best. So disappointed with this encounter after patronizing for so many years. Will certainly keep this in mind when purchasing sweets in the future.

title: Gluten Free Dreams Crushed
review: I went to Sweet Mandy B’s to try their gluten free chocolate cake. Unfortunately, it will not become one of the gluten free wonders of the world. Texture: did not resemble a cake....at all. It closely resembled a tart texture, perhaps. No icing.Flavor: super sweet and dense. Too sweet and dense. I would come here again for the sake of giving the gluten free pudding a try. Surely they can’t go wrong there?!Lack of variety. The day I was there they only offered the two items mentioned above for gluten free patrons.

title: Sweetest of Sweets
review: Sweet Mandy B’s near DePaul University is an outstanding bakery that features cupcakes, cookies, stacked brownies and rice cereal delights. The cupcakes are moist with a generous amount of sweet frosting. The cookies are crispy on the edges and chewy in the middle - just the way the perfect should be! They offer something for everyone with a sweet tooth!

title: best best best
review: Super bakery.  Try frosted sugar cookies; slices of cake; so many kinds of cup cakes.  Just about anything at all!

title: Smell the sweets from the street!
review: Really enjoyed the sweets here, would have liked to try a cake but didn't have the time (or the room in our stomach!). Preferred the brownies and cookies over the cupcakes. Don't go expecting a giant menu, but they do have coffee and milk to enjoy with your snack!

title: Stick to the Cupcakes
review: I would recommend the cupcakes but not the lemon meringue pie. With a dozen bronzed peaks, SMB's pie looked so graceful! However, the dense meringue overwhelmed the lemon filling in both amount and flavor. Because this whipped and baked egg white and sugar topping was not light and airy, I suspect that a stabilizing agent was added to prevent weeping and collapse from the heat. The lemon filling was not tart enough, the crust was very soggy, and the price was $32.00!

title: Yummy
review: The cupcakes are so good! The staff was just so friendly! I loved their sugar cookies with the harder frosting, those are my favorite!

title: Always top shelf
review: We have had cupcakes from here that have been amazing As a birthday surprise someone brought my favorite banana cream pie What can I say they have one of the best. Very light cream filling full of fresh bananas and the whip cream fresh cream light and delicious Highly recommend

review: Really enjoyed the sweets here, would have liked to try a cake but didn't have the time (or the room in our stomach!). Preferred the brownies and cookies over the cupcakes. Don't go expecting a giant menu, but they do have coffee and milk to enjoy with your snack!

title: Awesome Buttercream
review: Oh sweet Mandy b’s...why do I insist on getting cakes here and paying $50 when I can get the same two layer cake at Whole Foods for $25? Maybe bc it’s some of the best buttercream icing ever! All the baked goods are pretty darn delicious here and I’m not sure u can go wrong with any flavor of the cupcakes. Also have done a couple of the cupcake decorating classes with my 3 and 5 year olds. It’s a good deal as u get to take cupcakes home and loads of fun for around $20. Kinda have a love/hate with this place, more on the love. Product is pretty good, service can have attitude at times but year after year I always find myself here for baptisms, birthdays and the much needed cupacake fix.

title: Great cupcakes
review: Overpriced for what we are used to but the product is fabulous. Try the red velvet cupcake. The atmosphere is also ok, a little crowded though. Be patient as the line does move quickly.

title: Awful and Dirty
review: So we read reviews and thought we would try. Well you walk in to so many people behind the counter and no one willing to help you. Waited 10 minutes to get served, very disorganized. We choose the red velvet and Cookie Monster cupcake well save your money. They were dry,hard and I felt like they were baked a couple of days ago. Absolutely no flavor. The little seating area was so dirty with cupcake crumbs on the seats the tables sticky. The floor was dirty this bakery needs lots of help and a fresh coat of paint would go along way but I guess i would work on the recipes first. Less than a mile away is Molly’s Cupcakes now these are to die for try them over Sweet Mandy B’s. They were so bad we threw them out after two bites.

title: Scrumptious!!! Truly delish! Worth falling off the wagon for a sample!
review: Founded in 2002 as one of the early cupcake superstars, Sweet Mandy B’s continues to impress! We’ve done cakes, cookies, whoopie pies, and dozens and dozens of regular and mini cupcakes for many years. Everyone has their favorite, but the chocolate frosting is to die for. If you find yourself in the Lincoln Park neighborhood, this is a can’t miss spot!

title: One of the best!
review: Sweet Mandy B's is what we grew up on in my family, every birthday, graduation, etc. cupcakes or cake from Sweet Mandy B's was always present. Now it's one of my husband's favorite spots to frequent as well. Not only are their cakes and cupcakes amazing, but their cookies are delicious too! This is a must stop when in Chicago!

title: OMG RUN, DON’T WALK
review: The sweat treats at this neighborhood bakery are out of this world!! I cannot day enough great things about this place. Cupcakes are usually dry and disappointing...but not at this bakery! Everything we tried was scrumptious. Cannot say enough great things about this bakery. And my Lavazza coffee was also great. Thank goodness we don’t live in Chicago because this bakery would be dangerous.

title: Excellent cupcakes
review: We came to a birthday party which besides a cake had about a dozen cupcakes from Sweet Mandy B's. Naturally, a dozen isn't enough, especially, if they are different flavors, as people like to try more than one. They are excellent cupcakes and reasonably priced. The staff was efficient and friendly.

title: Delicious!
review: If you get the chance to come on a weekend get the cookie dough cookie sandwich. It was simply fantastic. Some raw cookie dough places taste a little off but they do it right. The place is cute and there are plenty of options to satisfy your sweet tooth. Cupcakes seem to be the main draw but there was so much more to try.

title: Best Cupcakes ever!
review: I recently moved away from Chicago.. AND I do not know how I will go on without these cupcakes! They are seriously amazing!!

title: Decent
review: We got two cupcakes, a mini chocolate cake, and a snickerdoodle. The chocolate cupcake was pretty dry but the snickerdoodle cupcake was amazing! Their icing is delicious :) my 11-year-old disliked his snickerdoodle but personally I thought it was good. The lava cake was pretty good.

title: A long drive to get a cinnamon roll
review: As I've written before, when we moved into our condominium on the Gold Coast in 1983, there were several bakeries in the neighborhood. People would line up every morning to get fresh pastries and cookies and cakes and pies. But all of those bakeries have closed. So my wife and I have to stray a long way from home to find fresh goodies. Is Wal-Mart in Sandwich far enough? And where am I going to go to find a bakery to make my mother's birthday cake this year? Well, Sweet Mandy B's at 1208 West Webster Avenue is a good start. Established in 2002, it is a bakeshop for old-fashioned treats from cupcakes to pies to cookies to breakfast bites. By most accounts, Sweet Mandy B's ranks among the top 10 bakeries in Chicago. So why can't she open a location in the Old Town neighborhood? For the time being, at least, we'll have to settle for West Webster. You can't go to Sweet Mandy B's and order just one or two items. I always get a few cinnamon rolls, a loaf of banana bread and a loaf of pumpkin bread and a bag of chocolate chip cookies and a German chocolate brownie. Pies? I can't pass up key lime or pecan or apple. Cake? How about Devils Food with raspberry filling and chocolate icing? And have you tasted Sweet Mandy B's pineapple upside down cake? I'm sure every customer has his or her favorites. That's the fun of going to Sweet Mandy B's, choosing which items and flavors you prefer. Who's counting calories?

title: Awesome baked goods
review: Probably the best iced sugar cookie I've ever had. The cupcake was very good. Everything looked amazing. I wish I could have tried more.

title: Cupcakes, rice treats and More!
review: This place not only puts out one the best cupcakes but also has rice crispie treats and pies. For me, I don't like sweet frosting. Their frosting is the best. Fun to see families with the kids and dogs stopping in for a sweet. You can sit on bar stools to enjoy your treat and their are small tables as well. A must if you are visiting Chicago.

title: Awesome brownies
review: We were walking by here on our way to dinner when I started to have low blood sugar. We stopped in here and I got the peanut butter brownie. Wow. Was that awesome. Great selection of cupcakes, cookies and other sweets too. I see why it was so popular at 9:30 on a Saturday night.

title: How Sweet It Is!
review: For my spouse's birthday, I was on the hunt for key lime pie (one of his favorites). I didn't want to get from Whole Foods where I normally shop for dessert, so decided to try Sweet Mandy Bs. It had good Yelp reviews, so why not. The staff there are super friendly & welcoming. Lots of pastel decor, very cute! I was only there to pick up my order, but still had great customer service. As for the pie, I didn't have high expectations going in, but was pleasantly surprised. Soooo delicious, did not disappoint. My spouse enjoyed it just as much, and he's very selective. Will definitely go back & try their other desserts. Thank you Sweet Mandy Bs!

title: Best cupcakes I've ever eaten
review: Although I've tried other bakery treats here, I have to say it's the cupcakes that keep bringing me back. I'm a huge chocolate fan, but their unique flavors (lemon, cookie monster, & snickerdoodle spring to mind) are so delicious, I forego traditional chocolate in favor of them! Our daughter's 3rd birthday included a full sized cake in the shape of a cupcake, and the strawberry frosting was unbelievably good. If you like frosting, know that you can often buy a small container of the stuff, usually oddly colored leftovers from other projects.

title: Who doesnt love cake and cookies?
review: Friendly, neighborhood, delicious...what else could you want? The samples are also first class. You can order for the side room, order to take out..or order to have delivered. The cakes, et al are just outstanding!! Red velvet!! Vanilla!! Chocolate!!You name it, they have it..The coffee is also wonderful!! A great place to enjoy!! And very reasonable...

title: Yum!
review: Coming from Canada we are always on the hunt for a good snicker doodle cookie (very hard to find in Canada). We found Mandy B's and were not let down. Located in a quaint neighbourhood Mandy's was quite busy for a Sunday morning when we stopped in to pick up our order. In addition to our cookies, which were phenomenal, we also picked up some red velvet cupcakes, which were also excellent.

title: Friendly and Deleesh
review: Friendly staff, helpful at my children's book signing, Olive and Babyland. Delicious food and wonderful teas. It is a neighborhood delight.

title: Lincoln park Sweets
review: Great bakery with many choices and reasonable prices. Coffee is excellent as ell in a great Lincoln Park neighborhood.

title: A Nostalgic Sugar Rush
review: Mmm so many choices from caramel apples to pies, cakes and cupcakes. It took me a while to decide on a slice of vanilla cake with buttercream frosting. Simply good. The buttercream was so creamy, and it was one of the best buttercream frostings I've had. I can't wait to visit again and try some of the other desserts.

title: Wow!
review: Decisions, decisions, decisions. Cute shop, friendly staff, great desserts. What else could you ask for?

title: Delish!
review: Stopped by during a girls trip to Chicago. It was well worth the drive north.  Enjoyed the cupcakes, pie and cookies.  Officially my favorite cake in Chicago!

title: Cupcake Heaven
review: I know people love Sprinkles — but I must say I prefer Mandy B's.We've only had their chocolate and vanilla cupcakes - but they are so moist — and the icing is some of the best buttercream icing I've ever had.Would love to try a pie sometime. This is the kind of place where everything is good. Sure - it's expensive. But I'd pay a little more for a sweet treat that is truly homemade, rather than the sugary, imposter variety at most grocery store bakeries.

title: EXCELLENT
review: We stopped here on a whim after being downtown. We came in late and firgured thatthey would not have anyhting left.We were wrong. There were plenty of fresh goodies that were fersh and suberb.Really enjoyed the bars.Ordered birthday cake after that and we found the frosting to be salty for some reason and asked for a ton of confetti to be on cake.There was almost none. ordered 3 different flavors for layers and all were delicious.Will be back for tgreats not for the cake.

title: Dangerous for your sweet tooth
review: The prices are fair, my wife and I got 6 items and the total came out to around $23 USD after tax. Very fair for such a highly rated and recommended place in such a part of town. Everything I didn't have looked great, what I got was scrumptious. Highly recommended!Service: 4/5Location: 4/5Quality: 5/5Value: 4/5

title: Good Bakery, Outrageous Prices
review: Sweet Mandy B's is a bakery in Lincoln Park that some people would call a "must visit". I am not one of those people. This bakery has a large selection of delicious treats, but most of the items are far from anything to rave about. Don't get me wrong, if you have a sweet tooth then you will be satisfied, but there are better bakeries in Chicago if you head farther into the city. The worst thing about Sweet Mandy B's is how light your wallet feels after a visit because their prices are truly outrageous for the quality of baked goods you are receiving, but what else can you expect from Lincoln Park.

title: beyond yummy!
review: Sweet Mandy B's is one of those very special bakeries that is simply outstanding. Everything they make is top notch delicious. I visit every time I'm in town, and I'm never disappointed. Their frostings and fillings are particularly delicious. If you have a sweet tooth, you must stop by. I don't have favorites - I can close my eyes and point and walk away a happy and satisfied customer.

title: Nuts!
review: Our friends took us there after dinner for dessert. Even close to closing, they had a wide array of items to choose from. We got a double doosie, peanut butter cupcake, molasses cookie, chocolate mint cookie and a cherry scone. Cupcake was moist and had just the right amount of frosting +3Double doosie chocolate chip cookies were good but it had too much frosting between the cookies making the entire confection entirely too sweet +1Molasses cookie was flavorful on its own and did not benefit from the heavy application of frosting +2Chocolate mint cookie was perfection, could really taste the mint+5Cherry scone was filled with walnuts which would be fine if it would have been labeled as such. Having a nut allergy, that one got pitched in the trash uneaten -5

title: Sinfully good cinnamon rolls
review: When we come to Lincoln Park area in Chicago, Sweet Mandy B's is a must. On this trip we had the cinnamon rolls for the first time and I must say it may have been the best I've eaten in the last 20 years. My mom's was the best but this is close. It's gooey and buttery! For someone who is a fitness buff, this was a major sin, but what the heck, I don't eat like this often. Finished one entire roll and could have had another but resisted. Will gobble the other one tonight!

title: Best cupcakes I've ever eaten
review: Although I've tried other bakery treats here, I have to say it's the cupcakes that keep bringing me back. I'm a huge chocolate fan, but their unique flavors (lemon, cookie monster, & snickerdoodle spring to mind) are so delicious, I forego traditional chocolate in favor of them! Our daughter's 3rd birthday included a full sized cake in the shape of a cupcake, and the strawberry frosting was unbelievably good. If you like frosting, know that you can often buy a small container of the stuff, usually oddly colored leftovers from other projects.

title: Who doesnt love cake and cookies?
review: Friendly, neighborhood, delicious...what else could you want? The samples are also first class. You can order for the side room, order to take out..or order to have delivered. The cakes, et al are just outstanding!! Red velvet!! Vanilla!! Chocolate!!You name it, they have it..The coffee is also wonderful!! A great place to enjoy!! And very reasonable...

title: Yum!
review: Coming from Canada we are always on the hunt for a good snicker doodle cookie (very hard to find in Canada). We found Mandy B's and were not let down. Located in a quaint neighbourhood Mandy's was quite busy for a Sunday morning when we stopped in to pick up our order. In addition to our cookies, which were phenomenal, we also picked up some red velvet cupcakes, which were also excellent.

review: Friendly staff, helpful at my children's book signing, Olive and Babyland. Delicious food and wonderful teas. It is a neighborhood delight.

The buttercream was so creamy, and it was one of the best buttercream frostings I've had. I can't wait to visit again and try some of the other desserts.

title: Wow!
review: Decisions, decisions, decisions. Cute shop, friendly staff, great desserts. What else could you ask for?

title: Delish!
review: Stopped by during a girls trip to Chicago. It was well worth the drive north.  Enjoyed the cupcakes, pie and cookies.  Officially my favorite cake in Chicago!

title: Cupcake Heaven
review: I know people love Sprinkles — but I must say I prefer Mandy B's.We've only had their chocolate and vanilla cupcakes - but they are so moist — and the icing is some of the best buttercream icing I've ever had.Would love to try a pie sometime. This is the kind of place where everything is good. Sure - it's expensive. But I'd pay a little more for a sweet treat that is truly homemade, rather than the sugary, imposter variety at most grocery store bakeries.

review: Sweet Mandy B's is one of those very special bakeries that is simply outstanding. Everything they make is top notch delicious. I visit every time I'm in town, and I'm never disappointed. Their frostings and fillings are particularly delicious. If you have a sweet tooth, you must stop by. I don't have favorites - I can close my eyes and point and walk away a happy and satisfied customer.

Cupcake was moist and had just the right amount of frosting +3Double doosie chocolate chip cookies were good but it had too much frosting between the cookies making the entire confection entirely too sweet +1Molasses cookie was flavorful on its own and did not benefit from the heavy application of frosting +2Chocolate mint cookie was perfection, could really taste the mint+5Cherry scone was filled with walnuts which would be fine if it would have been labeled as such. Having a nut allergy, that one got pitched in the trash uneaten -5

title: Sinfully good cinnamon rolls
review: When we come to Lincoln Park area in Chicago, Sweet Mandy B's is a must. On this trip we had the cinnamon rolls for the first time and I must say it may have been the best I've eaten in the last 20 years. My mom's was the best but this is close. It's gooey and buttery! For someone who is a fitness buff, this was a major sin, but what the heck, I don't eat like this often. Finished one entire roll and could have had another but resisted. Will gobble the other one tonight!

title: Amazing desserts in Chicago!
review: This is my favorite place to get desserts in Chicago! I love just about everything I have ever gotten from here. I have a hard time choosing what I want because everything always looks so amazing. I'm not a huge cupcake fan, however, I love their cupcakes! There is just something about their frosting I just crave. My favorites are the vanilla cupcakes, lemon cupcakes, and confetti cookies. Their cookies are always soft and chewy. The service is always fast and friendly. In my opinion, this is the best bakery desserts you will find in the city!

title: Great Cupcakes
review: This was my first time visiting Sweet Mandy B's and I was in from out of town.  Loved the different flavors of cupcakes and treats.  Highly recommend the cookie dough cupcake.  Also loved the flourless chocolate cake.  Will come back next time I'm in town!

title: "Best cupcakes in town"
review: If you've lived in downtown Chicago as long as we have--more than 30 years--you are well aware that there are fewer and fewer bakeries still in business. You know, the traditional bakery, where you could smell the pies and cakes and cookies and cupcakes being made in the kitchen, where folks from the neighborhood lined up on Saturday and Sunday mornings to buy fresh and hot danish and rolls. Well, Sweet Mandy B's at 1208 West Webster is the last of a dying breed. They produce old-fashioned desserts, including dreamy, creamy cupcakes, acclaimed the best in town. But there is so much more, like the chocolate and yellow cakes slathered in a colorful array of buttercream. And don't forget the puddings, an item you rarely see in any bakery. I'm particular to the butterscotch pudding but you might be partial to the chocolate or banana. The only way to enjoy a cake (yellow, Devil's Food, lemon, Red Velvet, banana, banana chocolate, strawberry, carrot) is to order a six-inch, three-layer variety and take it home. It's good for 8 to 12 servings. You won't regret it. But how can you resist the angel food cake, caramel apple cake, cinnamon rolls, banana bread, pumpkin bread, muffins, raspberry or fudge brownie bar, apple or key lime or pecan or coconut cream or chocolate cream pie or chocolate chip cookies? The fresh aroma from the kitchen challenges you to choose only one or two items. Fortunately, we don't live too far away from Sweet Mandy B's so we can stop by whenever our sweet teeth beckon. Which is often. My only regret? I wish they would add German chocolate cake, my favorite, to their menu.

title: sweets
review: Sweet Mandy B's is a amazing place. The cupcakes and the butter creme frosting is to die for. The true is that everything is amazing here. We live 4 hours away and we travel here sometimes just to get the bake goods from here. The staff and the owner are super friendly and go put of their way to make sure you are happy with your purchase. So if you are in Chicago please make a trip to Sweet Mandy B's.

title: Always a sweet treat
review: This place is great! They have wonderful cookie and bars.  You can also buy the frosting to go.  I've never tried their cakes but they always seem to look incredible.

title: Old Fashion Dessert with an amazing taste
review: Recently while in Chicago, our niece picked up one of their small round Birthday cakes. The cake was one of the best I have had for a long time. The butter cream foster took me back to the childhood bakeries my mother would buy from. I was so much a fan, we stopped on the way out of town and picked up a variety of cookies, cupcakes, and other single slices of cake to bring back with us. We thought the space was clean, the staff friendly and accommodating. Ii you truly have a sweet tooth but, like yours MORE flavorful and LESS sugary, I would definitely recommend a stop at this bakery. On a side note, it is located in a very exclusive shopping area of Lincoln Park.

title: Delish!
review: It does not get any better than this. This place is AMAZING! Every desert we have tried has nocked our socks off. The brownies (all of them) are treasures. Cookies are amazing. This is our go-to place whenever we need to bring a desert to a party and there is never anything left. We need to cut the deserts into small pieces because they are HUGE. But is always impresses even the most particular taste buds.

title: Favorite place to stop for sweets!
review: This place has the best cookies and cupcakes in downtown Chicago! Kids love the cookies with sprinkles. I'm a fan of all the cupcake flavors. I've never met one I didn't like! Try this place, you won't be disappointed!

title: Best Cupcakes in Chicago!
review: Great place to take kids for a cupcake or a treat like Grandma makes! They just added some seating too. Wonderful buttercream frosting in fun pastel colors! I have been going here for over 20 years! I have been on the cupcake tours in city and this is simply the best!

title: One Word...YUM!!!!
review: Went here to buy two dozen cupcakes for a gathering. As the saying goes, if food is around and no one is talking, it's gotta be good. Well there was not a peep to be heard. Absolutely the most moist and flavorful cupcakes out there. The girls who work there are also very helpful and sweet.

title: Worth the trip from Boston
review: Two friends from the Chicago area independently told me I needed to get cupcakes from here. It was out of our way, but my family made the pilgrimage and it was completely worth the trip.

title: The Best
review: With a great variety of desserts I left with a bag full of goodies to try and didn't even get through them all.  Everything was great! Really enjoyed the treats.  Must try.

title: Peanut butter chocolate rice crispy is a must try
review: No one should pass on trying these, Very nice made treat. I tried many items, all very tasty but the PB chocolate rice crispy stuck out and made my day.

title: Yummy!
review: Sweet Mandy B's Bakery was recommended by several sources. I wanted cupcakes for a small celebration. Over the phone, I was guided to some options and was offered a great deal of suggestions and assistance. A bonus.... Mandy B's delivered my cupcakes to the restaurant where our celebration was going to be held. There was a nominal delivery fee and a two-hour window. The cupcakes arrived intact. The caterer at the restaurant and the bakery worked well together to provide this service that they seemed to have done many times before. The cupcakes were sooooo delicious. We could hardly eat our dinner waiting to dig into the sweet devil's food and yellow cupcakes with chocolate and vanilla buttercream frosting, filled with chocolate pudding. The pricing was around $3.50 per cupcake for these particular choices. Well worth the price for the deliciousness and the service provided. Definitely will go there in person to see what other pastries and cakes they have.

title: Best rice crispie treats!
review: I have been introduced by a friend and we have been returning often! Amazing butter cookies and the best peanut butter chocolate rice treat I've had !

title: Not just a cupcake place!
review: A friend of mine has made me into a cupcake searcher LOL. Whenever I go somewhere I have to check for a cupcake place (well and Donuts too but I was already a donut searcher LOL). So though I only live about 45 miles out of Chicago, I hadn't actually gone and looked into too many cupcake sellers until I did a couple 'staycations'. Sweet Mandy B's was on staycation #2.First off, it's not JUST a cupcake place but a full service bakery. It's in a very cute, residential area which is fun in itself and has a really charming feel and look. I ordered 4 cupcakes since that was what I came for but I found that there was a ton of other things to choose from and I ended up walking out of there with 3 other bakery items. Thank goodness I had 3 days to eat it all LOL.The cupcakes are of medium size and tbh, of varying yummy-ness. The banana was delicious! It was a banana bread type cupcake with chocolate frosting and though that doesn't sound like anything too special, it was very moist and just really tasty. The Cookie Monster one (which has a bottom this is a baked chocolate chip cookie) was too sweet for my taste. The PB cup wad dry so disappointing but the final one I bought, Snickerdoodle was like the banana...very yummy. So...that's 50% awesome and 50%, eh. Could be better but also worse. I at least know which to buy again and which to pass up.The bakery items were all good quality though. Nothing dry. I bought a huge raspberry bar tha was very good and had a lot of the delicious crumble topping. I also bought a lemon square but tbh, it was too tart for me but that is more a personal opinion. Others may really like that. The final item, a mint brownie was good but slightly too sweet though I would still say a tasty snack.Overall I'd come here again as there were a few more flavors of cupcakes I'd like to try and a few more bakery items too. Even the few things I didn't like, with the exception of the one dry cupcake, were of good quality so I'd say give this place a try. There's something for everyone! =o)

title: Great variety, beautiful shop, overly sweet
review: I like Sweet Mandy B's. I've gotten cupcakes, cakes, birthday cakes, and who knows what else here. Recently their taste has gotten extremely sugary sweet, and I like my sugars more than most. They need to take it down a few notches or I'll have to find another bakery.

title: THE BEST CUPCAKES & DESSERTS
review: Sweet Mandy B's is absolutely the best US destination for cupcakes and cakes (their pies are awesome too). The cake is always moist & even though I'm not an icing person, I can't get enough of Sweet Mandy B's. I sure hope they ship!

title: The best cakes, etc.
review: Great neighborhood spot that has the best cakes and cupcakes in town. Sweet Mandy B's frosting is amazing and the cakes is great. They also have such great combos as "double doozies:" white buttercream sandwiched between two awesome chocolate chip cookies. Their pies, muffins, and other baked goods are wonderful too.

title: Best bakery in Chicago
review: I love going to jus place, I wish it wasn't so expensive ...but it is really go. It's hard leaving this place without spending $20-25 bucks... But oh well you only live once...love it!

title: Go for the Cupcakes!
review: If you have a sweet tooth, please visit this place specifically for the cupcakes.  You will not be disappointed.  The frosting is very sweet, so keep that in mind when ordering. It is a great place to pick up desserts for birthdays and other occasions.

title: Great sweets - not so sweet service
review: Visited on a Wednesday evening after having dinner in the area with our 3 kids. The place was still pretty busy 15 minutes before closing time (8:45pm) and our kids loved their treats - a cookie, a cupcake and a chocolate covered marshmallow. Unfortunately the young lady behind the counter did not seem too happy to have customers at that time and her poor attitude made the experience less than sweet for the adults.

title: Great breads and cakes
review: Great breads and cakes. Tried the pies as well that weren't as good but not disappointing either. Great interior for kids.

title: Sumptious Sweets
review: Their speciality is cupcakes, but Sweet Mandy B's has incredible pies and other delicious treats as well. In terms of their sweets, it's a 5. The pies, particularly the fruit pies, are fantastic. Not overly sweet, simply delicious. (Haven't tried the cupcakes as I'm not a cupcake fan.) The reason for the 3 is the atmosphere. It's more of a carry-out place than a relaxing place to go to enjoy pie and coffee. You can eat there, but it's more like eating in a lunchroom with rickety tables, loud music. So a great place to get dessert, just take it home with you.

title: Best bakery for sweets in the neighborhood
review: Cakes and cupcakes set the standard here. No better place in Lincoln Park when you want to take a show-stopping dessert. The peanut butter frosting is amazing--even for those who don't love peanut butter. I was never a fan of angel food cake...UNTIL I tried SMB's. It will spoil you for any other version. Nothing's inexpensive, but everything is delicious. Mud cups a big hit with the under-10 crowd!

title: Wanted All of It
review: Wow -- we wandered into this bakery while exploring Lincoln Park, and it was very difficult to decide what treat to eat, between the many delicious-looking cookies, slices of cake, cupcakes, etc. We settled on cookies--an iced mollasses cookie and an M&M cookie. Both were packaged with care by the staff so we could enjoy later...and enjoy we did! Both cookies were delicious and very flavorful. Yum! Will plan on returning to try more treats!

title: Delishhhhhh
review: My first thought was to get one of everything but my husband convinced me to get only the marshmallow cover in milk chocolate, the flour less chocolate cake, the butterscotch pudding and some kind of s'more sandwich. Everything looks so delicious and my selection was just as I expected from watching the Food Channel Network presentation on this restaurant. Very much worth the drive.

title: Pretty Good
review: This was a good place. Kinda small for the amount of people that show up. I ate their cookie monster but the cupcake fell apart as i was eating it which was annoying but it was still good. I also had an oatmeal chocolate chip cookie which was real good too.I would go back but my wife says she still likes Molly's better.

title: Sugar cookies to die for.
review: I've had several different kind of cupcakes from here and have yet to be disappointed. My last visit I decided to give the sugar cookies a whirl and wow, amazing. I don't think you can come here and order something that is less than heaven. A little pricey but definitely worth the splurge for delicious treats.

title: Sweet Mandy Wow!
review: I have never had a bad experience with Sweet Mandy B's ... Every dessert they make is amazing -- especially the birthday cakes, which taste amazing ... I also know the owner is very involved with the Chicago community and does charitable work ... I've always had service with a smile ...

title: Not just a cupcake place!
review: A friend of mine has made me into a cupcake searcher LOL. Whenever I go somewhere I have to check for a cupcake place (well and Donuts too but I was already a donut searcher LOL). So though I only live about 45 miles out of Chicago, I hadn't actually gone and looked into too many cupcake sellers until I did a couple 'staycations'. Sweet Mandy B's was on staycation #2.First off, it's not JUST a cupcake place but a full service bakery. It's in a very cute, residential area which is fun in itself and has a really charming feel and look. I ordered 4 cupcakes since that was what I came for but I found that there was a ton of other things to choose from and I ended up walking out of there with 3 other bakery items. Thank goodness I had 3 days to eat it all LOL.The cupcakes are of medium size and tbh, of varying yummy-ness. The banana was delicious! It was a banana bread type cupcake with chocolate frosting and though that doesn't sound like anything too special, it was very moist and just really tasty. The Cookie Monster one (which has a bottom this is a baked chocolate chip cookie) was too sweet for my taste. The PB cup wad dry so disappointing but the final one I bought, Snickerdoodle was like the banana...very yummy. So...that's 50% awesome and 50%, eh. Could be better but also worse. I at least know which to buy again and which to pass up.The bakery items were all good quality though. Nothing dry. I bought a huge raspberry bar tha was very good and had a lot of the delicious crumble topping. I also bought a lemon square but tbh, it was too tart for me but that is more a personal opinion. Others may really like that. The final item, a mint brownie was good but slightly too sweet though I would still say a tasty snack.Overall I'd come here again as there were a few more flavors of cupcakes I'd like to try and a few more bakery items too. Even the few things I didn't like, with the exception of the one dry cupcake, were of good quality so I'd say give this place a try. There's something for everyone! =o)

title: Great variety, beautiful shop, overly sweet
review: I like Sweet Mandy B's. I've gotten cupcakes, cakes, birthday cakes, and who knows what else here. Recently their taste has gotten extremely sugary sweet, and I like my sugars more than most. They need to take it down a few notches or I'll have to find another bakery.

title: THE BEST CUPCAKES & DESSERTS
review: Sweet Mandy B's is absolutely the best US destination for cupcakes and cakes (their pies are awesome too). The cake is always moist & even though I'm not an icing person, I can't get enough of Sweet Mandy B's. I sure hope they ship!

title: The best cakes, etc.
review: Great neighborhood spot that has the best cakes and cupcakes in town. Sweet Mandy B's frosting is amazing and the cakes is great. They also have such great combos as "double doozies:" white buttercream sandwiched between two awesome chocolate chip cookies. Their pies, muffins, and other baked goods are wonderful too.

title: Best bakery in Chicago
review: I love going to jus place, I wish it wasn't so expensive ...but it is really go. It's hard leaving this place without spending $20-25 bucks... But oh well you only live once...love it!

title: Go for the Cupcakes!
review: If you have a sweet tooth, please visit this place specifically for the cupcakes.  You will not be disappointed.  The frosting is very sweet, so keep that in mind when ordering. It is a great place to pick up desserts for birthdays and other occasions.

title: Great sweets - not so sweet service
review: Visited on a Wednesday evening after having dinner in the area with our 3 kids. The place was still pretty busy 15 minutes before closing time (8:45pm) and our kids loved their treats - a cookie, a cupcake and a chocolate covered marshmallow. Unfortunately the young lady behind the counter did not seem too happy to have customers at that time and her poor attitude made the experience less than sweet for the adults.

title: Great breads and cakes
review: Great breads and cakes. Tried the pies as well that weren't as good but not disappointing either. Great interior for kids.

title: Sumptious Sweets
review: Their speciality is cupcakes, but Sweet Mandy B's has incredible pies and other delicious treats as well. In terms of their sweets, it's a 5. The pies, particularly the fruit pies, are fantastic. Not overly sweet, simply delicious. (Haven't tried the cupcakes as I'm not a cupcake fan.) The reason for the 3 is the atmosphere. It's more of a carry-out place than a relaxing place to go to enjoy pie and coffee. You can eat there, but it's more like eating in a lunchroom with rickety tables, loud music. So a great place to get dessert, just take it home with you.

title: Best bakery for sweets in the neighborhood
review: Cakes and cupcakes set the standard here. No better place in Lincoln Park when you want to take a show-stopping dessert. The peanut butter frosting is amazing--even for those who don't love peanut butter. I was never a fan of angel food cake...UNTIL I tried SMB's. It will spoil you for any other version. Nothing's inexpensive, but everything is delicious. Mud cups a big hit with the under-10 crowd!

title: Wanted All of It
review: Wow -- we wandered into this bakery while exploring Lincoln Park, and it was very difficult to decide what treat to eat, between the many delicious-looking cookies, slices of cake, cupcakes, etc. We settled on cookies--an iced mollasses cookie and an M&M cookie. Both were packaged with care by the staff so we could enjoy later...and enjoy we did! Both cookies were delicious and very flavorful. Yum! Will plan on returning to try more treats!
