review: I went to The Range for dinner with a group from work. What a find! The space is very clean and has a modern farm theme that Eva Gabor would appreciate (you young'ns will have to look up that reference.) The Range has a list of their major food vendors on the bottom of their menu, which I appreciate. You know that they have developed a good relationship with local growers/butchers, and are buying quality ingredients. Two diners started with carrot soup, which looked wonderful and which they said was quite good. A great way to start a meal on a cold, cold night.For mains, one diner had the bacon flatbread and some had a veggie flatbread (I believe it was mushroom) that's no longer on the menu (because they serve only what's fresh.) I had the roasted half chicken. I loved the chicken -- very tender and the skin was crispy and so flavorful. Under the chicken were pickled veggies - carrots and greenbeans. Amazing! I love pickled vegetables, and these were delicious and complemented the chicken perfectly. There were some roasted potatoes to top off the dish. The wine and beer lists offered a good variety. The coffee after dinner was delicious. Our service was excellent -- attentive but not overbearing. I can't wait to go back and see what they have next.

title: Great find!
review: Happened by this place once, being from the burbs we made note to put it on visit list and just did it for brunch. Great farm fresh food with some specialties like gluten free pancakes. Had the pork Benedict which was great pulled pork obv potato rounds and poachers serves with salad. Chilaquiles also excellent. Great bowtruss coffee. Bloody marys good. Cristina our server was friendly and completely knowledgeable on the menu. Trendy, casual spirit to the restaurant befitting the neighborhood. Nice drink menu and bar selections.

title: Fair Enough
review: Nice decor with fun green fake grass on the ceiling but service was somewhat indifferent on a slow Friday night for dinner and food was just average.

title: Definitely a winner
review: Just had Saturday brunch at Range. There were 4 of us, and we all ordered different dishes, plus an order of pancakes for the table. The entire menu is inventive and there is a wide range of options. Each dish was fresh tasting and delicious. Friendly service, attractive modern decor. Definitely a winner.

title: Farm-to-Table Gem You Should Not Miss!
review: I met a friend at Range for brunch on a Friday before we went to an afternoon movie and it was the perfect way to start the day! The restaurant is located in the heart of Lincoln Park/DePaul neighborhood. This farm-to-market restaurant has a great ambiance and good service. Now, I have to admit the restaurant wasn't busy by any stretch of the imagination on this Friday mid-morning but you can just tell when the atmosphere and attention to detail will serve you well. For brunch, I had the 'pork & salsa benedict' - two perfectly poached eggs on pulled pork atop a slice of potato served with an arugula salsa verde salad with pear pomegranate vinaigrette dressing - yummy yummy!! For a restaurant to excel as a farm-to-table concept it requires an extensive network of local, organic farmers to provide the chef with great ingredients for his creative dishes. I can't wait to return to see what new items the chef has whipped up next time!

title: Creative farm-to-table gem
review: Last night was my third visit to Range. We ordered a plate of squash croquetas to share; my daughter and I had their amazing veggie burger as entree, and my wife and son had the chicken sandwich. I am not really vegetarian (OK, maybe I'm a crypto-vegetarian). However, I like to try different vegetarian entries. Veggie burgers in general are tricky, because lesser establishments try too hard to make them look, feel and taste like the regular variety. Not Range. Their burger patty tastes like, well, like a delicious vegetable patty---sweet potato, pumpkin, rice, and more. Love it! The chicken sandwich, with red cabbage slaw and goat cheese, was also a hit at our table. The ambiance is elegant and quirky enough to be interesting (note the "grass" ceiling). In addition, the staff was extremely good at addressing our serious allergy concerns; it's usually a good sign when the waiter points out that they take "cross-contamination" very seriously, without me or my wife asking.

title: A Cut Above, Near DePaul
review: Mostly student joints around DePaul but this place is aiming for a little more elegance.  A nice eclectic menu with good salads and appetizers, and tables that adjoin the sidewalk for fresh air.  We loved the salad, burger, Cuban sandwich, asparagus soup, everything.

title: Really Good Fries
review: This restaurant is quite stylish with a 60ish Mad Men vibe. We went for an early lunch on Memorial Day, there was plenty of seating. Service was attentive and efficient, especially before more tables started filling up. The menu options were creative and featured several unique taste pairings for sandwiches and flat breads. The food was tasty, I had the turkey sandwich and I tasted the bacon flat bread, however both had bleu cheese as a main ingredient which almost completely covered the other flavors of the dishes. The best thing we had at Range was by far the herbed french fries. The were seasoned perfectly and perfectly crisp. No comment on the parking, we walked from a nearby apartment. But, in Lincoln Park it is usually challenging to find street parking. Final analysis: Not bad, Not the best, maybe trying a little too hard to be 'cute.'

title: Small plates-unique offerings
review: I wanted to like this restaurant more than I did. Located near DePaul-parking might be a challenge.In May, they still were offering their winter menu and it was 85 out.The Buffalo cauliflower was great-very creative -tasty. The Range(cheese) platter was good-but we need more toast to eat it on. Baked Brie was greatThe tamales plate was mediocre-dry.The chocolate cake lacked flavor.We ordered special drinks that were just ok. Total for 2 was about $80

title: *sigh* - I'm calling it now - another restaurant that will fail in this location
review: There were definitely a few issues when my husband and I met another couple here for dinner on a Friday night:1. No valet parking. This is a huge deterrent, pretty much making the restaurant rely on foot traffic. It took our friends 20 min to park. Being so close to DePaul, you would think the restaurant could make a deal for some spots.2. Lack of non-alcoholic beverages. My friend and I are both pregnant. Despite it being on their menu, they were out of lemonade and originally out of iced tea (they made some for us). They also don't stock cranberry juice. We felt very limited with what we could drink initially - just club soda with lemon.3. Slow service. When we first sat down, we were still waiting for our friends. Our waiter was very quick to take our drink order. He was also quick to take our friends' drink orders when they arrived. Everything after that was sllloooow. Though the food arrived quickly, the waiter waited a very long time to come back to our table initially to order apps, then dinner. The dinner took just under 3 hours.4. The food. I actually really enjoyed almost everything I had. We got the cheese plate for an app, which was fantastic. The butternut squash flatbread (also for an app) was just ok. It was pretty dry and not too much flavor. I ordered the fried chicken and my friend ordered the burger - both were good. However, our two catholic husbands found it difficult to order anything off the menu without meat (we visited during lent). My husband had buffalo cauliflower (very good but served in huge chunks instead of bit sized pieces) and mac & cheese. The mac and cheese was on the kid's menu and it tasted like noodles with olive oil and garlic. I'm not sure how they think a kid would think that tastes like mac & cheese when we barely got any flavor from it. My friend's husband ordered two grilled cheeses, also off the kid's menu, and there was barely any cheese on the bread. Unfortunately both of them left hungry.So, in the end, the only things we liked were the cheese plate, fried chicken and burger. Though the service was slow, everyone was very nice.It's just not a place I would go back to. Perhaps they need to turn this spot into retail.

title: Great find on a cold night!
review: We had planned to go to an old stand-by that ended up being closed and found this neighborhood restaurant. I love trying new places and enjoyed this one. It has a modern decorative feel but still warm. The menu was not large but had a little of something for everyone. The service was laid back but attentive. The food was really good too! We definitely will go back.

title: Great casual spot
review: A fun, casual spot with fantastic outdoor dining in the adjacent courtyard. Service is a little uneven- they delivered the wrong pizza twice. However, the quality of the crust makes up for any frustration. It is slightly charred, bubbly, and yeasty. Salads are fresh and delicious. Drinks are great. The tartufo afogato is heavenly.

title: A pleasant surprise
review: Usually I find the reviews of a restaurant to be pretty accurate. This place had some bad reviews, both the pizza and the service. Well we decided to give it a try based on a friends recommendation and we were pleasantly surprised at how good everything was.The service was over the top. you could not take a sip of water without having your glass filled and even before you finished the last bite they were there clearing your plates and bringing new ones.The manager / owner??? [ I forgot his name but he was from Latvia] was charming, attentive, and had complete control of his restaurant. The portions were substantial and the prices reasonable. To top it off they have a very nice outside patio andon this particular night no one was sitting inside.We had fried calamari appetizer, pear and gorgonzola salad, and a white thin crust pizza with baby shrimp, zucchini, etc.Delicious and affordable. I will be returning soon.

title: My Local favorite, never disappoints
review: Nella's is a great spot for Neopoltan pizza/food. The pizza is certainly the headliner and I've pretty much tried them all over the years. The pastas are homemade as well, you can't go wrong with a combo pasta/pizza for two people. I would suggest the Nutella pizza for dessert if you have room, it will keep you coming back. Nella also makes her own Limoncello - you have to have some to help digest! It is a friendly place with nice patio, wonderful atmosphere and food that consistently outperforms.

title: Hidden gem
review: Okay we ended up here by accident on a rainy heave rainy day. My wife and kids were very hungry and we googled for some suggestions for pizza places around us. This was the closest listing and we decided to take a chance. We were so glad we took the chance. Service excellent. Food excellent. Ambience excellent. We have added this to our list of favorite in the city.

title: Transported Back to Napoli
review: The first mark of this restaurant's excellence is the multitude of dining award sticker on the front door of Pizzeria Da Nella. This large, family style restaurant is perfect for group dining. Also, the patio provides a romantic setting for date nights under the lights. The pizza is the closest to authentic Napoli pizza that I have ever tasted. The only thing that keeps it from being truly authentic is that each slice is cut. Some people may prefer their pizza to be sliced especially if they are sharing, but I prefer the fun of slicing and dicing your pizza any way you like it, the Neopolitan way! I learned from my family that lives right in the crazy Napoli city center and always crave a simple margherita pizza consistently cooked to perfection. We ordered a buffala margeherita pizza and the arugula salad with prosciutto and Parmesan. I am excited to go back to try the pasta and have been very impressed by their expansive menu options. We are lucky to be able to walk to this authentic pizzeria in the neighborhood. The craft beer selection is all imported from Italy and Europe, and beer list gets a little pricey, but they do have a list of reasonably priced glasses and bottles of wine. The service was spot on! They were very accommodating and flexible. Everything was well timed, and it's a very casual friendly environment. Bravo, da Nella!

title: Delicious
review: Ate here tonight for the first time and my whole family enjoyed it. We ordered a few different pizzas and they were amazing. The atmosphere in the restaurant is very nice. Patrons were anywhere from very fancy to very casual. Wait staff were friendly and prompt in service. I highly recommend this restaurant!

title: Master Neapolitan Style Pizza Maker
review: The best Neapolitan style pizza I have ever had. This is not good pizza, this is great pizza. Family run and friendly makes this my favorite place for pizza in Chicago; which is a very bold statement in Chicago. This is the best pizza city in the country (Sorry New York).

title: ITALY in Chicago
review: The best pizza that I've never eat..And I'm Italian!!! People are fantastic and Franco is incredible.. VERY ITALIAN FOOD. more than an excellent restaurant !!!

title: Fine Neopolitan Pie
review: Accommodated 16 family members on short notice. Pizzas and salads were great. Certainly = to Spacca Napoli down the road.

title: This is really I-T-A-L-i-A-N
review: In our travels, one thing we have learned is that nobody, and I mean nobody, makes pizza like Chicagoans do. My wife, who once worked in New York for eight years, insists New York-style pizza is very good. But I ignore her. In Chicago, you are treated to every kind of pizza there is--thin crust, pan, deep dish, Neapolitan, New York--so you can speak with some expertise on the subject. I am addicted to thin crust, cheese and sausage, but every once in a while I will sample others that are highly recommended by friends or food critics or other travelers. How we missed Pizzeria da Nella Cucina Nepolatana at 1443 West Fullerton, I don't know. It's in our Lincoln Park neighborhood and it produces classic Neapoitan pizza from a wood-oven stove that is operated by a Naples native whose passion for Italian food is only matched by her experience with pizza. They really take pizza seriously. The mixture of dough, yeast, water and sliced mozzarella isn't just a delicious dish, it is a passion, only made better by crispy crusts, succulent sauces and a variety of fresh toppings. At Nella, you have to try the pizza. But the menu features creative spins on a wide array of pastas, salads and other Italian dishes. Start with bruschetta, fresh chopped tomatoes, garlic, basil, extra virgin olive oil topped with fresh mozzarella. Many versions of bruschetta don't use cheese. I enjoy either kind. Without too much mozzarella, Nella's was excellent. The spinach salad with onion, red peppers, balsamic vinegar and extra virgin olive oil was a keeper, too. For entrees, we gave five stars to the Salmone dello Chef (filet of wild salmon) and Pollo alla Saltimbocca (chicken breast sauteed with fresh mozzarella, prosciutto and spinach). For dessert, we shared tiramisu, as good as we have tasted anywhere. This is a traditional Italian restaurant, old school, not a conventional one. The recipes are unique and original. When I reminded my wife that she had overlooked one of her favorites, Pesce Marino (black and wild Mahi-Mahi on a bed of shrip and scallop risoto), she vowed to order it on our next trip to Nella's.

title: Wine bar on second floor is a hidden gem for private gathering
review: I just attended a media event for the Lydia Smith Sickle Cell Foundation at this location, in a newly-opened facility tucked above the Pizzeria that was well-suited for a private gathering. It is a little hard to notice the entrance and the parking valet just to the left of the Pizzeria entrance, and the stairs are kind of long, but they are well-lit and safe. The food and drink were delicious including thin-crust pizzas and the servers were gracious. The audiovisual setup and privacy were just right for our group of about 40 people.

title: very, very, very close to the real thing
review: This pizzeria has a touch of a real neapolitan pizzeria, with a stone oven using wood to cook, a rich selection of pizzas to please every palate, done on the typical neapolitan style. Appetizers are served in large portions: we had crispy, not heavy fried calamari, bruschetta, prosciutto and bufala mozzarella, all abundant and satisfying. Again, pizzas were flawless and yummy. Don't miss the desserts, like semifreddo alla Nutella or the baba (a bit more Rhum would have made it perfect!). Unusually wide selection of artisanal Italian beers, good selection of Italian, especially from Campania, wines at reasonable prices. Warm atmosphere, friendly service. A very nice experience.

title: Quite good
review: I've eaten hundreds of pizzas in Europe/Italy, and the few dozen of that type/style I've been able to find in this country, so that is what I'm comparing Nella's to. Apples to apples. You can't compare this stuff to a deep dish place or Domino's...It was good, but as is often the case with this style of pizza, the middle of the pizza is consistently mushy, often totally mushy and completely lacking in any sort of structural integrity. Flavors very good, crust very nice on the edge and near the edge, but after 4 pizzas here, the middle was completely soft and wet- soaking wet in fact, and not so fun to eat. You HAVE to fold it up and roll it into the drier edge crust. I'm Italian and recognize/kind of don't like the superior aire in the air at here. I'm used to it and don't think a complain/comment at a place like this about the super soggy center would be well received. Having said that, i'll go there again, give it another chance, and if the pizza comes out watery in the middle, I'll say something and see how they take the feedback. If it's like i expect, like I'm a stupid American who doesn't get it, i'll come back here and give them a 3 star review. If they take the criticism and act genuinely interested, and tell me how to avoid it in the future by asking or something, i'll give them 5 stars. If I get the quiet cold shoulder, i'll do nothing. Good luck!

title: Great Pizza
review: Went on a Saturday night and had reservations at 7:30, when we arrived there were plenty of tables, but half a hour later, they were packed. We had the calamari and caprese salad to begin and then shared two pizzas. They were great, super crust and toppings, one was with arugula and we loved that. We then shared two desserts, the chocolate cake and then the chocolate gelato with espresso poured over top. That one was my favorite, wanting one as I type! Service was great, waiter explained the menu well.

title: Loved Pizzeria da Nella
review: Every plate from the start to the end tasted great. Pizza is just different and very flavor. Loved the chocolate desert. Everyone who visits Chicago should go. We even met Nella in person.

title: So excellent!
review: Super friendly and informative service. Very delicious pizza. Never had a pizza like this before. So fluffy, delicate and flavorful. Spacious and clean place. Nella herself came to me and said hello! So pleased.

title: Fabulous thin crust pizza
review: I met a friend for lunch and she picked this place. I love trying new restaurants. It is a treat to find a closer option for thin crust pizza. We had the margherita and a white pizza with spinach. It is nice to try different items and then bring it home and enjoy for lunch the next day! It was very quiet at lunch, but I can't wait to go back at night or on the weekend and see the crowds, The server was great, I wish I remembered his name. The ovens are right there in the dining room. And they have an outdoor patio!

title: Authentic and Great Service
review: My wife and I recently dined on their patio. We had a clam and mussel appetizer, salad and wood fired pizza. It was all excellently prepared. Would put the food up against anybody. Can't say enough about the service. Knowledge and kindness of our waiter, the attention of the waiter and other staff, etc. Highly recommend Pizzeria da Nella.

title: Pizzeria de nella
review: Good pizza.  Vegetarians were well accommodated,  will visit when in Chicago.   An excellent variety of vegetarian pizzas.

title: A piece of Italy in Chicago!!
review: Pizza was amazing, I recommend it!!!! The owner was very careful! The place is very spacious and has plenty of tables.

title: Great Pizza and Craft Beers
review: This is a gem.. Pizza is outstanding. Old world traditional pizza hand cooked by owner from italy.. They have a great selection of italian craft beers.

title: Just Like Italy, without the 9 hour Airflight!
review: This has been our fourth visit to Da Nella. The pizza tastes just like what we had outside of Naples, on the island of Capri. The variety offered and the flavors are so good. And the crust! Oh mama mia! They have the perfect recipe down.The owners are on the premises, watching over the dining room, and manning (and wo-manning) the genuine wood-fired pizza oven. When the owners care so much to come by your table and talk to you, you know the quality of the product will be consistent. Awesome Italian wine list! Go and enjoy a delicious pizza and a glass of wine!!

title: Authentic Neapolitan Pizza
review: This is a hidden gem in Lincoln Park. The pizza is fantastic. they have a true Neapolitan pizza oven, and the owner's wife is from Naples. The pizza comes out perfect with the right thickness, char and chewy texture. My wife (who is gluten-free) gets the Risotto all a Contadina which is fantastic. We have been multiple times, and while the menu is extensive, we find ourselves compelled to get the same thing. The wine list is a nice selection of Italian wines, though bit pricy. The deserts are fantastic too. We usually get the Caprese - desert which is a flourless chocolate cake with almonds accompanied by ice cream. For gluten-free individuals this italian eatery offers many delicious choices.

title: So far..best pizza in the U.S.
review: I'm Italian, I love pizza (surprise!) and I've been traveling in the U.S. (New York, Orlando, Miami, Atlanta, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, San Diego, San Francisco, Chicago and other little cities). I've been pizza basically everywhere because I like trying new places and to see how they do it. Well, I was in Napoli (Italy) in November 2013 and tried "Da Nella" for the first time this week end (March 2014). I have to say that I did not find any difference between their pizza and some of the wonderful ones I had in Naples. I will definitely go again even if I live downtown and it's like 15-20 minutes driving to go there. Totally worth it. Best pizza in the U.S. so far, great selection of craft beer and nice location. Not difficult to park around the pizzeria. Good for families, great with friends and also good for couples (it's not a romantic place but you'll have a great meal!).Great job!

title: Great pizza, great for kids
review: Its location is convenient in terms of parking, the space is huge and able to accomodate large parties, and the service is decent, not great. We go there for early dinners and see a lot of families. Pizza is excellent, and food comes out pretty fast if thats imporatnt to you. We go here once every other month with friends who have young kids, and the staff is very accomodating and friendly of crying babies, always a plus! :)

title: Great pizza
review: Small and brightly lit, the pizza is great! Many selections, but was a little disappointed we could not get one with made half-n-half (my son is a vegetarian I’m certainly a carnivore). The pies were medium sized – about 10inch – so were each had our own and took leftovers. Attentive service!!

title: Great Italian restaurant!
review: Delicious pizza! Really unique pizzas and great waiter,very knowledgable. Very clean and nice place inside. Loved it!

title: Truly Neapolitan
review: If you are in Chicago and want to eat Neapolitan food and Pizza you got two options:1) to take a flight out of Ohare airport and reach Napoli. 2) to book at Pizzeria da Nella in Lincoln park area off of Fullerton ave as I did this Sunday....fresh ingredients for a starter with zucchini flower stuffed with mozzarella and anchovies and a tasty pizza Margherita very close to want you can eat in Naples. Thank you Frank and Nella see you next time I'll swing by Chicago.

title: Local FAV
review: I come here very regularly, the Octopus salad is a must - fantastic!  The pizza is the best in the city and it is locally owned.  Fantastic place to meet, greet drink and eat!

title: A true New York Rival
review: Excellant Service, Food, & Fun.   Love this place.   Great Pizza but even better is everything else, from their Wood Burning Stove.

title: Their garden was a great place to dine
review: It was a beautiful night and we really enjoyed sitting in their spacious outdoor area. The pizza is very good, there are many other items on the menu. The salads are very good also. Don't miss the cannoli!

title: Food Fresh from Italy!!!
review: This place is amazing!! The food tastes like Italy! The pizza is made from scratch & in wood burning oven. Everything is high quality and made fresh!We ordered Salads Mista was very good! Any pizza is a winner!! And the pasta... You can't go wrong. Did I mention it is very reasonablely priced! This is an excellent value. You are missing out from great Italian food. Stop by and enjoy!!

title: Nice Surprise on Fullerton
review: Enjoy the large outdoor eating area in the summer. Great service. Friendly. White anchovies for an appetizer. Great pizza. Good wine list. Very good cocktails. One of the best choices in Lincoln Park.

title: Like at home
review: Like at home, yes, this is my feeling when i went in this pizzeria/restaurant. This is the unique place in Chicago and around where i can eat a pizza as in my country, Neaples. So i hope to come back soon.

title: Hidden gem near DePaul!
review: The test of a true pizza is the crust. This crust is so good I could enjoy it without toppings!  Recommended by locals this authentic Italian pizza is delicious!  Not your typical Chicago pie, this thin crust is simply delicious!  Come!

title: Come for the pizza; Linger on the patio in the summer
review: Available street parking made us come here for the first time last summer- the wood fired pizza oven and the shaded outdoor dining area keeps us coming back- stopped here Easter Sunday with a friend because of an email that said we are open on Easter- Here's the good and the bad: excellent pizza- perfect crust with at least half a dozen White pizzas (my favorite), the large room is set up for conversation (the three ladies behind us spoke Italian so there's must be something about the food)- the risotto is good and my husband has ordered the spicy seafood pasta (yesterday served in foil shaped like a swan)- the bad is only sweetened ice tea (definetely from a gallon bottle-UCK), no coffee (expresso and cappuchino but they can't make Americano?). The wine and beer selection is fun- have tried a few different selections at the reocmmendation of the wait staff.

title: Mediocre food and inept service.
review: Pizzeria Da Nella is located in the congested DePaul area. It consists of a large, plainly decorated dining room with a long bar and an outdoor patio adjacent to the side of its building. This restaurant specializes in wood fired Neapolitan style pizza and also offers appetizers, salads, and a very limited number of pastas and other entrées.Our party of four recently dined there on an early Sunday evening. We started with the Calamari Fritti. It was spongy and salty rather than crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. Next we had three Neapolitan pizzas consisting of the Bufalina (bufala cheese, basil, and tomato sauce), the Funghi e Salsiccia (mushrooms, mozzarella cheese, and tomato sauce), and the Ortolana (medley of vegetables, mozzarella cheese, and tomato sauce). All three were satisfactory but far from special. Wine by the glass was overpriced and small pours.Service was extremely slow. We had to wait a very long time to be served our drinks and experienced another very long interval between receiving our antipasto and ordering our pizzas. Moreover, the service was inept. We had to ask our waiter three times for some extra napkins, and he served a glass of white wine instead of the ordered red, which had to be returned causing further delays.Metered street parking is available but can difficult to find.Mediocre food, poor value, incompetent service, and parking problems all ensure that I won’t be returning.

title: great pizza with good service
review: Headed in at last minute after swimming nearby , food and service was very good , very enjoyable , welcoming for family groups.

title: Tutto benne!
review: Living in Southern Italy, most of the summer, true Italian pizza in the states stands out like a smooth driving in Naples. We have known the owner Nella and her family for several years, and when we come in, we are treated like family. Using a wood burning oven, handmade pasta, and other chefs all from Italy, all I can say is "Bellisimo!" When we come back to Chicago, Nella's is the Dolce Vita.

title: Very disappointed on June 2
review: We specifically stopped there as this bakery/cafe has been a long time favorite. Really surprised to see that it is "online order" ONLY. When we then checked the website to see what we might order + wait on the sidewalk for, we found that bread seems to only be available on Thursdays and Saturdays .... and, at 11 am, they were sold out of sticky buns. What a wasted trip.... luckily we headed north to Lost Larson + got some delicious items from them. Also on 6/2 Floriole's website is referring to dates in mid-April as "upcoming". Seems they are not really funcitoning right now. What a shame.

title: Best French pastries in Chicago?
review: It figures that Sandra and Mathieu Holl would produce some of, if not the best French pastries in Chicago. Sandra was named Pastry Chef of the Year in 2015 at the prestigious Jean Banchet Awards. You can taste why by sampling the fresh breads, sandwiches, salads, French pastries, cookies, sweets and breakfast items on the menu at the Holls' Floriole Cafe & Bakery. Located at 1220 West Webster Avenue in Chicago's Lincoln Park neighborhood, west of Racine, it is open from 9 to 1 Wednesday through Sunday. Come early. The Holls offer breakfast and luncheon goodies and an array of European-style pastries. They established their business in 2010 and the line forms at the door. Have your order in mind before you step to the walk-up window. Our personal favorites are the cinnamon swirl raisin bread, oatmeal cherry cookies, salted honey baby pie with delicious custard filling, chocolate croissants, ham and cheese croissants and danish. Since three bakeries closed within the last two years in our Gold Coast neighborhood, Floriole Bakery is as close as it gets to fresh breads and pastries. Thanks, Sandra and Mathieu.

title: Tasty toasts!
review: Coffee is very tasty and toasts are delicious! Ideal for a great working session alone or with a couple of friends. The place is small but comfortable enough to spend a great time.

title: Great bakery and coffee
review: After a huge meal down the street at Pequods, we wandered to Floriole specifically for a cup of coffee before jumping back in the car...which we certainly got, freshly brewed, and very tasty. Of course, standing there in front of all of these delicious looking pastries, no matter how stuffed we were, did us in...and we ended up getting some pastries to munch on the way home. They were each excellent, and we were happy that we did indeed buy some. The staff here was very friendly, and patient to work with us through our indecisiveness! Definitely great "local" bakery/coffee shop to visit!

title: Charming for breakfast
review: We maximized opportunity for savory and sweet options for breakfast. The quiche was really nice, flaky delicious crust. Almond Croissant was light, airy, really nice. Counter service with no trays for you to carry drinks and bakery items, which makes for a lot of back and forth. Not sure why I’m tipping except to prevent spitting in said drinks and breakfast items. It does have a nice atmosphere and lots of take away a business. Line is long mostly because only two people behind the counter.

title: They ask for tip before you even sit down
review: You order at the counter, wait for and then carry your own coffee. Get your own water- not sure what the tip is for? Food is good

title: My new favorite bakery!
review: After going to this bakery on our airbnb host's recommendation, my sister and I returned every day of our vacation. Every day we had a new treat, and we were never disappointed. The croissants and pastries were light and flaky, the quiche and cheesecake mousse were delicious, and the coffee was perfect. (And I'm a bit of a coffee snob.) There was limited but attractive outdoor seating, with well-lit and clean seating inside. The next time I'm in Chicago, Floriole is going to be one of my top destinations!

title: Late Saturday morning breakfast
review: Wow!!!  Fabulous bakery/restaurant.  Right in local neighborhood with many locals.  Enjoyed all breads, quiche, croissants and all baked goods.  All Good!  Fresh brewed coffee.  A little out of the way in North Chicago but worth the time and drive.  Will be back.

title: Delicious soup, bread and happy hour wine $5
review: I came in planning on getting a delicious pastry but it was soo cold outside so I decided to get the soup of the day. What a great choice. The cauliflower soup with sour dough bread was so delicious. The barista helped me choose the happy hour wine which was $5 and he was super nice. Definitely recommend for lunch

title: Peanut Butter and Jelly Cookies
review: We stopped in to try a couple of the PB&J cookies.  They were excellent.    The breakfast menu and coffee looked great, but we had just had breakfast so we didn't try anything else.

title: On a whole other level.
review: Floriole is the kind of place that's unexpected but absolutely delightful. The level of skill and quality of ingredients make the food here outstanding. It's not an expensive but I can't think of a better place to indulge in a little bit of personal time or an impromptu meet up with a friend or colleague. Upstairs doesn't outstanding place to sit and work or have a meeting with big tables and skylights adjacent to their outdoor rooftop mini Farm. I deliberately reroute my commute in order to pass by and stop in.

title: Very good coffee, French patisserie
review: The coffee was one of the best we had in the U.S., the quiche was good, too, but a little to much on the egg only side for me. The buckwheat scone was far too dry but they gave me more jam to eat it with.A nice guy cleaned the tables, but you have to get the coffee yourself. The meals are being served.So I would consider this a very good bakery with tables. Since we couldn´t find any European style café in the U.S., this might be the nearest you can get.It is a little too expensive for my taste. But the cookies, pastries and tarts are special. My kids loved the chocolate cookie.

title: Beautiful coffee shop with a French flair
review: Delicious food (I had the baked egg and toast) and great tea selection. They even had fresh flowers on the table upstairs. Great quiet place to do work.

title: Great Casual French Inspired Cafe but NOT Haute French
review: Decent casual French inspired cafe and bakery. I was meeting with a Linkedin Acquaintance for the 1st time and mentioned about this place near his work. I am glad i did not pay since i was unemployed at the moment and was about to pay be he was generous to treat so I took the offer. Again it was not Bad. I had a deep dish Quiche vegetable style since they served it another way (I think with ham) with meet but was watching my diet. It was delicious with fresh Spinach on top. They also had a side of "Popcorn" which I thought was odd to serve for Quiche which is why I labeled it "French Inspired" and not Authentic Traditional Haute French Cuisine. The croissants look good too but French Cuisine to me focuses on the taste and not how full you feel so I ate light. Prices too where good as well. Not expensive. I would go again to try the other Delicateness dishes. Otherwise a new one on my list despite passing by here when I used to Bicycle ride.

title: Cozy Atmosphere
review: I believe this place was open till 5:30 on a Monday although TripAdvisor says it’s closed at 2. I stumbled on this place while a friend was in a meeting. It was a quaint quiet little place. I got the bread bowl and an iced tea for a nice price. It was quiet, clean and the staff was friendly. The bowl came with so so much bread! I would go again to get actual food (the avo toast YUM). Loved this little find

title: OMG, very very Expensive for frozen
review: All frozen made, they only turn that oven on and bake them. They hare unbelievably expensive, do yourself a favor and go to the Belgium bakery and avoid Floriole, terrible people cheap food, all frozen. I am in the food business and I can get the same croissants they have. It is frozen products. All same shape. They think customers are dumb, but they are for what they charge you. My family made fun on me, but I tried.

title: Delicious, cozy, friendly, warm French restaurant.
review: Wonderful and friendly service, deleesh baked goods and original small plates. Lovely atmosphere. Very sweet and decidedly European.

title: Pretty, but the Quiche was Awful
review: The decor was bright and homey. The quiche seemed promising, but the results were inedible. The hot apple cider tasted good, but the size was small for the price. The baked goods looked very good. I should have tried them. There's no table service or checking on the customers' experience.

title: Interesting Food And Drink Choices.
review: This is an interesting restaurant with outdoor seating, weather permitting. They have lots to choose from - sandwiches sand salads, breads, cakes and pastries, and lots of coffee beverages. We look forward to returning.

title: Tasty and Different Food & Sweets
review: The baked eggs were tasty (and a bit spicy). Also enjoyed the side salads - tomato & mozzarella and a veggie quinoa salad.  The coffee cake was unfortunately dry. Lots of sweets and coffee drinks to choose from.  Indoor and outdoor seating. We'd go back.

title: Best bakery in Chicago
review: FINALLY I've found a bakery in Chicago that offers baguettes and croissants on par with what I can get in France! I was in baked-goods withdrawal after returning from a trip to Paris, and Floriole gave me a much needed cure! I was very impressed with everything I had!-delicious fresh authentic baguette and miche -broche was also perfect-breakfast pastries including pecan roll and croissants were great-Parisienne sandwich--ham and cheese on baguette was delicious -also had a great baked egg with miche on the side -fantastic hand made coffee drinks--get an au lait!-beautiful both charming and contemporary space--both indoor and outdoor options--feels like the perfect modern bakery in Paris Will be back soon for more bread and pastries (and coffee)!

title: Such a really nice bakery
review: We went to eat in that bautiful bakery. I took the red curried squash which was delicious and the smoked trout tartine with fennel and radish which was fresh and so delicious. I deeply loved it. The atmosphere of that plaxe is great and the staff is very welcoming. My favorite bakery for a snack in chicago for now

title: Relaxing and Delicious
review: I love this place! The food is fantastic especially the B.A.D sandwich. The ambience is also great and it's a perfect place to get some work done.

title: Great neighborhood spot
review: We wanted a quick casual breakfast so we grabbed some coffee and pastries. I had some sort of almond and chocolate croissant and it was amazing. Will definitely go back!

title: Absolutely the best! My favorite spot!
review: Everything I eat there is amazing. Such a good selection of classics and some new favs as well. Closest thing to France but with the American touch. Beverage menu covers all the bases from coffee to wine. Comfortable and with an interesting window to watch the kitchen in action. Upper story is nice and they have a roof top garden where they grow edible flowers and herbs. They have bee hives too! The lower dining area has a huge bifold glass wall which opens to bring the outside in. Go enjoy, and spread the word!

title: wonderful neighborhood place..
review: Had lunch there...outstanding turkey sandwich on their homemade flatbread..just so tasty. My wife had the salad that was also first class. Very warm and fuzzy place to drop in and have a meal or just coffee. Upstairs available or on the first floor with more activity.Friendly staff...Clean and inviting. Order at the counter, take a seat and the food is brought to you.

title: Cozy, excellent simple food, great bread too.
review: Went for breakfast. A limited menu but everything we had was very good. Simple dishes like ricotta on bread, egg sandwich,coffee, pastry, all good. and  the service was friendly too. Excellent loaf of bread we bought for home.

title: Chicago morning coffee place
review: Floriole was suggested by friend of mine. It was a good choice, since the place had several tables outdoor and that was one of weather perfect Chicago days. Indoor ambient is appealing and table size is appropriate for the menu servings.Like a lot the fact that cappuccino was served in ceramic cup. Didn't ask how many shots of coffee is in serving, but I was missing a coffee strength in it. I wanted to try some other offerings and order breakfast sandwich and buckwheat scone. Both were delicious and I liked that they are smaller size or better to say the size how suppose to be. On the other I didn't like that the scone I took with me to the table, for the sandwich I got a number and was served by employee and finnaly for the cappuccino I was called by barista to come and pick up.

title: Busy enough that it isn't fast...
review: Had lunch and an afternoon coffee/snack here. The lunch was delicious (I had a great sandwich), and the chocolate tart and latter were good too. But they take great care with your food so if you're in a rush, better let them know. We stayed until they were closing up so they "bribed" us with free pastries to get us to leave! Bonus

title: Very nice place with good pastry options
review: We tried the passion fruit tart, the texture was amazing however the butter taste was stronger than the passion fruit. The coffee on the other had was great.

title: Favorite breakfast spot
review: I have been to Floriole many times. It is a nice french pastry and bakery spot; some of the best croissants, pastries and breakfast in Chicago.

title: Wonderful food and fine pastries
review: We had a great lunch at Floriole. The sandwiches were creative and delicious. Pastries are superb! We had a passion fruit tart and a cheesecake in a jar with rhubarb compote on the bottom. So good!!

title: Outstanding cappuccino and bakery goods
review: I typically go there once a week for a cappuccino and baked goods.  Reasonably-priced meals in a cozy environment.

title: Amazing!
review: My husband and I are frequent customers and cannot speak highly enough about Floriole. We enjoy picking up a great challah or seeded loaf or house bread for breakfast at home. It is the best bread around. Eating in at Floriole is very pleasant as well. The upstairs seating is very cute. Croissants, canelles, Parisian sandwich are of very high quality. Wonderful place!

title: Best baked bread, worth the wait
review: When we are craving fresh bread, floriole is the place.  Located in the depaul neighborhood, the lines can be long but worth the wait.  Today, we enjoyed the seeded sourdough.  Awesomeness

title: what a breakfast!
review: This place was awesome. Order at the counter, sit down & they bring the food . We went for breakfast. The quiche was just simply delicious & served with fresh greens. The sticky buns are sinfully good. Great selection of pasteries.

title: Little gem
review: Visiting Chicago for the summer, came across this place while on a walk. Was delicious had a sandwich and a mineral. Staff were fast and efficient, only thing is, it's a little over priced!

title: Fantastic pastries
review: Their pastries are fantastic, reasonably priced and beautiful. There is a wide assortment from which to choose. Service is friendly and helpful. They provide the pastries to Intellgentsia and this is how we found them. We will be back for lunch sometime as it looks to be delightful!

title: You gotta love the chocolate croissants
review: Sandra and Mathieu Holl have gone from selling French pastries out of a 10-by-10 foot tent at Chicago's Green City Market for five years to realizing their dream, establishing their own brick-and-mortar cafe/bakery at 1220 West Webster in Chicago's Lincoln Park neighborhood in 2010. They've expanded their menu from signature pastries--the chocolate croissants with two layers of melty dark chocolate are to die for--to include breads, sandwiches, salads and more pastries. it's fun to stop by early in the morning and order three or four items to go--like a chocolate croissant, ham-and-cheese croissant, baked egg breakfast sandwich and a smoked turkey sandwich. And don't forget a sack of brownies and oatmeal cherry cookies and chocolate hazelnut cookies an chocolate walnut cookies and maple pecan cookies for the kids. And if you love to snack on sandwiches, order a large loaf of the house sourdough bread. It has a long shelf life and goes great with everything or on its own. I love it with tuna salad or egg salad or hard salami or corned beef.

title: Tops for French Breads & Pastries!
review: This cozy local spot offers among the very best breads and pastries in the city. Many compare with what you would find in France. Great for breakfast and lunch. And excellent coffee.  Brunch can be crowded.

title: Love the desserts!
review: I'm glad we came to try the 'popular pays' app here and take the passion fruit tart. It was delicious!! Very dulcet and smooth. We also tried chocolate mouse and I like it too, but it might seems too sweet for someone who's not as sweet-tooth as me :)

title: Sandwich and salad for lunch in the neighborhood
review: Quick lunch in the neighborhood. Quiche and a sandwich. Comfortable. Tasty sandwich - had the Parisian. The Canole pastry wasn't bad but didn't meet expectations. If you are in the neighborhood and want to eat something light, reasonably fast and reasonably priced, I'd suggest Floriole without hesitation.

title: Delicious breakfast - always out of the polenta!
review: During our five-years in Chicago, we frequented this spot. The beautiful ambiance is great for meeting friends for a light brunch or drinking coffee solo with the newspaper. The quality of the locally-sourced food is unmatched. The staff appears to genuinely care about the taste and presentation of their food. There are a few downsides to Floriole's popularity: it is often crowded on weekends and difficult to find a seat - especially if the top floor is reserved for an event. The food selection can be limited (I'm looking at you polenta) if you don't go early. To be honest, though, I've gone early and late and never had the chance to eat the polenta! Occasionally, you'll get a sour-faced cashier, but I attribute that to serving breakfast to Lincoln Park-ites for several hours each morning. I'd probably be grumpy, too. Otherwise, a great place for anyone to have a light breakfast, lunch or snack on the edge of the Lincoln Park neighborhood.

title: Gotta love the neighborhood places
review: Places like Floriole are what makes exploring Chicago neighborhoods so much fun.  Tucked away on Webster, Floriole offers great pastries and breads and an adventurous spirit of exploration. Besides good food, they offer classes and special ed nights.

title: Buttery Croissants & Divine Bread
review: My husband & I came from the suburbs to try their desserts. I got the almond croissant and we took home a baguette. The croissant was buttery & flaky, the bread was just the way I like it - crusty and chewy on the inside. We had turkey sandwiches and I spread honey on a piece - fabulous!

title: Great food - poor service
review: The food is very good. Creative menu and of course awesome pastries. But the staff just doesn't seem to get that being nice is part of the order. They seemed understaffed with one gal bussing tables. And the guy taking orders was surly. Even saying that, we'd go back for the food!

title: Disappointing
review: Some 2-3 years ago, Floriole was a hot spot in Lincoln Park with almost routine coverage in the Chicago Tribune as each scrumptious new seasonal (usually Franch) pastry was added to the list. Returning for lunch after an 18 month hiatus, my Parisian sandwich was just as good as I remembered it - despite extraordinary S-L-O-W service - but the pastry selection was decidedly dowdy, unimaginative and expensive - the latter especially for take out where $1.05 in taxes was added to a $5.00 dessert (that's 20%+ for those who care about such things). Fortunately since most of the pastries and all of the bread apart from the baguette had been overbaked, the temptation to buy more takeout was avoided.

title: Great brunch spot
review: it's a bit more casual in that you just place your order at the counter, they give you a number to put on your table, and they bring you whatever food you ordered. They have lots of really great things but some of our favorites are the quiche, salad, white bean puree, and their yogurt with fruit and granola. Nice outdoor seating if you can manage to snag a spot

title: Poor service
review: Went to Floriole for the first time last weekend and literally forgot to bring my food. By the time I asked, they couldn't even admit that it was input improperly and gave me the wrong food. At this time, they said it would another 5 min (after waiting already 15 min) that I could have what I ordered. I got my refund promptly and walked out.

title: Best breakfast/lunch in Lincoln Park
review: Floriole is the perfect place to go to meet a friend for a cup of delicious coffee or an excellent breakfast or lunch. It is also a most highly regarded bakery known for its artisan breads and pastries. I highly recommend going there.

title: Fun Neighborhood Spot
review: During a holiday visit to Chicago, we went to breakfast here on a weekday morning. What a great neighborhood spot! The space is very nice--open and airy, with lots of places to sit. There was an appealing array of both savory and sweet breakfast options. The pumpkin bread was perfect--tasted like pumpkin (not just sugar) and very moist. A vegetable and egg sandwich was served on tasty, toasty baguette with earthy mushrooms. The quiche of the day was average--a bit too eggy for my taste, but the salad that came with it was delicious and perfectly dressed. Best of all, the coffee was delicious and hot. Would happily return!

title: Sweet & Savory
review: Great little neighborhood bakery and cafe, Excellent soups, breakfasts eats and lunches.Salads were creative and food was very good. You order and on a nice day can sit outside and you carry your order out yourself. Delicious bakery goods at this popular spot. Worth a return visit.

title: beware of the Passion Fruit Tart!
review: We visited our daughter who now lives in Chicago and for my birthday she special-ordered the passion fruit tart with extra fruit and whipped cream on top. We picked it up and after a 10-minute ride were back at her apartment. When she opened it (and we transported it very carefully), the entire tart filling had flowed out of the tart. It was a horrible mess. She immediately called the bakery and the reason for my negative review is due to the way the staff handled her call. She offered to send photos and was given an email address that was incorrect. She called back and was told they did not need to see the photos but would give her a "gift certificate" for the bakery. There was never an apology. The baker was too busy to speak to her. The passion fruit tart is "tricky." There was no manager available. Noone ever called her back when they said they would. Finally, my daughter called back a few more times and eventually was told her account would be credited for the cost of the tart, but unbelievably, they could not look up what she paid, and would not take her word for what she said she was charged (they differed by several dollars). She will never be back. This bakery is apparently started by someone from Tartine in San Francisco, our absolute favorite bakery. I cannot imagine them handling a similar situation with such an unprofessional, uncaring, inept and downright offhanded manner. And really, if a tart is "tricky" to make, don't make it. This is supposed to be a professional bakery, not a home cook. If it's that "tricky" take it off your menu. If you can't make it, don't sell it. And if you screw up, own up. Take responsibility. Apologize for ruining an event. Make up for the mistake. None of the above happened. Unbelievable.

title: Attention Foodies- Best baguette this side of the Atlantic
review: We go to France every year or so and one of the high points is having a fresh baguette every day. We have have sampled many boulangeries' baguettes. Floriole's is second to none. Crispy, crackly crust with soft chewing center. Clearly, the best in Chicago. They also make authentic canneles de bourdeaux. Again, crisp, crusty caramelized exterior with soft souffle-like interior. The only competition for these are from Gail Gand at Tru restaurant. I was talking to the baker's spouse who told me his mother had bought the copper molds for the canneles on one of her trips from Paris. These people are perfectionists! It is a pleasure to have them in Chicago.

title: Great place for lunch
review: The bread is fantastic!  Three salad trio was very good.  Everything was very fresh.  We will return!   Good neighborhood find

title: Delicious food, great atmosphere!
review: I have eaten at Floriole many times and the food is always delicious! The quiches are so flaky and yummy and the pizzettes are wonderful. The atmosphere is great both indoors and out. I would definitely recommend Floriole to anyone wanting a delicious European treat or meal!

title: Ym, Yum, Yum
review: Not only is this space beautiful, both upstairs and down, every item they make is delicious. Nice service, great neighborhood to stroll around.Wonderful breakfast pastries and sandwiches, all coffee drinks, unusual sandwiches, nice soups. Farm to table. A bit expensive, but worth it.Have not yet tried their pizza nights, but will soon.check it out !

title: Will be back!
review: Perfectly located close to the intersection of Webster/Racine this Cafe/Bakery is walking distance from Armitage or Fullerton. It is pretty spacy. The upstairs location is nice with lots of light coming in through the windows. While very busy on a Saturday morning, you don't feel claustrophobic. A place you can sit and chat the day away. And the food? Oh my! I had a hard time deciding what I wanted and in the end asked a friend to pick out whatever -as it is all so good!

title: I didn't want to leave!
review: This is a real neighborhood gem, serving up wonderful brunch, lunch, coffee and baked goods. They use an abundance of local and seasonal ingredients and the sandwiches, served with fresh greens will melt in your mouth. The ambiance is wonderful - full of light and plenty of room for folks to pass an entire morning without realizing it. I will definitely return!

title: The best thing my mother has ever eaten in her life.
review: I searched Chicago to see who is making Caneles de Bordeaux, and it turns out that This is The One Bakery that does. They are every bit as good as the first we tasted at the Ferry Plaza in San Francisco two weeks ago. A Caneles de Bordeaux is a tiny cake baked in a fluted mold that is more than golden brown on the outside and is airy and custardy on the inside. The flavor of the cake is rum and vanilla. You can eat the small cake in five bites by holding it in the palm of your hand. A fork would smush it. These are best eaten the day they are made. Indeed, I have not found a bakery that ships them. There must be a reason why. I phoned ahead on a Saturday in July, and they told me they had a dozen left, so they held eight of these for me. When we arrived by taxi, they had about ten more left, and my mother bought six. She ate one on the spot with her cappucino and said they are the best thing she has ever eaten in her whole life. When I tasted my first in San Francisco two weeks ago, I proclaimed, "This is the last thing I want to taste before I go to heaven." You can see that we rate these highly. I have read that Floriole Bakery is praised for many other things, but we only experienced the very best thing they make, Caneles de Bordeaux. I cannot find a single place in my home state of Michigan that makes these, but I have ordered the fluted mold in order to learn how to make this delicacy myself.

title: Wonderful bakery with great food and welcoming environment
review: Located near the DePaul campus near Lincoln Park, Floriole offers a wonderful place to have coffee, pastries, and a lovely meal. During my visit, I had a wonderful tartine, on crusty bread with wonderful toppings and greens. For dessert, I selected a blackberry lemon tart with latte. And it was magnificent too. The latte was stellar, and the tart divine. The dinning area was open and airy with lots of light, a welcoming space without much fuss. The wait staff was attentive and helpful. There was a selectionn of quiches and sandwiches as well as lovely pastries and breads. As I left, I picked up a baguette, still warm from the oven. Definitely, we need to return and sample other items on the menu.

title: Worth moving to the neighborhood for this
review: What's not to like? Opened by a French Pastry School alumna, this is a place that honors the tradition and standards set by the school. I've had Floriole's quiche and panna cota with fresh berries on earlier visits; this time had a the "B.A.D." sandwich (bacon, arugula, goat cheese with almond date spread) and a plum galette on crusty bread. Terrific!6771ty Service can be a little poky, but it's all in the name of quality over quickness. Clearly popular with the neighborhood yuppies (a few too many armored strollers wheeled in and out of this not-capacious establishment), every neighborhood should be so lucky to have a café of this quality.

title: Good place for Newbie DePaul Parents....
review: Dear Husband and I were moving Eldest Child into the dorms at DePaul and needed some Cawfee. Walked down Webster and chose Floriole for its good looks and fun chalkboard. Good coffee, friendly service, nice neighborhoodly clientele. Great place to catch some caffeine and a croissant and sit in a little summer sunshine. We will go back as we visit the progeny over the next few years. Might be a great place to warm up in the wintertime, as well....

title: Promising First Visit
review: Having read about this place on David Lebovitz's blog I was anxious to try it out. Unfortunately the day of our visit, their chef was taken ill and therefore only the baked goods and the already prepared sandwiches were available. Nonetheless, we could tell that this was a place worth trying again. The two of us had one ham and cheese sandwich and the granola with yoghurt. The granola was wonderful and I hear that the sandwich was yummy as well. We also sampled a brownie and the Milk Chocolate Salted Caramel Hazelnut Tart, both excellent.

title: Decent food, loud atmosphere
review: Typical Italian fare, with quick service and good food. It just wasn’t great cuisine. It lacked a depth of flavor (other than heavy garlic) and the presentation was bland and ordinary. With high tin ceilings, the noise level (alternative ugh not a crowded dining room) was quite high.

title: Still Great After All these
review: Still Great After All these YearsDinner tonight at a local Lincoln Park favorite…Tarantino’s. Very friendly staff, wonderful bar tender, food served hot and tasty. My chicken breast piccata was sooo good. Wife and daughter split penne and sausage….more than enough for two.Price, atmosphere and staff make Tarantino’s a go to spot in LP. Tell’em Cactus Bob sent you!

title: Take-out during the Pandemic
review: We had take-out during the Pandemic and enjoyed an outside meal on a friend’s deck. I had the Black Linguini - which was great. It had shrimp and mussels - with a slightly spicy tomato sauce. Everything was packaged nicely.

title: A Lincoln Park Gem!
review: A great neighborhood spot with a great vibe and very good food.  We have been going here for years and have never been disappointed.  Friendly service, cozy atmosphere, good location and consistently very good Italian dishes make this spot a winner.  We will be back....again!

title: Good Food. Nice Outdoor Seating.
review: We had a nice dinner here in the outdoor area. (It’s much quieter than inside.). The food - salmon and pasta dishes - were delicious, and our server, Miley, was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Prices are a bit high, but it’s worth it for the good meal.

title: Excellent in all ways
review: Lovely setting with old Chicago charm. Dinner for 6 on the weekend after New Years. Every table taken. Seated on time. Excellent service. Good bar and wine list. Food, from salmon to pasta outstanding. Not inexpensive but excellent value for the dollar. Will definitely return.

title: Excellent Food and Service
review: This small neighborhood restaurant has excellent food and service. The restaurant is attractive but small, so reservations are recommended. You can sit outside (weather permitting). Prices are a bit steep, so we won’t be regulars, but we’re glad we went.

title: An Old Standard Loosing It’s Way
review: I’ve eaten at Tarantino’s for 10 years. I have to say it’s become a love hate relationship. We loved and love the ambiance of this neighborhood restaurant with sophisticated food in an area dominated by college bars. At one time I’d estimate we would eat there once or twice a week. Then John (the owner) decided to limit his wine pours to the bare minimum limit. I always wonder why restaurants that get a hefty bill for each table turn decide to chinch on alcohol which is high margin and represents a small portion of the total bill. The math just doesn’t work. And when I mentioned my frustration personally to John, he literally blew me off. So...down to once a month. Most recently I’ve noticed that the food quality and taste varies greatly by visit. From amazing (as it always had been) to bland and underwhelming. I hosted a table of 12, most of whom had eaten there before and enjoy Tarantino’s, 2 months ago and it was uniformly terrible. So...down to: “let’s give it one more try”.I’m not sure what’s up here. Maybe John has lost his drive or is distracted. But I hope he wakes up. There’s a reason he has empty tables at night when you can barely get in to his completion within a small radius at the same time. This is a falling star and it would be sad to see such a long time reliable staple just burn out.

title: A home rune everytime
review: This is my absolute go to restaurant in Chicago. Located in Lincoln Park it provides a nice escape from the loop dining choices. Creative and appealing Italian dishes are always excellent. I have been going here since 1992 and I have never had a bad meal at Tarantino's.You can eat Italian food all over Chicago but you would be hard pressed to find anything better. Give this place a try, you will not be disappointing!

title: Mostly average with a few highlights
review: Cute neighborhood restaurant. Decor inside cozy and warm. Seems like a place DePaul University students take their parents when they want a slightly upscale meal. We've eaten here many times since it's just around the corner, and the food is between 3 and 4. Most of the dishes are average to pretty good, but there are some standouts that have become our mainstays when we come here. Black linguine is delicious as is the heart of palm salad. Desserts are good too. They can also do half-sized portions of just about everything, which is great since the portions are huge otherwise.

title: Neighborhood elegant
review: One of those rare joys: a restaurant down on the corner that manages to be both casual (wear shorts if you like, but make them pressed) and gorgeous enough to celebrate an occasion. The menu features unique variations of familiar Italian classics -- eight pastas (plus specials), a couple of steaks, a nice turn on the grilled calamari starter (it's a flat, scored 'steak,' refreshed with a little salad on the side), the obligatory osso bucco and parmesan (chicken on the menu, veal on the special), plus pizzas, a risotto (al dente, of course) and surprises, like fried oysters. The bar is a pleasant option for solos or conviviality (the bartender clearly likes her job). Drinks are generous. If we lived within walking distance (we're a mile away), we'd be here once a month -- every month. Minimum.

title: Delicious eggplant parmesan in an outdoor setting
review: First time to this wonderful restaurant set on chic Armitage Ave in Lincoln Park. We went on a Sunday evening and had a delicious meal in their outdoor cafe setting. There is comfortable indoor seating as well. We had good service and good food. Prices were typical for the area. Other dishes at our table received a thumbs up! Enjoy.

title: Skip the pizza
review: Skip the pizza, much better on the menu,  if you don't like something on the entree, special orders don't upset them

title: Lincoln Park Jewel!
review: Ambiance is sensual and warm. The food is always consistently very good to great. Atmosphere is warm, friendly and romantic. My wife and I have spent 5 or 6 New Year's Eves there.Everyone we have taken there for dinner raves about the food and always wants to eat there when they are back in town or in the hood.John Tarantino is a very gracious host and will do whatever he can to make sure you have a wonderful dinner and experience.

title: A Step Up From Your Usual Go To Restaurant
review: Called at the last minute on a Saturday and they had a 2 person high-top available. I was surprised that most of the entree's were over $20. I had the halibut special which was delicious but a bit over cooked. No bread was brought to the table, which was fine with me as I was not eating carbs. I mentioned it to the server and she said it was by request only. My dinner mate would have loved the bread. The mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts were delicious. While we were sitting there, the large bar was filling up with "mature" couples (Over 40). It appeared people were regulars. We also saw larger groups come in to celebrate and families. It was very clean and the food was top quality.

title: Solid, Consistent Neighborhood Eatery
review: We organized a birthday dinner for six on a Friday night. Service was good, food was very good (especially the corn fried oysters.) We also had the mussels, papardelle, butternut squash ravioli, farfalle and rigatoni. All great. Dinner for six including two bottles of chardonnay $255

title: Great Food, Service was Ok
review: 4 of us had dinner at Tarantino's this past week and we had reservations at 7:30, but did not get to the restaurant until 7:45 (I called to let them they know we were running late). They held our table, and we were seated immediately. Our server (a European lady) appeared to be in a rush, and was professional, but not very friendly. I felt rushed to order, and we were seated at a table in the back, and she stood right next to our table with her arms folded most of the night - she is the only reason I would not rate the restaurant 5 stars!Hearts of Palm and Beet Salads were outstanding, as were the mussels, and the three pasta entrees we had. You need to ask for bread if you want it....and when my Mom asked for bread for her mussels, the server acted like that was a strange request.Again, food was outstanding, as was the wine list - just hope I have a different server next time.

title: Great local place
review: A nice upscale restaurant for casual or celebratory dining.  Summers outside are nice.   Bar is very good

title: Visiting Chicago
review: Had the best salmon dish ever! It literally melted in my mouth. Came with roasted potatoes and cooked spinach. It was excellent. Eaten in this restaurant before and it has been consistently good.

title: Great neighborhood dining!
review: Tarantino's is a beautifully decorated, intimate Italian restaurant in the Lincoln Park neighborhood. The food is reliably good with interesting specials and friendly service.  A great spot for the weekend but also a terrific mid-week treat. Also fun to sit at the bar before dinner.

title: Always love an Italian meal.
review: Parking on the street was hit or miss for 2+blocks. This neighborhood of Lincoln Park is pleasant. Atmosphere & service were top. Not loud inside.Bright & open inside, it was to chilly for dining outside? I did think the wood chairs were going to be uncomfortable but they were not. They did have booths but not surrounding both sides. We had for 2 appetizers both the salmon & beef Carpaccio for $11. each. We enjoyed both, I was crazy for the salmon with avocado Carpaccio. In the black linguini were many clams, too many to count & a few large shrimp for $24. The chicken farfalle pasta for $22. was as expected, not special. If I were paid for this review, I may have tried the more pricer menu & specials because they looked interesting & had more content. I was also not that hungry since I am trying to eat a path through Chicago in 2 months.

title: Mixed Feelings
review: Ate here with a group recently and also some time ago. Both times my reaction was mixed. The pizzas and the appetizers seem to be the best offerings here. The pastas were OK. Service is good and wines by the bottle are not overly marked up. The premises are casual attractive and the outdoor seating (weather permitting) is very pleasant. Deserts are substandard.

title: A Great Neighborhood Restaurant
review: If you find yourself in the Lincoln Park section of Chicago and in need of a very good local restaurant, you cannot go wrong with Tarantino's!The food (mostly Italian if one has to apply a label) is excellent (with many specials being offered a), the wine selection is well above average, the service is quite good and the price is right.We visited recently with my daughter, her husband and one year old son for an early dinner Saturday night. We received a warm welcome and the wait staff accommodated our needs and timing with a toddler in tow. We enjoyed an excellent meal at a relatively leisurely pace for a fair price. Doesn't get much better than that!

title: Filet mignon with an Italian-American flavor
review: I suppose it doesn't make sense to order filet mignon or tilapia at an Italian-American restaurant that has been cooking delicious rigatoni and bruschetta and orechiette and black linguini and two-sausage pizza for 20 years. But, on this night, I had a taste for filet mignon. Tarantino's 10-ounce filet was seasoned, grilled and glistening with truffle butter, something right out of the best steakhouse in town. Medium well and tender. I couldn't have asked for more. My wife traces her bloodlines to northern Italy so the menu excited her from the grilled polenta to the apricot crusted rack of lamb with rosemary mashed potatoes and brussels sprouts. I passed up the high recommended mixed heirloom tomato salad with fresh mozzarella in favor of the parmesan shrimp. What can I say? I'm a sucker for a tasty shrimp dish. The filet mignon with mushrooms and asparagus and green beans and rosemary whipped potatoes was a culinary masterpiece. Next time I'll probably order the 16-ounce bone-in ribeye. Finally, we shared a wonderful plate of tiramisu. How can you dine at an Italian restaurant without trying the tiramisu? And would any self-respecting Italian restaurant not include home-made tiramisu on its menu?

title: Italian Food that's very Good!!
review: "Tarantino's" was great ***. Heirloom tomatoes with mozzarella in a balsamic vinaigrette out of this world. My wife had chicken parmesan she enjoyed it very much and I had the tilapia, the best I have ever had. So if your in the city's Lincoln Park area that's the place to go for Italian food that's very good.

title: Neighborhood Family Owned Italian/American!
review: Lincoln Park area. Cozy relaxing atmosphere - it was very quiet because the Cubs were playing, which was fine for us a party of 6. Our waitress Nicole was very helpful. If you want bread you must request it- it's worth it! It is served with fresh olive oil dipping sauce. The desserts are wonderful- Creme Brulle, Molten Lava Cake, Taramisu, fresh Sorbet It is a bit pricey but overall we had a great meal, good service. Would visit again

title: Fantastic meals!
review: Another one of my favorite stops for dinner in Lincoln Park. Some of the best apricot encrusted lamb chops I've ever had. Polished off with a craft cocktail and I'm in heaven. Service is always very strong and the atmosphere is perfect for a couple guys that want to enjoy generous portions of meat or perfect for date night.

title: just really top notch!
review: We have walked by a dozen times and finally went in!  A treat!  Vegetables perfectly grilled, the salmon was perfect and the pappardelle just right with more perfect veggies.   Tuesdays turned out to be half off bottles of wine. Our Sangiovese was great!

title: good neighborhood place
review: Went here with 2 friends while visitin chicago. This is a very decent place to have dinner and nice wine with friiends.. Portions are good sized and the flavors were nice as well. I would go back.

title: Fallen Star
review: Tarantinos has been a "go to" for us for a decade. We used to go 3 times a week, then down to 2 and now once every so often. Why? First, the food, which was always excellent is now spotty at best. Even basic staples vary widely. Second, they nickel and dime patrons on pours and cocktails, which basically causes you to choose other restaurants unless you're completely a tea totaler. This place is not cheap, margins on wine and beer are sky high, so why piss customers off and make them dine elsewhere. Third, the owner John, who these days spends his time attached to the bar and whatever woman he has with him, or in Florida...JUST DOESNT CARE.We live in the neighborhood, I've mentioned the above points to John directly several times. He either doesn't care care or has some other inability to read the tea leaves. On nights when there is a wait at nearby, less famous restaurants in Lincoln Park, Tarantinos is empty or closes early. The staff turnover, for such an icon, is through the roof. Portions are smaller, quality is inconsistent (or absent), they cut corners at the bar (really? What's the profit margin on liquor) and the writing is on the wall. The recession is over and they empty early and fail miserably to live up to their historic reputation.Same management, so no blame there. It's simply this. John, wake up, focus or sell to someone who can bring Lincoln Park what it desperately needs. Adult restaurants where the folks in the brownstones and town houses will spend freely for get good food and generous treatment.

title: wonderful neighborhood gem
review: This placed is tucked in the Lincoln park neighborhood. What a treat. I had the tomato and mozarella salad that was wonderful. For a meal I had the fish and risotto. Both were outstanding. The wine choice by the server was spot on as well. My friend had the salmon and she loved it. This is a place I could go to again and again. the pizza looked amazing.

title: Good Italian Dinner
review: Craving pasta, we went here on Saturday night of July 4th weekend. The place was EMPTY!--guess that's not a popular night to eat out. Despite the lack of customers, the space was nice--informal but still classy.Service was great--very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.Nice cocktail selection. Ended up getting delicious Chianti! Food was great. The hearts of palm salad was good and the arugula/parmesan salad was especially great. We then split an entree--smoky chicken in a delicious pasta with tomato sauce that had good flavor (slightly acidic). The portion was HUGE--splitting an entree left both of easily full.Would happily return!

title: Nice room. Local ambiance. Real good food.
review: This local gem on tasteful Armitage Street west of the L, is a very nice find. The owner, John, is there to keep things friendly and fun. His niece is bringing the younger perspective & energy. We always get the pasta and it is very good. I just told John he needs to expand the pasta choices for more variety (and therefore more business from people like me!). I expect the place to only get better. And when the weather breaks, the sidewalk is a wonderful place to end your day.

title: A little disappointing
review: I was looking forward to returning to Tarantino's after 10 years! The place is still adorable but the food- just so-so. It was not as good as I remembered. Skip the smoked chicken pasta instead try the rigatoni.

title: Nice local Italian restaurant in Lincoln Park
review: Small and loud, but with very good Italian food.  Portions are large and can be shared.  Nice wine list, reasonably priced.  Good choice of daily specials.  Nice selection of pastas, pizzas, salads and non-carb choices.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Great neighborhood restaurant!
review: Tucked away on the quiet side of Armitage, Tarantino's is a neighborhood favorite. Cozy welcoming decor throughout. Nice bar area that you can eat at as well. Overall on the small side, so sometimes a bit noisy, but not obtrusive. Food is amazing.... Have never had a bad meal. Their specials are always fabulous! Always try the risotto. John, the owner, is always there and mingling with guests. I never make reservations and they always are able to squeeze you in. It's been a favorite for 12 years.

title: Tarantino's is a Gem
review: Whether you are enjoying Chicago in the summer time or during the winter - anytime is a good time to dine at Tarantino's. This neighboorhood restaurant treats pastas and proteins so deliciously - a little Italian, a little Mediterranian. We enjoyed sitting outside this past June, and while downtown Chicago was noisy and packed - Armitage and Tarantino's was calm and serene. I love the grilled calamari and the faralle. Can't beat the sorbets, either!

title: Couldn't Recommend More Highly!
review: Loved the pork chop in grape compote with rosemary potatoes. Also had the calamari starter. Their sidecar was excellent. Loved the atmosphere!

title: Polenta and the Tears of Christ
review: What more can one say? Delicious Italian cooking, fine wines, great service and a wonderful location on West Armitage in the lovely Lincoln Park area.

title: tuesday 1/2 price bottles of wine:-)
review: Delightful neighborhood resturant worth seeking out.
