Family owned and run, nestled in Chicago's Garden District. my favorite things here are the excellent seasonal appetizers (yesterday it was freas figs stuffed with goat cheese and wrapped in crisp prosciutto and cornbread fried fresh oysters) and the dessert menu. Not a thing wrong with the mains, but the chef seems to be more creative with the appetizers......and it is my considered opinion they serve the best creme brulee in the city here. you will enjoy this gem. go on Tuesday if you can.( see title above)

title: All the reviews correct, good food but a bit noisy.
review: Nice neighborhood restaurant, but very noisy inside. Got better as the place emptied out around 8pm. Patio looked inviting but the weather was a bit too cold. Everybody's meal was good, no complaints. The pizza was light and crunchy. Cured salmon special was mouth watering. Will return.

title: Awesome little Italian restaurant in Lincoln Park
review: This place has been around for a few years now and always serves up some great Italian food. Outdoor seating in the spring and summer time. Highly recommend the lamb chops and the rigatoni. Wine list is overpriced, but on Tuesdays they have 1/2 off bottles of wine!

title: Great place for a lovely meal
review: Friendly staff, wonderful food, large portions, nice atmosphere - what more can you want? Good value - about $35 per person.

title: Delicious but noisy!
review: This was a first Visit and the food was liked by All. The service was friendly but somewhat rushed as they were very Crowded. The noise level was uncomfortable; it was hard to hear my Companions. I would return, but on a quieter weeknight.

title: Love the atmosphere and the service.
review: Tarantino's is a great place for dinner and conversation. Love he decor and atmosphere. The service was great, Ryan was attentive but did not hover. We had mussels and gazpacho for appetizers. We got a lot of mussels for the price and they were very tasty with the bread. The gazpacho was very green, unusual but nice for summer. The soft shelled crab was a bit sweet for my liking and not cooked crisp enough. What shell that was there was a bit papery. My daughter had the rigatoni which was excellent. Will definitely be back for this. The creme brûlée was awesome and the pistachio profiteroles were ok. The owner would come by each table and make you feel welcome. We will surely be back.

title: Best for beverages, Apps & Salads....don't order entrees!
review: Three of us recently dined at Tarantino's. the ambiance and friendliness of the staff greets you. The music, however in the background doesn't fit. Playing some Italian greats might be suggested versus earlym 70's. Selena behind the bar is a star with her smile and suggestions for beverages and wine selections. Our Apps...Oysters, Beet Salad, Calamari steak....yum. We then ordered entrees where I think the Executive Chef was on a smoke break. The Lamb Chops, which you can't screw up...sucked. My lobster ravioli....bland. The consensus...entrees-no flavor. After a wonderful start....execution of entrees a miss. Disapointing. If you're looking to start a fun evening, do visit. But stick with Beverages, Apps and possibly salad. After being in business as long as Tarantino's....they should accept this feedback and hope to do better. I recommend this with caution.

title: Great food in an interesting setting
review: Tarantino's is a great restaurant in Lincoln Park. While small (about 70 seats), it is beautiful with exposed brick walls and interesting decor. We all loved our entrees -- ravioli, fucilli, and tilapia. The only negative was that they were extremely quick to clear the table. My husband was still eating and they had cleared almost everything including bread plates. The total cost, without tip, including one glass of wine was $90.

title: Consistent Neighborhood Place
review: Always consistent Lincoln park Italian (don't know why it says the neighborhood is "calumet"). The seafood is always very good and recommneded as well. On weekends there are plenty of children (from about 5pm-6:30, the stroller set takes over the place, which is good or bad, depending on your situation), but by 7pm the place is an excellent date or family restaurant.

title: Nice Breakfast Find
review: Nice find, good food, lots of choices some really unique, and reasonable prices for being in Chicago.

title: Brunch was just fine
review: The kids enjoyed their breakfast choices of waffle and hearty breakfast. It took them a bit to hunt up some Earl Grey tea. My ChixClub sandwich was that flavorful but it was okay. The menu says Pepsi products, but no Mt Dew. Luckily I had enough cash.

title: Great breakfast
review: I love the pork belly hash, service is good prices a little high.  I’ve eaten here 3 times never disappointed, ok maybe the one slice of toast, I’m a big boy I need 2 slices PS Cash only

title: Good Find
review: Made an “on a whim” stop here after our daughter took a campus tour of DePaul. Excellent! Small, cash only, but reasonable prices, good portion sizes, and friendly staff. If she decides to attend DePaul, I’m sure that we will eat there again!

title: Breakfast hot spot
review: Lovely restaurant, especially during warm weather when you can sit Al fresco.  We enjoyed the chicken and waffles, eggs and pancakes.  Can be busy most Sundays but the table turnover is fairly quick.  Cash only joint.

title: Fantastic!!
review: This was my first time at this restaurant and I can guarantee that it won't be my last. My blueberry pancakes were wonderful and they were huge. I loved the atmosphere there and staff were very friendly.

title: Great brunch place, breakfast and sandwiches.
review: Awesome neighborhood brunch restaurant with great food at reasonable prices.  Large portions and GOOD coffee. Indoor and outdoor seating.  Breakfast and sandwiches, limited parking.  College/Church neighborhood, gets crowded on weekends.

title: Jam and Honey is fabulous once again
review: This is the fifth time I have been to the jam and honey. It was just as wonderful as the first time. The coffee is incredible. There are so many excellent choices on the menu. And you can't go wrong if there is Nutella at every table. The owners are very kind. Look at these photos !

title: Good Food. Good Service.
review: This restaurant has a pretty diverse menu, and the food is good. The service is very good. Located on DePaul campus, and discounts offered with DePaul IDs - a nice touch. Hey also added a second bathroom, which was an excellent move.

title: Food Seemed Average This Time
review: We've been pleased on previous visits, but on this visit the Caesar salad was below average and the Cobb salad just average. The "duck bacon" was rather strongly spiced and unpleasant. Street parking. Free Wi-Fi. Hamburger ok but fries not crisp.

title: Great breakfast
review: Family breakfast. Service was good good size outdoor seating area with choice of sun or shade. I had an omelet with chrizo, cheese and mushrooms. perfect. the other meals were good also.

title: Really good breakfast
review: Large and interesting breakfast/brunch menu.  Good outdoor seating across from St. Vincent Church at DePaul.  Good service.  Will go back.

title: Fine breakfast place
review: A very large menu with plenty of choices and large portions, this is a terrific breakfast choice. The Mexican Scramble was nicely done, mildly spicy and with good potatoes on the side. Great coffee. Good service.

title: Jam and Honey is fabulous once again
review: This is the second time I have been to the jam and honey. It was just as wonderful as the first time. The coffee is incredible. There are so many excellent choices on the menu. And you can't go wrong if there is Nutella at every table.

title: The Jam and Honey is a wonderful place
review: The Jam and Honey is a wonderful place. Each of had something different and they were all wonderfully prepared, and the owners and servers are so kind; and unexpectedly, the coffee was incredibly marvelous too. Plus, there is a big jar of Nutella at every table. You can't go wrong with that!

title: Delicious !!!!!!
review: Stopped in on a Friday morning @ 8:30 and it was not busy, the food is delicious and the portions r huge! Coffee is great. Service is excellently!

title: Great breakfast
review: Wonderful place for breakfast. Jars of Nutella on the table. Had a Mexican omelet with chorizo yesterday. Love the chorizo sausage hash too. Pancakes, waffles, breakfast sandwiches. Always hopping on the weekends. One of my favorite breakfast spots. Outside tables in summer. Cash only but an ATM on premise.

title: Okay for Brunch
review: Jam and honey is okay. The food is just okay. Nothing really stood out. Despite simply being average fare, the place is packed on the weekends.

title: A Bland Restaurant With Bland Food
review: The food at Jam and Honey is about as mediocre as mediocre gets. It is decent breakfast food, and the menu is enormous. Unfortunately, I leave the restaurant consistently disappointed. It is constantly filled with to the brim with DePaul students because of the discount the restaurant offers. There are far better restaurants within a few blocks of this place, and I would only recommend this restaurant to a DePaul student who is too lazy to lave campus to find a worthwhile meal.

title: Decent Food. Nothing special
review: Recently had breakfast here. They're cash only and it's at least $10 per person if you go minimal. They present the check using an American Express logo'd tray which I thought was weird. The menu is pretty large and well written. It really makes you want to order more than 1 thing. Unfortunately, the execution of it wasn't that great. Portion sizes are very large. Pancakes were really dense and didn't seem to have any distinct taste to them. The honey butter they're served tasted pretty much like regular butter. The omelette was a bit over-cooked and started to get brown pan marks and a bit rubbery. Not bad. Just not good. It was also more of a "scramble" as it was so stuffed with ingredients you couldn't really make out any creaminess to the eggs. Potatoes were cooked fine, but not seasoned very well and had no crispness to them. The side sausage was pretty good.Service was very friendly and efficient.

title: Good food, good service
review: Stopped here to visit a friend going to DePaul.  The food was good.  Everyone enjoyed their choice.  Worth a try, especially if you like breakfast which I do. BRING CASH because they do not accept cards.

title: Good Food. Great Service.
review: This is a nice little restaurant near DePaul (if you're a student or employee, bring your DePaul ID for a discount). The menu is vast, and the food is good. (The Italian omelette, with ricotta cheese and tomato jam, is like breakfast and dessert in one.) The servers are eager to please, and the prices are reasonable. Not crazy about open jam pots on the tables (we are clean freaks) and one rest room for the entire restaurant. Otherwise, nothing to complain about. We will go to this restaurant again.

title: Love Breakfast!
review: It is one of our places to take our family when we visit. Regardless of our table numbers the food is great! I love the idea that if you want one of their baked pancakes you can call in the order ahead of time to shorten the 25 minute bake time. Regardless of our orders everything was done to perfection!

title: Good But Expensive Breakfast Spot Near DePaul
review: Creative but not particularly healthy selection of egg and waffle dishes with a heavy emphasis on bacon. While the food was fine it does not compare with north suburban staples like Egg Harbor and Walker Brothers despite being far more expensive. Cash only with their own cash station on premises.

title: Brunch
review: We just dined here for the 1st time and will definitely be back. The food, service & ambiance were great. We had a large group with several young kids & our waitress brought all the kids pancakes to tide them over until we ordered. Class act.

title: Breakfast in the neighborhood
review: It's a good neighborhood place to go for breakfast. The food is good, the options are good. Service is up to par. The place is not big but the spacing is more than appropriate. So it's a good place to go for a peaceful, pleasant breakfast. One consideration: they only receive cash.

title: Yummm
review: I would love going here with my boyfriend for breakfast and brunch. The quantities are generous and the food is delicious. My favorite plate was the mushroom burger. It's very clean and the service is excellent.The wait is also never too long.

title: Sorry to say...
review: Nice environment, friendly staff and good food. I loved the creative pancake and French toast items on the menu and I thought it was quaint and fun that large containers of Nutella were on each table. Since they are across the street from DePaul University I thought I'd found a great score for future trips to see my son. As we were about to leave my opinion dropped drastically. A family with young children sat down. A girl about 9-10 years old was served pancakes. Her mom handed her the large jar of Nutella and continued on with her conversation with another adult in their group avoiding her daughters actions. The young girl picked up her spoon, licked it and proceeded to dip it in the Nutella container and server herself! YUCK!!!!! I'm so glad I didn't put any Nutella on my food. So I don't think I will be returning!

title: Good breakfast selection
review: We really enjoyed eating our Sunday brunch outside. Tables are well spaced out and service outside was very good. They have a nice selection on their breakfast menu also. I especially liked their Eggs Florentine. Anxious to go back and try some other interesting sounding items from their menu. Notes - they only accept cash & they offer discounts to DePaul University students.

title: Great Lunch Spot
review: I came into the restaurant around 2:00pm and it was still quite busy for a Friday afternoon. The server was very quick and our food came out so fast. I had the Veggie Black Bean Burger by recommendation from our server. It was the best black bean burger that I've had. The flavor was excellent and it was very filling. The entire menu looked really great, so I look forward to going back at some point and trying something else!

title: Lunch at Honey and Jam
review: They have a great choice of lunch and breakfast foods. They are only open for breakfast and lunch. Excellent dining for couples and families.  If you want good breakfast and lunch try Honey and Jam. I recommend highly.

title: cool place, great service, amazing breakfast!
review: I had the Chilaquiles - after every bite, I kept muttering how good it was!! Crispy tortillas, an amazing spicy (on the mild side) meat/black bean concoction with cheese and scrambled eggs - yum! My new favorite brunch item!The waffles were also unbelievable - crispy and fluffy. Not a bite left on the plates. The potatoes were amazing as well.I had a bite of a pancake which really capped off my meal - it was so good with the best syrup!Fun place, crowded, give yourself time to wait a bit (run across the street and check out one of the most beautiful churches ever - it was magnificent) and bring cash as they do not accept credit cards.

title: Amazing breakfast!
review: Great breakfast - I went twice and had the vegetarian burrito which was fab and the berry waffles - very generous serving, and speedy service too! Nutella on every table too which was a nice touch

title: Excellent!
review: I honestly was no expecting much when we walked across the street from St. Vincents Church to this little café. We were waiting for an event we were attending at the church and had arrived quite early, so we decided to try for a cup of coffee or maybe a bite of breakfast. THis place had nice flower boxes and al fresco tables outside, so we decided to give it a try. We were a bit concerned when we saw the "cash only" sign - because who carries cash? But we scraped together what was needed and decoded to order breakfast.What a delightful surprise! The waitress was very attentive, other staff came out to be certain our water glasses were always full. They had fresh-squeezed OJ and we doned that pitcher easily. The food was terrific. They had a very nice selection, including some special twists. For example, they did have Eggs Benedict but they also had Italian Eggs Benedict and more. We also tried their stuffed French toast - oh! and their breakfasts sandwich. Yes, they do have jams and they can bring you honey for your toast. Delicious coffee as well. We actually will return on purpose to have breakfast here and likely even to try out their lunch menu!

title: Amazing Move-In Day Brunch for DePaul Family
review: We've driven or walked by Jam 'n Honey many times as our son considered, auditioned for and was admitted to the DePaul School of Music. We finally stopped in and are we glad we did! The wait on this beautiful morning was 20 minutes but we were seated in 10. Service through and through was top notch! Our meals varied from a Chicken Caesar wrap to a Loaded Waffle. Fresh, quality ingredients are in abundance regardless of choice. We enjoyed a memorable time as we left our son at DePaul on a full stomach from Jam 'n Honey!

title: Great Service and Home Atmosphere!
review: We were a group of 6 and were seated promptly.  Our waiter was darling and he was excellent.  Very attentive and personal.  Professional to the max!  Food was excellent.  It is a cute corner and the sun was shining in.  Very clean and attractive.

title: Great brunch and decent service
review: A group of friends and I decided to check out this place for brunch on Labor Day. We went at rush but were seated within 25 minutes and service was FAST. The banana pancakes were pretty delicious and there was Nutella on the table. SCORE. Out of everything ordered (eggs, toast, meat), the only thing people said they didn't like we're the potatoes. Coffee was very bare-bones (no specialty creamers, sweeteners) and I couldn't find the server to refill my cup (they were busy), but all in all, it was a pleasant experience.

title: Delicious Brunch!!!
review: Jam and Honey is a hybrid between a trendy brunch location and home-style cooking. They have a very large menu with basics to specialty items, especially in the french toast/waffle section. They only accept cash and do not serve alcohol- however there are two ATMs directly across the street and they only charge a $5 corkage fee- so bring some champagne with you to enjoy a mimosa! I enjoyed the open-face ham, egg and swiss with hollandaise- it was absolutely delicious. They table had two different jams, honey and the biggest jar of Nutella I've ever seen. Worth the trip!

title: Get the Oatmeal Pancakes!
review: Their oatmeal pancakes are to die for!!  Of course, there are all kinds of other good food on their menu but you just MUST try these.

title: Delicious!
review: Delicious breakfast in the Lincoln Park area! Large portions and great variety! We will definitely return on our next visit to the area!

title: nom nom nom
review: Their southwest chicken salad is hands down my favorite thing on their menu.  I order take-out from them at least twice a week!  Disclaimer - there's ALWAYS a line out the door for brunch - a sure sign that the food is delicious!

title: Awesome Breakfast!
review: Great breakfast spot on DePaul's campus!  Close to red line too!  A little pricey but well worth it.  Lots of breakfast burrito choices and a jar of nutella on every table.

title: Yummy!
review: Great breakfast! Near DePaul University. Went w/our son who lives in Chicago. This was his 1st visit also, I had the stuffed French Toast. It looked like a picture in a food magazine. Covered w/strawberries and blueberries, plus a side of sausage. No wat to eat it all. It was delish! Hubby and son had eggs and bacon, potatoes plus pancakes. Very good but too much food! Son's friend had the garbage omelette. It was great too! Would definitely go here again. Friendly, attentive staff.

title: Great Breakfast Spot in Lincoln Park
review: Here's a nice, newer neighborhood corner restaurant. The service was quick, the portions were large, and the atmosphere was energetic. For some odd, reason, they don't take any cash/credit cards, only cash, so bring some (if I were the proprietor, I'd be A -- paranoid about staff ripping me off, and B -- paranoid about getting held up -- this place is busy = lots of cash in the till).Breakfast food is basic and nicely prepared. Toast arrived about 5 minutes after the entrees (maybe they need another toaster?). All tables have a jar of Nutella on them -- nice touch.One person at our table ordered lunch and her cheeseburger and fries looked good. The fries are wedge style.Finally, for those who care, it's a Pepsi place.

title: BRING CASH!
review: This cute little place has lots of outdoor seating, though it's right by the train so it can get a little noisy. The food was good (I recommend the chipotle chicken wrap) and priced right. The service was a little slow, but it was Sunday at about 11am so it was extremely busy. It currently only takes cash, which we didn't know until my friend notice a SMALL sign on the side door. There was probably one on the front door, too, but it was so crowded we didn't see it. So make sure you bring some cash!

title: Stick to the basics
review: Order the basic of the basics(forget anything with sauce) and you'll be fine. This is a salt and pepper eggs over east with potatoes an orange slice and whole west toast . Coffee and juice and you'reDone and ready to face the delights of Lincoln Park, why not start with the free zoo?

title: AMAZING! Chorizo Hash was out of this world!
review: You've gotta hit up the chorizo and hash skillet... amazing!

title: Great Breakfast at Reasonable Prices
review: We have visited Jam and Honey twice in the last two weeks, and have been very pleased both times.  Excellent omelettes and great hamburgers. Very attentive service.  Good coffee.  Great addition to the neighborhood.

title: The way it should be…
review: Still relatively new to Chicago, Locals introduced me to this fantastic neighborhood establishment. Jim the owner abd his staff are always so pleasant and professional, I had several omakase dinners here b4 Covid. This was my first return in over a year. Ever dish Jim prepared was beautifully presented from the oyster shooters, to a gorgeous plate of fresh white tuna, hamachi, salmon topped with caviar finished with gold leaf, immaculate black cod. So happy I live nearby!

title: Sadly not what I hoped for
review: I was excited to try Sai Cafe as I had not been there in years and read some positive reviews.The fish was fresh enough but the 3 maki I ordered were tasteless. The rice was unseasoned. The cucumber inside was full of water as it must have not been drained, making the fish taste it took a bath.The unagi was so full of unagi sauce it was drowning and the unagi was a soggy fishy mess.Would not return. If you want pure non gimmicky sushi try Tanoshi or Sushi Dakku.

title: Japanese at its BEST
review: A friend from South Haven, Michigan recommended this gem in the heart of Lincoln Park. We made reservations and were seated immediately. They have multiple rooms. We were seated in the room with a fireplace, and exposed brick walls. Nicki our server was both friendly and attentive. We started with Ahi Poke. It was supposed to be spicy. A little disappointed. However the rest of the rolls were amazing. We first ordered the Hamachi special. Amazing. Next we ordered salmon on fire. Delicious. We paired our meal with a Riesling which was perfect, not too sweet. Our friend knew Jimmy B. Unfortunately he wasTraveling. Will have to return to meet him. Highly recommend.

title: Great sushi!
review: Really friendly neighborhood sushi restaurant.  We ordered a variety of dishes.  All of it was wonderful...

title: Sai Cafe classic sushi
review: Sai Cafe was one of the first sushi restaurants to open in Chicago. It is still thriving for a simple reason- quality sushi. Comfortable, relaxed setting.  Consistently great  sushi rolls and sashimi.

title: Hit or miss....
review: No a bad spot, but service and food can be hit or miss. I have been here dozens of times in the past decade. Sushi is generally very good, but pricey. Liquor is very pricy as well. In general, servers have no personality and are robotic. In this neighborhood, good restaurants are normally pricey, so no big deal, but I do expect if I’m spending $150 for two, that my service is above average and at least they try to smile.Hot entrees are occasionally cold by the time they make it to the table, but the staff usually is quick about reheating, but an apology would be nice....

title: Sigh-Cafe
review: When I lived in chicago just a smidge over a decade ago, this was one of my fave sushi places. My husband and I are visiting and I insisted that we go. I had talked this place up and I was excited to take him to my old ‘hood. I have to say, the edamame was good- they perfectly salt the water and the beans were firm- flavorful but not overwhelming. But, sadly, that’s where the bummed-ness started. I have to say, I think the fish on the nigiri was pretty good, but whatever taste the maki might have had was dampened by the mushy and very sweet rice. And, the crunchy (??) seaweed wrapper. It’s been my experience that the wrapper should be firm but bite-able. The rice should be just a teeny bit vinegary and soft but the rice grains should be visible. Not so much here. Anyway, I’m bummed and a little embarrassed about how I was bragging. I guess it’s proof that our memory isn’t always right. Sigh...

title: Good Food
review: Sai Cafe is a great restaurant, and the food is great to. There is nothing exceptional about the ambience, but the waiters and chefs are extremely friendly. There are a bunch of interesting sushi rolls on the menu, so the more adventurous should enjoy the experience.

title: freshest sashimi, elegant , neighborhood spot for 30 years!
review: you don't last 30 years in the restaurant business without good quality, good service,etc. James Bee is a master and although he does not go after hype or publicity, anyone who is an experienced sashimi, poke,sushi fan is going to have an eye opening experience. The Ahi Poke, is amazing, The Salmon belly with fresh grated wasabi and pink salmon roe and caviar is wonderful. The Kani su has huge hunks of Alaskan King Crab in it.Black Cod and Home made Gyoza are amazing! Beautiful Bar and Sushi Bar are elegant but not too fancy. The Rear room especially is family friendly but the place has so many adults who grew up eating there and eat there with their kids. It really is a neighborhood institution. I have eaten once a week there for over 20 years. and there are groups of weekly diners! You will love it.

title: Amazing Quality and Service
review: The sushi and sashimi variety and quality are unsurpassed.  The service is traditional Japanese and excellent.  My personal favourites (saba and uni) are always perfect.

title: Amazing sushi and sashimi
review: Everyone has their favorite sushi place and this is mine. I've been coming here for more years than I wish to reveal, but it's always consistent and delicious. The fish is fresh and wonderful and the flavors are terrific. The staff is always sweet and welcoming and the decor is lovely. I've been to a lot of different sushi restaurants, and none of them ever compares to Sai Cafe.

title: Dinner
review: If you love sushi this is the restaurant to visit. The staff are lovely and the food is out of this world good. Fresh, unique and beautifully served. Do not hesitate just go.

title: Amazing sashimi!
review: Had a many course meal at the sushi bar with friends that was just amazing. I'm not exactly sure how my friend arranged the meal or if it was a special option for those in the know but basically the amazingness just kept coming and each was a complete surprise. This is different than what I see offered on the menu. All I know is that everything was delightfully fresh, inventive, beautiful, and delicious. I highly recommend.

title: Sushi!
review: The best sushi anywhere!! Friendly staff. Beautifully decorated and of course, delicious food!! You won't regret it! Come and enjoy some of the most amazing rolls you can find.

title: excellent dinner
review: Did we order perfectly or was everything just that good?  So fresh and with delicate flavors.  Hamachi with jalepeno appetizer is sensational. Great hand roll tuna- could be a bit spicier. Tempura udon just right.

title: The way it should be…
review: Still relatively new to Chicago, Locals introduced me to this fantastic neighborhood establishment. Jim the owner abd his staff are always so pleasant and professional, I had several omakase dinners here b4 Covid. This was my first return in over a year. Ever dish Jim prepared was beautifully presented from the oyster shooters, to a gorgeous plate of fresh white tuna, hamachi, salmon topped with caviar finished with gold leaf, immaculate black cod. So happy I live nearby!

If you want pure non gimmicky sushi try Tanoshi or Sushi Dakku.

However the rest of the rolls were amazing. We first ordered the Hamachi special. Amazing. Next we ordered salmon on fire. Delicious. We paired our meal with a Riesling which was perfect, not too sweet. Our friend knew Jimmy B. Unfortunately he wasTraveling. Will have to return to meet him. Highly recommend.

review: Everyone has their favorite sushi place and this is mine. I've been coming here for more years than I wish to reveal, but it's always consistent and delicious. The fish is fresh and wonderful and the flavors are terrific. The staff is always sweet and welcoming and the decor is lovely. I've been to a lot of different sushi restaurants, and none of them ever compares to Sai Cafe.

title: Dinner
review: If you love sushi this is the restaurant to visit. The staff are lovely and the food is out of this world good. Fresh, unique and beautifully served. Do not hesitate just go.

title: Amazing sashimi!
review: Had a many course meal at the sushi bar with friends that was just amazing. I'm not exactly sure how my friend arranged the meal or if it was a special option for those in the know but basically the amazingness just kept coming and each was a complete surprise. This is different than what I see offered on the menu. All I know is that everything was delightfully fresh, inventive, beautiful, and delicious. I highly recommend.

title: Sushi!
review: The best sushi anywhere!! Friendly staff. Beautifully decorated and of course, delicious food!! You won't regret it! Come and enjoy some of the most amazing rolls you can find.

title: excellent dinner
review: Did we order perfectly or was everything just that good?  So fresh and with delicate flavors.  Hamachi with jalepeno appetizer is sensational. Great hand roll tuna- could be a bit spicier. Tempura udon just right.

title: Best quality sushi and sashimi, nothing hidden, just raw goodness
review: The sushi offers the best quality, freshest fish in Chicago. It is expensive for every day dining but well worth it. The pan seared scallops are to die for! The spicy creamy taco maki is a must have for those with a spice fetish. And they use real Alaskan King Crab legs on their Kani Su.

title: Great Appetizers, Nigiri and Sashimi...
review: I have been going to Sai Cafe since the early 2000's. I really enjoy sitting at the sushi bar... chit chatting with the sushi chefs (which is always great to get the recs of the day from them). We especially love ordering nigiri and sashimi at Sai Cafe - always tastes super fresh. Love their hamachi jalapeno, tuna poke and age dashi tofu appetizers - which you may find at other sushi joints but these are consistently tasty. I'm also in love with their cream spicy scallop handroll (also available nigiri style) - I usually finish my meal with one of those handrolls or an uni handroll - it's my version of dessert. The owner, sushi chefs and servers are super nice as well. It's always a treat dining here. Drinks - my husband usually sticks to japanese beer or sake here. I think their Lychee Martini is perfect and exactly how it should taste like - and its delicious.

title: Great Sushi, noisy atmosphere
review: We ate there on a Saturday evening. Crowded but we had reservations. We had a variety of sushi and my wife had the grilled sea bass. Helpings were generous, food was really good. The atmosphere is nice but very noisy. There were three college aged girls seated next to us who were practically yelling at each other. As the din increased so did their volume. We would go there again, perhaps later in the evening after the crowd has thinned down.

title: Really great food in a low key setting
review: Had a wonderful and varied meal here. Everything was delicious. We had both the grilled black cod appetizer and the sea bass entree - so delicious. The chicken fried rice had a great smokiness. Volcano roll was a standout among the rolls. A lot of the food we ordered was pretty spicy so take that into account when you order. Service was quick and efficient and the wait staff made great suggestions of what to order.

title: Quality of fish can't be beat (at least in Chicago)
review: Sai Cafe is located in the heart of Lincoln Park. The restaurant itself isn't fancy, but the limited number of sushi rolls are all outstanding. Nice number of non sushi options as well. The quality of the fish is better than just about anywhere else in Chicago.

title: Fish is very fresh!
review: I love sushi and live on the east coast. I was in Chicago and received a tip about this place from a friend. My immediate thought was great sushi in the middle of the country? We went anyways and this place did not disappoint. The fish was super fresh and so tasty. There aren't a million crazy rolls, which I thought was actually a good thing. Great atmosphere in the smaller dinning room that you walk into first. Try the Ahi Poke for an appetizer and the Volcano Roll for one of your rolls for lunch or dinner. We ended up ordering another after our first round.Great place, thanks for the experience

title: Not just sushi
review: Everyone at my table raved about the sushi but I was not in the mood for it. I had the Japanese rice with shrimp. I thought it was nicely done with just the right seasonings. Mine had shrimp in it and the shrimp was a nice size. I also had an one of the appetizers. We had the baked scallops and they were wonderful!  There were eleven of us at the table and we were all in a corner but the mirrors on the wall helped us all feel like we were not claustrophobic. Service was very good and they kept up with both giving us water and drinks well. The one negative to this place is parking. However there is pay for parking around the neighborhood.

title: Fantastic dinner!
review: Before we left Chicago, I was determined to have Sushi and looked at a number of places. Being in a quiet neighborhood was a concern, but that concern quickly went away when we arrived in Lincoln Park to find Sai. Certainly a busy commercial area so take advantage of the valet parking (or enjoy a pleasant walk).The food was great,portions the right size. We did share a roll that was only 4 slices BUT each slice was size of a small child's hand (definitely could not use chopsticks to pick it up).It was not busy so the wait staff was constantly filling our glasses and checking on us. That was a little over the top but understandable.It was a 30 min drive from the Hyde Park area but I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

title: Neighborhood Gem in Lincoln Park
review: This restaurant is a neighborhood gem. Incredible sushi, if you like nigiri the portions are very generous. If you don't eat sushi, their other food is great too. Service is friendly and quick. The restaurant also has a cozy and romantic atmosphere, nothing is better than sitting in one of their booths by the window. Lastly, they have a varied and reasonably priced drink list, which is hard to find at a sushi restaurant in the city.

title: Excellent Sushi in Lincoln Park
review: A few must haves: Wild Salmon, Oyster Shooter, and Hamachi Jalapeno. Nigiri was all fresh and we particularly enjoyed the Spicy Scallops and Spanish Mackerel. Service was impeccable and fast. The owner checked in with us several times and provided recommendations. We look forward to returning when we are hungrier to try the Omasake- their version of Omakase. A solid recommendation to anyone looking for sushi in Lincoln Park right near the Armitage brown line.

title: Totally fine
review: This is the closest Japanese place to my apartment and I've eaten there twice since I moved in 3.5 weeks ago. I'm not going to rave about this place because I've been to some really great restaurants in the area and this was not one of them. But it is a totally respectable joint and I wouldn't think twice about going again. Service was good and the ambience is nice as well.

title: Sai Surprise
review: On a recent visit to Chicago, I was fortunate to have the opportunity to dine at Sai Cafe. Friends introduced me to this gem of a sushi place (they've been eating here for over 20 years!) and while they enjoyed their meals, I gorged on incredibly tasty and well prepared vegetarian sushi. When I visit Chicago again in the future, I will be back for a meal at Sai!

title: Spicy tuna
review: A friend suggested Sai Cafe for sushi while in the city. We are glad she did. Two blocks off the brown line makes it easy to reach from downtown. The service was attentive yet laid back and we loved the neighborhood feel.

title: Disappointing experience
review: We decided to try Sai Cafe because we were hungy for Japanese food. Big mistake! The sushi was just barely average. My chicken teriyaki came to the table stone cold and had only small slices of chicken. But the service was horrendous! It didn't appear as though servers had been assigned to tables and we have 5 - 6 flitting around the table. They constantly asked if we were finished with things - and started to take them away - when we were clearly not done. They moved food around and seemed to be in some kind of weird hurry. We were definitely not be back.

title: Consistently great, fresh sushi !
review: We have been coming here for years and it is a great sushi restaurant !  It is always very fresh- and interesting combinations- they have made a lot of improvements in the decor and  the service is always good too.  Consistently good !

title: Just delicious
review: Wonderful food! And wonderful staff. We basically ordered whatever we were recommended and everything was great! Also...very reasonably priced for the quality :)

title: The best Japanese food in Chicago!
review: We LOVE this restaurant. It is a hidden neighborhood gem that is not to be missed! The food is amazing, the atmosphere is inviting and comfortable. We having been eating here for over a decade, and everyone we have brought with us has become a regular. The owner seems to know almost every customer by name, and the staff is wonderful about special request or changes to the menu. Highly recommend!!!

title: Best Sushi in Town
review: For no frills Sushi the is still the BEST quality Sushi around. No fancy crazy rolls just very fresh large Sushi. The Oyster Shooters are a must.

title: Real sushi!
review: The food quality in this restaurant never disappoints. The service is good and there is no pressure to turn the tables. Plus they have valet parking.

title: Excellent Sushi and Sashimi
review: Warm friendly back room makes an excellent environment for quality dining. Service always exceptional.

title: overrated "fancy" sushi
review: Overrated and overprice. Not even good for the area. I recommend sushi elsewhere. Waitresses swarm you and the whole place is trying to be hard to be a scene.

title: Best Sushi in Town
review: The best Sushi I have had.  A fantastic atmosphere.  And the service is top notch.  I love this place.

title: Fresh, Fresh, and Fresh
review: Some of the best sushi I have had in awhile and I ate at Sushi Den in Denver just last week. You could just tell it was fresh by looking at it. Had oyster shooters and other rolls. Everything was amazing and top notch. Can't wait to get back here.

title: Great price
review: $20 all you can eat In the loop I can't find anywhere can offer this great deal

title: Definitely a good sushi in Chicago
review: A good Japanese ambiance in this excellent sushi place, although the chef is Korean but has spent years in Japan and clearly know how to make sushi.He has us taste some specialties that were not on the menu. Some delicious fish.Everything is fresh, well prepared, the rice is perfectly cooked.The ambiance is nice, almost cosy.I will definitely go back to this local sushi in Lincoln Park.

title: Sushi is always fresh.  Pieces are big.  Have good maki's.
review: Sushi is always fresh.  Pieces are big.  Have good maki's.

title: Great Japanese food, well prepared and presented. No surprises. Try the scallop appetizer.
review: Great Japanese food, well prepared and presented. No surprises. Try the scallop appetizer.

title: Cozy place, vulcano maki...
review: Cozy place, vulcano maki rocked, and the chocolate dessert was yummy.

title: Best Deal in Chicago for Sushi
review: The best thing about Sai Cafe is that you actually get good sized portions for the money.  And to top it off it is really really good.  The Sushi Bar lacks some atmosphere.  But for the money, it can't be beat!

title: Best sushi in Chicago. Been going here since '85. Fresh, large portions, tasty appetizers, too!
review: Best sushi in Chicago. Been going here since '85. Fresh, large portions, tasty appetizers, too!

title: Great sushi
review: Great sushi

title: They kept it up, even after all these years. Deserves a pat on the back.
review: They kept it up, even after all these years. Deserves a pat on the back.

title: Great sushi and cute atmosphere!
review: Great sushi and cute atmosphere!

title: the spicy crunchy tuna rolls are the BEST.
review: the spicy crunchy tuna rolls are the BEST.

title: I've eaten there twice and haven't been disappointed yet.
review: I've eaten there twice and haven't been disappointed yet.

title: Oyster shooters!  Good sushi too.
review: Oyster shooters!  Good sushi too.

title: Awesome asian/sushi.
review: Awesome asian/sushi.

title: Mediocre place.  The maki rolls are not special and do not set the restaurant apart from the other hundred sushi...
review: Mediocre place.  The maki rolls are not special and do not set the restaurant apart from the other hundred sushi restaurants.  The food is overpriced for just an average roll of sushi

title: decent sushi place.  Well, I don't think Chicago has good sushi place at all, to be honest.
review: decent sushi place.  Well, I don't think Chicago has good sushi place at all, to be honest.

title: Great place for a great breakfast
review: Went with some friends who live there.  Nver would have found it on my own.  Great friendly staff, broad menu selection and a relaxed atmosphere.

title: Overpriced but decent fare
review: A hearty breakfast, but the prices we a bit too high for a standard breakfast...even for Halsted.  Nice size portions (get your hollandaise sauce on-the-side, it's quite lemony and can ruin the taste of your benedict).

title: Very Good Good. Excellent Service.
review: This restaurant always has consistently good food, which is surprising for a place with such an extensive menu. And the service is excellent. This time, our server was Angelina, and we really appreciated her. She was attentive and friendly and catered to our every need. We will return.

title: Yum
review: Great food. The omelette was big enough for three people. Service was friendly and quick. Highly recommend.

title: Great food , but...
review: Food was good, surly male waiter with little patience,all the plates were worn and the forks were bent , would I go again? Maybe but could probably do better elsewhere

title: Hidden gem
review: This was the highlight of our restaurant experience in Chicago.  We came here for breakfast and it was amazing!  I had banana pancakes and they were delicious!!!

title: Good Food. Variety of Foods. Great Service.
review: This neighborhood restaurant has always been a favorite of ours. We often meet our cousins there. The menu is vast and offers lots of choices. This time, our service was exceptional from Courtney. We appreciated his service and the service from all of the workers making sure our coffee cups and water glasses were always filled.

title: Below average
review: Nice place...nice staff but the food was forgettable.I tried the Spring Frittata ..the asparagus and mushrooms were luke warm and raw, unappetizing for sure.My wife declared her pancakes to be ok but her side of bacon seemed to be of the microwave variety...added to this the coffee was rather poor too.To add insult to injury the prices are on the higher side as well

title: Reliably Good Food
review: This Nookies is like the others - reliably good food and good service. They are good neighborhood restaurants that we seem to frequent fairly often. Prices are reasonable, and the menu choices are numerous.

title: Good service, average food.
review: The breakfast meals we selected did not have much flavor. We ordered the huevos rancheros and an omelette. The food wasn't bad, but with all of the breakfast places in Chicago, I would say it was average and not over the top. The service was good.

title: Great food & service
review: The food and service is wonderful. They add new freshness and vitality to ordinary breakfast. Highly recommended.

title: What you'd expect---and More!
review: Why is it that the clanking sounds of dishes, cups and silverware make the perfect background for places like this? Unpretentious, inexpensive, a bit noisy...and just that delightful breakfast or lunch platter you crave. Their wonderful array of breakfast skillets goes beyond the basics---like my skillet of scrambled eggs, potatoes and smoked salmon with capers and Hollandaise. For breakfast or lunch, the menu covers either choice perfectly. Even on a busy Saturday or Sunday, the tables turn quickly. The waitstaff runs the show with friendly bootcamp-like precision and efficiency.

title: diner in upscale neighborhood
review: Local family restaurant with homey atmosphere and really good food. Breakfasts are especially good and homemade soups. Interesting salads. Not your run of the mill diner.

title: Great for breakfast or lunch
review: We've eaten here several times either for breakfast or lunch and always had good food and good service.

title: Great place for breakfast
review: We had breakfast at Nookies Too twice when we were in Chicago. It was excellent on both occasions. The serving staff are very friendly and they make sure your coffee cup never runs dry!

title: Great place for a great breakfast
review: Went with some friends who live there.  Nver would have found it on my own.  Great friendly staff, broad menu selection and a relaxed atmosphere.

title: Overpriced but decent fare
review: A hearty breakfast, but the prices we a bit too high for a standard breakfast...even for Halsted.  Nice size portions (get your hollandaise sauce on-the-side, it's quite lemony and can ruin the taste of your benedict).

title: Very Good Good. Excellent Service.
review: This restaurant always has consistently good food, which is surprising for a place with such an extensive menu. And the service is excellent. This time, our server was Angelina, and we really appreciated her. She was attentive and friendly and catered to our every need. We will return.

title: Yum
review: Great food. The omelette was big enough for three people. Service was friendly and quick. Highly recommend.

title: Great food , but...
review: Food was good, surly male waiter with little patience,all the plates were worn and the forks were bent , would I go again? Maybe but could probably do better elsewhere

title: Hidden gem
review: This was the highlight of our restaurant experience in Chicago.  We came here for breakfast and it was amazing!  I had banana pancakes and they were delicious!!!

title: Good Food. Variety of Foods. Great Service.
review: This neighborhood restaurant has always been a favorite of ours. We often meet our cousins there. The menu is vast and offers lots of choices. This time, our service was exceptional from Courtney. We appreciated his service and the service from all of the workers making sure our coffee cups and water glasses were always filled.

title: Below average
review: Nice place...nice staff but the food was forgettable.I tried the Spring Frittata ..the asparagus and mushrooms were luke warm and raw, unappetizing for sure.My wife declared her pancakes to be ok but her side of bacon seemed to be of the microwave variety...added to this the coffee was rather poor too.To add insult to injury the prices are on the higher side as well

title: Reliably Good Food
review: This Nookies is like the others - reliably good food and good service. They are good neighborhood restaurants that we seem to frequent fairly often. Prices are reasonable, and the menu choices are numerous.

title: Good service, average food.
review: The breakfast meals we selected did not have much flavor. We ordered the huevos rancheros and an omelette. The food wasn't bad, but with all of the breakfast places in Chicago, I would say it was average and not over the top. The service was good.

title: Great for breakfast or lunch
review: We've eaten here several times either for breakfast or lunch and always had good food and good service.

title: Great place for breakfast
review: We had breakfast at Nookies Too twice when we were in Chicago. It was excellent on both occasions. The serving staff are very friendly and they make sure your coffee cup never runs dry!

title: You Will Find it Hard not to Stuff Yourself
review: Plenty of variety in breakfast, brunch and lunch selections.  Each is prepared with care and served with typical Chicago friendliness.

title: Happy I got lost and found myself here
review: On my way to Lincoln park and zoo, it seemed like I was a little lost. Needed to have my breakfast and this small oasis caught my eye.Went inside and was greeted by this lovely woman.Decided to have my breakfast on the bar.Since I had no idea what to order, after I made my choice, asked how filling it is as I was hungry, was offered to change my dish as I was so "open minded", I accepted the offer.My dish came out, looking good, tasting good.Staff here takes "fresh juice" seriously and it is actually squeezed in front of your eyes ( I was hypnotized how the machine worked )Regular clients kept coming in...Good food Reasonable pricesVery warm and welcoming staff Happy I got lost and found myself here

title: Good Food But Not As Good As Sister Restaurant
review: This sister restaurant to the Nookies on Wells has the same menu, daily specials, and the same food. It's smaller than Wells and maybe less busy, and the service is not quite as good. Prices are reasonable and comparable to similar restaurants. Long wait on weekends.

title: A little of this and that...
review: Wanted to stuff my college student before we headed home. I read up on Nookies and then found Nookies Too was near DePaul, so we headed there for brunch. People do not lie when they say it's not easy getting a table in Lincoln Park for brunch. The hostess said 20 min, but I'm pretty sure we waited for about 40. It was an unseasonably warm day in Chicago in Feb, so we had no problem waiting outside in the sun, but I do not know where people would wait had it been a normal winter's day.This is an old diner on the smallish side. People are packed in and you are basically sitting next to your neighboring table. It's quite loud, at least where we were sitting, across from the kitchen. The service was ok, our waitress did not seem familiar with the menu and had to check on what came in hubby's pita and also told me that the Combo Crepes were strawberries AND blueberries, even tho the menu states OR. I asked for the Combo Crepes with strawberries and there was all of this confusion, but it may have been a language barrier more than anything else.I was planning on the Monte Cristo that I had read about in a review, but it turns out that must only be offered at Nookies, so I choose the Crepe Combo which was crepes with strawberries and cream cheese. My crepes were very good, perhaps a little overdone and crisp for my liking, but the strawberries and cream more than made up for it. There were three, so the best part were the left-overs for the college boy. Three of us also ordered hash browns, which were small diced potatoes fried up in literally no grease. They were very dry, but in a good way. We all liked them after seasoning them a bit.Vegetarian hubby ordered the Veggie Pita with vegetable soup. He said it was quite good and plentiful. Our younger son had the Strawberry Pancakes, which was three fluffy pancakes loaded with strawberries. He loved them and enjoyed every bite! Our college boy enjoys a hearty breakfast. He ordered the Sweet and Savory. I'm not quite sure what was included and what he possibly added, but he ate the following: pancakes with strawberries and chocolate chips (awesome), hash browns (amazing), bacon (he said nothing special) and scrambled eggs (his words: "they are good, but really fluffy, kind of an odd texture, not sure I'd order them again" but he ate them).We all shared a large orange juice to see what all of the rage was about on TA. If you have had freshly squeezed orange juice before, that's what it tastes like. I guess we're spoiled at home, because hubby makes it often. Skip the $5 glass of OJ.Overall, we enjoyed our meal, it was worth the wait and we were all stuffed for a good portion of the day.

title: Something for Everyone!
review: Quaint little shop within easy walking distance of the Lincoln Hotel offered great breakfast options for everyone at our table. Coffee was good and the waiter was attentive. Will return next time we're in town to try more of the wonderful menu offerings.

title: Vacation Brunch
review: Lovely first visit and repeat for my boyfriend. Light and great seating. Delicious eggs benedict, hash browns, blt, tomato clam soup and bottomless coffee! Very friendly and attentive service!

title: Yummy breakfast spot
review: First - getting a table in Lincoln Park for brunch is work - you are going to wait 30-45 minutes anywhere, 60-90 minutes other places. Our wait was only 30 minutes here at 10:30AM Sunday. Food was excellent - we split a trio of sweet offerings for the table - pumpkin pancakes, apple fritters, french toast - whoa! We all had something different - omelettes, scrambled eggs - everything was great. Tab was very good as well - very very good breakfast/brunch spot.

title: A New Diner Option
review: This restaurant is your typical diner, crowded and loud. However, the service was efficient and the food was delivered as ordered and fresh from the kitchen. Even though the noon hour rush kept the restaurant full, we did not feel rushed to leave our table. All four of us found our orders to be delicious and satisfying.

title: BYOB and delicious!!!
review: Oh my! Wish we would have discovered on day one of our trip! Not only is the place BYOB but the food is the BOMB! Thank goodness we walked 10+ miles a day to work off the deliciousness! The best thing that we had in 25-30 meals (in chicago) was here --- the "good ol' boy skillet". Crazy at it seems it was the perfect meal. Comfort on a plate. Sadly, that was my husband's meal...I took the waiter's suggestion of the Jalisco burrito and felt it was one-note with no texture or spice. Grab your booze and get the good ol' boy!

title: Mid Day Search for Great Food
review: Quaint wee spot with great dishes to satisfy your appetite!  I had the Turkey Ruben and it was great tasting.

title: Amazingly good food
review: Bustling restaurant with brisk polite service. Had the french omelet with ratatouille and tarragon which was divine. Portions are very generous. Recommend and be prepared to wait 10-15 minutes.

title: BEST breakfast
review: Everything we had was delicious...be sure to have fresh squeezed OJ too!  We had 5 different dishes and all were great...I had the green goddess scrambler...one of the best breakfast dishes I've ever had!

title: Found this place on my way to Lincoln park
review: Happened on this place along the strip.Waitresses were very friendly.The food was very good.I had Paris eggs benedict and my girlfriend had Green Goodess.The presentation was excellent.They are very large too!Could have easily shared the Green Goodess.Reasonable $35.00 with tip.FYI very good coffee!!!!

title: it used to be my fav place
review: Iw as working close by so I liked their warm sandwiches for lunch or baked potato and breakfast, price was good as well I miss a very friendly stuff I am sad they close out

title: Tasty, Filling, Pesto Breakfasts
review: Both my father and I had pesto dishes and left the place happy and full. Didn't cost all that much either!

title: Pleasant Surprise!
review: A friend suggested we have breakfast here. We were not disappointed! The décor is nothing fancy, in fact it almost has a farmhouse feel. The food was outstanding! I ordered an Eggs Benedict served on Brioche bread. It had shaved ham, poached eggs and a Rosemary Béchamel sauce; served with roasted rosemary red potatoes. Out of this world!!! My son had Nutella Banana Crepes. The crepes were light, yet fluffy and so delicate. The flavor was a party in your mouth! The staff was very friendly and service spot on. Cannot wait to go back!

title: Great Breakfasts, Perfect Egg White Omelettes
review: This place rocks from the food to the service and especially their breakfasts. The service is very welcoming, your coffee cup never goes dry, the water glass is always full, and they do it all with an informal charm.But oh my goodness, the omelets are the best in the city. I always order egg white with mushroom, tomato, and spinach and they come with potatoes but you can substitute fruit which I always do and of course toast and jam. The omelets are huge, fluffy, and filled with veggies and incredibly tasty. Great place!ZB

title: Pass
review: Walked in with my husband. Food was good, but the staff were unpleasant. I asked for ketchup upon delivery of my food. My waiter became distracted by a new customer. I asked a woman sitting near computer if she would please get me some ketchup as I could see several bottles behind their work station. The woman replies, I will let him know. I said, I let him know already and it has been a while -meaning, I would like to eat my food please. The woman got me ketchup and then told the waiter he was taking too long. Sorry, I didn't mean to be such a burden to you. I guess my money is not green.

title: friendly service
review: we enjoyed lunch at Nookies Too with our granddaughter who was in a stroller. the staff at this restaurant were very accommodating, welcoming us in and even helping us up the couple steps with the stroller...the food was also good. we will be back.

title: Delicious!
review: We went around lunch time but we both got breakfast foods. I got a delicious croissant made into french toast with marscapone and strawberries inside of it. It was HUGE and heavenly. they had a number of unique and fresh items. Our server (Daniela) was also very friendly and helped us decide on what to eat. Very reasonable prices as well. Definitely recommend.

title: Nice little diner in the heart of the city
review: Located in the affluent Lincoln park it is a casual diner in the heart of this great city. Awesome food and the price is unbelievable for the city. Just a short walk trough beautiful residences to the Lincoln park zoo

title: Typical place to have a good time
review: I've been there with friends, we ordered different dishes and all of them looked and tasted delicious! A must go also for brunch!

title: Great food with big portions!
review: My husband and I stayed down the street for a weekend and we went here twice because the food is good, quick, reliable, and they serve big portions. The coffee is perfect and being big water drinkers, we never had to ask for refills. Sunday brunch was a few minute wait but Monday morning, we were seated right away. Also, very friendly staff! Enjoy!

title: Good for a tasty lunch
review: Nice steak sandwich lunch after a long walk around the area. Excellent value. Would be an ideal place for all the family

title: Awesome breakfast
review: We met some friends for breakfast at Nookies Too on our way out of town. The restaurant was recommended by another friend we were staying at in Lincoln Park (and it was within walking distance). While a little on the pricey side (but that's expected I guess for where it's at) our breakfast was wonderful. We ordered the gambut, from kids chocolate chip pancakes and french toast, to omeletts, to the breakfast sandwich I had. Everything was wonderful. Honestly it may have been one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had - three eggs and two or three sausage patties. Their hashbrowns were really, really good too. We stopped by at the right time because our party of seven didn't have a wait, but when we left the place was packed and there were tons of people waiting. A very popular place - and it ought to be!

title: Good for Brunch
review: Great place for breakfast or brunch, the bagels aren't as good as New York or LA but as good as you'll find in Chicago. The eggs and other breakfast dishes are very good.

title: Best breakfast ever!
review: While there were lines at Toast, we decided to walk 2 blocks north to Nookies Too for breakfast. Wow! We had the best breakfast food I have ever eaten in a little (hole in the wall) restaurant. Not only were the pancakes, french toast and egg dishes wonderful, but the service was outstanding as well. My selection one morning was the "special" - pumpkin pecan pancakes, whole wheat french toast with grilled bosc pears and a cherry, apricot pancake - amazing! Breakfast doesn't get any better than this. SHHHH! Don't tell anyone about Nookies Too.

title: Fantastic service; great casual breakfast dining
review: Don't be turned away by Nookies Too's wait. I went here with a larger group of eight people. We were told the wait would be 30-35 minutes, but didn't mind because we were waiting for some of our group to arrive and it was an unseasonably warm November day. They offered to seat us seperately, but we declined. After the wait time expired, a man who I assume is the owner or manager came out to bring us all freshly squeezed orange juice and apologized for the inconvenience. After an hour of waiting, we were seated and he returned again with a pumpkin pancake topped with pecans for everyone. He seemed to do everything in his power to be able to seat us together and make sure that we were still satisfied customers. For that, we are appreciative. The food was excellent, especially for the price. I would definitely return!

title: Great breakfast and great prices
review: This place has a great breakfast.  We love going to other breakfast/brunch spots, but they tend to be pricy for what seems like standard breakfast food.  We love this place because the prices are great, and we are never disappointed in our meal!

title: Great breakfast, fresh squeezed OJ and BYOB!
review: Stopped here for Sunday brunch - there was a "20-25" minute wait that actually turned into a 45 minute wait, but we didn't mind based on how great the breakfasts being delivered to other diners looked. It was worth the wait - everything we ordered was delicious and satisfying. They squeeze their own fresh orange juice behind the front counter, and with their encouragement of BYOB, we were able to enjoy mimosas with our brunch (they do not have a liquor license). They have a kids menu, too, although you may have to ask for it - we did, in spite of our 6 and 8 year olds' presence at the table. We will definitely return!

title: Pleasant Surprise!
review: A friend suggested we have breakfast here. We were not disappointed! The décor is nothing fancy, in fact it almost has a farmhouse feel. The food was outstanding! I ordered an Eggs Benedict served on Brioche bread. It had shaved ham, poached eggs and a Rosemary Béchamel sauce; served with roasted rosemary red potatoes. Out of this world!!! My son had Nutella Banana Crepes. The crepes were light, yet fluffy and so delicate. The flavor was a party in your mouth! The staff was very friendly and service spot on. Cannot wait to go back!

The omelets are huge, fluffy, and filled with veggies and incredibly tasty. Great place!ZB
