They have a kids menu, too, although you may have to ask for it - we did, in spite of our 6 and 8 year olds' presence at the table. We will definitely return!

title: Always a good choice for breakfast...
review: I have been here a few times and have never been disappointed with their breakfast food. I can't get decent bacon or any breakfast food in Japan so it is a priority of mine when visiting the USA. The pancakes and bacon here are delicious. I've never had to wait but I am usually there on a weekday and late. The servers are always personable and I've never had a problem with the service. You can't go wrong here.

title: Diner classics with fresh takes.
review: Diner classics with fresh takes.

title: Great, very casual breakfast or brunch spot that is very busy
review: We happened upon Nookies Too while walking in Lincoln Park on a Saturday morning in December. It was very busy and there was a wait, but it was only about 15 minutes. We both chose options off their seasonal menu, but the regular menu was full of traditional sounding breakfast and brunch items. I had the Apricot Cherry Almond pancakes and my husband had pear french toast. Portions were huge, and each item was only $7.95, which I thought was a really good value. We were offered coffee immediately upon sitting down, and it was kept hot and freshened the whole time. Our server took our order in a quick amount of time, but we did have a pretty long wait for the food and another long wait for the check. I'll just chalk that up to a busy Saturday afternoon! I'd go back if I were in the area, and I understand that there are other Nookies locations that I am sure are just as good.

title: great omelettes; long lines
review: great omelettes; long lines

title: The sweet trio is always...
review: The sweet trio is always great...a little bit of everything

title: Nice portions, decent value
review: Clean, roomy dining area with tasteful décor.  The portions were larger-than-average and the coffee and fresh cream was a nice accompaniment.  Good flavors, but only disappointment was the crab cake benedict (overcooked/burnt edges and not very flavorful).  Overall, a very good value for the price.

title: Too Loud. But Food is Good.
review: This neighborhood restaurant offers good food, reasonable pricing, an extensive menu, and friendly service. The one negative is that the restaurant is just too loud. Even when it’s not filled to capacity, conversations carry all over the room, and it’s hard to hear your own conversation. The restaurant really needs to add some sound insulation.

title: Mr
review: Visited many times-great breakfast however we ordered delivery this time-it was adequate problem is the order was one meal short and was told they would not redeliiver-refunded the meal but still not acceptable-careful of delivery orders

title: Great breakfast with huge portions!
review: Excellent service and food. If you leave hungry then something is wrong with you. Omelettes are huge, served with fresh shredded potatoes and two pancakes which could be a meal in itself. Very kid friendly with inexpensive kids meals. Try the banana bread French toast! Yummy!!!Can’t wait to go back and try their lunch menu!

title: Breakfast Meeting
review: Great place to have a wonderful egg skillet and latte, while discussing work. They’re back booths are quiet and comfortable. The wait staff is professional. The food is very fresh. Additionally the bathrooms are impeccably clean. I would definitely go back!

title: Good Chicago food in the old corner cafe tradition
review: In my youth very many corners on main streets had a cafe that served American style food at a decent price. This place is much likre they were. When I moved back to Chicago 2 uears ago, that was one thing I missed. The skillet was very good and the short stack was better than most. The Chicago tradition of good service lives here. If you are too young to remember those old "just a place for a good meal" restaurants, this old school place will show what thet means.

title: Great for Brunch
review: Enjoyed brunch on a Sunday morning around 10. There was a wait of about 25 minutes. Be sure to walk up to the cashier counter and write your name on the waitlist. Food was fantastic, portions are quite large at a great price-2 eggs, bacon, hash browns and a pancake served a with a fresh fruit slice around $10.

title: Great Food. Great Service. Nice People.
review: This restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch, and the food is very good. The family who runs it is all about customer service. They’re friendly and so pleasant. They remember all of their regular customers and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Parking can be different, but I recommend parking on the street with the Park Chicago app.

title: Wow - this is a real treat for breakfast!
review: Stopped here for breakfast and we’re really pleased with that choice. First off they have an amazingly large menu, so you are sure to find something to your liking. Secondly they provide massive portions, so you will probably have to get a doggie bag - but you’ll certainly eat the leftovers yourself because the food is so good. Plus they offer great service, a lovely setting and as a first time visitor you get to ring the “bell,” so a fun attractive setting too. Definitely go here. You’ll love the friendly setting and great food!

title: Such a great place for brunch!
review: I found this place by chance a few weeks ago and have loved every meal I have had here. The service is great and the food is wonderful.

title: Quintessential breakfast and lunch place. On the corner...
review: This is the perfect place for a weekend breakfast or lunch. Okay - weekdays too will work! They have delicious cream of chicken rice soup (my mother went back 3 days in a row to get it!) and a nice menu of everything else you can imagine ordering for breakfast or lunch. The wait staff is a little cocky - not sure why - but I'm over it.

title: My favorite all around breakfast/lunch place
review: When this place moved in, I was thrilled. Family-owned and run, it offers great home-cooked dishes and excellent service. The owner is always there, so you KNOW you are getting their best treatment. West Lincoln Park has long needed a good replacement for the now defunct Mitchell's restaurant. This is it. Similarly great egg-white omelets (that overflow your plate), great soups (even better than Mitchell's were) delicious sandwiches, and great breakfasts.

title: Wonderful cafe for breakfast or lunch!
review: Cornerstone cafe has been a regular in our lives for years. First, at the Western avenue location and to our delight , one block away on Webster. The food is always good, reliable, very delicious and abundant portions. Wait staff are great, particularly Linda (with them at both locations for years) and Will, very friendly and accommodating. Lisa, front desk is terrific. She navigates seating and service with enthusiasm. She makes sure you are taken care of and always has a kind word and greeting! Cafe is casual and comfortable and outside dining available in warm weather. Skillets are great as is french toast. Salads and wraps aso a hit! Paul and his son Paul are staples and make the cornerstone a great experience. They know all the regulars and have become family. Perfect place for breakfast, lunch or coffee to go! They also celebrate bdays with a special acknowledgment of the guest.

title: Cute storefront cafe with great food!
review: Stopped here after visiting Barnes and Noble across the street and was not disappointed! Portions are generous, service is friendly and overall is a very welcoming place for breakfast or lunch.

title: Great Food & Wonderful Owners
review: We love to support this neighborhood restaurant because the food is great, and it is owned & run by a wonderful family who like to get to know (and remember) their customers and go out of their way to ensure a great dining experience. Open for breakfast and lunch, the food is delicious. Try the banana bread French toast - it's divine!

title: Perfect Crab Cake Benedict!!!
review: First time here and this place is great! Being from a family of Greek diner owners, I am a very tough critic of such places. Cornerstone is super clean, friendly, great service and does the basics extremely well as well as having some newer twists on its menu. My daughter's Pigs in blanket were classic, my wife's egg scramble was great and my crab cake Benedict perfect. Sauce was not too heavy and crab cake perfectly balanced. I hate writing this because the place is already pretty busy but the truth is the truth... we will be back to explore the rest of the menu! Oh and you must try the banana bread french toast!

title: Great local coffee shop
review: We stumbled into this charming corner cafe by chance and returned for breakfast each day of our visit. The portions were generous ---4 egg omelet !---- and hardy with good variety.

title: How does this place not get 5 stars?????
review: This place has the following:1) excellent service2) fresh everything3) home made everything4) the best corned beef hash ever5) reasonable prices for a full stomach6) see number 4A must try - oh, and if you a first timer, don't forget to ring the bell when leaving!

title: Great addition to the neighborhood
review: We went with a large group. A very nice, clean menu and large portions of food. Everyone liked their food. Service was fine. The only issue we had was a toddler who would not stop shrieking.

title: Scrummy brunch
review: It took 2 years to open but worth the wait. A modern, homely diner with old style charm. The management and staff are super friendly, and the food is of a very high quality but at affordable prices. Great place for brunch or lunch.

title: Welcomed Off-Shoot
review: We have been going to the parent Cornerstone Café on Western Avenue for many years. This off-shoot opened in July. It has excellent omelets and other breakfast choices. However, on this first visit to this location, I just think that the cooking and the service does not quite come up to the level of the Cornerstone Café on Western, though it is still fine enough to merit a return visit.

title: Great breakfast
review: The restaurant has only been open for a few weeks - but it is doing things right.  We went for breakfast with two other couples and everyone enjoyed their food.  Service was good also.

title: Sushi
review: Macku is a beautiful setting with a beautiful bar area.  The menu and presentation was very nice, but the dishes lacked the favor I was expecting from a high end restaurant.

title: fabulous food
review: The sushi here is fabulous - fresh, tasty and original.  Even the non-sushi eaters will love this restaurant.  The filet and lobster dish is excellent.

title: Gourmet Sushi
review: There is no better sushi/Japanese restaurant in Chicago and we have been to many of them. The chef/owner is very knowledgeable and only uses the best ingredients. He also has a top shelf collection of Japanese whiskeys and sake. Go for the Omakase and get ready for a treat with every course being a surprise. You will not find Macku's unique preparations elsewhere. This is gourmet sushi, not just neighborhood Japanese food. This is their 9th anniversary year (2018) and that kind of longevity has to be earned in this town. Enjoy!

title: Surprising visit on the spur of the moment
review: Four of us visited at the last minute at about 9 pm on a Wednesday night, after an event nearby. We were just about the only ones there in this small place. We were offered and opted for the chef's 5 course Omakase. Each dish was artfully presented by a wonderful waitstaff and covered a broad range of Japanese cuisine. I will definitely return to this neighborhood gem.

title: First time to classic place
review: Took family here and we thought this was fantastic.. loved the sashimi dishes.  I got the "Chef's special"... he served it up well, although everything was from the menu- I always like when they throw in something unique too!

title: Week day dinner
review: We had to wait a while for dinner because a big party came in.  It was not the greatest sushi I have had but very expensive.

title: Sushi sushi !!
review: Let’s start off by saying I’m not a major huge fan of sushi! This place always hits the spot for fresh sushi. The employees can always recommend yummy sushi dishes and they always taste fresh and refreshing don’t miss it

title: Good Sushi Place
review: Our family went to this restaurant because it is my two daughters' favorite sushi place and she wanted to go there for her birthday. My wife and I are not crazy about sushi, but we enjoyed our meals there. The waiter was very helpful in helping us pick out the various selections the restaurant offered. We had a good time there and the food was very good. They do have other items you can order besides Sushi.

title: Terrible service can overpower any food, no matter how carefully prepared and delicious it may be
review: “Terrible service can overpower any food, no matter how carefully prepared and delicious it may be. We will definitely not be back and we do not recommend this place at all” I get the feeling that your experience at Macku (with our first server at least Tall, big build, Asian) can depend MASSIVELY on who you are and possibly even on how you look. My boyfriend and I went to celebrate our 7th anniversary last Saturday. We both work and go to school full time so date nights are rare and we had been looking forward to this all month. We had a reservation so we were sat quickly and noticed a few empty tables so we were looking forward to it being a smooth dinner. Our initial server, whose name I wish I would have caught must of thought we were deaf - He came to our table and loudly asked “What do you want to drink?” - No introduction, no chef specials, just those 6 words. We totally disregarded it, we were there to celebrate you know? I simply said “no not yet, we’d like to take a look at the menu first, thank you.” He grunted as he walked away and came back within a few minutes and loudly asked again “WHAT DO YOU WANT TO DRINK”, I told him we were ready to order some appetizers if he didn’t mind. Which of course he did, and he made sure to make it known, he said he wasn’t ready for an order and that he would be right back and walked away. He then left to take care of the table right next to us, in a gentle and very informative manner he explained the menu and took their order without any hesitation!!! Before becoming a nurse I’ve waited tables at many restaurants, because of that, I am always apt to cut servers a lot of slack but this guy was so rude and his treatment was simply inexcusable. I honestly don’t even know how or why we made it this far at this point. Anyhow as we were trying to order off the menu he would simply say NO, NO, NO WE DON’T HAVE THAT - Instead of suggesting what they did actually have because at this point it seemed as if they had nothing. We were able to order a few appetizers, sashimi, and our drinks. We received our food rather quickly, my boyfriend (FYI: HE IS A SUSHI CHEF downtown) asked for Wasabi and the server SCOLDED him and said he would ruin the sashimi with more wasabi and refused to bring it to the table. We asked a different server for the wasabi, and with no hesitation it was brought to us. Again, why are we still here? This is beyond ridiculous, it can’t possibly get any worse, can it? Ohhhh but it certainly can. After repeatedly seeing that same server kindly explain the menu to other tables, he came to our table and said “The chef’s have a big order coming so you have to order your entire meal right now if not you’re going to have to wait more than an hour for food so what do you want” 1. We were the ONLY table he said that too. 2. There were a few empty tables still and 3. We still hadn’t received the drinks we ordered more than 15 minutes prior and yet he was trying to kick us out?! After botching every possible aspect of our meal, I voiced my opinion to the manager. She sincerely apologized and offered us a Do Over with a different server. Nickolas was our second server and the experience difference was insane, he was fantastic and explained everything to us which we are grateful for - However, Terrible service can overpower any food, no matter how carefully prepared and delicious it may be. We will definitely not be back and we do not recommend this place at all.

title: Try the Omakase menu - with high-end seafood. OMG....
review: I take people visiting - or groups of friends - here when I can - simply because it is consistently excellent and inventive. Recently I tried their Omakase option (chef's choice - ad-libbed as you go.) : on Thursday it was actually 30% off for their $75.00 Omakase menu - a GREAT value. Then one day, I ordered the option of the best quality seafood omakase. This was more expensive, but I asked to be told when I had reached my fiscal limit. Each dish was presented like a piece of art: on unique and inventive dishware - or huge seashells - or astounding sculptural serving plates. The dishes were unlike anything I had ever had: snails in incredible sauce; the freshest caviar on a spoon, langostina whose shells were so crisped that they were edible and delicious. An amazing experience. They also have an impressive Japanese whiskey collection - which my son-in-law loved. I only wish they carried a pink sparkling wine - my favorite accompaniment to sushi - and they brought back their prior mixed seafood caldron of soup (with quail egg and a variety of seafood, slightly spicy - delicious enough for a meal.)

title: Creative and excellent sushi experience
review: I've experienced many sushi restaurants and found Macku at the top of the list for quality, variety and the entire sushi experience. We sampled many different dishes, each an individual presentation and many memorable. Service was excellent as well. It is pricey although not too excessive considering it was Chicago. I look forward to another trip here when I return.

title: Dinner
review: We had the Chef selection. It was simply outstanding! Each dish was creative and very tasty and fish was very fresh. I would definitely return.

title: Food took forever
review: The food took 45 minutes to arrive, the sushi was wrapped in cucumber and no one warned us (I hate cucumber) and the portions were tiny. It did taste okay, but not worth it.

title: Excellent and unique sushi!
review: Macku is a great and tasty sushi restaurant.  Their sushi chef makes rolls and entrees that you cannot get at other sushi restaurants.  If you love sushi, you WILL LOVE Macku!

title: One of the best Sushi experiences in Chicago
review: After our third consistently amazing visit i am writing a review. Hands down this must be one of the top sushi places in Chicago (and I've been to a lot of them). If your fortunate enough to have Macku serve you then ask for the omakase and let him do his thing. Just an amazing delicious experience. Even the most stubborn and fanatic true sushi lovers will like this spot.

title: Sushi
review: Macku is a beautiful setting with a beautiful bar area.  The menu and presentation was very nice, but the dishes lacked the favor I was expecting from a high end restaurant.

review: The sushi here is fabulous - fresh, tasty and original.  Even the non-sushi eaters will love this restaurant.  The filet and lobster dish is excellent.

review: Macku is a great and tasty sushi restaurant.  Their sushi chef makes rolls and entrees that you cannot get at other sushi restaurants.  If you love sushi, you WILL LOVE Macku!

review: After our third consistently amazing visit i am writing a review. Hands down this must be one of the top sushi places in Chicago (and I've been to a lot of them). If your fortunate enough to have Macku serve you then ask for the omakase and let him do his thing. Just an amazing delicious experience. Even the most stubborn and fanatic true sushi lovers will like this spot.

title: world class
review: From the imaginative selection and preparation of sushi and shashimi and totally fresh seafood and fish this restaurant doesn't miss a thing. The presentation and mixture of these fresh ingredients are simply the best. The list of sake is vast as well as a monster list of Japanese whiskeys. A must visit restaurant.

title: Mack Sushi is a one of a kind experience!
review: We went to Macku Sushi and were lucky enough to be treated by the owner Chef Macku!When i can afford it, I will ask the Chef to make what he wants, and thats what we did that evening. I can't quite explain what a delectable and unique treat it was. Macku has his and it's own style and flavors. Like a true Sensay in the culinary tradition of japan he uses his extensive knowledge of ingredients, and tailors them to you and your tastes and needs. I cannot recumbent this kind of experience for everyone, but if you know what I'm trying to explain then go!

title: Waste of our trip from the burbs
review: We had the Living Social coupon to use thats why we decided to dine here eventhough we live in the burbs besides the reviews were great. It was an Omikase 6 meal course. From the first course which was the sweet potato soup from the last course=chicken breast served with mashed potato. The second course was a battered fish (like Gordon's from the box) with heavy cream on top. Really threw us off because we dont see any Asian in these meal. The course in between was just fine, nothing we have not seen before. The hamashi sashimi was the only one we liked the most. The sushi maki was not even rolled to par with ingredients we thought was an after thought. The wait staff made a mistake to tell us that the Living Social coupon includes 2 free drinks/beer, but it turned out not. I wanted to cancel the drinks as soon as he told us but we just felt bad because they might have prepared it already.The lychee mimosa was not good at all. I am not sure where it got the good rating. We can not recommend this place. Not worth it even with discount. Sorry :)

title: An Experience To Cause A Rethinking of Previous Sushi Restaurant Reviews
review: Omakase - A term I had not heard previously, but an experience that astounded when partaking in a Groupon offered at Macku. Treated to an intimate window table - but within earshod of the sushi chef - the delightful 6-course meal began with a carrot soup reduction generously accented with lump crabmeat. The tempura whitefish shared appetizer was exquisite. But the squid-big eye tuna-sake sashimi was a sight to behold, graced with roasted garlic, microgreens, and shaved burdock. Unbelievable. Sashimi has always - in my experience - just been served with unadorned fish. The Macku version is so much more eye-appealing, and a gastronomic delight. The sweet potato sushi roll topped with a well-spiced tuna tartare was yet another delight. Two subsequent courses were wonderful, and we opted for the asparagus flan desert, so nicely prepared. Wine list is good, tho pricey. A great experience, and we will be back - even without a Groupon.

title: One of the Best Sushi Restaurants in Chicago
review: If you like sushi, ask for omakase and prepare for a truly creative dining experience. (If you don't like sushi, why are you reading this?) We were absolutely in heaven. The food was unbelievable. Let me ad a kudo for the waiter who had the courtesy to give us price range options for the omakase before we began too, and let us know when we were hitting our limits. This kind of meal gets pretty pricey and, given that I didn't want it getting totally out of hand, the matter of fact way it was addressed was really helpful and made in easier to concentrate on the wonderful meal. I have only one small gripe -- either raise the seats or lower the sushi bar. We like to sit there and watch the prep and chat up the chefs. The height difference unfortunately makes that difficult with this particular sushi bar.

title: Some of the best Sushi I've had.
review: Macku san is no beginner restauranteur, and this may be his best. He serves some of the most delicious and artistic food I have ever had. we went there on our last night in Chicago, and am I glad we did. if you enjoy Japanese food esp, sushi, go, sit at the bar, and let Macku san make you a meal.

title: Never disappointed
review: I have been coming here for years. I recently came back to Chicago for a visit and this place is still just as great as the first time I ate here. They always have fresh fish flown in and the flavor is unmatched by any other sushi place. I highly recommend stepping out of your comfort zone and try something new. It will be worth it!!!

title: Macku gets it right!
review: We had an amazing date night at Macku Signature (Halsted location).We had the chefs special and he really outdid himself. We first had a tomato soup. The plate comes out with mozzarella cheese, olive oil, and other lovely ingredients and then our server pours a tomato bisque like soup in the dish. The taste was incredible. I can not even mention all of the dishes but a few were the lobster dumpling Ina mushroom sauce, sea urchin (loved it), SAWA GANI crispy river crabs, salmon ni giro with enoki mushrooms, truffle oil, chives OMG!!!I have always had sushi rolls and I'm happy to say Chef Macku has ruined that for me. The texture of each fish was different than your everyday sushi place in the midwest. Truly authentic and delicious. I'm adding a few pictures too! Enjoy!

title: Second review: The place is headed downhill
review: You will see I wrote a review in Feb of 2013 which suggests there is no where better for Sushi in Chicago. Well I sadly write today saying the restaurant is falling apart. I believe this to be because they opened a second restaurant, Macku Signature, and the management and main chef are splitting their time. No one is overseeing the quality of the experience and food full time anymore. My most recent trip to Macku was probably my last unfortunately.

title: Unforgettable initiation to sashimi before our trip to Japan.
review: At Macku, we explained our concern about what we might eat on an upcoming trip to Japan, as we thought we didn't like sushi. The sushi chef at Macku proved to us how wrong we had been. We ordered a chef's choice dinner (at slightly below the chef's recommended starting price point), and were served one delicious dish after another. Aside from the carrot soup to start (delicious, but not fish), almost all of the seafood we were served came in large bites of uncooked fish or shellfish, with fascinating garnish. Most were among the tastiest bites we've ever eaten, and those that didn't make that grade were good or interesting. Our favorites were the maguro sashimi and white tuna sashimi. The most memorable presentation was isake, fileted fish served whole, with the strips laid across the fish's back, to be dipped in soy sauce. What most surprised us about this meal is that only one dish was served with any rice, and that only a dollop lying beneath the bite of raw fish. We came in very skeptical of sushi, and left as total converts to good sashimi (i.e., raw fish served alone without rice accompaniment. In Japan a week later, we had breakfast at a restaurant near the Tsukiji Fish Market after the early morning tuna auction. It was good and very fresh, but it wasn't as good as the sashimi that Macku served us.

title: If you want sushi rolls, this place is not for you
review: I've been visiting Macku and Macku Signature for the last ten years and have not found better Japanese / Sushi in Chicago. I always sit at the bar and do Omakase (chef's choice menu) and have never been disappointed. In fact, I've been able to try dishes (live scallop, blue fin tuna, live uni, trout sashimi) that were remarkable. Omakase is not inexpensive, but a very special treat and remarkable experience! Chef is engaging and entertaining and takes great pride in ensuring a high-quality, unique experience. A much try in Chicago!

title: Freshest fish, beautiful presentation
review: Macku's excellent, fresh fish is always presented with imagination and style. The signature touches on the sashimi and nigiri add flavor, not flash. For starters, try a soup. The carrot soup is flavored with crab and is presented in a small white cup with chives and a delicious rice cracker. The udon is crazy good. (My mouth is actually watering as I type this.) The atmosphere is romantic, quiet and tasteful with real jazz playing in the background. We dine here regularly and are always treated well. It's one of our top choices when we are entertaining guests.

title: Overpriced & went down hill
review: This is a review of the location on Halsted but I couldn't find that on Tripadvisor to rate so please keep that in mind this is not a review about the one on Clybourn.We had very high expectations coming here because the chef was from Kaze until it closed & Kaze had fantastic flavorful food! How we miss those crazy intense wonderful flavors...The Food was so overpriced & did not deliver. Aso the server told us to come back for some super hyped up dishes that are very expensive & sounded fussy & pretentious. Too bad. How about just fresh awesome tasty seafood?

title: Going Down Hill
review: I'm very conflicted about this restaurant. my wife and I have been coming here for years, but things have changed recently. I went on line to make a reservation to celebrate my anniversary and saw that they have 2 restaurants. I knew that I wanted the one on Clybourn as it is much quieter than the one on Halsted, so I clicked on the Clybourn site and made an online reservation for dinner. We do this all of the time, easy right? When I went to make the reservation, I was re-directed to open table to complete the process, which I use all of the time, so I was happy to make my reservation this way, but.... when I arrived at the restaurant, they told me that my reservation was for the other location on Halsted and only the other location uses open table, not the original one on Clybourn. So why was I re-directed there to make the reservation? Not only that, but they would not give me the restaurant points since only one of their restaurants participates with open table. Had I not been re-directed on line to make the reservations, i would not have thought twice about it, but now that I was, and they wouldn't honor it, I was not happy. Really??? they only honor this at one restaurant and not the other? I don't like being misdirected and misled, so I'll now think twice about going back here, even though I've enjoyed it in the past. This created 2 strikes in my mind.Back to the other reason for three stars. As I mentioned, we have been coming here for years and my wife loves the Cod dinner and she loved the way that they made the Gomae. The Cod was as always very good, and a nice size portion, but they have cut down the portions by what seemed like more than 50%, as the meal was significantly smaller than it used to be. And the Gomae, although also quite tasty, used to be made with spinach, bananas, and peanut sauce, but the peanut sauce is now missing, so it's a bit more run of the mill than it used to be. Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but they rushed us so much that my dinner came out before I even had time to finish my soup. I don't know why they felt the need to rush us, on a Wednesday evening, they were not even close to being full, so they didn't need the table. I used to love this restaurant, now it's just another Asian restaurant, nothing special. All in all, just a so so experience.

title: Sister Restaurant, with a better dress and same quality food
review: This review is for Macku's Sushi sister restaurant on 2925 N Halstead, called Macku Signature. I have been at the N. Clybourn restaurant many times throughout the year and without prior planning always have a hard time getting in at prime hours.Luckily, by opening up this new restaurant, many will have the ability to experience the taste of the Chef. My husband and I made last minute reservations. The new restaurant is much easier to get to, easier parking, bigger, more modern, and the atmosphere is slightly more formal but still very comfortable. Service was excellent, and very accommodating to my husband and my differences in food preferences.My husband and I chose to order Chef's choice. Unlike most restaurants where both parties must have the same food for each course, the Chef tailored each course according to our preferences. My husband wanted more typical sushi, and I wanted more non-typical options. Also, you let them know how much you want to spend per person and then they start sending beautiful and tasty courses out. We chose to spend $80 per person. Plus we also had a groupon so, it was much less than that.I have attached pictures of each of our course. We had at least 5 courses. First Course: White asparagus soup, and Not your typical Miso soup. Second Course: Me - risotto type dish, Husband - fresh salmon and a quail egg.Third Course: Ravioli with lobster broth. ( Would definitely order again)Fourth Course: Me - Seared Bison (melt in your mouth), Husband - bass with olives, citrus sauce.Fifth Course: Me - Black Cod with Shrimp (YUMMY), Husband - Fresh seafood, great presentation, and lettuce wrap type approach served in a beautiful bowl that was lit from the bottom. See picture to appreciate.Even after all these courses, we had more money left from the dollar value we had set for the chef. The last course that my husband chose was more raw sushi, and I opted for a custard dessert. Wow!! Pleasantly surprised with the dessert.This was high quality food, and what I considered very reasonable price for all the food we were served. The new restaurant was pretty, and suitable for a date and special occasions.Both Macku restaurants are my favorite Sushi restaurants for the quality of the food, creativity, and service.

title: Great in every way -
review: My first experience with Sushi in Chicago. The quality of the fish was excellent and was really no different than we get here in California thanks to constant air travel.Explored the menu and mostly went with the nigiri stuff I like where it is just a fine cut of fish on a slab of rice. The specials were the best thing on the menu so I suggest listening carefully to them and ordering what sounds good for some really exciting flavor combinations. Giving service average because she offered a special of my favorite sushi fish, mackerel and came back to tell us it was completely sold out. She also did not catch or read back my entire order so we were short one dish that I had asked for. It was not poor service however. Mistakes happen and I am a bit of a mumbler. I am calling the food excellent even though I am from Los Angeles where we have the best sushi restaurants in the Western Hemisphere. This place can hang with some of the best on food quality.

title: Don't Tell Anyone
review: This place is amazing. I am caught between wanting to promote them and wanting to keep this place a secret. I have been here 5-10 times in the past 3 years and it is always outstanding. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about Macku (other than that the location is terrible, which is what contributes to people staying away).

title: By far the best Sushi in Chicago
review: The people in the kitchen and at the sushi bar here care very much about the dish they serve you. The fish is fresh and pretty much everything is delicious. Also, i recommend ordering various non sushi dishes and highly recommend the tasting menu. You will not be disappointed. If you are on a low budget, this is not the place for you.

title: Great dining experience
review: Went for dinner, and was going to let the Sushi Chef put together a selection. Then I noticed their prix fixe menu, a multi-course meal including sake/wine pairings for each course. It was a cornucopia of unique delights and presentations. It was just what I wanted, and well worth the culinary experience. Wait staff was excellent.Note: I tried to make a reservation off the Contact Form on their website. There was a lot of confusion, and ultimately they did not have the reservation when I arrived. Fortunately, it was mid-week and not busy. Better to call to make a reservation.

title: most creative sushi and more
review: We where in town for a conference and gave Macku Sushi a try due to its excellent reviews and creative menu, We were not disappointed. For our party of seven the waiter suggested the tasting menu consisting of several small warm courses and sashimi plates followed by a final plate of three or six nigiri. Every course featured different combinations of flavours, textures and products none of us had ever tasted before, although some were veteran sushi eaters. Absolutely delicious. The small restaurant had a very modern design, but warm and welcoming at the same time. Worth every cent!

title: Nice place for sushi
review: We went with some relatives who live at Lincoln Park, Chicago, and are familiar with the place. It's a neighborhood sushi place, with kind of an intimate atmosphere. The service was good, and the sushi was very fresh, tasty ad creative. We tried several different plates, which were all good. It's a little on the expensive side, but it's worth it!

title: Sushi heaven
review: The food is delicious. There are traditional and imaginative sushi options at this wonderful restaurant. The service and presentation are perfect. The quality of the food is unsurpassed. I only wish I lived closer to this little neighborhood gem. Also, a wonderful French pattiserie is just a couple of doors down - an added bonus. Reservations are a must!

title: One of the most unique and best dining experiences I ever have had!
review: A close friend of my son is a sushi aficionado who believes that Macku is the only place to go in Chicago for this type of food. My son has accompanied his friend to Macku a couple of times within the last several months and has extolled the quality of the food. Knowing that I had never eaten sushi, my son invited me to join the two of them to try it out. So on a weeknight in early March the three of us dined at Macku. It is located on north Clybourn St. in a lively section of town having numerous restaurants and bars. My son’s friend had made reservations for 7:30 p.m. and when my son and I arrived shortly before then, the friend was already seated at a well placed table in the rear end of the dining room. The restaurant, which is set up with tables as well as a counter with stools, seats approximately 46 and is very comfortable. On the night we were there it was bustling with customers.My son’s friend, who is a long-standing patron of this restaurant and well acquainted with the staff, graciously consented to do all the ordering. He was very ably assisted by our waiter John who was professional and extremely informative. As to what we ate, please understand that because I am a complete neophyte relative to sushi, I am not capable of providing the Japanese names of the approximately 10 dishes we shared. However, I can say that most of the food was either specially ordered or the special of the night. It included white tuna ceviche, asparagus soup with foie gras (the only dish that was cooked), tuna tartar, spring rolls, spicy tuna rolls, and asparagus pudding for dessert. Our meal was accompanied by a pouilly-fuissé that was selected in coordination with John.Prior to our dinner at Macku I had very mixed feelings as to what to expect. I thought that I probably would like some items, dislike some, and be indifferent to the rest. Well, I am extremely pleased to report that I was greatly surprised as to how phenomenally good all the food was. Everything was extremely fresh, wonderfully flavorful, very colorful, and beautifully presented. Most important, nothing in our food had the remotest hint of any “fishy” taste. Moreover, we all agreed that our wine, which was very tasty and refreshing, was the perfect accompaniment to our meal. During our dinner while course after course was presented and consumed with great relish by all three of us, I kept saying that I couldn’t believe how good the food was. This dinner at Macku was certainly one of the most unique and best dining experiences I ever have had!

title: Unique nigiri & entrees - wonderful little trendy neighborhood place w class atmosphere
review: This is a great, unintimidating place for exploring Japanese fusion - tuna tartare appetizer, bison appetizer(!), wonderful and unique yosenabe - a gratifying meal in itself - replete with seafood ( including jumbo scallops!) and quail egg and delicate but remarkable flavor. Creamy and indescribable carrot soup and signature sweet potato soup (to die for!) and outstanding white asparagus soup. Udon is also lovely. Broiled black cod entree with "chocolate" sauce (think Japanese mole!)- indescribably delicious. The various signature nigiri are a must! Delicate and nuanced and flavorful and creative. You will want multiples of each. I would say the regular rolls are not as impressive or unusual here. Go for their specialty items. Ask the waiter if in doubt. If you have the means and time, go for the omakase menu - where the chef picks what to prepare for you - depending on market availability and your budget and appetite! Macku has a nice selection of drinks and wines. Waitstaff is impeccable and helpful. Did I mention that the atmosphere is lovely and intimate without being stuffy? I have taken my girls - as older teens - and have gone with dates and with friends. Perfect for all scenario.

title: Great beer selection and bar food
review: So forget all of the televisions and the fact that you won't be able to concentrate on what your friends are saying because you keep looking at the home run/touchdown/3-point shot or whatever. Instead, your friends don't matter, unless you want to share some apps with them (which you do - they are delicious). But keep the Badger Burger (with fried cheese curd yumminess) all to yourself. The food. Is just. Good.

title: One of my Go to
review: Whether sports, Tuesday trivia, or dinner out my friends and I religiously hit up State for their vast drink selection, delicious food, outstanding bartenders and more TVs than than 3 Best Buy’s combined. Love it here and easy to train to! Never change!

title: Great burgers and great service! A must for DePaul families!
review: We went here on a Friday afternoon for lunch. Although the interior seems move slated to evening/bar crowd, the place was quiet, clean, and comfortable for lunch/dinner service. We were pleasantly surprised when the waiter mentioned that the burgers were on special that day, so we all ordered 3 different burgers (cheddar, PBJ, and jalapeno) and each one was exceptional! Seriously, try the PBJ! But the biggest factor in this review was that the service was excellent as well! Our waiter was on point every step of the way, quick to give us menu, quick to deliver or refill drinks, quick to take our order and serve our food, checked back with us to make sure everything was ok. Great food, great service, we are coming back!

title: Hidden gem
review: Was told this place was a college bar, but it’s so much more than a stereotypical college bar. Lots of space, TVs everywhere, and a first-class establishment. Then there’s the food—anything you could possibly want, and the portions are gigantic. My group shared practically one of everything on the appetizer menu. Put it this way, I never thought I could ever get full on a quinoa salad. Can’t wait to come back—craving this place today.

title: Nice Place for a graduation celebration
review: We went here for a graduation celebration and the waitress was very nice and helpful, the food was pretty good. There was a lot noise so somewhat difficult to hear especially for my elderly parents and the restrooms were not very well lite. Other than that I would most definitely go back.

title: High Quality. Decent Price
review: Overall great food and drinks, the place is cover in TVs and booths were super cozy. Went on a Friday and it was not that backed but had a great time

title: Lots of Beer & TVs & Noise
review: This restaurant is perfect for an on campus eatery. It's large with a lot of seating, and booths that will accommodate 6-8 people at a time. There are TVs everywhere. And the noise is off the charts. Food is average. If you like loud sports bars, this is a great place to come.

title: Love those specials!
review: This busy popular sports bar and restaurant was serving specials as our group was walking past. We opted for drinks and appetizers on the way to another restaurant. The menu is extensive bar food which pairs well with the many choices of microbrews. It was a treat to enjoy several appetizers which we might have avoided if not taking the time. We were able to follow our team in a playoff college hockey game as we enjoyed the tasty apps. The wonderful weather this time of year encourages us to check out those great spots by walking as parking can be a headache around Chicago.

title: Fantastic Burgers
review: We arrived right when the restaurant was opening at 11:00 a.m.. Got right in and seated. Pub- type atmosphere, tons of TVs, great for sports people. I ordered mac & cheese with a bleu cheese, grilled onion, bacon, garlic aioli sauce on it. Delicious! Husband ordered an American-style burger with buffalo tots. This was also outstanding. Very creative sides. We didn't order any drinks, but the bar will be very accommodating for drinkers; they also have a wide variety of alcoholic beverages on their menu. Will be back if I am in the area. Was an easy, accessible restaurant from the street.

title: Cheese & more Cheese
review: This place has some insane tasting burgers and mac&cheese. All of the curds, fries, and beer flight were good. I recommend the grapefruit beer, it was the best in our flight. The Korean burrito sounds weird, but it's one of the best tastes of Chicago. The buffalo mac&cheese is extremely tasty and very filling. We had a really cool server, and we choose her recommendations. Trust the server her at STATE.

title: Upscale Bar Food
review: Went here for a weekend lunch. Food was surprisingly good. Mostly upscale versions of what you would typically find in a sports bar. Spicy Chicken Sandwich was great as were the Korean BBQ tacos. Where they kind of fall down is in the service department....More

title: Huge Menu Selection
review: State has a very large menu selection and the food is generally very good. Its often packed for sports events (mostly college football).

title: If You Like TV Sports...Go Here!
review: Large bar...great appetizers and food. Many...many...many tvs for sports(we watched NCAA tourney). Very loud but fun. Wait staff is excellent.

title: So much more than a sports bar!
review: I can't say enough about this place!  We just had our daughter's wedding at State and couldn't have been happier.  Everything was perfect.  Emily Caron, our event planner was a doll, and so easy to work with.  The entire staff was wonderful and the service...More

title: Delicious food and great Friday night special!
review: My sister, nephew and I stopped at this restaurant near DePaul University on a Friday night; we were surprised to hear their special:  Purchase any drink and get most items on the menu for 6.99!  I ordered the chardonnay wine flight and was very pleased...More

title: Get your game on at State!
review: Why watch a game at home when you can watch it on 124 tvs and eat delicious food at the same time. The service is great, the staff is very accommodating, and the atmosphere is one of the best for watching a game in Chicago....More

title: Best place to watch a game!
review: Been here multiple times and always have loved the food and had great service. My favorites are between the Truffle burger and the Cheddar burger. They have great specials on food during the week which is great if you're a college student trying to save...More

title: Best bar food in Lincoln Park.
review: The atmosphere is great on game nights and the food is absolutely spectacular in comparison to other Lincoln Park bars.

title: Inexpensive and really good!
review: Great value and wonderful food! We always have a great time whenever we come here! Get off at Fullerton on the "L" and you won't be disappointed!

title: Nachos, not so sure....
review: Stopped in for a quick bite to eat.  Football season......but they have every tv on the same 2 channels. 124 TV,s....I asked.  Kind of funny and overwhelming!  Noisy.  But it is a sports bar, so expect the noise levels.  We ordered beers and something to...More

title: Check your receipt
review: I live in the area of State and have been a number of times. The food and beers are certainly good. However, I have now had two issues with being overcharged on my credit card versus what the receipt says. Be sure to check your credit card statement after eating there. The first time they handled well but the second time they dragged out for months and never fixed.

title: Great Food & Price
review: We stopped by State to have dinner with a few family members of ours and we really enjoyed our time. The food was outstanding, starting with three apps (short rib asparagus, Korean BBQ lettuce wraps and white cheddar curds) and adding four entree's (Cilantro lime salad, white truffle burger, red goat burger and the white truffle mac & cheese) along the way, We were very pleased with everything that we ordered. The food was very tasty. On top of this, most of the menu was priced at $6.99 with a drink order. The bill for four, outstanding. Normally in Chicago I spend this for two of us. Well, actually I normally spend more. Job well done!

title: very good bar food special deal
review: I go there on Fridays when they have a special discount on most of their menu. 6.99 you have to buy a drink which can be either a soft drink iced tea or an alcoholic drink. great burgers salad chicken fish. I'm very large and varied menu for a bar. it's a huge sports bar with tons of TVs so if you want to watch a game it's a great place to be but it can get noisy at night. like a lot of bars these days the windows can open. I only go on Friday because of the specials otherwise the sandwiches can get a little pricey.

title: Good starting place
review: Location is close to the train, the venue is large enough for groups. Lots of TVs if you're interested in watching sports. For our purposes of meeting up with friends it was fine (they are locals) but for me there wasn't a lot about it that made it "special or unique". I only had a few drinks, but my friends that ordered their food liked what they ordered. Definitely try their root beer- yum!

title: Wow. Great bang for our buck
review: My girlfriends beau attends DePaul. He said we should go to state. Our waiter was Colin. He was excellent. This night all entrees were 5.99. Wow. I had buffalo chicken Mac and cheese. It was fantastic and enough for two meals.y daughters was excellent and huge as well. We also had a baked pretzel as an appetizer. It was very good. To qualify for the entree special, you do have to buy a drink. Well worth it. Thanks for such a wonderful meal. KevinKe

title: Great food
review: The food is significantly better than expected. Good fun atmosphere. And the root beer beer is awesome

title: Excellent food
review: I've been to State a few times in the past, basically just as a Lincoln Park bar. It's always been a younger crowd, but nothing wrong with it. Just went last weekend to watch the NCAA tournament and was amazed at how much better it has even gotten. They have 100 beers on tap and the food was fantastic. The boneless chicken wings were amongst the best I've ever had - and perhaps the best. Sure it was noisy because of the game, but it has a nice, comfy atmosphere. Service was also top notch.

title: We had a lovely family lunch at Warehouse Pizzeria
review: We had a lovely lunch at Warehouse Pizzeria. The food was terrific and the menu varied for a pizzeria. The prices were moderate. The wait staff were charming and efficient. The decor is mediocre. It doe s have some outdoor seating and some indoor/outdoor seating, which we used. The clientele was very attractive. The location is excellent on Fullerton and there is plenty of road side parking.

title: Huge burger, Very good pizza
review: We had an early dinner here after moving Grandma into assisted living facility across the street. This was a small bar and grill with a good menu. The fresh cut fries were excellent as we're the wings that could be customized with about four sauce options. The thin crust pizza was good, but average, however the deep dish was very good with a nice pull on the cheese. The burgers are larger than average coming with two quarter pound burgers. We were able to sit by the open garage door on a lovely evening and felt a comfortable breeze.

title: Excellent food with great craft beers on draught
review: We visited early evening on a Saturday so it wasn’t yet crowded. Service was fast and friendly. We enjoyed The pepperoni rolls and the mac&cheese rolls for appetizers - definitely go for the pepperoni! We also had the Chicago Classic pizza served deep dish style - this was great. Crust was perfect and the sauce flavor was the best (not too sweet) - leftovers also great so take some with you. We picked here over other options for the food and craft beer menus and loved the visit for both.

title: Bar prior to Cubs game
review: We had some issues meeting up with a friend and wandered into this bar on Saturday morning. Here's a summary of why I liked it:Ordered the Bloody Mary special and got a piece of pizza with my drink...both were wonderful. We sat at the bar and talked to the bartender (who was originally from Cleveland). I felt very comfortable and enjoyed several conversations with the bartender. Really nice guy, friendly atmosphere in a cool neighborhood. Restrooms were very clean for a bar!

title: Great Purdue bar!
review: Our family of six decided to try this Purdue bar & it did not disappoint! We ordered appetizers as well as a margarita pizza & it was the best I’ve ever had. Can’t wait to go back. My only negative is the service was a bit slow but not the servers fault, not enough working.

title: Best Pizza
review: We had the Bacon Mac & Cheese Pizza & The House Pizza! My favorite was the Bacon Mac & cheese. The best pizza in my opinion!

title: Average Pizza, Average Service
review: We came here to watch the Wisconsin/Ohio State game. It’s a good place to watch sporting events because there are a lot of TVs here. The cheese curds are delicious. As is the vegetarian pizza. The Margherita pizza is meh as is the Calabrese. Each pizza is $17. They have a nice selection of beer. Sitting at a table in front of the garage door is chilly. Our waitress was indifferent. I’m not sure I would return here.

title: Weekend getaway to Chicago
review: Stopped for drinks on our way to downtown.  Great selection of beers and wonderful service.  We also had the cheese curds, the sweet onion jam was really good!

title: Amazing deep dish
review: This is a great LOCAL place that loves to give the feel and flavors of locals. Everybody working was super friendly, and the deep dish pizza is a true Chicago style deep dish. Lots of red sauce on top differentiates it from others. Love it!!!

title: fun place
review: I went here a couple of weeks ago with family and friends to celebrate a birthday. The staff were lovely, the drinks were delicious and the food as tasty! If you can handle heat try the Habanero Heat Wings!! Tasty but very very hot!!

title: A popular college hangout with all the trimmings
review: The Warehouse Bar and Pizzeria at 1419 West Fullerton Avenue in De Paul University's Lincoln Park neighborhood is a popular gathering place for college students who cater to pizza, burgers, salads, craft beer and all manner of bar food while watching sporting events on TV. I only wish we had a place like this to go to when I was in college. Opened in 2015 in the space once occupied by Via Carducci, Warehouse is run by Carmelo Scalzo, nephew of the former owner of Via Carducci, and cousin Agostino Femminella. They've added a modern touch to the growing popularity of sports bars. Warehouse has 15 TVs and a 28-foot-long bar and offers 16 draft beers and 40 brands in bottles and cans. You won't get thirsty here. And you won't go hungry, either, with a menu that seems to cover all bases. Start with pizza dough sticks or pizza rolls or nachos or wings or cheese curds or Monster fries, a unique and fascinating concoction of house-cut fries topped with shaved beef, bacon, Bolognese meat; sauce, pepperoni, mozzarella and fresh herbs. It's enough to make your eyes roll. Build your own pizza, Cajun (shrimp, Gouda and vinaigrette), Rustica (figs and Gorgonzola) or Angry Italian (spicy soppressata, giardiniera and sausage). They are a sharp alternative from Warehouse's traditional thin crust pizza. Maybe you'd just prefer a burger. Warehouse's Classic Burger is highly recommended, 1/2 pound of hamburger patty topped with American cheese, lettuce, tomato and onion on a brioche bun. On my last visit, I took a step back to my teenage years and ordered a bowl of tomato basil soup and a grilled cheese sandwich. That was my standard order in the 1950s. It still tastes good. Then top it off with a banana split or a bowl of gelato or sorbet. All sports bars should feed their customers like the Warehouse. If they did, you probably wouldn't have time to watch the game.

title: A great place to drink a beer with solid food options
review: It was a coincidence that I dropped in here. I needed a beer. And they have them. 19 on tab. A couple of more in bottles. And the food is amazing. Perfect, friendly and uncomplicated service. I'll for sure come back.

title: Great salads, average pizza
review: With so many pizza places within a mile radius, this would definitely not be my first choice. We were a party of 4 and all thought the pizza was merely average. However, the waitress was super friendly and attentive. We split a couple of salads and they were excellent. Funny, we went here for the pizza and left raving about how good the salads were!

title: Great Thin Crust Pizza
review: I love The Warehouse's thin crust pizza!  It is also a great neighborhood bar/restaurant that has a very welcoming staff and good atmosphere.

title: Love this place!
review: Super tasty pizza, reasonably priced and amazing mimosas on the weekends! They have over 8 different types of mimosas plus... They are unlimited!

title: Highly recommend!
review: We were visiting Lincoln Park from out of state and stopped in for an early lunch on a weekday. We spent about $45 plus tip. We were with our son who is a craft beer aficionado from CA. He heartily approved of the beer list and the food was well-prepared, quick, and hot. My caprese salad was especially good and our son's mac and cheese/bacon pizza was awesome. The bartender who also took our food order was extremely easygoing and friendly and knew his stuff. It was the kind of place I wish I lived down the street from!

title: Pizza nearf the rental
review: Arrived in Chicago hungry.  Looked over the balcony and saw the sign.  Ordered a few pizzas for the 6 of us and they were delicious.  Later the beer was good and the sports TVs were a plenty and the service was attentive.

title: Solid pub grub and nice beer list
review: Dropped by for lunch in the middle of the week. Simply did wings with a side of fries. They sell their wings by the pound, we just split one pound. Went with the traditional "buffalo" sauce, didn't want to try the habanero (but might do that next time). Wings came out temperature hot and spicy hot, pretty crispy and meaty. The fries were long, thin, and crispy, not too bad. The service was fine, since it was lunchtime it was just the bartender taking orders, bringing out the food, etc. She was pleasant and checked in on us more than once.The front of the bar, along Fullerton Ave, has tables with high-backed chairs, there are only 4 or 5 tables. Befitting the "warehouse" name, the front of the building is a garage door with glass panels, when the weather gets nice I would imagine they'd open that puppy up. Along one wall is the bar itself, along the other wall are high top tables with stools, and a flat screen on the wall next to the table...kind of hard to watch the TV at your table since it is right next to you. A few more TVs are above the bar.

title: Good food good vibe
review: Hubby's college friend's son owns this establishment. We had never been here before. It is located near DePaul University in a quiet neighborhood. Excellent beer selection! We both enjoyed the Jambalaya--chunks of chicken, andouille and shrimp. An appropriately warm entree on a cold evening. We had the Sausage Party appetizer--sausage crumbles in cheese sauce served with warm tortilla chips. The staff is very welcoming. If in the area, we would certainly visit again.

title: Focused on Bierwerker this visit
review: I don't get to Chicago frequently, but always try to stop by Local Option when the schedule allows. I usually enjoy some of the great beers they have on draft along with some soothing metal on the sound system. I switched it up this time because they had classic rock or some similarly mellow tunes flowing.I found the Exorcist, Mourning Wood, and American Muscle to be very good. At another place, I also had their Outlawger and it was quite good.

title: For beer in Chicago, cannot be beat...
review: This rating is for beer, I'm not a huge fan of their food. But, it doesn't matter. They serve extremely rare Belgians and Americans on draft, especially for special events. Have had some beers from Firestone, De Struise, Cantillon, etc. that I've not had elsewhere on draft. For beer nerds, a must-go.

title: Another great bar in Chicago
review: This was our final stopping point for craft beer on our penultimate evening in Chicago - and we enjoyed ourselves so much that we ended up dining here as well. We opted for quesadillas to share for starters, and I followed with skate wing, both very tasty. Very friendly service too.We will certainly be back here on our next Chicago trip.

title: Beers n Wings
review: We were out in the Lincoln Park area and decided to quench our thirst. We had a friendly accommodating bartender that served us ice cold beers. They have a great craft beer selection. We tried the wings and tater tots and they were excellent. The bartender even bought us a drink and you don't see that very often. Great atmosphere with a great staff.

title: Beer wise not necessarily the local option...
review: Friday afternoon 5pm and this place was totally empty. Strange. Anyway there were couple of new American beers for me. They also had some beers brewed for them. Beer list was quite nice but European beers are not that rare for me. Dark and somewhat rock themed interior. Food list was somehow very New Orleans themed (muffaletta, jambalaya, po’boy...). The service was good.

title: Unpretentious classic craft beer spit
review: A classic Chicago beer spot with great beer and great staff. Constantly changing draft list and knowledgeable staff. You don't feel like a snob hanging out here though plus the music helps.

title: Awesome bar
review: Went here on a Saturday night and sat at the bar for a pint.  Staff is very nice and friendly but the atmosphere is certainly rough...In a fun way!  The rotating craft selection is huge! Overall a very fun time.

title: Beer tourist
review: Solo, in town for a wedding. Dark and low key. Proper craft taplist, highly curated for the discerning craft drinker. Regional beers shining hard. One surly bartender, one extra nice bartender with long hair. Perfect balance of characters. Food is tasty and portioned well. Avoid that Maryland crab though...

title: Metal, Brew, and Great Eats
review: I just loved this place and now consider it a Chicago favorite. You'll be a fan as well if you love good food (I had the skate and tried someone else's muscles) and craft beer. The beer selection had local crafts, a number of 3Floyd's, and a few further out tossed in. Only thing that might get some people is if you don't appreciate heavier music. Too that I say, lighten up and try it, or stay away and leave the place for those of us that do =) I can't wait to get back.

title: Unwelcoming
review: Had this place on my list of brewpubs to visit on a trip to Chicago. Chicago is such a friendly city but we walked in this pub and felt so unwelcome! A blackboard full of interesting sounding beers but no information on the beers, including tastes/strengths/sizes. Seemed too much bother for staff to help a non local. Seems we were not cool enough for this place.

title: My kind of bar
review: Of course the beer is incredible, and varied. Lots of international choices, as well as the 'local options'. ;) What makes this place special is the atmosphere. Sort of ambient metal and filled with friendly people. We went when it wasn't too busy (mid-afternoon), so we had the pleasure of a nice long chat with a really knowledgeable member of staff. It was nice to sit back and relax without being hassled in a bar, with good music and beer. I wished we'd eaten there but we had other plans. Next time for sure.

title: Cool little bar!
review: We stopped here for drinks after dinner last week and what a cool little find! They have a nice beer list, including some of their own. We tried a few different kinds and enjoyed them all. We bought a couple of bombers to take home with us, as well. It was a quiet evening (a Monday) and the bartender was very friendly, but not overly invasive. He knew stuff when it came to the beer scene, and had some good suggestions for things to try.

title: Excellent Beer Selection
review: Brewpub offering selection of their own craft beers as well as numerous rotating taps.  Creole style food offered at reasonable prices.

title: Better beer is here
review: Beer snobs rejoice! Check this place out if you're interested in high quality beer options. The place/environment isn't anything overly exciting but the service, knowledge and beer options make it a worthy stop. Did not have food, unable to rate. It is obvious the heart of this establishment is with it's high quality beer options.

title: Good food good vibe
review: Hubby's college friend's son owns this establishment. We had never been here before. It is located near DePaul University in a quiet neighborhood. Excellent beer selection! We both enjoyed the Jambalaya--chunks of chicken, andouille and shrimp. An appropriately warm entree on a cold evening. We had the Sausage Party appetizer--sausage crumbles in cheese sauce served with warm tortilla chips. The staff is very welcoming. If in the area, we would certainly visit again.

title: Focused on Bierwerker this visit
review: I don't get to Chicago frequently, but always try to stop by Local Option when the schedule allows. I usually enjoy some of the great beers they have on draft along with some soothing metal on the sound system. I switched it up this time because they had classic rock or some similarly mellow tunes flowing.I found the Exorcist, Mourning Wood, and American Muscle to be very good. At another place, I also had their Outlawger and it was quite good.

title: For beer in Chicago, cannot be beat...
review: This rating is for beer, I'm not a huge fan of their food. But, it doesn't matter. They serve extremely rare Belgians and Americans on draft, especially for special events. Have had some beers from Firestone, De Struise, Cantillon, etc. that I've not had elsewhere on draft. For beer nerds, a must-go.

title: Another great bar in Chicago
review: This was our final stopping point for craft beer on our penultimate evening in Chicago - and we enjoyed ourselves so much that we ended up dining here as well. We opted for quesadillas to share for starters, and I followed with skate wing, both very tasty. Very friendly service too.We will certainly be back here on our next Chicago trip.

title: Beers n Wings
review: We were out in the Lincoln Park area and decided to quench our thirst. We had a friendly accommodating bartender that served us ice cold beers. They have a great craft beer selection. We tried the wings and tater tots and they were excellent. The bartender even bought us a drink and you don't see that very often. Great atmosphere with a great staff.

title: Beer wise not necessarily the local option...
review: Friday afternoon 5pm and this place was totally empty. Strange. Anyway there were couple of new American beers for me. They also had some beers brewed for them. Beer list was quite nice but European beers are not that rare for me. Dark and somewhat rock themed interior. Food list was somehow very New Orleans themed (muffaletta, jambalaya, po’boy...). The service was good.

title: Unpretentious classic craft beer spit
review: A classic Chicago beer spot with great beer and great staff. Constantly changing draft list and knowledgeable staff. You don't feel like a snob hanging out here though plus the music helps.

title: Awesome bar
review: Went here on a Saturday night and sat at the bar for a pint.  Staff is very nice and friendly but the atmosphere is certainly rough...In a fun way!  The rotating craft selection is huge! Overall a very fun time.

title: Beer tourist
review: Solo, in town for a wedding. Dark and low key. Proper craft taplist, highly curated for the discerning craft drinker. Regional beers shining hard. One surly bartender, one extra nice bartender with long hair. Perfect balance of characters. Food is tasty and portioned well. Avoid that Maryland crab though...

title: Metal, Brew, and Great Eats
review: I just loved this place and now consider it a Chicago favorite. You'll be a fan as well if you love good food (I had the skate and tried someone else's muscles) and craft beer. The beer selection had local crafts, a number of 3Floyd's, and a few further out tossed in. Only thing that might get some people is if you don't appreciate heavier music. Too that I say, lighten up and try it, or stay away and leave the place for those of us that do =) I can't wait to get back.

title: Unwelcoming
review: Had this place on my list of brewpubs to visit on a trip to Chicago. Chicago is such a friendly city but we walked in this pub and felt so unwelcome! A blackboard full of interesting sounding beers but no information on the beers, including tastes/strengths/sizes. Seemed too much bother for staff to help a non local. Seems we were not cool enough for this place.

title: My kind of bar
review: Of course the beer is incredible, and varied. Lots of international choices, as well as the 'local options'. ;) What makes this place special is the atmosphere. Sort of ambient metal and filled with friendly people. We went when it wasn't too busy (mid-afternoon), so we had the pleasure of a nice long chat with a really knowledgeable member of staff. It was nice to sit back and relax without being hassled in a bar, with good music and beer. I wished we'd eaten there but we had other plans. Next time for sure.

title: Cool little bar!
review: We stopped here for drinks after dinner last week and what a cool little find! They have a nice beer list, including some of their own. We tried a few different kinds and enjoyed them all. We bought a couple of bombers to take home with us, as well. It was a quiet evening (a Monday) and the bartender was very friendly, but not overly invasive. He knew stuff when it came to the beer scene, and had some good suggestions for things to try.

title: Excellent Beer Selection
review: Brewpub offering selection of their own craft beers as well as numerous rotating taps.  Creole style food offered at reasonable prices.

title: Better beer is here
review: Beer snobs rejoice! Check this place out if you're interested in high quality beer options. The place/environment isn't anything overly exciting but the service, knowledge and beer options make it a worthy stop. Did not have food, unable to rate. It is obvious the heart of this establishment is with it's high quality beer options.

title: Dinner and Drinks
review: Went with 2 buddies (mid 30s), and had 2 drinks and dinner. The dinners were fine, but I do agree with some reviews. Having a list of nonsense beer names on a chalkboard isn't exactly helpful when selecting a drink. Having to wait for the waiter to come and explain each beer is tedious. With that being said, the choices I selected for of the highest taste caliber possible. With that being said (again), there are no prices, so 'sticker shock' got us when we received the bill and each was 10 bucks each. Seemed a bit high.The staff was very knowledgeable (as they had to be), and the "Soup of the Year" was great. The atmosphere (post-apostolic) was fun, the music was head-banger; shame the place didn't have like darts or a pool table or two.

title: Great spot for local, quality beers
review: So many great beers brewed by Local Option as well as other craft breweries (I recommend the 'Walk of Shame' saison). The bartender was welcoming, friendly, and thoroughly described all their beers for us since we had never been there before. He also gave us some recommendations for a few other places to try while we were in town (which we did, and they were great too!). These guys know beer.

title: Brilliant beer, bangin' tunes and bearded barstaff... what more could you want?
review: My boyfriend visited Chicago and came home raving about this place, so when we visited together this year it was a given that I HAD to go... I don't regret that decision for a second.We trudged through knee deep snow to get there and it was well worth it.The second you walk through the door you're greeted by dark decor, loud music and an immense beer list - I'd say my inner teenager was in heaven, but at 32 I was also in my element.The staff were lovely, the selection of beers amazing and the music was so different from any other craft beer bar I've ever visited. This place is truly unique and well worth a visit. If I lived in Chicago I'm sure I would go regularly.

title: Could be so much better
review: I think this place could be something really neat...but it isn't there yet. I walked in and asked for a drink list, and the bartender pointed the wall. I found the list a font that was challenging to read...and I'm a teacher! If I have difficulty reading it...yeesh! No description of any of the beers. So I tell the bartender that I like wheat beers. She rattles off various beers. That doesn't help me. Maybe ask, "What wheat beers do you like?" Maybe give me a small sample of the best wheat beer. I ordered water. My husband loved this place. He'll try any beer, and they do have lots of different options including their own beer.

title: World class beer bar
review: Best beards in town...ohhh wait this is a review of the bar.  Best beer bar in town, the beards are added.  Great stuff, awesome atmosphere.  The bartenders know their stuff as well.

title: Pricey Brews • No Flights
review: I went to Local Option for a night-cap, excited about trying all their different beers. Unfortunately, they don't offer flights. I don't understand microbreweries that don't offer flights, samples, or something of the sort. Anyway, I tried the Voku Hila (Helles bock), which was OK. I also tried the American Muscle (a TIPA), which was great. The rest of their microbrews may well have been good or even great, too, but I'll never know because I didn't want a whole pint of each. I paid for some "guest tap" beers, as well, and the bill was borderline ridiculous. I definitely won't be back.

title: What a Place!
review: Went to Local Option for the release of Founders KBS, came out with a smile from ear to ear due to the atmosphere, service, and amazing selection.The place was absolutely packed, but the staff did an awesome job making sure tending to my thirst.Three pieces of advice:1. Don't be fooled by the decor! This is an amazing craft beer bar.2. Be prepared for some great, loud music.3. Check out the website in advanced for their incredible selection, or don't and get a bar tender to suggest one for you. Cross your fingers they have Parabola.

title: Good beer and food
review: A nice selection of special craft beers.  Surprisingly unique and good food.  Knowledgeable waiters.  Unfortunately the horribly loud metal/devil music damn near ruined the whole night.  It was a real relief to finally leave and go somewhere quiet for dessert.

title: Rude and unwelcoming service
review: My husband and I visited his cousin who lives a couple of blocks from this bar. We decided to do some daytime bar hoping. There was only one bartender. I can't remember his name but he had a very long beard, this was yesterday, 3/10/14. From the very beginning he was very short with all of us. I ordered a glass of red wine, which I noticed came from an already opened bottle. I tasted it and found it to be odd tasting. I politely told him I didn't care for it, to which he responded: well, I can't take responsibility for the wine, we didn't make it. I said, ok, and ordered a liquor drink instead. When he brought the check the glass of wine was on it and when I asked him to remove it his answer was: I'm sorry, I was instructed to pour it so I can't remove it. I have NEVER in my life received such poor customer service. Both my husband and his cousin were shocked as well. It's a shame...they said the beers they had were great. None of us will be returning. Hire better people, that's my advice to the owner.

title: Cool place... Friendly staff
review: Went here on the recommendation of the waitress down the street at McGee's.  The beer was awesome and the staff very friendly.  I recommend to anyone who wants a good beer and a place away from 'the scene'.

title: A little overpriced
review: This actually is a really good place to have a beer and just relax with some friends. The biggest downside is that it is a little overpriced. The staff was very friendly when we were there, but we were also the only ones in the place. I would go back just for the selection.

title: Calling all BEER GEEKS!!
review: Please find this place if you want to drink beer that you've never had, will never have again because you will not find it in bottles or on tap anywhere else. We plunked at the bar on a random Monday night for over three hours. This bar knows the locals by name, and doesn't seem to scoff if you want to order a High Life (saw two patrons consuming). This bar is dark with great art and beer kitsch adorning the walls. Didn't eat, but the menu looked intriguing; ie, muffuletta and jambalaya. Thanks Amanda and the other gentleman behind the bar. This was the best beer stop, by far!!

title: One of the best pubs I have been to!
review: I loved this place! Well worth the trip on the train from the centre of the city where I was staying. Loads of beers to try and the food was good and well priced. I loved the atmosphere, the layout with skulls on the hand pumps, and on the glasses. I purchased one from behind the bar which was cool. Would definitely go back if I visited Chicago again,

title: One of Chicago's Best Beer Bars
review: Craft Beer drinkers will find yet another place to get some of the best craft beer in Chicago. Food was very good too, and pairs well with the beer. The wait staff here too, like Map Room, Hopleaf and Haymarket, knows the beer like Rainman knew phone numbers.Must stop for beer drinkers.

title: This place is awesome
