review: If you love craft beer, you HAVE to go here. They have an incredible beer list and the employees are incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. My colleague and i stopped in over the summer on a business trip and it was a great experience. Food was excellent, beer selection was TOP NOTCH.I will go again on my next trip.

title: Craft Beer and Royal Crown
review: Don't let the skulls scare you - this place welcomes nerds. Welcomes nerds??? Yeah, especially beer nerds - they even have a sign welcoming you. The farmer was in the city to do business with a couple of cool cats who live in the neighborhood. I asked for something good and moderately priced. I arrived about a half hour early and felt a little over dressed and out of place - the Local is very local. But don't be afraid, the staff welcomed me and helped me understand where I could and could not park in Lincoln Park. The Local is famous for it's ever changing assortment of microbrews. Now the farmer don't drink no more (had a little problem and rehabbed in 03'), so I ask for a Red Bull and they said no, no, no. So I asked for the original energy drink Coca-Cola and again they said no, but offered me a Royal Crown (not to be confused with my old running buddy Crown Royal). For those of you who are younger than 30 or from the UK as my traveling "mate" was that night, Royal Crown or RC is a southern cola that finished a distant #3 in the cola wars. I love it's full bodied sugary sweetness. The mates ordered a variety of microbrews and were very pleased. We then proceed to all order tacos (steak, chicken and veggie) and were all very pleased. I had mine with the "tots" as a homage to one of my all time favorite nerds - Napolean Dynamite. Nerds unite - meet the farmer at the Local.

title: Pretty good Cajun food, not the best. But there are times when you crave their fried calamari and Po' boy sandwiches.
review: Pretty good Cajun food, not the best. But there are times when you crave their fried calamari and Po' boy sandwiches.

title: Fish tacos are fantastic.  Po'Boys are also really good.
review: Fish tacos are fantastic.  Po'Boys are also really good.

title: Great crab cakes
review: Recently bought crab cakes which were delicious! Also, appreciated both the cooking instructions (which were printed on the price label, and which were right on the mark) and the free tub of mustard sauce (which is made with horseradish).  Thank you to Dirk and Team!

title: Soup loaded with potatoes to added price per pound
review: I visited Dirks again while in Chicago visiting my son and purchased some soups and they were loaded with potatoes to add weight since they are priced per pound. Soups were average and not worth the high price and tip jar was still there, there is no tip jar at Whole Foods!

title: Get rid of TIP jar
review: Great choice of fish but asking to leave a tip isn't appropriate in this establishment.I notices the cashier always looking to see what I am leaving and I have often heard them call out when coming in from a carryout that her is a tip.

title: BEST sashimi grade salmon EVER!
review: Oh such a find! We got the sashimi grade salmon cut as sashimi, picked up pickled ginger and wasabi -- oh oh oh what a meal! The guys are all very nice too -- to adults and to kids. Lots more to try but I can't get off of the salmon.

title: Overpriced and Overrated
review: $12 for 2 cups of watered down lobster bisque with a shell. $8 for  herring in wine sauce comprised of 8 small pieces of herring. $60 a pound for sable. No thank you. Never again.

title: Excellent fish!!
review: Dirk's has excellent fish - the best there is in Chicago. The quality is excellent, as is the selection. Friendly and helpful employees.

title: Best Fish in Chicago!!!
review: Dirk’s is my go to for any type of fish!! The quality is the absolute best and the employees are totally cool!! Best cocktail shrimp anywhere in the world!

title: Best seafood in Chicago
review: Dirk's has been my seafood store for years. Their assortment is excellent, they always tell you where the fish is from, how it is raised or caught and the sustainability of the species. They provide the freshest fish, recipes, a friendly atmosphere even for newbies, and quality that is CONSISTENT. That is most important when buying fresh fish. You get what you pay for. Always. They now have a small lunch menu too. Great for travelers. Great fish at good prices. I wish they would open a restaurant.

title: Fresh Lunch
review: We missed the legendary Saturday fish cookout at Dirk’s so we grabbed lunch on Sunday. We got the the spicy crawfish salad sandwich, the tuna salad sandwich, and the fish tacos. Let me tell you, the spicy description does NOT disappoint!! Everything was just delicious!

title: One of the best places in the City to source good seafood
review: This is definitely my go-to place for special seafood. Fresh, tasty, and with a lot of great, unusual offerings.

title: Best Fish Shop in the Lincoln Park Area
review: Always fine service and great fish. Clean. Helpful staff. A main stay in our community for many years. Parking right outside in street-side mall.

title: Super Impressive Selection of Fresh Seafood
review: This is my new go-to place for seafood.  Fresh, big, delcicious Hokkaido scallops!  Halibut cheeks!  Where do you see those??  You don't!  Delicious crab cakes, live lobster.  We had a veritable feast with items from here the other night.  You should, too!

title: Absolutely First Class and a Great Owner
review: Talk to Dirk, he will take care of you. We were visiting from out of town with a major craving for some raw oysters. Dirk took care of us big time. We got to try all the available varieties, walked away with 4 dozen oysters and promises for more. Definitely listen to Dirk for advice. His recommended ones were the best. Definitely call ahead and he will get you stuff within a day or two if not in stock.

title: I love this place -great for sushi!
review: We almost always get excellent sushi salmon and sometimes sushi tuna here.  Staff is super helpful and friendly and they grill in the parking lot almost year round on the weekends.

title: Outstanding seafood and service....
review: I called ahead to place my order. It was waiting for me all packaged perfectly. I ended up buying more things because they all looked so great! And they were. Ahi tuna, fresh scallops, a spicy rub and lemons.

title: Great Market, A Bit Pricey
review: Dirk's always has high quality product and helpful staff.  Would be 5 stars if I didn't drop so much money every time I went in there.  I guess that's to be expected at a high-end fish market in the midwest, though.

title: Delicious ice cream!
review: Delicious ice cream and waffle. We tried caramel, Texas sheet cake and lemon something, all great. The waffle cones were delicious and fresh. Super friendly staff as well.

title: Delicious
review: Great ice cream.  I had the salted peanut butter with chocolate speckles.  Excellent!  The speckles were actually chocolate chunks.  Give it a try!

title: Get the waffles
review: Jeni's has unique, delicious ice cream that is well worth the price.  But this location also boasts her amazing waffles.  What a indulgent combination.

title: Lovely
review: Great ice cream shop on Armitage. Super selection of ices. I had 3 half scoops for 6 dollars. . . Salted caramel, chocolate ruffle and whisky with pecans all very good.

title: Overrated
review: Yes, there are multiple flavors but they basically turn around vanilla, almonds, peanut butter and chocolate, and caramel ( like all ice-creams!!) the line is huge, the service deplorable, the prices skyrocketing.

title: Yummy Stuff!
review: This is probably the best ice cream I've ever had. There are a plethora of unusual flavors (Brambleberry Crisp, Cream Puff, Frose Sorbet, etc.) and the friendly employees are more than willing to let you sample as many of them as you'd like.  We visited...Jeni's twice while we were in town.  Sunday required a wait in line, but Thursday afternoon was no wait at all.  Definitely visit a location if you're in Chicago!More

title: Top notch ice cream parlor
review: Get ready to wait in line, and rest assured it's with the wait. And despite the wait, once you get to the counter, you're treated like the place is empty and they have all time in the world for you.  Such an assortment of different...flavors that they vary on a regular basis. If you like ice cream, you can't miss this joint!More

title: Neighborhood Ice Cream @ it’s best!
review: In the heart of Lincoln Park is Jeni’s.  If you are an ice cream fanatic like myself this is a must visit!  The assorted flavors offer something for everyone.   The pistachio honey was my personal favorite!  On the corner of Armitage and Fremont there are...a number of places to visit while you lick your scoops!  MAC is next door, I enjoyed adding to my collection while enjoying my ice cream!  Enjoy :)More

title: Creative flavors and friendly service
review: I love that you can get 2 generous half scoops for the price of 1 (presumably very large) scoop. Be aware that for $1 more, you can get an additional half scoop!   The ice cream attendants are all super friendly and don't begrudge you when...you ask for samples. My cashier even clued me on potential sources for cheaper pints when I considered purchasing one as a gift. Amazing service!More

title: Expensive, but tasty!
review: We went upon recommendation of my daughter who has had it at school. Very friendly staff. They give you samples if you'd like. The ice cream was good but don't know if I've ever had bad ice cream at a specialty shop?!?  It's $5 for...1 or 2 very small scoops. I'd say 1 scoop is about 1/3 of a cup.   Average rating is due to price, not taste.   May or may not return.More

title: I would pass this up....
review: Overpriced ice cream served in a cramped loud environment does nothing for me. The five dollars per scoop may not seem ridiculous, until you see it's about the size of a golf ball! The watermelon frozen yogurt was not bad, the vanilla was nothing special. Certainly not worth five dollars for a golf ball size scoop in a sugar cone. I didn't think too much of this Intel I saw a server make himself a cone and go on break with a scoop the size of a baseball in it! This neighborhood is no for people with more money than brains, so perhaps being located inside the overpriced grocery store will help their business. There is one table and a counter inside the ice cream shop, with stools.... If I'm gonna pay five dollars for a taste of ice cream, I expect at least a spot where I can sit and enjoy it. I would go down the street, there are two or three good ice cream shops that have been around for years that I enjoy much better.

title: You will SCREAM for Jeni's ice cream
review: I have a splendid love affair with Jeni. She may not know it, but I secretly think about her late at night, when my PIC falls asleep. If I'm getting waffles downstairs for breakfast, I close my eyes and pretend they are Jeni's house made waffle cones. Yes my name is Pastrypants, and yes I have a problem.The location may not be super close to me, but anytime I'm in the Lincoln Park area, I am magnetized to Jeni's, day or night. Plenty of street parking, you enter through it's neighbor Foxtrot and then head inside towards the back where the flavors are in abundance. They have their signature flavors such as vanilla, brown butter almond brittle, different levels of chocolate, salted caramel and a salted pb. Below that are their limited edition flavors, usually a seasonal thing. There isn't a ton of seating, but I prefer the one little booth with a few comfy seats near the entrance. Otherwise, there are communal tables with barstools. Fresh flower vases adorn the tabletops. The staff is always super friendly and accommodating, even when I want to try like 6 different selections. The tasting spoons are actually little baby metal spoons, and the containers and spoons they give out are eco-friendly, and I appreciate not so much waste. Jeni was a James Beard award winner, and it shows through her ice creams. Crafted beautifully and such a great selection. If you want, they sell ready pints to go. Sure they are a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for. I like the fact that I can enjoy a fresh made waffle cone or even order 3 half scoops, so I don't have to feel like such an oinker, but still have a cute little threesome. teehee

title: Grat ice cream great place
review: We stopped in for a sweet treat after dinner. Despite there being a line, the staff were quick and attentive to get to everyone and answer any questions. There are many flavors of ice cream & most all unique to the shop. The only drawback is that there is only one flavor of sorbet, which is delicious, but variety is always nice.

title: My favorite Ice Cream now in Chicago!!!!!!
review: Jeni's ice Cream is the most flavorful and freshest ice cream you can buy. Its from Ohio and I have been eating it for years! Pro-tip! Only in Chicago can you get the street waffle with ice cream on it! I had it and loved it!

title: HOMEMADE ICE CREAM IN NEW FLAVORS
review: Stopped in at Jeni's for the first time and tasted really unique flavors. They were all delicious. They recommended the salted peanut butter with chocolate pieces and it was decadent. I highly recommend tasting a flavor you wouldn't ever try and I guarantee you will be pleasantly surprised! It is a bit confusing when entering as you must enter the little store next door which connects to them but has a different name. Wonderful Ice Cream!

title: best chinese in chicago
review: we love dees and dee and have been going there for 30 years.  best chinese food in the city and dee is a sweetheart

title: Good but a bit confused
review: We went a bit late on a Friday night. They were closing but stayed for us. The menu is strange. Very Japanese for a Chinese restaurant but great seaweed salad. Good rolls. Good sashimi. Very extensive menu. Roast duck was a star. Now that is Chinese. All good and not expensive although we didn’t drink.

title: Great Chinese in Lincoln Park
review: You don’t have to travel to Chinatown to get great Chinese in Chicago. Located in the heart of Lincoln Park, Dee’s has been a fixture for over 30 years. Dee Kang started it and is still making sure the quality of her food meets her exceptionally high standards. Traditional Chinese food including award winning egg rolls are not to be missed. Each dish is flavorful and offers a variety of selections. Coupled with Chinese food is her incredible sushi bar. Cocktails are not to be missed, especially her lemon drop martini. Lovely outdoor patio in the summer and Dee’s friendliness and hospitality makes you want to visit again and again.

title: Wonderful Chinese cuisine
review: Excellent food with dishes representing various indigenous Chinese specialties, very good sushi as well.  I have eaten here many times and have never been disappointed.  Consistently good.

title: Best Chinese in the area
review: Love so much of the menu and the service at Dee's.   Seeweed salad, cucumber salad, orange chicken, potstickers, and mongolian beef are all fantastic!! One of my favorite places to eat in the world.

title: Nice place for Chinese/Asian food in Lincoln Park
review: Dee's Restaurant is a nice place for Chinese/Asian food in Lincoln Park. I really like Chicago's Chinatown but this gem is just as good, is clean, comfortable, easy to get to.., has great friendly service and is very good at accommodating large groups. Valet parking is available however I always seem to find street parking in the evening. Their duck is wonderful, as are their shrimp dishes. This place is a cross section of America is older folk, young, well behaved children, singles, couples which makes it very comfortable.It's one of my favorite Chinese restaurants. I have not tried their Japanese sushi.

title: Chinese Food and Sushi in a Neighborhood Relaxed Atmosphere
review: Dee told us that the restaurant has been on Armitage Ave. for 33 years. The food is good, the prices reasonable, the selection is more than ample, and the servers hustle. We like to stop when we our in the area. Sushi rolls are large, the Chinese portions are good sized, and the taste is pleasing. this is a casual place that also does lots of carry-out business.

title: Absolutely PERFECT Experience
review: We have been patronizing this establishment for years and Dee has never let us down. (Yes, there really is a lady names Dee who owns and operates the restaurant.) They have a beautiful dining room and an extra room in the back for larger parties. We have dined with just two people as well as had parties of 20 people. The food is always great and the service is superb. They will honor special requests for less or more spices and the selection is very large.

title: A Lincoln Park Icon
review: Good food though a little overpriced. A Lincoln Park icon thats been here for decades. Consistently good, a little heavy on the oil though. Potstickers are shrinking over the years, with the current offering barley 1 1/2 inches now...Good mongolian beef, crispy duck and deep fried fish. Takeout is available, though like most of their Chinese brethren, they are not known for their generosity. I routinely place takeout orders for over $100, and was dismayed when they refused to give me a few pieces of raw cucumber for my bao....come on now, i know you have cucumber for the sushi...sometimes we have to allow for the cultural differences including extreme thrift, rudeness and condesention to enjoy the bounty!

title: Service needs improvement!
review: The main course of food was average.  I had the sweet and sour chicken which was no better than any other Asian fare. While the deserts were very good the service needs  a major upgrade!

title: Major Disappointment
review: I had been packing all day and wanted some Chinese food. I called Dee's and they said delivery would be within the hour. Perfect. Hours up and I receive a phone call - is your address this? No and I confirmed address. This occurred twice more and now it is 20 - 25 minutes later. Finally, the driver got the address correct and the food arrives cold. I called Dee's and told them what had happened. They said they would give me credit on my next order. Next order? I don't think so. What a major disappointment

title: Always consistent food quality served with a smile
review: We have been coming to Dee's since she opened the restaurant- we typically take out yet enjoy on site dining as well.  A super choice for Chinese food.

title: Best Chinese Food in Chicago
review: I go here every year when I come home for Christmas with my family.  We love the food.  It is our favorite Chinese restaurant.  We always get the garlic eggplant, Mongolian chicken and sizzling rice soup.

title: Still the best
review: They've been around for decades while dozens of acclaimed new Chinese restaurants have opened and closed... and their place as the city's premier destination for Chinese cuisine remains unchallenged.   The standards are served with subtle differences and more adventurous dishes tempt the foodies.

title: Great local Chinese
review: We went here for an early dinner with two parents and three girls. Great Asian food, super price, we arrived early and headed to a comedy club after a great value meal. A bit outside the city but brilliant food and value.r

title: Outstanding
review: 1) Dee is awesome.  Talk to her. 2) The potstickers are the best I've had.  And I've lived in Japan. 3) The Mongolian beef is better than anything else I've tried in the city.

title: Very Good Take-Out
review: First--to the staff at TripAdvisor: the photo you have posted for this restaurant is totally bogus and for a place named Dee Dee's--fix it or continue to look as though you haven't a clue.I work in Lincoln Park and have gotten take out from Dee's twice in the last 6 weeks. The Chinese food is tasty, well prepared, and very good quality. They cheerfully honored a speclal request ("extra spicy"). I have not tried any of the Japanese menu items. I've only tried 3-4 dishes, but all were comparable to good quality Chinese dishes in Boston or New York (my other foodie haunts).The staff members were friendly and efficient. On one hot evening I arrived before my phoned-in order was ready and they offered me ice water while I waited comfortably.

title: Excellent Chinese food and atmosphere
review: Dee's is a classy neighborhood Chinese restaurant with great food (Chinese and Japanese) where people of all ages feel comfortable. The owner, Dee, welcomes everyone and the restaurant is just as welcoming to one family's 3 year old as another's 90 year old mother. It's a very nice, friendly place. I've been there many times and have had a good meal every time. Last night we had scrumptious pot stickers, Kung Pao Beef and Chicken with Shitake Mushrooms and Peapods. Yum.

title: A local favorite.
review: This Mandarin restaurant serves both good Chinese food and sushi. Their service is usually good, but last night they were hosting a party and they did not have enough staff on hand to properly serve their other customers. Despite our reservations we had to wait 15 minutes to be seated. Sometimes restaurants do find themselves in this unfortunate situation and graciously offer their patrons a complimentary glass of wine or tea. Dee's is a neighborhood restaurant. I expected them to treat their loyal patrons more thoughtfully. At the very end of our dinner, when we were leaving, the hostess did apologize for the slow service. My two dinner companions have a connection to this sweet neighborhood, so they may return. I, on the other hand don't share their sentimental connection, so I would probably not return to Dee's, but select instead a restaurant with a reputation for excellent service and good food. There are three critical elements of a great dining experience: good food, great dinner companions, and thoughtful, timely service. We had the first two elements; Dee's failed to deliver a critical element of the dining experience.

title: The best Mandarin/Sechuan restuarant in the city
review: Our family has been eating here since they 1st opened in 1983. Dee is a gracious hostess and owner . She always greets you with a great smile and is truly glad to see you return. The food is great. The pot stickers,lettuce wraps and egg rolls are great. My son lives in the neighborhood and loves her sushi and orange chicken and fried rice. My husband loves the spicy shrimp and I like the mushu in any combo.Once I bring friends here they won't eat Mandarin food anywhere else .Try it you'll not only like it but will return often. Review by Linda Horsch

title: Best Szeschuan Whole Fish in Chicago
review: Dee still has the best whole Fish anywhere in the City. If you've never had whole fish, try it you'll love it -- especially here. Kung Pao style is deep fried Red Snapper, spicy to taste, with mounds of chinese vegetables and great sauce. Cost is $30, but it is HUGE - enough to feed two people easy. Also enjoyed the Pot Stickers, which are light & tasty. Service is impeccable, and atmosphere in her 'new' locale (new for us), is even better then the old place.

title: bad sushi and average asian food, nice outdoor space however which makes it a 2
review: bad sushi and average asian food, nice outdoor space however which makes it a 2

title: good food and good music
review: good food and good music

title: Great food, if a bit overpriced for Chinese.
review: Great food, if a bit overpriced for Chinese.

title: my step-dad's office was...
review: my step-dad's office was across the street.  loyal fans...

title: Disappointing given its...
review: Disappointing given its Zagat rating. Further justifies my point that there is no good Chinese food in Lincoln Park.

title: It's been here as long as I have lived here. They do it right.
review: It's been here as long as I have lived here. They do it right.

title: they have best chinese rice. Its the best I have had in my entire life!
review: they have best chinese rice. Its the best I have had in my entire life!

title: best takeout in city; the scallops are great
review: best takeout in city; the scallops are great

title: It's good!
review: It's good!

title: Great Breakfasts, Better Lunches
review: Pain Quotidian is my favorite “fast food” place. Aside from fabulous baked goods, salads and the tartines (open faced sandwiches) are so good. You can enjoy it with a glass of wine. Love it.

title: Bakery Craving
review: Stopped in to pick up a pastry. Had the apple turnover and the pasty was light and airy. Best I've had in a long time. Definitely going back during this trip to Chicago to try something else.

title: Good salads, soups and sandwiches
review: This is a place to come for good soups, salads, and sandwiches. I had a warm grain salad which I really enjoyed.  My friends had gazpacho, and other salads.  Washed down with some wine, I recommend trying out this restaurant.

title: take out, eat in always EXCELLENT
review: LPQ never disappoints. Food is fresh, delicious and always served with a smile. Servers are well trained, professional. Takeout is always consistently good. I give LPQ gift cards because their food is above and beyond—makes a great gift for a newbie or for someone who has already been entranced by the experience. Food is pricey but high quality and locally sourced. Yum!

title: Best Croissants!
review: Paris Ham & Wisconsin Gruyère Croissant with a Sunny Side Egg was one of the best breakfast sandwiches I’ve ever had!  The coffee was served in a small bowl, thanks hipsters for making that trend cool...  Overall, delicious!

title: Don't bother
review: Stopped in for a light lunch around 1:30, restaurant almost empty with 2 wait staff personnel and one person standing doing nothing behind the pastry counter. Obviously the wait staff not happy with each other and what they were doing. Tables were stacked with dirty dishes and glassware we had to wait 10 minutes till a table was cleared for us with no one in the restaurant. The menu is very limited and very pricey for what one is served. My husband ordered a waffle which was about he size of a half dollar, I had a ham and cheese on a burned croissant neither meal was worth the price paid. Our waiter was running around in circles, very frustrated and telling us he was leaving at 2:45 because he had to pick up his daughter from school. WE could hardly wait to finish and leave. Not sure how this place stays in business!

title: Horrible service. Nickel and dime you for a jam!
review: Have been to this restaurant twice. Odd system to order. Everything goes through a computer system. I have seen this in dinner restaurants that work efficiently. For a breakfast/brunch spot not so much. The servers are skimpy. You get only what you order...meaning if you need an extra pat of butter, coffee cream or jam they must submit through the computer system. You then wait , until your food is cold, to obtain said item. Also, multiple wait staff and it appears certain servers can only do certain things..like get the jam. Very confusing and frustrating.Wait staff attitude was very unpleasant. Felt like they were put out and doing you a favor for any additional requests. Felt like it was a privilege to be seated for brunch/lunch. This is not what I need on a Saturday or Sunday for a brunch experience. This is not high tea at the Peninsula Hotel! Get over it!I would never go back and prefer local neighborhood restaurants for hearty, delicious, breakfast/lunch with warm, friendly service.Try Cornerstone on Webster and Clybourne. Great food, nice folks. Casual atmosphere.

title: To brunch with expectations, not satisfied
review: Of the 3 dishes we ordered, we had problems with 2: Lebanese salad had an exaggerated amount of vinegar which overpowered all the well-assorted vegetables, and a gluten free egg dish was served with regular bread, they brought only one slice of gluten free bread when we had nearly finished the food.

title: Very fine spot, highly recommended, but...
review: PROS: You may like LPQ or not, but this site is a very special venue. The corner building with high windows secures wondeful light, especially in the bar area. Furnitures, details are truly appealing, you can enjoy high quality time. Food was superlative, for its category. The bakery never fails -very good taste.CONS: the brunch/restaurant area is very loud. I think they should do something, at least on the ceiling, to dump noise. the guys at the bar are not all kind, to say the least. Actually, one out of 4 I spoke to was kind. They don't clearly explain that if you eat there, you only will be served in lunch package made to-go. The latter are actually well done -a truly fine idea for pic-nic or take home, but being served at such a beautiful bar in paper boxes spoils your experience a bit.Conclusion: this is a wonderful bar/restaurant thanks to the very architecture of the building that hosts it. I suggest you eat in the restaurant your brunch and then have tea and sweets in the bar, letting time pass.

title: LPQ in Lincoln Park - excellent meetup spot!
review: Lincoln Park's LPQ is an above-average version of this popular meetup spot. We enjoyed breakfast and conversation here on a fine spring morning in April before strolling the neighborhood shops. A 3-minute walk from the Armitage Station so you can get here from anywhere!

title: Plus que le pain quotidien…
review: LPQ is a casual dining restaurant chain with a genuine feeling of authenticity. From its beginning in Brussels to over 200 shops worldwide, this chef-driven (Alain Coumont) café offers healthy, light fare as served in Europe. The warm brick and wood interior focuses on a long communal table. Free Wi-Fi and comfy chairs encourage hanging around. Breakfast and brunch are featured with many organic and vegan items including daily-baked bread and pastries, fresh fruits, greens and vegetables, house jams and mustards, coffee and tea served in bowls (no handles) and some of the loveliest soft-boiled eggs we’ve ever seen. Selected beer and wines are available for afternoon or early evening meals (open until 8p).Our late lunch consisted of chicken soup and tartines (open-face Belgium sandwiches); smoked salmon (which was excellent), chicken curry and Paris ham and cheddar. The presentation was above average with fresh garnishes, chutneys and mustards. Service (Jordan P) was cheery, prompt and everything was very good. Enjoyable as it was, the experience is a bit pricey though this shouldn’t be a surprise as the prices are clearly marked on the menu. Our lunch which also included a soft-boiled egg and coffee and tea for three came to $78.00 before gratuity. Those who compare LPQ to Panera are missing the point. LPQ offers a unique dining experience. What the French call “a little elegance in our daily lives”. Like all special things, they generally are indulged in occasionally.

title: Delicious spot for good conversation
review: My daughter and I enjoyed a delicious breakfast in this lovely, casual atmosphere. Our server was friendly and attentive. The coffee was a little pricey but really good and our server willingly refilled our pots without us asking. We will definitely return on our next visit.

title: Quaint atmosphere but food was ok
review: I went for breakfast Sunday morning and was disappointed to find out they were out of chai tea and one of their new pastries (cinnamon croissant roll). I had the ham and gruyere cheese croissant-which was fine but I think the cheese could have been melted more. The sandwich was nearly cold. The salad served with it, was just ok too. The drinks (coffee and tea) are served in bowls, so not a mug with a handle. That was a bit awkward when you are trying to drink you hot beverage but not scald yourself. The location and atmosphere were great though.

title: Great breakfast
review: Enjoyed a fantastic breakfast here with my son with a healthy menu, excellent coffee beverages, and solid service.

title: Coffee Scam
review: I enjoyed my chicken salad open face sandwich with chutney today. I thought it was overpriced at $13.95, but okay, the atmosphere was nice and the service excellent. But the coffee! I ordered "a cup" without taking time to find the price on the menu. Was the price even there? The "cup" arrived - no handle - along with a pot of coffee, enough for two cups. Did I order "a cup" or not? Yes, I ordered a cup, and in most restaurants, the refill is free. This "cup" cost $4! I call that way overpriced. My friend ordered iced tea and that was also overpriced at $3.75. Yikes! This is not a fancy, upscale restaurant. It's nice, but I certainly feel ripped off by the coffee service. I probably won't go back.

title: Great Breakfasts, Better Lunches
review: Pain Quotidian is my favorite “fast food” place. Aside from fabulous baked goods, salads and the tartines (open faced sandwiches) are so good. You can enjoy it with a glass of wine. Love it.

Did I order "a cup" or not? Yes, I ordered a cup, and in most restaurants, the refill is free. This "cup" cost $4! I call that way overpriced. My friend ordered iced tea and that was also overpriced at $3.75. Yikes! This is not a fancy, upscale restaurant. It's nice, but I certainly feel ripped off by the coffee service. I probably won't go back.

title: Bring Your Own Coffee Cup
review: This pretentious little spot has decent food but tries way to hard to be cool. Coffee cups without handles? Come on. Just silly. I'm not really interested in drinking coffee out of a soup bowl. And do you need to label everything on the menu as "organic"? Ok. You're cool. Now get over it. You're a coffee shop.

title: Loved this bakery/eatery
review: Had a fabulous lunch here while visiting with friends. something on the menu for everyone. Beer and wine selection was adequate and very good (we had a couple of each in our group). Salads were awesome as was the open face sandwich. Armitage is a great street also.

title: Excellent Food in a Great European Atmosphere
review: Had a wonderful lunch at this restaurant with a French flair. All the food looked and smelled excellent. I tried the Chicken Soup and it was excellent but even better was the Avocado Toast which I highly recommend. The place was clean and the service, although a little slow, was very good. I highly recommend it.

title: Poorest place in years
review: I live in Chicago and I travel a lot. This restaurant is the biggest disappointment I've ever experienced anywhere. And I've never even had the chance to eat there. Service is beyond bad. Twice now I've asked before taking a table if it's possible to be out in 30-45 minutes. Both times the answer was yes. The first time no one came to take my order, today I ordered and waited and waited and 10 minutes before I had to leave I was presented with an entree that differed from the description. Big difference between tomato as on the menu and tomato sauce as delivered. I just got up and left. I can't eat a meal in 10 minutes no matter how fast I chew. To add insult the manager told me that the only table was available for a solo eater. No problem until I looked around and saw many four tops occupied by one. His answer was they were getting busy. While I waited and as I left there were many two tops and four tops he could have offered. I am highly disappointed in this location. I will not go back. Thank goodness for Starbucks across the street. I was starving! And knew I could count on getting something to eat!

title: Lovely Spot for Coffee
review: This is a great spot for coffee. Warm environment and the staff were very friendly. I was very impressed with the option of organic cream! This seems like a place that cares about the sourcing of ingredients, and I was intrigued by the food and wine menu. Despite being a chain, it is a place with heart.

title: Outstanding "Healthy" Breakfast/Lunch
review: Truly enjoyed this great place to get a healthy breakfast or lunch. Server was outstanding, quiet place, and great choices.

title: The place is average, sort of like Panera with a fancy french name
review: I ate here in Chicago and in New York.  Both times the food was average at best.  It is the same as Panera only with half the food choices of Panera.

title: Absolutely Delicious!
review: Stopped for breakfast, and were so happy we chose this spot. Great service, with a very friendly staff. The Parisian omelet was so tasty, we wanted to kidnap the chef and take him home with us. We added a twisted pastry to share with a ribbon of chocolate running through it. So reminded us of Paris. Will go back again. Just loved the place.

title: Not to friendly service
review: It was my first time in this chain...when I entered I did not know where to order becasue noone was interested in me. I was standing and being ignored by 4 people....finally I started asking questions where should I go order or who would help me and they looked like thy were annoyed by me....and when I ordered they forgot to give me what I ordered....I don'k know what it is...maybe they are too busy and over worked....I just didn't like the experience being there.I felt I am not welcomed or not needed there....

title: LPQ can be missed
review: Food is delicious. Service good. Had avocado toast which cannot be replicated at home. So delicious. Omelet w ham, guyere a salad comes with. And real bread. Not toast. French baguette bread. Jose M was our excellent server. Have been to other LPQ locations and never disappointed. Its pricey but really good quality food.

title: Bad Service
review: We went to eat here on Christmas Eve and waited over 20 minutes for them to tell us that they were out of everything we ordered. We waited until 25 minutes for them to give us a cheese plate. The service was very slow and the host was very brisk when we left, letting us know they were understaffed.

title: A work in progress!
review: I've been here twice and found there is inconsistent service as well as menu items not available. The menu has a nice variety and in nice weather there is the option of eating inside or out. You can eat in or stop by for a bakery item and drink. The ambiance is like a French market so comfortable and no rush to move on so that is a plus. You can't go wrong with the Quiche Lorraine - the most consistent offering I've found. Organic and vegan offerings are also a plus. Worth a visit, but be willing to overlook the inconsistent service and menu items.

title: Cramped but unique and fun
review: They feature a community table but we decided to go for our own private table since it was our anniversary. We stopped here for breakfast by happenstance. My wife had a ham and cheese something or another sandwich and I had the waffle. The waffle was small but very dense and yummy. This was a fun stop and unique setting.

title: Needs to work out the kinks.
review: Food was pretty good, my boyfriend had a sandwich and I had soup along with some goat cheese and bread. Nothing super special. The service was very very slow though, I'm hoping that this is a kink as the restaurant just opened.

title: Organic French Dishes -- Also Bakery with French Specialties
review: I've had lunch here a few times and will come back. Probably the best choice in the neighborhood. The dishes are rather original, many open face. Good service. Friendly. Nice ambiance.

title: Great
review: It feels safe and chill inside the restaurant and the food there taste great. The staff are nice and the food came out pretty quickly.

title: Would eat here all the time!
review: We were visiting from out of state and this restaurant was close to our daughter’s dorm. The menu was extensive and making a decision was hard! Every dish was fresh and flavorful. I want to do back for dim sum

title: Great Food - Best Chinese We’ve Had In a While
review: We ordered in from Mo’s for the first time and really enjoyed it. We ordered sweet and sour chicken and scallops with walnuts, and both were delicious. My only disappointment was they forgot to deliver the brown rice I ordered. But the food was excellent, and we’ll gladly order from there again.

title: Solid neighborhood Asian joint - for takeout, delivery or dine-in
review: As the title implies, Mo's is a consistently good, neighborhood, Asian restaurant. Everyone in my family likes something different - my wife and eldest child enjoy the Chinese, I like the Thai and our youngest loves the sushi. We usually order for pick-up, but dine in from time to time. I generally recommend pick-up as dine-in service can be somewhat slow (my only criticism), especially on Friday and weekends. Also, the prices are very reasonable; in fact, a bargain compared to other similar restaurants.

title: Dinner deal FTW
review: Got 3 rolls for $14.99. Now that's a deal! The sushi was perfect portion for two to share, the staff was somewhat slow but overall it was a great experience. I will for sure be back!

title: Nice Asian restaurant in a strip shopping center
review: The restaurant is located within a strip shopping center. They have a full bar, but you can BYOB for a nominal charge. Service very friendly and attentive and the restaurant had a casual ambiance. Great deals on drinks, $4.00 for Mai Thai's and Long Island Iced Teas! Overall a nice experience.

title: My go-to Chinese Pick-Up restaurant!
review: The Mongolian Beef is amazing. We also love the egg rolls. I did order the teriyaki chicken and the flavor was good but chicken was super dry. I still loved it and now order the steak. I order pick up here a few times a month and always love the food. I was however, taken aback when I asked for an extra pinch of peanuts on my pad thai online (totally expecting a small upcharge), but they charged me several dollars (same price as asking for extra shrimp loll)! I always ask for a side of [peanuts when I pick up my order] at the restaurant and never get charged. Its not a negative, but just insight from a regular :) Also, spicy tuna roll is DELICIOUS!

title: Lunch special
review: Great price point on lunch special.   Pretty standard washed out Chinese cuisine appealing to the American palate.  Tried the sushi dish which was decent .

title: Good veggie choices
review: Had dinner with a couple girlfriends and we shared several entrees with enough to take home. We stayed on the Thai side of the menu versus sushi but would return to try it out. We ended up ordering mushrooms with tofu which was delish, plus another veggie dish with tofu. Very pleased, would return again or order carry out.

title: Nice New Restaurant
review: Just opened in January. Nice to have another good Asian restaurant in Lincoln Park/DePaul area. Great selection of Asian food. We had Sushi. King Crab roll was unique and delicious. Also enjoyed the rainbow roll. They will also make brown rice sushi. Nice selection of wine by the glass. I am sure the service will improve when they are open longer

title: Excellent new Asian bistro
review: While there are a number of Asian restaurants in the city, this one is a nice addition to the Lincoln Park Southport area. The food is well prepared and delicious. The menu is extensive. There's a grill, sushi bar, and a bar featuring cocktails. In the courses I tasted, the ingredients used were obviously fresh.

title: Good Food with a Large Variety
review: I really like that Noodles & Company offers veggie noodle alternatives. There are lots a menu options from which to choose, and the dishes are tasty. We ordered delivery and will do so again.

title: very friendly and great good!
review: WE were staying around the corner and the convenience took us here first, but the food, the price and the friendliness brought us back several more times.  Great Tomato Basil Soup!

title: Unforgettable
review: The manager chatted with me and my daughter while she took our order. She offered suggestions on menu and things to do. Best of all, she brought each of us a rice krispy treat on the house. Super customer service !!

title: Great value for a relaxing meal
review: A gem hidden behind McDonald's.  Excellent soup and salad combinations.  The view of the plaza, artwork, and plantings eased the rush of a busy day.

title: Good, Reasonably priced
review: We saw Noodles and Company as we drove into Chicago. We love noodle shops and it was near our hotel, so we decided to give it a try. The food was good and came out quickly. It appears to be premade and microwaved. The price was reasonable. It is not a traditional Asian Noodle House as we had hoped, so take that right out of your head….. The person taking the orders was very nice and efficient. The pick-up-the-table person was slow, slow, slow. Maybe it was his first job. Definitely needed an in-service on sweeping; if it is going to take 15 minutes to sweep around two chairs, it is better to move them, n’est pas?

title: Great variety and delicious food at reasonable prices
review: All three of us decided on a sandwich with soup and all three of us had something different. It was all fresh and delicious and the prices were good. I would definitely eat here again.

title: Healthy fast food!
review: This was such a great restaurant for fast food. We were in Chicago for a volleyball tournament and our last game ended late and we had an early game the next day so the girls needed good food fast. Noodles and Co. did all that we needed.

title: Variety of noodle dishes at a good price
review: I like this place. I actually ate the the location on Michigan Ave. I've eaten here several times. The food is always good and consistent. The chicken noodle soup is great. It is made to order. There's lots of chicken and the egg noodles are al dente. Very fresh! It is not overly salty. I also had the Malaysian noodles with chicken. It had a nice, balanced flavor.I always look forward to coming to Noodles and Company for a quick, healthy meal that doesn't break the bank.The service is friendly and efficient.

title: Not bad, better than going to wendy's or the like
review: We enjoyed the variety of dishes available and we really liked the food. Worth the money! And its located where you can still walk and enjoy Chicago.

title: A Asian Style Fastfood Restaurant With Reasonable Price
review: Managed to find a fastfood chain that sell Asian Food in Skokie during my stay in US. The food was tasty and reasonable in pricing. Especially with the availability of Asian Chili Sauce in the Restaurant. A must try place for people looking for Asian Food at a fastfood price!

title: What a Nice Surprise!
review: We weren't hungry but needed to eat, so went the inexpensive, quick route. At N&C, guests can order custom-made noodle dishes--Asian, Italian, American dishes. We had the pad Thai with shrimp, and the flavor was very good indeed--fresh and not overly sweet. AND it's really inexpensive. I'd go back in a minute!

title: Fresh tasting. Good value.
review: Great place to have lunch. The food was very fresh tasting, like they used great ingredients and that resulted in the excellent tasting food. We went a lot of places during our trip, and this was the one we agreed that we could come back and have a second time during the same trip.
